Dirt Music by Tim Winton is a Booker prize shortlisted novel from 2001 and winner of the 2002 Miles Franklin Award .
Meri Jeevan Yatra ( मेरी जीवन यात्रा ) aka My Journey Through Life is the Autobiography of Great Social reformer , Scholar , Polyglot Mahapandit Rahul Sankrityayan , first published in 1944 .
`` Blue Melody '' is a short story by J. D. Salinger , first published in the September 1948 issue of Cosmopolitan .
Earth 's Children is a series of speculative alternative historical fiction novels written by Jean M. Auel set circa 30,000 years before present .
Categories for the Working Mathematician is a textbook in category theory written by American mathematician Saunders Mac Lane , who cofounded the subject together with Samuel Eilenberg .
Kalvan Kingmaker is an English language science fiction novel by John F. Carr , the third book in the Kalvan series and the sequel to Great Kings ' War .
Afloat and Ashore is a nautical fiction novel by James Fenimore Cooper first published in 1844 .
Alien Legion is a science - fiction comic - book series and associated titles created by Carl Potts , Alan Zelenetz , and Frank Cirocco for Marvel Comics 's Epic Comics imprint in 1983 .
Njanji Soenji ( Republican Spelling : Njanji Sunji ; Perfected Spelling : Nyanyi Sunyi ; Indonesian for `` Songs of Solitude '' or `` Songs of Silence '' ) is a 1937 poetry collection by Amir Hamzah .
Ballad of the Desert ( also known as Damo Yao , or `` 大漠谣 '' ) is a two - volume Chinese Han Dynasty romance novel written by author Tong Hua .
Great Contemporaries is a collection of 25 short biographical essays about famous people , written by Winston Churchill .
Piercing the Darkness , which was published in 1988 , is a sequel to Frank E. Peretti 's novel This Present Darkness .
A Political Romance is a 1759 novel by Laurence Sterne , author of Tristram Shandy .
The Ghost Writer ( 1979 ) is the first novel by Philip Roth to be narrated by Nathan Zuckerman , one of Roth 's putative fictional alter egos , and constitutes the first book in his Zuckerman Bound trilogy .
Darwin 's Children is a science fiction novel by Greg Bear published in 2003 .
The Analytical Language of John Wilkins ( Spanish : El idioma analitico de John Wilkins ) is a short essay by Argentine writer Jorge Luis Borges originally published in Otras Inquisiciones ( 1937 - -1952 ) .
High Rhulain is a children 's fantasy novel by Brian Jacques , published in 2005 .
The Silent Cry ( Japanese 万延元年のフットボール ; Man'en Gannen no Futtoboru , literally ' Football in the First Year of Man'en ' ) is a novel by Japanese author Kenzaburō Ōe , first published in Japanese in 1967 and awarded the Tanizaki Prize that year .
Cannibals and Kings ( 1977 , ISBN 0 - 394 - 40765 - 2 ) is a book written by anthropologist Marvin Harris .
Mother of Demons is a science - fiction novel by American author Eric Flint .
The Lhammas is a work of fictional sociolinguistics by J. R. R. Tolkien .
Sports , Sin and Subversion is the new book from Belizean author Evan X Hyde , published in July 2008 .
Reality Sandwiches is a book of poetry by Allen Ginsberg published by City Lights Publishers in 1963 .
The Finders is a novel by British author Nigel Hinton which was first published in 1993 and is the only one of his children 's books not related to the Beaver Towers series .
The Question of Lay Analysis ( German : Die Frage der Laienanalyse ) is a 1926 book by Sigmund Freud advocating the right of non - doctors , or ' lay ' people , to be psychoanalysts .
The Art of Dreaming is a book written by anthropologist Carlos Castaneda and published in 1993 .
World Brain is a collection of essays and addresses by the English science fiction pioneer , social reformer , evolutionary biologist and historian H. G. Wells , dating from the period of 1936 - -38 .
Poem Strip ( Italian : Poema a fumetti ) is a 1969 comic book by the Italian writer and illustrator Dino Buzzati .
Knot of Stone : the day that changed South Africa 's history is a 2011 historical murder mystery written by South African / Dutch author Nicolaas Vergunst .
List of the Lost is a novel written by Morrissey , released on 24 September 2015 .
Graveminder is a 2011 Gothic mystery novel by Melissa Marr .
The Crooked Hinge is a mystery novel ( 1938 ) by detective novelist John Dickson Carr .
The Tale of Aragorn and Arwen is a story written by the English author J. R. R. Tolkien .
Asterix and the Missing Scroll ( French : Le Papyrus de César , `` Caesar 's Papyrus '' ) is the 36th book in the Asterix series , written by Jean - Yves Ferri and illustrated by Didier Conrad .
Things Not Seen is a first - person novel written by Andrew Clements and his third novel after Frindle and The Landry News .
Time of the Great Freeze is a science fiction novel by American author Robert Silverberg , first published by Holt , Rinehart and Winston in 1964 .
New Statesmen was a `` political superhero series '' featured in British comic Crisis , created by John Smith and Jim Baikie , which lasted for fourteen episodes from 1988 to 1989 .
Would n't Take Nothing for My Journey Now , published in 1993 , is African - American writer and poet Maya Angelou 's first book of essays .
`` Work , Death , and Sickness '' , sometimes also translated as `` The Right Way '' , is a short story by Russian author Leo Tolstoy written in 1903 .
The Underworld USA Trilogy is the collective name given to three novels by American crime author James Ellroy :
A Spaniard in the Works is a book from 1965 by John Lennon .
Power Evangelism is a book by Christian charismatic leader John Wimber .
The Accidental Pervert is a universally themed play written and performed by Andrew Goffman and directed by Charles Messina .
On the Twentieth Century is a musical with book and lyrics by Betty Comden and Adolph Green and music by Cy Coleman .
Mauprat is a novel by the French novelist George Sand about love and education .
Die Feen ( German : ( diː feːn ) , The Fairies ) is an opera in three acts by Richard Wagner .
Pro Cluentio is a speech by the Roman orator Cicero given in defense of a man named Aulus Cluentius Habitus Minor .
We Are All Made of Glue is English novelist Marina Lewycka 's third novel , published in 2009 .
Battle Hymn of China , by Agnes Smedley .
The Mouse with the Question Mark Tail is a 2013 children 's novel written by Richard Peck and illustrated Kelly Murphy .
The Walls of Delhi is a novel written by Indian writer , Uday Prakash .
Sherlock Holmes and the Man from Hell is a 1997 Sherlock Holmes pastiche novel by Barrie Roberts .
Facial Justice is a dystopian novel by L. P. Hartley , published in 1960 .
Fatal Cure is a medical thriller written by Robin Cook .
Crawling Sky is a graphic novel adapted from a short story by Joe R. Lansdale by his son Keith Lansdale .
The Horror from the Hills is a horror novel by author Frank Belknap Long .
Light a Penny Candle ( 1982 ) is Maeve Binchy 's first novel , which follows two girls growing up during and in the aftermath of World War II .
Nylon Angel is a postcyberpunk novel by science fiction author Marianne de Pierres
Between the Acts is the final novel by Virginia Woolf , published in 1941 shortly after her death .
The Curious Sofa is a classic 1961 book by Edward Gorey , published under the pen name `` Ogdred Weary '' ( an anagram ) .
`` Arms of Mary '' is a 1976 hit single by the Sutherland Brothers and Quiver ; group member Iain Sutherland wrote this mid - tempo ballad whose singer reminisces about the girl with whom he had his first intimate encounter .
The Codex Trivulzianus is a manuscript by Leonardo da Vinci that originally contained 62 sheets , but today only 55 remain .
The Life of Samuel Johnson , LL.D. ( 1791 ) is a biography of Dr. Samuel Johnson written by James Boswell .
The Kestrel ( 1982 ) is a fantasy novel by Lloyd Alexander , the second of three books often called the Westmark trilogy .
For One More Day is a 2006 philosophical novel by Mitch Albom .
Pig Earth is the first novel by John Berger in the Into Their Labours trilogy .
An Oxford University Chest is a book about the University of Oxford , written by the poet Sir John Betjeman and first published by John Miles in London in 1938 .
The Sovereignty of Good is a book of moral philosophy by Iris Murdoch .
American Dream , Global Nightmare is a book by Ziauddin Sardar and Merryl Wyn Davies ( Icon Books , 2004 ) .
The Reluctant Widow is a Regency romance novel by Georgette Heyer which describes the story of the heroine Elinor Rochdale who has her life turned upside down when she enters the wrong carriage on her way to be a governess to sustain herself .
Politics as a Vocation ( Politik als Beruf ) is an essay by German economist and sociologist Max Weber ( 1864 - -1920 ) .
All About Lulu ( published 2008 ) is a coming - of - age novel by American author Jonathan Evison .
Maigret and the Yellow Dog ( French : Le Chien jaune ) is a detective novel by the Belgian writer Georges Simenon .
Charley 's Aunt is a farce in three acts written by Brandon Thomas .
The Stress of Her Regard is a 1989 horror / fantasy novel by Tim Powers .
A Gladiator Dies Only Once is a collection of short stories by American author Steven Saylor , first published by St. Martin 's Press in 2005 .
Hound - Dog Man is a 1959 film directed by Don Siegel , based on the 1947 novel by Fred Gipson .
The Jewel of St Petersburg is a 2010 prequel to The Russian Concubine and The Concubine 's Secret by Kate Furnivall .
Krigaren ( lit . The Warrior ) is a 2001 novel by Swedish writer Björn Ranelid .
The City of Fading Light is a 1985 novel written by Australian author Jon Cleary about a Hollywood actress who tries to rescue her Jewish mother from 1939 Berlin .
Noite na Taverna ( in English : A Night in the Tavern ) is a short story collection written by Brazilian Ultra - Romantic author Álvares de Azevedo under the pen name Job Stern .
Banana Fish is a classic shōjo manga by Akimi Yoshida which ran from 1985 to 1994 and spawned several mini - spin - offs :
The Book of Ahania is one of the English poet William Blake 's prophetic books .
Exile 's Gate is a 1988 science fantasy novel written by C. J. Cherryh .
The Inner Reaches of Outer Space is a 1986 book by mythologist Joseph Campbell , the last book completed before his death in 1987 .
Name It and Frame It ? is a 1993 book , written by Steve Levicoff , about unaccredited Christian colleges and universities , exploring the accreditation process and the nature of legitimate and illegitimate unaccredited institutions of higher learning .
Automatic Kafka is a nine - issue comic book limited series written by Joe Casey with art by Ashley Wood .
Fablehaven ( pronounced /ˌfeɪbəlˈheɪvən/ ) is The New York Times ' best - selling children 's literature fantasy series written by Brandon Mull .
The Art of Unix Programming by Eric S. Raymond is a book about the history and culture of Unix programming from its earliest days in 1969 to 2003 when it was published , covering both genetic derivations such as BSD and conceptual ones such as Linux .
The Reluctant Journal of Henry K. Larsen is a young adult novel by Canadian author Susin Nielsen , first published in 2012 .
Some Gorgeous Accident ( 1967 ) was James Kennaway 's fifth novel and the last to be published during his lifetime .
Doctor Sax ( Doctor Sax : Faust Part Three ) is a novel by Jack Kerouac published in 1959 .
They Fly at Çiron is a 1993 science fiction novel by Samuel R. Delany , wholly rewritten and expanded from a novelette written in the 1960s .
Amongst Women is a novel by the Irish writer John McGahern ( 1934 - -2006 ) .
A Behanding in Spokane is a 2010 black comedy by award - winning Irish playwright Martin McDonagh .
The Wizard in the Woods is a 1990 children 's fantasy book by Jean Ure and the first book of The Wizard trilogy .
The Ferguson Rifle ( 1971 ) is a novel set in early 19th - century America , written by Louis L'Amour .
Very Tricky , Alfie Atkins ( Swedish : Aja baja , Alfons Åberg ) is a 1973 children 's book by Gunilla Bergström .
A Sunday at the Pool in Kigali ( original French title : Un dimanche à la piscine à Kigali ) is the first novel by Montreal author Gil Courtemanche , originally published in 2000 .
The American Scene is a book of travel writing by Henry James about his trip through the United States in 1904 - 1905 .
The Philosopher 's Pupil is a 1983 novel by the British writer and philosopher Iris Murdoch .
Hunger und Seide is a book of essays ( or , `` mixed prose '' ) by Nobel Prize - winning author Herta Müller .
The Making of the English Landscape is a 1955 book by the English local historian William George Hoskins .
The Silver Donkey is a young - adult fiction book written by Sonya Hartnett , set during World War I. The book traces the journey of an English soldier who deserts the war and comes across two young girls in the French countryside , Marcelle and Coco .
The Symphony of Ages is a series of fantasy -- romance books by Elizabeth Haydon .
Kalau Ta ' Oentoeng ( Perfected Spelling : Kalau Tak Untung , meaning If Fortune Does Not Favour ) is a 1933 novel written by Sariamin Ismail under the pseudonym Selasih .
The Fire - Eaters is an award winning children 's novel by David Almond , published in 2003 .
The Best and the Brightest ( 1972 ) is an account by journalist David Halberstam of the origins of the Vietnam War published by Random House .
La Sainte Courtisane ( pronounced : ( la sɛ̃t kuʁ.ti.zan ) , French for `` The Holy Courtesan '' ) is an unfinished play by Oscar Wilde written in 1894 .
Archer 's Goon is a 1984 fantasy novel by Diana Wynne Jones both for the young adult and adult markets .
The Snowfall Trilogy is a series of three fantasy novels written by Mitchell Smith .
The Train Has Reached Amritsar ( Hindi original : Amritsar Aa Gaya Hai ) is a short story by Hindi author and playwright , Bhisham Sahni set during the Partition of India .
On the Malice of Herodotus or On the Malignity of Herodotus ( Greek : Περὶ τῆς Ἡροδότου κακοηθείας ) is an essay by Plutarch criticizing the historian Herodotus for all manner of prejudice and misrepresentation in Histories .
The Oak and the Calf , subtitled Sketches of Literary Life in the Soviet Union , is a memoir by Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn about his attempts to publish work in his own country .
The Benevolent Frog or The Frog and the Lion Fairy is a French literary fairy tale , written by Madame d'Aulnoy .
Propeller Island ( French : L'Île à hélice ) ( also published as The Floating Island , or The Pearl of the Pacific ) is a science fiction novel by French author Jules Verne ( 1828 - -1905 ) .
`` Markheim '' is a short story by Robert Louis Stevenson , originally prepared for the Pall Mall Gazette in 1884 , but published in 1885 in The Broken Shaft :
The Miser 's Daughter is a novel by William Harrison Ainsworth serially published in 1842 .
The Six Messiahs is a 1995 novel by Mark Frost , a sequel to The List of Seven .
Byzantium Endures ( 1981 ) is a novel by Michael Moorcock .
The Goblin Gate ( 2010 ) is a young adult fantasy novel by Hilari Bell , a sequel to her novel The Goblin Wood .
`` The Forgotten Enemy '' is a short story by Arthur C. Clarke that appeared in the science fiction magazine New Worlds , in August 1949 .
`` Go On Girl '' is a song written by Ne - Yo , Tor Erik Hermansen , Mikkel S. Eriksen , Espen Lind and Amund Bjørklund , for Ne - Yo 's second studio album Because of You .
Life on the Lagoons , which deals with the history and topography of the watery area around the city of Venice , is the first book by the Scottish historian Horatio Brown .
Wilhelm Meister 's Apprenticeship ( German : Wilhelm Meisters Lehrjahre ) is the second novel by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe , published in 1795 - -96 .
`` The Thing on the Doorstep '' is a short story written by H. P. Lovecraft , part of the Cthulhu Mythos universe of horror fiction .
Treachery in Death by Nora Roberts writing as J.D. Robb is the thirty - second book in the In Death series .
The Persian Boy is a 1972 historical novel written by Mary Renault and narrated by Bagoas , a young Persian from an aristocratic family who is captured by his father 's enemies , castrated , and sold as a slave to the king Darius III , who makes him his favorite .
`` Tlön , Uqbar , Orbis Tertius '' is a short story by the 20th century Argentine writer Jorge Luis Borges .
The Skriker is a 1994 play by Caryl Churchill that tells the story of an ancient fairy who , during the course of the play , transforms into a plethora of objects and people as it pursues Lily and Josie , two teenage mothers whom it befriends , manipulates , seduces and entraps .
A Warning to the Curious and Other Ghost Stories is the title of M. R. James ' fourth and final collection of ghost stories , published in 1925 .
Fromont jeune et Risler aîné ( 1874 ; English : Fromont Junior and Risler Senior or Fromont and Risler or Sidonie ) is a novel by French author Alphonse Daudet .
Prayers for Rain is a crime novel written by Dennis Lehane , published in 1999 .
Elizabeth and Her German Garden is a novel by Elizabeth von Arnim , first published in 1898 ; it was very popular and frequently reprinted during the early years of the 20th century .
The Zookeeper 's Wife is a non - fiction book written by the poet and naturalist Diane Ackerman .
The Green Odyssey is an American science fiction novel written by Philip José Farmer .
The Spanish Gardener is a 1950 novel by A. J. Cronin which tells the story of an American consul , Harrington Brande , who is posted to San Jorge on the Costa Brava , Spain with his young son Nicholas .
LoveMusik is a musical written by Alfred Uhry , using a selection of music by Kurt Weill .
Relief of Fevers ( Armenian : Ջերմանց Մխիտարություն , Jermants Mkhitarutiun ) is an encyclopedic study written by medieval Armenian physician Mkhitar Heratsi in 1184 , which has survived in full to our days .
The Governess , or The Little Female Academy ( published 1749 ) by Sarah Fielding is the first full - length novel written for children , and a significant work of 18th - century children 's literature .
The Key to Theosophy is an 1889 book by Helena Blavatsky , expounding the principles of theosophy in a readable question - and - answer manner .
The School for Wives ( French : L'école des femmes ; pronounced : ( lekɔl de fam ) ) is a theatrical comedy written by the seventeenth century French playwright Molière and considered by some critics to be one of his finest achievements .
The Solar Electricity Handbook is a yearbook written by eco - technology author Michael Boxwell .
Thirteen Moons is an historical novel published in October 2006 by American author Charles Frazier , his second book after the award - winning Cold Mountain .
Empire Star is a 1966 science fiction novella by Samuel R. Delany .
Professor Shonku is a fictional scientist created by Satyajit Ray in a series of Bengali science fiction books .
The Worms of Kukumlima is a humorous book written by Daniel Pinkwater for all ages and first published in 1981 .
Jar of Fools is a once - weekly comic strip by Jason Lutes that was compiled , first into a two - part anthology , and then a graphic novel .
Again to Carthage is a novel by American author John L. Parker Jr. initially published April 1 , 2008 .
L'Europe buissonnière is a 1949 novel by the French writer Antoine Blondin .
Death Is a Lonely Business is a mystery novel by Ray Bradbury published in 1985 .
Watch Your Mouth is a novel by American writer Daniel Handler .
Incarceron ( 2007 ) is a young - adult fantasy and science fiction novel written by Catherine Fisher that was first released on May 3 , 2007 .
The Swan Book is the third novel by the Indigenous Australian author Alexis Wright .
`` Pigeons from Hell '' is a short story by Robert E. Howard written in late 1934 and published posthumously by Weird Tales in 1938 .
Byzantium after Byzantium ( Bizanţ după Bizanţ in Romanian ; Byzance après Byzance in French ) is a 1935 book by the Romanian historian Nicolae Iorga , which gave its name to a national cultural movement .
The Living Reed is an historical novel by Pearl S. Buck in which life in Korea , from the latter part of the nineteenth century to the end of the Second World War , is described through the viewpoints and lives of several members of four generations of a prominent aristocratic family .
The Merchant and the Alchemist 's Gate is a fantasy novelette by Ted Chiang originally published in 2007 by Subterranean Press and reprinted in the September 2007 issue of Fantasy & Science Fiction .
The Banishment of Cicero is a 1761 tragedy play by the British writer Richard Cumberland .
True Monster Stories , written by Terry Deary , is the first of the non - fiction True Stories Series of books .
The book La sonrisa etrusca ( `` The Etruscan Smile '' ) originally written in Spanish was written by the Spanish economist and writer José Luis Sampedro in 1985 .
Imperial Earth is a science fiction novel written by Arthur C. Clarke , and published in time for the U.S. bicentennial in 1976 by Ballantine Books .
Vita Karoli Magni ( Life of Charles the Great ) is a biography of Charlemagne , King of the Franks and Holy Roman Emperor , written by Einhard .
A Singular Man is a 1963 novel by J. P. Donleavy .
The Book of Predictions was a book published in 1980 and written by David Wallechinsky , Amy Wallace , and Irving Wallace , the authors of The Book of Lists .
The Coming of Conan is a collection of eight fantasy short stories by American writer Robert E. Howard , featuring his sword and sorcery heroes Kull and Conan the Barbarian , together with the first part of his pseudo - history of the `` Hyborian Age '' in which the Conan tales were set .
Peter Schlemihl is the title character of an 1814 novella , Peter Schlemihls wundersame Geschichte ( Peter Schlemihl 's Miraculous Story ) , written in German by exiled French aristocrat Adelbert von Chamisso .
The Souls of Black Folk is a classic work of American literature by W. E. B. Du Bois .
Centesimus annus ( Latin for `` hundredth year '' ) is an encyclical which was written by Pope John Paul II in 1991 on the hundredth anniversary of Rerum novarum , an encyclical issued by Pope Leo XIII in 1891 .
The Voyage to Icaria ( Voyage en Icarie ) is a novel written by Étienne Cabet published in 1840 .
Un roi sans divertissement ( `` a king without distraction '' ) is a 1947 novel by the French writer Jean Giono .
The Tale of Peter Rabbit is a British children 's book written and illustrated by Beatrix Potter that follows mischievous and disobedient young Peter Rabbit as he is chased about the garden of Mr. McGregor .
Thunder and Lightnings is a realistic children 's novel by Jan Mark , published in 1976 by Kestrel Books of Harmondsworth , London , with illustrations by Jim Russell .
The Apocolocyntosis ( divi ) Claudii , literally The Gourdification of ( the Divine ) Claudius , is a political satire on the Roman emperor Claudius , probably written by Seneca the Younger .
Footfall is a 1985 science fiction novel written by Larry Niven and Jerry Pournelle .
The Old English Baron is an early Gothic novel by the English author Clara Reeve .
The Warlock in Spite of Himself is a science fantasy novel by American author Christopher Stasheff , published in 1969 .
The Castle in the Forest is the last novel by writer Norman Mailer , published in the year of his death , 2007 .
A Kingdom of Dreams is a 1989 New York Times Bestselling historical romance novel written by American author Judith McNaught .
Antony and Cleopatra is a tragedy by William Shakespeare .
The Lucifer Principle book by Howard Bloom , sees social groups , not individuals , as the primary `` unit of selection , '' on genes and human psychological development .
Faith of My Fathers is a 1999 bestselling non - fiction book by United States Senator John McCain with Mark Salter .
Arabian Nights and Days ( 1979 ) is a novel by Egyptian writer Naguib Mahfouz , winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature .
Danger on Midnight River is the sixth novel in World of Adventure series by Gary Paulsen .
Peter Pan ; or , the Boy Who Would n't Grow Up or Peter and Wendy is J. M. Barrie 's most famous work , in the form of a 1904 play and a 1911 novel .
La inocencia castigada ( English : Innocence Punished ) is a Spanish language novel by María de Zayas y Sotomayor , from the collection Desengaños amorosos ( English : Amorous Disenchantments ) .
The Unsex'd Females , a Poem ( 1798 ) , by Richard Polwhele , is a polemical intervention into the public debates over the role of women at the end of the 18th century .
The Restless Supermarket is a novel by Croatian - South African author Ivan Vladislavic , which tracks the changes in Hillbrow , Johannesburg , during the 1990s , through the eyes of a grumpy , retired proof - reader who spends his life in one café .
The Honor of the Queen is David Weber 's second Honor Harrington novel .
Blue Nights is a memoir written by Joan Didion first published in 2011 .
Trusted Like the Fox is a 1948 thriller novel written by British author James Hadley Chase .
`` Scanners Live in Vain '' is a science fiction short story by Cordwainer Smith ( pen name of Paul Linebarger ) , set in his Instrumentality of Mankind future history .
The Spinal Cord Perception is the first novel by Joshua S. Porter , better known by his stage name Josh Dies , the singer / songwriter for the band Showbread .
Two Riders of the Storm ( French : Deux cavaliers de l'orage ) is a 1965 novel by the French writer Jean Giono .
Men of Maize ( Spanish : Hombres de maíz ) is a 1949 novel by Guatemalan Nobel Prize in Literature winner Miguel Ángel Asturias .
The Partly Cloudy Patriot is a book published in 2002 , and is a collection of essays about American history and the author 's own reflections on such issues , by Sarah Vowell , a contributing editor for the WBEZ / Public Radio International program This American Life .
From Atlantis to the Sphinx is a work of non - fiction by British author , Colin Wilson , with the subheading Recovering the Lost Wisdom of the Ancient World .
The Twyborn Affair is a novel by Australian Nobel laureate Patrick White , first published in 1979 .
An Englishman Looks at the World is a 1914 essay collection by H. G. Wells containing journalistic pieces written between 1909 and 1914 .
`` The Frog Prince ; or , Iron Henry '' ( German : Der Froschkönig oder der eiserne Heinrich , literally `` The Frog King ; or , The Iron Heinrich '' ) is a fairy tale , best known through the Brothers Grimm 's written version ; traditionally it is the first story in their collection .
Russian Beauty is a novel written by Russian author Victor Erofeyev .
The Golovlyov Family ( Gospoda Golovlyovy , Господа Головлёвы ) is a novel by Mikhail Saltykov - Shchedrin , written in the course of five years , first published in 1880 by Alexey Suvorin 's publishing house , and generally regarded as the author 's magnum opus .
Philosophy in the Tragic Age of the Greeks ( German : Philosophie i m tragischen Zeitalter der Griechen ) is an incomplete book by Friedrich Nietzsche .
All the Myriad Ways is a collection of 14 short stories and essays by science fiction author Larry Niven , originally published in 1971 .
The Trickster of Liberty is a 1988 novel by Gerald Vizenor that acts as a prequel to his earlier novels Bearheart :
The Sea Dragon Heir is a fantasy novel written by Storm Constantine first published in 2001 .
The Omen Machine is Terry Goodkind 's 12th novel , and the first in a new series about Richard and Kahlan .
When She Woke is the second novel by American author Hillary Jordan , published in October 2011 .
Rich Like Us is a historical and political fiction novel by Nayantara Sahgal .
The Great Wheel is Robert Lawson 's final children 's book , published in 1957 , the year of his death .
The Green and the Gray is a 2004 novel by Timothy Zahn , author of numerous works , including the Star Wars expanded universe trilogy Heir to the Empire .
The Faithful Spy is a novel by New York Times reporter Alex Berenson .
The Half - Made World is a 2010 steampunk fantasy novel by Felix Gilman .
Schleicher 's fable ( avis akvāsas ka ) is an artificial text composed in the reconstructed language Proto - Indo - European ( PIE ) published by August Schleicher in 1868 .
A Good Hanging and Other Stories is a collection of short stories by crime writer Ian Rankin .
Les Fiançailles de M. Hire ( Monsieur Hire 's Engagement ) is the title of a short novel by Belgian writer Georges Simenon .
Final Diagnosis is a 1997 science fiction novel by author James White and is part of the Sector General series .
Engleby is a novel by the author Sebastian Faulks .
Christ in Concrete is a 1939 novel by Pietro di Donato about Italian - American construction workers .
The Last Parable is a 1953 novel by Alec Coppel about the life and times of a judge .
`` The Grain '' , sometimes also translated as A Grain as Big as a Hen 's Egg , is a short story by Russian author Leo Tolstoy written in 1886 .
The Secret of Terror Castle is an American juvenile detective novel written by Robert Arthur , Jr ..
The Naval War of 1812 is Theodore Roosevelt 's first book , published in 1882 .
Knowing God is a book by the British - born Canadian Christian theologian J. I. Packer , and is his best - known work , having sold over 1,000,000 copies in North America alone .
The Labyrinth Key is a science fiction novel by Howard V. Hendrix first published in 2004 .
Eighty Years of Book Cover Design is a 2009 book by Joseph Connolly published by Faber and Faber .
May Pagsinta'y Walang Puso ( Heartless Love ) was a 1921 Tagalog - language novel written by renowned Filipino poet , journalist , and novelist Iñigo Ed . Regalado .
Sons of Mississippi is a book by Paul Hendrickson about sheriffs in Mississippi .
Beggarman , Thief is a 1977 novel written by Irwin Shaw .
The Mind of the Maker ( 1941 ) is a Christian theological book , written by Dorothy L. Sayers ( who was better known for her crime and mystery novels and other fiction , particularly for the character Lord Peter Wimsey ) .
Common Lisp the Language is an influential reference book by Guy L. Steele about Common Lisp .
Chorus Skating ( 1994 ) is a fantasy novel written by Alan Dean Foster .
The Valley of Kashmir ( 1895 ) is a travel book by the English writer Sir Walter Roper Lawrence .
Right Where It Hurts is a 2001 children 's book written by New Zealand author David Hill .
The Kingkiller Chronicle is a fantasy trilogy by Patrick Rothfuss , telling the autobiography of Kvothe , an adventurer and famous musician .
The Beautiful Boy ( or just The Boy ) is a book , ISBN 0 - 8478 - 2586 - 8 , by Germaine Greer , published in 2003 .
The Chrysalids ( United States title : Re - Birth ) is a science fiction novel by John Wyndham , first published in 1955 by Michael Joseph .
Doktor Sleepless is a monthly comic book series written by Warren Ellis with art by Ivan Rodriguez that is published by Avatar Press , launched in July 2007 .
Beyond the Blue Event Horizon is a science fiction novel by the American writer Frederik Pohl , a sequel to his 1977 novel Gateway and the second book in the Heechee series .
Master of Heavenly Beauty ( Slovene : Mojster nebeške lepote ) is a novel by Slovenian author Ivan Sivec .
The Toff on the Farm is a 1958 mystery novel by John Creasey featuring his character the Honourable Richard Rollison , aka ' The Toff ' .
The Sarantine Mosaic is a historical fantasy duology by Guy Gavriel Kay , comprising Sailing to Sarantium and Lord of Emperors .
So Disdained is the second published novel by British author , Nevil Shute ( N.S. Norway ) .
England , Their England ( 1933 ) is an affectionately satirical comic novel of 1920s English urban and rural society by the Scottish writer A. G. Macdonell .
The Door into Summer is a science fiction novel by Robert A. Heinlein , originally serialized in The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction ( October , November , December 1956 , with covers and interior illustrations by Frank Kelly Freas ) and published in hardcover in 1957 .
Borderliners is the English translation of De måske egnede , a novel written by Danish author Peter Høeg in 1993 .
Eight Fantasms and Magics is a collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by Jack Vance .
Matthew Flinders ' Cat is a 2002 novel by Bryce Courtenay ( ISBN 0670910619 ) .
Friends , Lovers , Chocolate is the second of the Sunday Philosophy Club series of novels by Alexander McCall Smith , set in Edinburgh , Scotland , and featuring the protagonist Isabel Dalhousie .
Lanfeust of Troy is a long - running French language comic series written by Christophe Arleston , drawn by Didier Tarquin , and published by Soleil Productions .
Wondrous Strange a teen fantasy novel and the first book by author Lesley Livingston .
Thirteen Reasons Why ( stylized as TH1RTEEN R3ASONS WHY ) is a 2007 young - adult fiction novel written by Jay Asher .
Les Filles du feu ( English : The Daughters of Fire ) is a collection of short prose works , poetry , and a play published by the French poet Gérard de Nerval in January 1854 , a year before his death .
To Make My Bread is a novel written by Grace Lumpkin about the Loray Mill Strike .
Dead Air is a Scottish novel by Iain Banks , published in 2002 .
An Béal Bocht ( Irish : The Poor Mouth ) is a 1941 novel in Irish by Brian O'Nolan ( Flann O'Brien ) , published under the pseudonym `` Myles na gCopaleen '' .
Eight Hundred Leagues on the Amazon ( French : La Jangada - Huit Cents lieues sur l'Amazone ) is a novel by Jules Verne , published in 1881 .
Summer Sisters ( ISBN 0 - 385 - 32405 - 7 ) is a 1998 novel by Judy Blume .
Penrod is a collection of comic sketches by Booth Tarkington that was first published in 1914 .
Pupu Tupuna is a series of Finnish children 's books by the Finnish author Pirkko Koskimies .
The Cry of the Owl is a psychological thriller novel by Patricia Highsmith , the eighth of her 22 novels .
Lizzie Bright and the Buckminster Boy is a young adult historical novel by Gary D. Schmidt , published by Clarion Books in 2004 .
Jubilate Agno ( Latin : `` Rejoice in the Lamb '' ) is a religious poem by Christopher Smart , and was written between 1759 and 1763 , during Smart 's confinement for insanity in St. Luke 's Hospital , Bethnal Green , London .
The Waves , first published in 1931 , is Virginia Woolf 's most experimental novel .
The Understory is the debut novel by American author Pamela Erens published in 2007 by Ironweed Press , and republished in 2014 by Tin House books following the success of her second novel , The Virgins .
David Golder is writer Irène Némirovsky 's first novel .
Zathura is an illustrated children 's book by the American author Chris Van Allsburg as well as the title of a 2005 film based on the book .
The Critique of Pure Reason ( German : Kritik der reinen Vernunft , KrV , in original : Critik der reinen Vernunft ) by Immanuel Kant , first published in 1781 , second edition 1787 , is one of the most influential works in the history of philosophy .
I Capture the Castle is the first novel by the British author Dodie Smith , written during the Second World War when she and her husband Alec Beesley ( also British and a conscientious objector ) were living in California .
Death and the King 's Horseman is a play by Wole Soyinka based on a real incident that took place in Nigeria during British colonial rule : the horseman of an important chief was prevented from committing ritual suicide by the colonial authorities .
Switch Bitch is a 1974 short story collection for adults by Roald Dahl .
Air Apparent is the thirty - first book of the Xanth series by Piers Anthony , which was first mentioned in the `` Author 's Note '' in Currant Events .
Life of Pi is a Canadian fantasy adventure novel by Yann Martel published in 2001 .
The Paratrooper of Mechanic Avenue is the first novel by the American writer Lester Goran .
No . 6 is a nine - volume novel series written by Atsuko Asano and published by Kodansha between October 2003 and June 2011 .
Cosmic Banditos is a 1986 novel by Allan Weisbecker , originally published by Vintage Books and reprinted in 2001 by NAL Trade Paperbacks .
Alas , Babylon is a 1959 novel by American writer Pat Frank ( the pen name of Harry Hart Frank ) , with cover art for the Bantam paperback by Robert Hunt .
Richter 10 is a 1996 novel by Arthur C. Clarke and Mike McQuay .
`` The Dead Past '' is a science fiction short story by Isaac Asimov , first published in the April 1956 issue of Astounding Science Fiction .
Buy Me Blue Ribbons was a 1951 play by Australian writer Sumner Locke Elliott .
To Visit the Queen ( 1998 ) ( titled On Her Majesty 's Wizardly Service in the UK edition ) is a fantasy steampunk novel by Diane Duane .
The Wire that Fenced the West is a book written by Henry D. and Frances T. McCallum and published in 1965 by the University of Oklahoma Press .
Where Have All the Leaders Gone ? is a New York Times bestseller book by Lee Iacocca , the former CEO of Chrysler .
The Ready - Made Family is the seventh in the series of children 's novels about the Marlow family by Antonia Forest , first published in 1967 , and set in that period .
Encyclopedia of the Central Intelligence Agency is a 2003 book by W. Thomas Smith , Jr. It is an encyclopedic work on the Central Intelligence Agency ( CIA ) , the only independent agency of the United States federal government that is tasked with intelligence - gathering .
The Godfather Papers and Other Confessions is a collective autobiography written by Mario Puzo , on his journey through writing The Godfather .
The Midwich Cuckoos is a science fiction novel written by English author John Wyndham , published during 1957 .
Angst ( novel ) ( Russian : Страх ) is a 2001 `` erotic mysticism novel with a detective plot '' by Oleg Postnov --a work that transgresses the genres , and yet the critics discern a panoply of literary and philosophical influences in the novel .
A Ghost in the Machine is a work of detective fiction by Caroline Graham , the seventh in her popular Chief Inspector Barnaby series , which has been adapted into the equally successful ITV drama Midsomer Murders .
The Trouble with Islam Today , original title The Trouble with Islam is a 2004 book critical of Islam written by Irshad Manji , styled in an open - letter addressed to concerned citizens worldwide - Muslim or not .
Poison Study is a 2005 fantasy novel written by Maria V. Snyder and the first book in the Study series .
The Miseducation of Cameron Post is a coming - of - age teen novel by Emily M. Danforth published in 2012 .
Jewels from the Moon and The Meteor That Could n't Stay is a 1964 children 's science fiction book written by Eleanor Cameron and illustrated by Vic Dowd .
Dress Your Family in Corduroy and Denim is a 2004 collection of 22 autobiographical essays by American humorist David Sedaris .
The Tea Party Goes to Washington is a book by United States Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky .
Galileo 's Dream ( 2009 ) is a science fiction novel with elements of historical fiction written by author Kim Stanley Robinson .
Mathilukal ( Malayalam : മതിലുകൾ , meaning Walls ) is a Malayalam novel written by Vaikom Muhammad Basheer in 1965 .
Hour Game is a crime fiction novel written by American writer David Baldacci .
`` An Outpost of Progress '' is a short story written in July 1897 by Joseph Conrad , drawing on his own experience at Congo .
The Wolves of Midwinter is a 2013 novel written by gothic fiction novelist Anne Rice and is the second book in her series The Wolf Gift Chronicles .
Across the Pathways of Space ( Par les Chemins de l'Espace ) is a collection of short stories in the French comic book ( or bande dessinée ) science fiction series Valérian and Laureline created by writer Pierre Christin and artist Jean - Claude Mézières .
Science , Liberty and Peace is an essay written by Aldous Huxley , published in 1946 .
Finn and Hengest is a study by J. R. R. Tolkien , edited by Alan Bliss and published posthumously in book form in 1982 .
`` The Machine Stops '' is a science fiction short story ( 12,300 words ) by E. M. Forster .
Four for Tomorrow is the first story collection by Roger Zelazny , published in paperback by Ace Books in 1967 .
`` Wintertime Wager '' is a 10-page funny animal comic book story written , drawn , and lettered by Carl Barks .
The Jamieson - Fausset - Brown Bible Commentary refers to a biblical commentary entitled a Commentary Critical and Explanatory on the Whole Bible , prepared by Robert Jamieson , Andrew Robert Fausset and David Brown and published in 1871 ; and derived works from this initial publication , in differing numbers of volumes and abridgements .
Benny Shaw is the protagonist of two children 's literature novels by Irish author Eoin Colfer .
Bite Club is a Vertigo comic book mini series created by writers Howard Chaykin and David Tischman .
The Burning Room is the 27th novel by American crime author Michael Connelly , and the seventeenth novel featuring Los Angeles Police Department detective Harry Bosch .
The Fair Jilt : or , the Amours of Prince Tarquin and Miranda is a short story by Aphra Behn published in 1688 .
Quicken Forbidden was a comicbook title published by Cryptic Press , and created by writer Dave Roman and artist John Green .
Cur Deus Homo ? ( Latin for `` Why was God a Man ? '' ) , usually translated Why God Became a Man , is a book written by St Anselm of Canterbury in which he proposed the satisfaction view of the atonement .
Confessions of an Ugly Stepsister is a novel by Gregory Maguire , retelling the tale of Cinderella through the eyes of one of her `` ugly stepsisters '' .
The Devil 's Tune is a novel by the Conservative Party politician Iain Duncan Smith , published in November 2003 .
`` A Forest Hymn '' is an 1824 poem written by William Cullen Bryant , which has been called one of Bryant 's best poems , and `` one of the best nature poems of that age '' .
Storm Thief is a 2006 dystopian science - fiction novel written by Chris Wooding and published by Scholastic Books .
A Contract with God and Other Tenement Stories is a graphic novel by American cartoonist Will Eisner published in 1978 .
Hyenas : a Hap and Leonard Novella is a novella written by American author Joe R. Lansdale .
Nebula Winners Twelve is a 1978 anthology of short stories edited by Gordon R. Dickson .
Billions of Entrepreneurs is a book by Harvard Business School professor , Tarun Khanna .
The 33 Strategies of War by Robert Greene is a `` guide to the subtle social game of everyday life informed by the ... military principles in war . ''
Ich und Du , usually translated as I and Thou , is a book by Martin Buber , published in 1923 , and first translated from German to English in 1937 .
Flare Path is a play by Terence Rattigan , written in 1941 and first staged in 1942 .
The Adventures of Leucippe and Clitophon ( in Greek τὰ κατὰ Λευκίππην καὶ Kλειτoφῶντα ) , written by Achilles Tatius , is one of the five surviving Ancient Greek romances , notable for its many similarities to Longus ' Daphnis and Chloe , and its apparent mild parodic nature .
The Smell of Apples is a 1993 debut novel by South African Mark Behr , also published in the same year in Afrikaans as Die Reuk van Appels .
Der Sand aus den Urnen ( in English , The Sand from the Urns ) , is a German - language poetry collection by Paul Celan , published in Vienna in 1948 .
A Treatise on Crimes and Misdemeanours or Russell on Crime is a book originally written by William Oldnall Russell .
Progression of Animals ( or On the Gait of Animals ; Greek : Περὶ πορείας ζῴων ; Latin : De incessu animalium ) is a text by Aristotle on the details of gait and movement in various species of animals .
Planet of the Damned is a 1962 Hugo Award nominated novel by the American science fiction writer Harry Harrison .
The Word for World Is Forest is a Hugo Award - winning science fiction novella by Ursula K. Le Guin , first published in 1972 in the anthology Again , Dangerous Visions and published as a separate book in 1976 .
Infinity Blues is a book of free verse poetry by singer - songwriter Ryan Adams , published by Akashic Books .
The Songs of a Sentimental Bloke is a verse novel by Australian novelist and poet C. J. Dennis .
The Ghost Belonged to Me is a novel written for children by Richard Peck , author of Newbery Medal winning A Year Down Yonder .
Out of the Everywhere is a collection of seventeen scientific essays by Isaac Asimov .
Spanish Testament is a 1937 book by Arthur Koestler , describing his experiences during the Spanish Civil War .
Return from the Stars ( Polish : Powrót z gwiazd ) is a science fiction novel by Polish author Stanisław Lem .
Betsey Brown is an African - American literature novel by Ntozake Shange , published in 1985 .
Colour Me English is a 2011 collection of essays by Caryl Phillips .
Lair of the Lion is a paranormal / romance written by American author Christine Feehan .
Juegos de lectura en voz alta is an Argentine teacher 's book by Luis Pescetti .
Dark Side of the Morgue is the second of a series of original mystery / thrillers by former James Bond author Raymond Benson .
Amazons II is an anthology of fantasy stories , edited by Jessica Amanda Salmonson , with a cover by Michael Whelan .
The Adventures of Slim and Howdy is a 2008 novel by Kix Brooks and Ronnie Dunn ( superstar duo Brooks & Dunn ) and novelist Bill Fitzhugh .
My Brief History is a memoir published in 2013 by the English physicist Stephen Hawking .
`` Do not go gentle into that good night '' is a poem in the form of a villanelle , and the most famous work of Welsh poet Dylan Thomas ( 1914 - -1953 ) .
The Long Revolution , by Raymond Williams , 1961 .
The Shaggy Man of Oz ( 1949 ) is the thirty - eighth in the series of Oz books created by L. Frank Baum and his successors , and the second and last by Jack Snow .
Swordbird is a children 's fantasy novel written by Nancy Yi Fan .
The Plague Dogs is the third novel by Richard Adams , author of Watership Down , about two dogs who escape an animal testing facility and are subsequently pursued by both the government and the media .
Fantomerna ( lit . The Phantoms ) is the third novel by Swedish author Klas Östergren .
Aag Ka Darya ( River of Fire ) is a novel written by Qurratulain Hyder in the context of an Indian subcontinent partition .
The Oath is the English title of Le serment de Kolvillag , a novel by Elie Wiesel .
Old Rose and Silver is a novel by Myrtle Reed first published in 1909 .
All That Is Solid Melts into Air is an academic text written by Marshall Berman between 1971 and 1981 , and published in New York in 1982 .
The London Spy by Ned Ward ( 1660/67 - June 20 , 1731 ) was a periodical about London life , later published as a book .
Geschichte des osmanischen Reiches is a work by Austrian orientalist Joseph von Hammer - Purgstall .
The Grantville Gazettes are anthologies of short stories set in the 1632 universe introduced in Eric Flint 's novel 1632 .
The Suicide Shop ( French : Le Magasin des suicides ) is a 2006 black comedy novel by the French writer Jean Teulé .
How It Is is a novel by Samuel Beckett first published in French as Comment c'est by Les Editions de Minuit in 1961 .
Music on the Bamboo Radio is a novel written by Martin Booth that was first published in 1997 .
The Betrayal of the American Right is a book by Murray Rothbard written in the early 1970s and published by the Ludwig von Mises Institute in 2007 .
`` A Defence of Poetry '' is an essay by the English poet Percy Bysshe Shelley , written in 1821 and first published posthumously in 1840 in Essays , Letters from Abroad , Translations and Fragments by Edward Moxon in London .
My Glorious Brothers is a historical novel by the Jewish American novelist Howard Fast , depicting the 167 BC Maccabeean revolt against the Greek - Seleucid Empire .
Pig Heart Boy is a children 's novel by Malorie Blackman which was first published in 1997 .
Mysooru Mallige ( 1942 ) is a literary work of Kannada poet , K. S. Narasimhaswamy .
Reclaiming the Dead Sea Scrolls is a book was written by Lawrence Schiffman , published in 1994 by Doubleday , as part of the Anchor Research Library .
The Electric Kool - Aid Acid Test is a nonfiction book by Tom Wolfe that was published in 1968 .
Coots in the North is the name given by Arthur Ransome 's biographer , Hugh Brogan , to an incomplete Swallows and Amazons novel found in Ransome 's papers .
The Public and its Problems is a 1927 book by American philosopher John Dewey .
The Whispered Secret , previously published as Leven Thumps and the Whispered Secret is a fantasy novel by Obert Skye that traces the journeys of Leven , a seemingly ordinary boy from Burnt Culvert , Oklahoma , and Winter Frore , a neglected girl , as they seek to bring Geth back to his former state .
The Carrie Diaries is a young - adult novel , the first in a series of the same name by American author Candace Bushnell .
The Werewolf of Paris ( 1933 ) is a horror novel as well as a work of historical fiction by Guy Endore .
Back When We Were Grownups is a 2001 novel written by Anne Tyler in memory of her husband , who died in 1997 .
The Book of Fixed Stars ( Arabic : كتاب صور الكواكب‎ kitab suwar al - kawakib ) is an astronomical text written by Abd al - Rahman al - Sufi ( Azophi ) around 964 .
If I Stay is a young adult novel by Gayle Forman published in 2009 .
The Curious Savage , written by John Patrick , is a comedic play about Ethel P. Savage , an elderly woman whose husband recently died and left her approximately ten million dollars .
Where the Rivers Flow North is a novel written in 1978 by Howard Frank Mosher .
Roma Sub Rosa is the title of the series of historical mystery novels by Steven Saylor set in ancient Rome and populated by noteworthy denizens thereof .
What the Buddha Taught , by Dr Walpola Rahula , has been regarded as an important introductory book on Buddhism .
Twenties Girl is a 2009 book by Sophie Kinsella ( pen name of Madeline Wickham ) .
The Circus of Dr. Lao and Other Improbable Stories was an anthology of fantasy stories edited by Ray Bradbury and published in 1956 .
The Infernal Desire Machines of Doctor Hoffman , published in the United States as The War of Dreams , is a 1972 novel by Angela Carter .
A Death in the Family is an autobiographical novel by author James Agee , set in Knoxville , Tennessee .
You Bright and Risen Angels is a 1987 novel by William T. Vollmann , detailing a fictional war between insects and the forces of modern civilization .
Jackdaws is a World War II spy thriller written by British novelist Ken Follett .
`` Redemption Cairn '' is a science fiction short story by Stanley G. Weinbaum that first appeared in the March 1936 issue of Astounding Stories .
Rokovnjači ( The Bandits)is a novel by Slovenian author Josip Jurčič .
The Botticelli Secret is a 2010 historical - mystery - detective novel written by Marina Fiorato in the vein of code adventures such as The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown .
Sacerdotalis caelibatus ( Latin for `` Of priestly celibacy '' ) is an encyclical written by Pope Paul VI .
Puckoon is a comic novel by Spike Milligan , first published in 1963 .
Mayyazhippuzhayude Theerangalil ( On the Banks of the River Mayyazhi ) is a Malayalam language novel by M. Mukundan .
Rodinsky 's Room ( ISBN 1862072574 ) is a non - fiction book by the British authors Rachel Lichtenstein and Iain Sinclair , first published by Granta Books in 1999 .
`` Distant Replay '' is a magic realism / slipstream short story published in 2007 by Mike Resnick .
Uphill Climb is a 1987 short story written by Canadian Science Fiction Author Robert J. Sawyer .
Andha Yug ( Hindi : अंधा युग , The Age of Blindness or The Blind Age ) is a 1954 verse play written in Hindi , by renowned novelist , poet , and playwright Dharamvir Bharati ( 1926 - 1997 ) .
Nemodlenec ( Czech for `` not praying man '' ) is a Czech novel , written by Karolina Světlá .
Peter and the Starcatcher is a play based on the 2006 novel of a similar name by Dave Barry and Ridley Pearson , adapted for the stage by Rick Elice .
Religio Medici ( The Religion of a Doctor ) by Sir Thomas Browne is a spiritual testament and an early psychological self - portrait .
The Last Hero is a short novel , the twenty - seventh of the Discworld series by Terry Pratchett .
How to Lie with Statistics is a book written by Darrell Huff in 1954 presenting an introduction to statistics for the general reader .
Drew Hayes Poison Elves # 1 ( March 2013 ) picks up almost precisely at the cliffhanger point where Drew ( Hayes ) left it at the end of issue # 79 from Sirius ..
Even the Stars Look Lonesome ( 1997 ) is African - American writer and poet Maya Angelou 's second book of essays , published during the long period between her fifth and sixth autobiographies , All God 's Children Need Traveling Shoes ( 1986 ) and A Song Flung Up to Heaven ( 2002 ) .
The Werewolf of Ponkert is a collection of two horror short stories by H. Warner Munn .
Murder on Mars is a juvenile science fiction novel , the sixteenth in Hugh Walters ' Chris Godfrey of U.N.E.X.A. series .
Roma Eterna is a 2003 novel by Robert Silverberg which presents an alternative history in which the Roman Empire survives to the present day .
The Interpretation of Dreams ( German : Die Traumdeutung ) is a book by psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud .
The Seven Sisters was written by Ed Greenwood , and published by TSR , Inc. as a 128-page book .
Fear Nothing is a novel released in 1998 by the best - selling author Dean Koontz .
The Century for Young People is a non - fiction history book written by Peter Jennings and Todd Brewster .
On Aggression ( German : Das sogenannte Böse zur Naturgeschichte der Aggression ) is a 1963 book by the ethologist Konrad Lorenz ; it was translated into English in 1966 .
The Armageddon Rag is a mystery - fantasy novel by American bestselling author George R. R. Martin , first co - published in 1983 in hardcover by both Poseidon Press and The Nemo Press .
Der Neinsager ( ' He Said No ' ) - like its companion piece Der Jasager ( ' He Said Yes ' ) - is a Lehrstück by the German dramatist Bertolt Brecht .
A esmorga is a novel by Galician writer Eduardo Blanco Amor from 1959 .
GraceLand is a 2004 novel by Chris Abani , which tells the story of a teenager named Elvis , who is trying to get out of the ghettos of Lagos , Nigeria .
Grave Descend is a novel written by Michael Crichton under the pseudonym John Lange .
Blue Labyrinth is a thriller novel by Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child .
Luckypenny is a 1937 novel by Scottish writer Bruce Marshall .
The Alienist is a crime novel by Caleb Carr first published in 1994 .
The Crazy Man is a Canadian children 's story written by Pamela Porter in 2005 .
The Real Right Thing is a short story written by Henry James and published in 1899 .
Die Dame i m Chinchilla ( published in 1961 ) is a detective fiction novel written by Frank Arnau .
Days of Blood and Starlight is a young - adult fantasy novel written by Laini Taylor .
Portrait of a Spy is the 2011 Daniel Silva 's spy novel .
Winter Kills is a black comic novel by Richard Condon exploring the assassination of a U.S. President .
Reign in Hell is a 2008 - 2009 comic book limited series written by Keith Giffen , pencilled by Thomas Derenick , inked by Bill Sienkiewicz , and published by DC Comics .
The Big Fellow is a 1937 biography of the famed Irish leader , Michael Collins , by Frank O'Connor .
Het Gulden Cabinet vande Edel Vry Schilder - Const or The Golden Cabinet of the Noble Liberal Art of Painting is a book by the 17th - century Flemish notary and rederijker Cornelis de Bie published in Antwerp .
Looking for Jake is a collection of science fiction , horror and fantasy stories by British author China Miéville .
The Rush for Second Place is a posthumous collection of essays by William Gaddis .
The Encyclopedia of the Dead ( Serbo - Croatian : Enciklopedija mrtvih ) is a collection of nine stories by Yugoslav author Danilo Kiš .
Stargonauts is a science - fiction - comedy novel written by David S. Garnett and released in 1994 .
Shadowmarch is the first novel in the Shadowmarch tetralogy , by Tad Williams .
Summer and the City is a young - adult novel written by Candace Bushnell .
Does Anyone Ever Listen ? is a young adult novel by Rosie Rushton , first published with this title in 2006 by Piccadilly Press .
The Pigman 's Legacy is a young adult novel written by Paul Zindel , first published in 1980 .
Introduction to Algorithms is a book by Thomas H. Cormen , Charles E. Leiserson , Ronald L. Rivest , and Clifford Stein .
The Society of Mind is both the title of a 1986 book and the name of a theory of natural intelligence as written and developed by Marvin Minsky .
Dear Mr. Henshaw is a juvenile epistolary novel by Beverly Cleary which was awarded the Newbery Medal in 1984 .
The Great Automatic Grammatizator ( published in the U.S. as The Umbrella Man and Other Stories ) is a collection of thirteen short stories written by British author Roald Dahl .
George Washington 's Socks is a 1991 children 's novel by Elvira Woodruff .
A Gift from Nessus is a novel by the Scottish writer William McIlvanney published in 1968 and republished in 2014 .
Gai - Jin ( Japanese , `` Foreigner '' ) is a 1993 novel by James Clavell , chronologically the third book in his Asian Saga , although it was the last to be published .
Aimed for a more sophisticated audience than typical light superhero adventures , The Daredevils featured Captain Britain stories by Alan Moore and Alan Davis , as well as new Night Raven text stories , and reprints of Frank Miller 's Daredevil stories .
Bridge of Birds is a fantasy novel by Barry Hughart , first published in 1984 .
The Daleth Effect , also known as In Our Hands , the Stars , is a science fiction novel written by Harry Harrison and published in 1970 .
Mathias Sandorf was an 1885 adventure book by French writer Jules Verne .
Snow Wolf is an espionage novel by Glenn Meade .
Death in Cyprus ( published in 1956 ) is an M. M. Kaye mystery novel .
Bearers of the Black Staff is a fantasy novel by Terry Brooks released on August 24 , 2010 as the first of a two - part series called the Legends of Shannara .
Vestiges of the Natural History of Creation is an 1844 work of speculative natural history and philosophy by Robert Chambers .
Spy High is an English book series by A. J. Butcher about a high school for secret agents in training .
Swell Foop is the twenty - fifth book of the Xanth series by Piers Anthony .
Sons of Gruumsh was published in September 2005 , and was written by Christopher Perkins , with cover art by Todd Lockwood and interior art by Mike Dubisch .
Five Science Fiction Novels is a 1952 anthology of five science fiction novellas edited by Martin Greenberg .
Wonders of the Invisible World was a book published in 1693 by Cotton Mather , defending Mather 's role in the witchhunt conducted in Salem , Massachusetts , and espousing the belief that witchcraft was an evil magical power .
The Showgirl Princess is a children 's book written by Kylie Minogue .
The Cruise of the Breadwinner is a novella by the British author H. E. Bates .
Danny Dunn and the Universal Glue is the fifteenth and final novel in the Danny Dunn series of juvenile science fiction / adventure books written by Raymond Abrashkin and Jay Williams .
The Convent of Hell ( original Spanish title : El convento infernal ) is an erotic graphic novel written by Ricardo Barreiro and drawn by Ignacio Noé .
Censorship in Afghanistan is a book by Hazara poet and journalist Kamran Mir Hazar .
The Brothers K is a 1992 novel by David James Duncan an author , fisherman and environmental advocate from the Pacific Northwest .
Aye , and Gomorrah , and other stories is a collection of stories by American writer Samuel R. Delany , published by Vintage Books in 2003 .
When Darkness Comes is Robert Swindells 's first book .
Drums for Rancas ( Spanish : Redoble por Rancas ) is a 1977 novel by Peruvian author Manuel Scorza that that represent the historical struggles of the inhabitants of the Department of Cerro de Pasco as they fight to recuperate control and ownership of their communal lands from the Peruvian government and multinational mining interests .
God 's Little Acre is a 1933 novel by Erskine Caldwell about a dysfunctional farming family in Georgia obsessed with sex and wealth .
The Howard and Moore Complete Checklist of the Birds of the World is a book by Richard Howard and Alick Moore which presents a list of the bird species of the world .
Conversations with God ( CwG ) is a sequence of books written by Neale Donald Walsch .
Brewster 's Millions is a novel written by George Barr McCutcheon in 1902 , originally under the pseudonym of Richard Greaves .
Windhaven is a science - fiction and fantasy novel co - written by novelist and screenwriter George R. R. Martin , but mainly by novelist Lisa Tuttle .
Starman Jones is a 1953 science fiction novel by Robert A. Heinlein about a farm boy who wants to go to the stars .
Sedmikostelí is a Czech novel , written by Miloš Urban .
The Chelsea Murders ( known in the USA as Murder Games ) is a thriller by Lionel Davidson .
Quiet as a Nun is a thriller novel , written by Antonia Fraser .
Bring Larks and Heroes is a 1967 novel by Australian author Thomas Keneally which won the Miles Franklin Award in 1967 .
The Heritage of Shannara is a series of four fantasy novels by Terry Brooks , set hundreds of years after the original Shannara trilogy .
The Moons of Jupiter is a book of short stories by Alice Munro , published by Macmillan of Canada in 1982 .
The Negro is a book by W. E. B. Du Bois published in 1915 and released in electronic form by Project Gutenberg in 2011 .
Poor Richard 's Almanack ( sometimes Almanac ) was a yearly almanac published by Benjamin Franklin , who adopted the pseudonym of `` Poor Richard '' or `` Richard Saunders '' for this purpose .
Wonderful Ethiopians of the Ancient Cushite Empire is a book by Drusilla Dunjee Houston published in 1926 .
Five Go Adventuring Again ( published in 1943 ) is the second book in the Famous Five series by the British author , Enid Blyton .
A Son of the Circus ( 1994 ) is John Irving 's eighth published novel .
Hayom Yom ( Hebrew : היום יום‎ , `` Today is day ... '' ) is a calendar for the Hebrew year of 5703 ( 1942 - 3 ) , compiled by Rabbi Menachem Mendel Schneerson at the behest of his father - in - law , Rabbi Yosef Yitzchok Schneersohn , in the winter of 1942 .
La Thébaïde , or The Thebaid , is a tragedy in five acts ( with respectively 6 , 4 , 6 , 3 and 6 scenes ) in verse by Jean Racine first presented , without much success , on June 20 , 1664 at the Palais - Royal in Paris .
Scratch My Back is the eighth studio album ( and fifteenth album overall ) by the English musician Peter Gabriel , his first in eight years .
`` Valley of Dreams '' is a science fiction short story by Stanley G. Weinbaum originally published in the November 1934 issue of Wonder Stories .
It Ca n't Happen Here is a semi - satirical 1935 political novel by American author Sinclair Lewis .
Williswinde is a collection of verses written by Louis Couperus .
Right as Rain is a 2001 crime novel by George Pelecanos .
Clan Apis is an award - winning graphic novel created by then Assistant Professor ( now Full Professor ) of Biology at Juniata College , Jay Hosler .
Thérèse Raquin ( teʁɛz ʁakɛ̃ ) is a novel ( first published in 1867 ) and a play ( first performed in 1873 ) by the French writer Émile Zola .
`` Up in the Gallery '' ( `` Auf der Galerie '' ) is a short piece of fiction written by Franz Kafka .
Sonnet 141 is the informal name given to the 141st of William Shakespeare 's 154 sonnets .
Hell Island is a horror / adventure novella written in conjunction with the Australian Books Alive promotion , by thriller writer Matthew Reilly .
