Royston Dias ( born 30 January 1993 ) is an Indian cricketer who plays for Mumbai Under-19 team .
Keith Kingbay ( born on 30 April 1914 ) was a racer , manufacturer , advocate , and author in bicycling .
Andy Gee ( born Andreas Gröber , September 1950 in Berlin ) is a German guitarist and musician , best known for his time with Peter Bardens , Steve Ellis and as a temporary member of Thin Lizzy .
Ziemowit Wojciechowski ( born 3 October 1948 ) is a Polish born former fencer .
Laura More ( using the pseudonym Laura Muncey ) ( born 16 December 1984 ) is a British singer who is best known for her appearance in the `` Call on Me '' music video , and in her lead vocals in Uniting Nations single `` Ai No Corrida '' .
Huáscar Barradas ( born Maracaibo , 1964 ) is a Venezuelan flutist and Professor of flute at the `` Instituto Universitario de Estudios Musicales '' in Caracas .
Carl Georg Ferdinand Thielemann ( 8 March 1803 -- 13 May 1863 ) was a Danish architect and royal building inspector during the 19h century .
Hannah Bunce Watson ( 28 December 1749 -- 27 September 1807 ) was a newspaper publisher from the U.S. state of Connecticut , whose printed output supported the American Revolutionary War .
Christian Newberry ( born in 1968 ) is a British former competitive figure skater .
Peter M. Brant ( born March 1 , 1947 ) is an American industrialist , businessman , art collector and philanthropist .
Abir Abrar ( born 1985 ) is an Indian stage , film , and television actress .
Sebastian Copeland ( born 1964 ) is an award winning photographer , polar explorer , author , lecturer , and environmental activist .
Banu Avar ( born 18 July 1955 , Eskisehir ) is a Turkish author , journalist , news anchor , and political commentator .
Loda Halama ( 20 July 1911 -- 13 July 1996 ) was a Polish dancer and actress .
Robert Kingsley ( 1903 - 1988 ) was an American legal scholar and California judge .
Otomārs Oškalns ( 12 April 1904 -- 1 September 1947 ) was a prominent Latvian communist and partisan fighter .
Fajar Alfian ( born 7 March 1995 ) is an Indonesian badminton player in double specialist .
Shoukath ( born 1971 ) is a Malayalam philosophical mystical writer .
Ma Yong ( simplified Chinese : 马勇 ; traditional Chinese : 馬勇 ; pinyin : Mǎ Yǒng ; born January 1957 ) is a former Chinese politician who spent most of his career in central China 's Hunan province .
Anushka Sharma ( pronounced ( əˈnʊʂkaː ˈʃərmaː ) ; born 1 May 1988 ) is an Indian film actress and producer .
Diego Stocco ( born 1976 ) is an Italian sound designer and composer for movies , television and video games .
Steinar Lone ( born 23 August 1955 ) is a Norwegian translator .
Everett McDonald ( born c. 1958 ) is a Canadian politician who was an elected member to the Legislative Assembly of Alberta representing the electoral district of Grande Prairie - Smoky from 2012 to 2015 .
Pieta Brown ( born 1973 ) is an American musician and singer - songwriter who has released five albums and three EPs .
Jeremy Levin ( born 1954 ) is a South African - born businessman , medical doctor and research scientist .
Nick Fulwood ( born 2 October 1963 ) is a retired British tennis player who reached the third round of the 1989 Wimbledon Championships .
Yadin Zaris ( Hebrew : ידין זריס‎ ; born 14 May 1990 ) is an Israeli striker player who currently plays for Israeli side Hapoel Hod HaSharon .
Ernst Wilhelm Eduard von Knorr ( 8 March 1840 -- 17 February 1920 ) was a German admiral of the Kaiserliche Marine who helped establish the German colonial empire .
Robert Cameron Sharp ( born 3 June 1958 ) is a Scottish former sprinter .
David Stirton ( 1816 -- August 16 , 1908 ) was a Liberal member of the Canadian House of Commons representing Wellington South from 1867 to 1876 .
Lucius Valerius Septimius Bassus ( c. 328 - aft . 379 or 383 ) was a Praefectus Urbi Romae in 379 or 383 .
Bernard Yack ( born 1952 ) is a Canadian born American political theorist .
Lyon Cohen ( 1868 - 1937 ) was a Polish - born Canadian businessman and a philanthropist .
Silvia Sommer ( born 9 April 1944 ) is an Austrian composer , pianist and music producer .
James Pickford is a British race car driver , born 30 April 1979 in Macclesfield , Cheshire .
Elwyn Hartley Edwards , MC , was an equestrian writer and editor , born on 17 April 1927 .
Sir John Bland - Sutton , 1st Baronet ( 21 April 1855 -- 20 December 1936 ) , was a British physician .
Janis Mackey Frayer ( born 1970 ) is a Canadian journalist with CTV National News .
Toba Khedoori ( born 1964 in Australia ) is an artist of Iraqi heritage , known primarily for highly detailed mixed - media paintings executed on large sheets of wax - coated paper .
Joanne Samuel ( born 5 August 1957 ) is an Australian actress who is best known for her role as the screen wife of Mel Gibson 's title character in the 1979 film Mad Max .
Lester Horton ( 23 January 1906 -- 2 November 1953 ) was an American dancer , choreographer , and teacher .
Everett Peter Greenberg ( born 1948 ) is an American microbiologist .
Kári Steinn Karlsson ( born 19 May 1986 ) is an Icelandic long - distance runner .
David Markham ( 3 April 1913 -- 15 December 1983 ) was an English stage and film actor for over forty years .
Eamonn Boyce ( born 1925 ) was an Irish volunteer of the Irish Republican Army .
Ruxandra Lăpușneanu ( 1538 - -21.11.1570 ) was a princess consort of Moldavia by marriage to Alexandru Lăpușneanu .
Mats Werner ( born 1 June 1953 ) is a Swedish , retired professional footballer .
John Turitzin was approximately born in 1955 .
João Lopes Marques ( born 29 August 1971 in Lisbon ) is a Tallinn - based writer , journalist and blogger .
Ade Adepitan MBE ( born 27 March 1973 ) is a British television presenter and wheelchair basketball player .
Erastus Tjejamba ( born 1936 ) was the Chairman of the Executive Committee of Hereroland from September 1984 to August 1987 and from October 1987 to February 1988 .
Polonca Kovač , true name Magdalena Kovač , ( born 19 February 1937 ) is a Slovene children 's writer and translator .
Janka Kulcsár ( born 8 April 1985 ) is a Hungarian pianist and répétiteur , and a founding member of the Moltopera Company .
Alissa Firsova ( Russian : Алисса Фирсова ; born 24 July 1986 ) is a Russian - British classical composer , pianist and conductor .
Johanna Klum ( born 12 July 1980 in Berlin ) is a German television presenter and former singer .
Julie Ann Dawson ( born August 1971 ) , is an American horror fiction writer , RPG designer , and publisher .
Ravi V. Bellamkonda ( born 1968 ) is a biomedical engineer and the department chair of the Wallace H. Coulter Department of Biomedical Engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology and Emory University since 2013 .
Gordon Edwards was born in Canada in 1940 , and graduated from the University of Toronto in 1961 with a gold medal in Mathematics and Physics and a Woodrow Wilson Fellowship .
David Lenz ( born , 1962 , Milwaukee , Wisconsin ) is an American portrait painter .
Alisha Dash ( 13 September 1993 -- ) is an Indian model turned actress .
Pier Luigi Bellini delle Stelle ( 1920 - 1984 ) was an Italian anti - fascist partisan and lawyer , notable for capturing Benito Mussolini at Dongo in April 1945 .
Jorge Curbelo full name Jorge Winston Curbelo Garis ( born 21 December 1981 ) is a Uruguayan footballer who plays for Arsenal de Sarandí in the Argentine Primera División .
Sharena Gunawan , better known by the stage name Sharena ( born 11 October 1983 ) , is an Indonesian actress and model .
Ligia Consuelo Bonetti Dubreil ( b. Santo Domingo , 27 March 1968 ) , also known as Ligia Bonetti de Valiente , is a businesswoman from the Dominican Republic .
William Alexander Greenhill ( 1 January 1814 , Stationers ' Hall , London -- 19 September 1894 , Hastings ) was an English physician , literary editor and sanitary reformer .
Margaret Wirrpanda ( 1939-February 24 , 2013 ) was a campaigner for Australian Aboriginal rights .
Leo Schofield AM ( born 6 May 1935 ) is an Australian restaurant critic , contributing a weekly column in The Mercury .
Eugenia Vronskaya ( born 1966 ) is a Russian figurative painter .
Barbara Jefford , OBE ( born 26 July 1930 ) is a British Shakespearean actress best known for her theatrical performances with the Royal Shakespeare Company , the Old Vic and the National Theatre , and her role as Molly Bloom in the 1967 film of James Joyce 's Ulysses .
Ernest Sibanda ( born 25 December 1925 ) was the first black person to join The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter - day Saints ( LDS Church ) in Zimbabwe .
Francesco di Bartolommeo Alfei ( Montalcino , 1421 - Siena , after 1491 ) was an Italian painter of the Renaissance , active in Siena .
Mahmoud Omar Mahmoud Shelbaieh ( born 20 May 1980 ) is a Jordanian footballer of Palestinian descent , who is a striker for Al - Wehdat .
Lucy Wangui Kabuu ( born 24 March 1984 ) is a Kenyan long - distance runner who specializes in the 5000 and 10,000 metres events .
Stephen Wallace Taylor ( born 1965 ) is a historian and chair of the Department of History and Political Science at Macon State College , in Macon , Georgia .
Denise Rood ( born 1955 ) , violinist , has for 15 years been a member of Philharmonia Virtuosi Chamber Orchestra and is currently a member of the Santa Fe Opera .
Mieke Wijaya ( born 7 March 1940 ) is an Indonesian actress who has won three Citra Awards .
Leo Koretz ( 1879 - 1925 ) was an American lawyer and stockbroker who ran an elaborate Ponzi scheme in Chicago , called the `` Bayano oil fraud , '' which garnered an estimated $ 30 million ( about $ 400 million today ) from hundreds of investors in Chicago .
William McFadden Orr , FRS ( 2 May 1866 -- 14 August 1934 ) was a British and Irish mathematician .
Attila Pinte ( born 6 June 1971 ) is a former Slovak football player of Hungarian ethnicity who currently cooperating as an assistant manager for ŠK SFM Senec .
Per Kasperi ( born 20 May 1993 ) is a Swedish ice sledge hockey player .
Robert Meeropol ( born Robert Rosenberg in 1947 ) is the younger son of Ethel and Julius Rosenberg .
Lyndal Oatley ( born 27 June 1980 ) is an Australian equestrian .
Sebastian Xavier ( born 10 February 1970 ) is a former Indian swimmer from Kerala .
Samir Seliminski ( born 9 May 1969 in Isperih ) is a Bulgarian former football player and the current football manager of Akademik Sofia .
Maurice Berkeley , 3rd Viscount Fitzhardinge ( 1628 - -90 ) , of Bruton , Somerset and Pall Mall , Westminster , was an English politician , of the Bruton branch of the Berkeley family .
Maja Blagdan ( born 16 May 1968 ) is a Croatian pop singer .
E. Benjamin Skinner ( born May 4 , 1976 ) is a writer on modern - day slavery and a Senior Vice President at Tau Investment Management .
Vaughan Oliver ( born 1957 ) is a British graphic designer based in Epsom , South of London .
Jean - Pierre Van Rossem ( born 29 May 1945 ) is a Belgian stock market guru , economist , econometrician , author , philosopher , Public figure , politician and former member of the Belgian & Flemish Parliament
Umberto Rispoli ( born 31 August 1988 in San Severino Marche , Italy ) is horse racing jockey .
Joanna Cooper ( born 1994 ) is an Irish model and beauty pageant titleholder who was crowned Miss Universe Ireland 2015 and represented Ireland at the Miss Universe 2015 .
Søren Lerby ( born 1 February 1958 ) is a Danish former football player , manager , and licensed agent .
Vasil Tole ( born 22 November 1963 ) is an Albanian composer of European classical music , including opera , chamber music , orchestral works and various pieces for small ensembles and solo instruments .
David A. Whiteley ( born c. 1944 ) is a retired American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer who trained three Champions and who in 1979 won the third leg of the U.S. Triple Crown .
Gillian Attard M.Q.R. ( born 3 February 1983 ) is a Maltese actress , singer , television personality , and Vocal Coach .
Pacomio Poqui was born on La Ranchería de Esniscue , Alta California around 1794 to Chumash parents , and was baptized and given the Spanish name José at Mission La Purisima in 1803 .
Franny Armstrong ( born 3 February 1972 ) is a British documentary film director working for her own company , Spanner Films , and a former drummer with indie pop group The Band of Holy Joy .
Mirsad Hibić ( born 11 October 1973 ) is a former professional Bosnian footballer who last played for Spanish club Atletico Madrid .
Princess Aisha bint Faisal of Jordan ( born 27 March 1997 , Amman ) is the daughter Prince Faisal bin Al Hussein and Princess Alia Tabba , and a niece of King Abdullah II of Jordan .
Caroline Kraabel ( born 1961 in San Francisco ) is a London - based American composer , improviser and saxophonist .
Andrew Fenn ( born 1 July 1990 ) is a British cyclist , who rode for Scotland in the 2010 Commonwealth Games and rides for Team Sky .
Hao Chujun ( Chinese : 郝處俊 ; 607 - -681 ) , formally Duke of Zengshan ( 甑山公 ) , was an official and general of the Chinese Tang Dynasty , serving as chancellor during the reign of Emperor Gaozong .
Ros Drinkwater ( born 14 February 1944 ) is a Scottish - born actress , best known for her portrayal of Paul Temple 's wife , Steve , in the eponymous television series , based on the character created by Francis Durbridge .
Richard Shephard MBE , DL , FRSCM ( b. 1949 ) is a composer , former educator , and Director of Development and Chamberlain of York Minster .
Audax Minor ( 1887 -- October 8 , 1979 ) , the pen name of George F. T. Ryall , was a Canadian writer who worked as the horse racing columnist for The New Yorker for 52 years .
Hannah Daniel ( born 20 January 1986 ) , is a Welsh actress , better known for her roles on BBC Wales TV film Dad and TV series Hinterland .
Emma Nuttall ( born 23 April 1992 ) is a British track and field athlete , who specialises in the high jump .
Frances Adcock ( born 9 August 1984 ) is a British - born Australian former competition swimmer who specialized in backstroke events .
Johnny Crowley ( born 21 February 1956 ) is an Irish retired hurler who played as a centre - back with the Cork senior team .
J. Donald Monan , SJ ( born December 31 , 1924 ) is the current Chancellor of Boston College and was the 24th President of Boston College , a post he held from 1972 to 1996 - -the longest such tenure in the University 's history .
Paul Sagan ( born 1959 ) is an American businessman and an executive in residence ( XIR ) at General Catalyst Partners .
Phil McCrea ( born 1948 ) was president of the National Association of Biology Teachers .
Alexandru Teriachiu ( 1829 -- March 2 , 1893 ) was a Romanian politician who served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs .
Géraldine Olivier ( born 5 June 1967 in Marly , Fribourg , maiden name Burri ) is a Swiss singer of volkstümliche Musik .
Ali Khatami ( born 1953 ) is the younger brother of former Iranian president , Mohammed Khatami , and served as his chief of staff during his second term in office .
Marc Fisher ( born 1958 in New York , New York ) is a senior editor for the Washington Post where he writes about national , foreign and local issues .
Reinhard Schaletzki ( 21 May 1916 -- 21 March 1995 ) , born in Upper Silesia , was a German international footballer .
Birgit Lohberg - Schulz ( also Schulz - Lohberg , Lohberg or Schulz ; born 3 December 1965 ) is a retired German freestyle swimmer who won two bronze relay medals at the 1987 and 1989 European Aquatics Championships .
Emma Edwards Green , born Emma Sarah Etine Edwards ( 1856 - 1942 ) , known also as Mrs. Emma Green , was an American painter and designer .
Sofia Penkova ( Bulgarian : София Пенкова ; born 26 January 1979 ) is a Bulgarian former competitive figure skater .
Maurice Riemer Calhoun , Sr . , known as Riemer Calhoun ( April 5 , 1909 -- August 4 , 1994 ) , was a Democrat from Mansfield , Louisiana , who represented a combined DeSoto and Caddo parish district in the Louisiana State Senate from 1944 to 1952 .
Ravji Patel ( 1939 - -1968 ) was a modernist poet and novelist in Gujarati .
Dušan Moravčíkz ( Bánov , 27 March 1948 ) is a former Czech athlete who competed mainly in the 3000 metres steeplechase .
Krisztián Németh ( Hungarian pronunciation : ( ˈkristiaːn ˈneːmɛt ) ; born 5 January 1989 ) is a Hungarian international football player who currently plays as a striker for Al - Gharafa in the Qatar Stars League .
Helmut Reinisch ( born 1953 in Graz ) is an Austrian gallery owner and collector of contemporary art as well as an author and expert in the field of old and antique carpets and textiles .
Kim Hagger ( born 2 December 1961 ) is a retired English athlete who competed mainly in the heptathlon and the long jump .
Christophe Sirodeau ( born Paris , 1970 ) is a French pianist and composer .
Michel Chiha ( 1891 - -1954 ) was a Lebanese banker , a politician , writer and journalist .

Sir Walter Morley Fletcher , KBE FRS ( 1873 - -1933 ) was a British physiologist and administrator .
Eric Boulter ( born 15 October 1952 ) is an Australian swimmer , athlete , and wheelchair basketball player , who won two medals at the 1972 Heidelberg Paralympics .
Richard Morecroft ( born 20 January 1956 ) is an English - born Australian television presenter and former host of the ABC News Sydney bulletin .
Leo Gregory ( born 22 November 1978 ) is an English film television actor .
Ole Skouboe ( born 6 September 1949 ) is a Danish former footballer and manager , and is currently working as president for Greek club Aris .

John Franklin Grimsley ( 18 October 1925 -- June 8 , 2015 ) known as Jack Grimsley was an Australian musical director and composer who worked as the Musical Director at Network Ten between 1966 and 1988 .

Billy Armstrong ( born 21 June 1943 , Coagh , County Tyrone , ) is an Ulster Unionist politician in Northern Ireland .
Steven Ellery ( born 22 August 1974 in Melbourne ) is a retired Australian racing driver known from V8 Supercars .
Nathaniel Pearce ( 14 February 1779 -- 12 August 1820 ) was an explorer who spent many years in Abyssinia ( present - day Ethiopia ) and wrote a journal of his experiences .
Abbie Eaton ( born 2 January 1992 ) is a racing driver from the East Riding of Yorkshire , England .
Birgit Sarrap ( née Õigemeel , born 24 September 1988 ) is an Estonian singer .
Charles S. T. Calder was born on 1 March 1891 in Forfar , and trained as an architect .
Barry McGee ( born 1966 in San Francisco ) is a painter and graffiti artist .
Rusty Goffe ( born 30 October 1948 ) is an English actor with dwarfism .
Nenad Maslovar ( Serbian Cyrillic : Ненад Масловар , born 20 February 1967 ) is a former Montenegrin football player .
Mulatu Astatke ( born on 19 December 1943 ; surname sometimes spelled Astatqé on French - language releases , and ሙላቱ አስታጥቄ in his native Amharic ) is an Ethiopian musician and arranger best known as the father of Ethio - jazz .
Raymond Piper HRUA HRHA MUniv ( 1923 - 2007 ) was a botanist and artist born in London and at the age of six moved to Belfast .

Rebin Shah ( born 4 October 1988 ) better known by his stage name Rebstar , is a Swedish recording artist and entrepreneur .

Arko Pravo Mukherjee was born on 19 May 1983 to Dr. Apurba Kumar Mukherjee & Mrs. Mahasweta Mukherjee in Kolkata , West Bengal .
William Berkeley Lewis ( 1784 - November 12 , 1866 ) was born in Loudoun County , Virginia , and later moved near Nashville , Tennessee , in 1809 .
María Noel Genovese Berisso ( born 25 December 1943 in Montevideo ) , better known for her stage name María Noel , is a former Uruguayan model and actress .

Pavel Ponomaryov ( Russian : Павел Пономарёв ) ( born 30 January 1980 in Leningrad ) is a Russian actor and musician residing in Estonia .
Lorna Byrne ( born 25 March 1953 ) is an Irish author and peace ambassador .

Martin Giroux ( born 23 May 1979 ) is a Canadian pop singer who sings in French .
QBoy ( born Marcos Jose Brito on 10 October 1978 ) is a UK - based rapper , producer , DJ , writer and presenter .
Joëlle Kapompolé ( born 23 December 1971 in Kolwezi , Zaire ) is a Belgian politician and a member of the PS . She was a member of the Belgian Senate from 2004 to 2009 .
Andrew Dodt ( born 26 January 1986 ) is an Australian professional golfer who plays on the European , Asian and PGA Tour of Australasia Tours .
Ratu Meli Bainimarama ( 24 September 1945 -- 30 November 2015 ) was a Fijian civil servant , who served as Chief Executive Officer ( CEO ) of the Ministry of Fisheries and Forests .
Leonidas Kavakos ( Greek : Λεωνίδας Καβάκος ; born 30 October 1967 ) is a Greek violinist and conductor .
Sanjay Gadhvi ( born 22 November 1965 ) is an Indian writer and film director who is known for Dhoom series .
Herman Slater ( 1935 -- July 9 , 1992 ) was an American Wiccan high priest and occult - bookstore proprietor as well as an editor , publisher , and author .
Mark Bassey ( born , Sheffield , England , 1961 ) is a jazz trombonist , composer , arranger , educator and band leader .
Arieh Iserles ( born 2 September 1947 ) is a computational mathematician , currently Professor of the Numerical Analysis of Differential Equations at the University of Cambridge and a member of the Department of Applied Mathematics and Theoretical Physics .
Dalal Midhat - Talakić ( née Midhat ; born 5 August 1981 ) is a Bosnian singer .
Philippe Mahoux ( born 26 June 1944 ) , is a Belgian politician and a member of the Parti Socialiste .
Brendan McConville ( born 1965 ) is an author and professor of history at Boston University .
Harold Warp ( December 21 , 1903 -- April 9 , 1994 ) was an American businessman who invented Flex - O - Glass ® .
Tomáš Mičola ( born 26 September 1988 ) is a Czech football player who currently plays for SK Slavia Praha in the Gambrinus liga .
Kim Lucine ( born 16 September 1988 ) is a French figure skater who skates internationally for Monaco .
Oliver Wade Hall - Craggs ( born 9 January 1966 ) is a British rower and Olympic sculler .
Simon Lack ( 19 December 1913 -- 8 August 1980 ) was a Scottish actor , working mostly in England .
Yvonne Constant ( born 15 June 1935 on the left bank of Paris ) began her career as a ballet dancer but later she made the transition to a musical comedy performer .
Isaac Milles or Mills ( 19 September 1638 -- 6 July 1720 ) was an English cleric , often described as the model parish priest of that day .
Frank Woodley ( born Frank Wood , 29 February 1968 ) is an Australian comedian and author who is best known for his work alongside Colin Lane as part of the comedic duo , Lano and Woodley .
William Cooper Procter ( 1862 -- May 2 , 1934 ) was the grandson of William Procter , the co - founder of Procter & Gamble Company .
Elizabeth MacLennan ( 16 March 1938 -- 23 June 2015 ) was a Scottish actress , writer and radical popular theatre practitioner .
Greg Mitchell ( born 1947 ) is an American author and journalist who has written twelve non - fiction books on United States politics and history of the 20th and 21st centuries .
Robert da Silva Almeida , best known as Robert ( born 3 April 1971 ) is a Brazilian former football player .
Roque Germán Olsen Fontana commonly known as Roque Olsen ( 9 September 1925 -- 15 June 1992 ) was an Argentine football player and manager .
Mixmaster Morris ( born Morris Gould , 30 December 1965 ) is an English ambient DJ and underground musician .
Indrani Bose ( born 1951 ) is an Indian physicist , senior Professor at Department of Physics , Bose Institute , Kolkata .
James M. Freeman ( born 1936 ) is an American anthropologist , and professor at San Jose State University .
Zhu Junyi ( Chinese : 祝均一 ) ( b. February 1951 in Haining City , Zhejiang province ) was a government official in Shanghai , China .
George Opdyke ( 1805 -- June 12 , 1880 ) as an entrepreneur and the 76th Mayor of New York City ( 1862 to 1863 ) during the American Civil War .
Radoslav Kirilov ( Bulgarian : Радослав Кирилов ; born 29 June 1992 in Simitli ) is a Bulgarian footballer who plays as a midfielder for Italian side Südtirol on loan from Chievo Verona .
Corinna Ulcigrai ( born 3 January 1980 , Trieste ) is an Italian mathematician working on dynamical systems .
David Seage ( born 29 November 1979 ) is an Australian rugby league player who currently plays for the Wynnum Manly Seagulls in the Queensland Cup .
Enda Walsh ( born 1967 ) is an Irish playwright .
Wim Hofkens ( born 27 March 1958 ) is a former football player who played five games for the Dutch national side .
Chantal Quesnel ( sometimes credited as Chantal Quesnelle , born 1971 ) is a Canadian actress .
İdris Bal ( born 25 April 1968 in Altıntaş Kütahya ) is a Turkish politician and academic who led the Democratic Progress Party ( DGP ) between 4 November 2014 and 31 March 2015 .
Andreas Strüngmann ( born 1950 ) was born in Germany and founded generic drug maker Hexal AG ( $ 1.6 billion sales during 2004 ) in 1986 .
Semih Tufan Gülaltay ( born 1968 , in Kars ) is the founder of the militant Turkish Revenge Brigade , and the National Unity Party ( Turkish : Ulusal Birlik Partisi ) .
Lisa Rands is an American rock climber born in 1975 .
Lucius Caecilius Firmianus Lactantius was an early Christian author ( c. 250 -- c. 325 ) who became an advisor to the first Christian Roman emperor , Constantine I , guiding his religious policy as it developed , and a tutor to his son .
Reinhold Joest ( also spelt Reinhold Jöst , born 24 April 1937 ) is a former German race car driver and current team owner .
Arthur Bunster ( 1827 -- October 8 , 1891 ) was a Canadian entrepreneur and Member of Parliament .
Adam Frizzell ( born 21 February 1998 ) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays for Kilmarnock in the Scottish Premiership as an attacking midfielder or winger .
René van Eck ( born 18 February 1966 ) is a former Dutch footballer which latest job was being the manager of Dutch Eerste Divisie side FC Den Bosch .
Alexandre Bondar ( Russian : Александр Бондарь ; born 21 September 1972 ) is a Russian writer and novelist , `` literary remake '' genre founder .
Jack Whitfield ( 23 March 1892 -- 26 December 1927 ) was a Welsh international rugby union hooker who played club rugby for Newport and club rugby for Monmouthshire .
Steve Supresencia ( born 1980 ) is a Filipino football referee who has been a full international referee for FIFA .
Garrison Hawk ( also known as `` Hawkman , '' born 23 October 1978 ) is a Jamaican singer and dancehall artist .
Wen Chih - hao ( born 25 March 1993 ) is a Taiwanese football player who currently plays as a midfielder for Beijing Enterprises Group F.C.
Ebru Umar ( born 20 May 1970 ) is a Dutch columnist of Kurdish descent .
Lars Moe ( born 30 April 1951 ) is a Norwegian veterinarian .
Renato Chisso ( Quarto d'Altino , 28 July 1954 ) is an Italian politician from Veneto .
Malcolm Harwood ( born 1938 in Oxford ) is an English professional poker player who learnt how to play whilst doing his National Service .
Stefan Gandler ( born 1964 in Munich ) is a philosopher and social scientist .
Peidong Yang ( b. 1971 ) is a Chinese - born American chemist and material scientist .
Cheryl Donegan ( born 1962 ) is an American conceptual artist .
Andrew Donlevy ( b. in 1694 , probably in Sligo , Ireland ; date and place of death uncertain ) was an Irish Roman Catholic priest and educator .
Martin Novoselac ( born 10 November 1950 in SFR Yugoslavia ) is a former Croatian footballer known best for his solid defensive skills in clubs throughout Europe .
Přemysl Švarc ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈpr̝̊ɛmɪsl̩ ˈʃvarts ) ; born 27 March 1985 ) is a Czech triathlete .
Ousainou Darboe ( born 8 August 1948 ) is a Gambian human rights lawyer and politician .
Dennis Östlundh ( born 30 August 1977 ) is a Swedish footballer who has been playing as a member of the Assyriska Föreningen football club in the Superettan .
Zhang Tielin ( born 15 June 1957 ) is a Chinese - born British actor and occasional film director .
Daniel Baradza ( born c. 1973 ) is a sculptor from Mutare , Zimbabwe .
Ciarán Carey ( born 16 January 1970 ) is an Irish hurling selector and player .
Dwane Husbands ( born 24 July 1985 ) is a Barbadian singer who is best known for being featured on the Rihanna song Dem Haters , thus appearing on her 2006 second album A Girl like Me .
Coralee Elliott Testar UE ( born February 1946 in Prince Edward Island ) is a Vancouver based Producer and Screenwriter .
Jasmin Dizdar ( born 8 June 1961 ) is a British - Bosnian film director , screenwriter and author best known for his multi - award winning feature film Beautiful People and his World War Two thriller Chosen starring Harvey Keitel .
Abraham Neyman ( born June 14 , 1949 , Israel ) is an Israeli mathematician and game theorist , Professor of Mathematics at the Federmann Center for the Study of Rationality and the Einstein Institute of Mathematics at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem in Israel .
Duchess Donata of Mecklenburg ( born 11 March 1956 ) is the senior member of the House of Mecklenburg - Schwerin .
Abdalla Eltayeb ( 2 June 1921 -19 June 2003 ) was a prominent Sudanese scholar of the Arabic language .
Steven M. Wise ( born 1952 ) is an American legal scholar who specializes in animal protection issues , primatology , and animal intelligence .
Geoff Ablett ( born 13 March 1955 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) during the 1970s and 80s .
Gennaro Troianiello ( or spells as Troianello ) ( born 21 March 1983 ) is an Italian footballer who plays for Italian Serie B club Ternana on loan from Salernitana .
Edward C. Stringer ( born 1935 ) is a retired Associate Justice of the Minnesota Supreme Court .
Alexander Zakin ( 22 January 1903 -- 16 October 1990 ) was a Russian - born pianist , best known for being the accompanist of the violinist Isaac Stern between 1940 and 1977 .
Ibrahim of Ghazna ( 1033 - -1099 ) , was sultan of the Ghaznavid empire from April 1059 until his death in 1099 .
Will Jacobs ( born 1955 ) is an American comics and humor writer .
Romola de Pulszky ( or Romola Pulszky ) , ( married name Nijinsky ; February 20 , 1891 -- June 8 , 1978 ) , was a Hungarian aristocrat , the daughter of a politician and an actress .
Cathy Kelly ( born 12 September 1966 ) is an Irish former journalist and writer of women 's fiction since 1997 .
Muhammad Bayazid Sarker ( born 1 January 1971 ) is a Bangladeshi economic researcher and central banker .
Carl Ludwig Sahl ( 8 January 1840 -- 1 April 1897 ) was a German businessman and diplomat who lived in the British Colony of New South Wales for 25 years until his death , and served as the German Consul in Sydney as well as the Special Commercial Agent of the Kingdom of Fiji in Sydney .
Lothar Baumgarten ( born 1944 ) is a German conceptual artist , based in New York and Berlin .
Maya Hakvoort ( born 19 September 1966 in Nijmegen ) is a Dutch musical actress .
Peter Andrew Jones ( born 14 December 1951 ) is a British artist and illustrator who has produced a large number of fantasy and science fiction genre illustrations .

Junior Osborne ( born 12 February 1988 in Watford ) is a former English footballer who played as a full back or as a centre back .
Pierre Canivet ( 1890 - -1982 ) was a French curler and tennis player .
Kim Alcheon ( 577 ~ after 654 ) was a member of the Silla royal family .
Ibrahim Diaw or Ibrahima Diaw ( born 28 November 1979 in Poissy ) is a French - born Senegalese handballer who plays for CS Dinamo Bucureşti in the Romanian Liga Naţională and the Senegalese national team .
Marzena Godecki ( born 28 September 1978 ) is a Polish - born Australian actress .
Raphael Bronstein ( 1895 -- November 4 , 1988 ) was a violinist and violin professor .
Sir Mark Prescott , 3rd Baronet ( born 1948 ) is a race horse trainer with over 1300 winners to his name .
Fabrizio Savelli ( 1607 - 26 February 1659 ) was an Italian military leader , commander of papal troops and , later , a Catholic Cardinal .
Cynthia Maddox ( born 1941 ) is an American model who is best known for appearing on the cover of Playboy magazine five times in the early to mid-1960s , though she was never a playmate .
Øystein Dahle ( born 18 March 1938 ) is a Norwegian businessperson and organizational leader .
Léonard Andjembé ( born 1 January 1948 ) is a Gabonese politician and professor .
Jan van Noordt ( 1623 , Amsterdam -- 1681 , Amsterdam ? ) , was a Dutch Golden Age painter .
Steijn Schothorst ( 14 October 1994 ) is a Dutch racing driver .
Adwoa Yamoah ( born 1988 ) is a beauty pageant contestant who placed 1st runner - up at Miss Universe Canada 2012 and represented Canada in the Miss Universe 2012 pageant after the winner Sahar Biniaz allegedly hurt her foot a few days before the pageant was about to start .
Percy Jocelyn ( 29 November 1764 -- 3 September 1843 ) was Anglican Bishop of Clogher in the Church of Ireland from 1820 to 1822 .
Graham Roos FRSA ( born 1966 , Sheffield , UK ) is a producer , writer and performer .
Chandralekha Perera ( Sinhalese : චන්ද්‍රලේකා පෙරේරා ) ( born 1 December 1961 ) , is a popular Sri Lankan pop singer .
Mitko Chavkov ( Macedonian : Митко Чавков ; born 24 January 1963 ) is a former Interior Minister of Macedonia .
Mehdi Ghazanfari ( Persian : مهدی غضنفری , born 16 November 1960 ) is an Iranian politician who was Minister of Industries and Business from 3 August 2011 to 15 August 2013 and Minister of Commerce in the second cabinet of Mahmoud Ahmadinejad from 9 August 2009 to 3 August 2011 .
Jiang Weilie ( Chinese : 蒋伟烈 ; born November 1955 ) is a vice - admiral ( zhong jiang ) of the People 's Liberation Army Navy ( PLAN ) of China .
Zhang Cuiping ( Chinese : 张翠平 ; pinyin : Zhāng Cuìpíng ; born 23 September 1987 ) is a Chinese sport shooter .
Philip Peyala ( born 15 July 1937 ) , popularly known as Philip Sabu is a former Zambian goalkeeper .
Niall FitzGerald , KBE ( born 13 September 1945 ) is an Irish businessman .

( Elsie ) Helen Knight ( née Weil , 24 November 1899 -- 1984 ) was a British philosopher .

Talkhon Hamzavi ( Persian : تلخون حمزوی‎ , born 1979 ) is an Iranian - Swiss film director and screenwriter .
Sarah Deutsch ( born 1961 ) is an American attorney who currently serves as vice president and associate general counsel of the telecommunications company Verizon Communications .
Basil Moss ( born 25 May 1935 ) is a British character actor , who featured regularly on television in the 1960s and on radio in the 1970s .
Eugène Hénaff ( 30 October 1904 -- 28 October 1966 ) was a French cement worker , Communist , trade union leader and member of the French Resistance during World War II ( 1939 - -45 ) .
Lisa Beznosiuk ( born 20 August 1956 in Sheffield ) is an English flautist of Ukrainian and Irish descent , specialising in period performance of baroque and classical music on historical flutes .
Ning Xiankui ( Chinese : 寧 憲奎 ; born 19 May 1967 ) is a Chinese fencer .
George Peard ( 1594 - -1645 ) was an English politician who sat in the House of Commons of England from 1640 to 1645 .
Juan Ruiz ( ca . 1283 -- ca . 1350 ) , known as the Archpriest of Hita ( Arcipreste de Hita ) , was a medieval Castilian poet .
Samuel Blommaert ( Bloemaert , Blommaerts , Blommaart , Blomert , etc . ) ( Antwerp , 11 ( or 21 ) August 1583 , -- Amsterdam , 23 December 1651 , ) was a Flemish / Dutch merchant and director of the Dutch West India Company from 1622 to 1629 and again from 1636 to 1642 .
Josie Cotton ( born 1956 ) is an American singer / songwriter , best known for `` Johnny Are You Queer ? '' and `` He Could Be the One '' from 1982 .
John or Johane Maranke ( Johane Marange ) ( 1912 - 1963 ) was a Zimbabwean Christian leader , prophet , and founder of the African Apostolic Church of John Maranke .
Louis Longridge ( born 5 July 1991 ) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays for Raith Rovers , on loan from Hamilton Academical , as a winger and striker .
Stieg Hedlund ( born 1965 ) is a computer and video game designer , artist , and writer with over 25 years of experience who has worked on more than 30 games in the video game industry .
Mark Malamud ( born 1960 ) is the Principal and Manager of Busymonster LLC , a consultancy company focused on advanced user interface and design .
Lynn Daucher ( born 1946 ) is a United States politician who was a Republican California State Assemblywoman from Orange County from 2000 until 2006 when she was term limited .
Muhammad Abdul Bari , MBE FRSA ( Bengali : মুহাম্মাদ আব্দুল বারি ; born 2 October 1953 ) , is a Bangladeshi - born British physicist , scholar , writer , teacher , community leader and the current secretary of Muslim Aid , who is widely regarded as one of the most powerful Asians and Muslims in Western Europe .
Gunda Niemann - Stirnemann ( née Kleemann , born 7 September 1966 ) is a former German speed skater .
Frank J. Coyne ( born in Scranton , Pennsylvania in 1948 ) is Chairman , former President , and former Chief Executive Officer of Verisk Analytics and its subsidiary , Insurance Services Office ( ISO ) .
Joe Letteri , ONZM ( born 1957 ) is a senior visual effects artist , winner of four Academy awards , four BAFTA awards and four VES awards .
Robert Cheeseman or Cheseman ( 1485 - -1547 ) was an English politician .
Alf Harvey ( born c. 1854 ) was an English footballer who made one appearance for England as a full back in 1881 .
Karol Olgierd Borchardt ( 25 March 1905 -- 20 May 1986 ) was a Polish writer and captain of the Polish Merchant Marine .
Kōryū Tadaharu ( 光龍 忠晴 , born 4 February 1984 ) is a Mongolian former sumo wrestler from Ulan Bator .
Emile Lamm ( 24 November 1834 -- 12 July 1873 in New Orleans ) was a French - born American inventor and dentist .
Marco Villagatti ( born 15 May 1983 ) is an Italian footballer who plays for Arezzo of the third division .
Nabil Sawalha is a Jordanian comedian , born near the city of Madaba in 1941 .
Carlos Manuel Hoo Ramírez ( born 15 October 1978 ) , commonly referred to by his alias El Cóndor , is a former Mexican Armed Forces commando and imprisoned high - ranking member of the Sinaloa Cartel , a drug trafficking organization .
Augusta Lundin ( 13 June 1840 in Kristianstad -- 20 February 1919 ) , was a Swedish fashion designer .
Taha El Sherif Ben Amer(June 1936 - March 6 , 1978 ) was a Libyan engineer and politician .
Philip S. Porter ( 1925 -- August 7 , 2011 ) was a martial artist in the United States .
Mohammed Khursheed Hussain(born 6 December 1990 in Hyderabad , India ) is a World Champion Typist holding two Guinness World Records for the titles ' fastest time to type the alphabet ' and ' Fastest time to type using the nose ' Khursheed Hussain recently break another Guinness World Record using his nose in 47.44 seconds
Antonino Arconte ( born February 1954 ) is an Italian writer and former secret agent .

Inger Helene Nybråten ( born 8 December 1960 in Fagernes , Oppland ) is a former Norwegian Cross - country skier who competed in the 1980s and 1990s .
Lew Byong - hyun ( born 18 October 1924 ) is a retired South Korean general and diplomat .
Joseph W. Greig ( 1895 - -1977 ) was an American geochemist and physical chemist , a pioneer in high temperature phase equilibria and immiscibility investigations of oxides and sulfides .
Cyril Delevanti ( 23 February 1889 -- 13 December 1975 ) , sometimes credited as Syril Delevanti , was an English - born character actor with a long career in American films .

Sarah Perrotta ( born 1979 , United States ) is a Hudson Valley based singer , songwriter and pianist .

Willie Fung ( 3 March 1896 -- April 16 , 1945 ) was a Chinese film actor who played supporting roles in 125 American films between 1922 and 1944 .
Maria Mironova ( Russian : Мария Андреевна Миронова ; born 28 May 1973 ) is a Soviet and Russian actress .
Sergio Edelsztein was born in Buenos Aires , Argentina in 1956 and studied at the Tel Aviv University from 1976 - 85 .

Jorge Rivera López ( born 19 March 1934 ) is an Argentine actor of television and film .

Quincy Detenamo ( born 8 March 1979 ) was an Olympic weightlifter who was found guilty of manslaughter in Australia .

Gaby Brown is an Australian radio presenter , born in Sydney in February 1976 , best known for her work on the national youth broadcaster triple j. She started at the station in 1999 , presenting a variety of programs including popular chart show The Net 50 , and talk - back program `` The Chat Room '' .

Augustine Courtauld ( 26 August 1904 -- 3 March 1959 ) , often called August Courtauld , was a yachtsman and British Arctic explorer , best known for serving as the solo meteorologist of a winter observation post , Icecap Station , located in the interior of Greenland in 1930 - 1931 .

Matthew Stewart , 4th Earl of Lennox ( 21 September 1516 -- 4 September 1571 ) was the 4th Earl of Lennox , and leader of the Catholic nobility in Scotland .
Charles Newland Godfrey Jadis ( 6 November 1730 -- March 1801 ) was a naval officer , army officer , and merchant in Canada .
John Emmeus Davis ( born 1949 ) is a scholar , writer , teacher and community organizer who has advanced the understanding and development of community land trusts in the United States , Great Britain , Australia , and Belgium .
David Mayer de Rothschild ( born 25 August 1978 ) is a British adventurer , ecologist , and environmentalist and head of Sculpt the Future Foundation , a charity that supports innovations and creativity in social and environmental impact efforts .
Steve Hywood ( born 31 May 1950 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played for Richmond in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .

Clifford H. Baldowski ( 1917 - -1999 ) was an editorial cartoonist for the Augusta Chronicle , Miami Herald , and Atlanta Constitution who drew thousands of editorial cartoons under the name `` Baldy '' .
Joanna Manning ( born 1943 ) is a feminist activist and former Roman Catholic nun currently living in Canada .
Prince Alexander Chavchavadze ( Georgian : ალექსანდრე ჭავჭავაძე ; Russian : Александр Чавчавадзе ) ( 1786 -- November 6 , 1846 ) was a notable Georgian poet , public benefactor and military figure .

Charles Isaac Mungo Dibdin ( 27 October 1768 -- 15 January 1833 ) , or Charles Pitt or Charles Dibdin the younger , as he was professionally known , was an English dramatist , composer , writer and theatre proprietor .
Ilan Shor ( or Șor ; born 6 March 1987 ) is a Moldovan businessman .

Ivor Spencer - Thomas ( 11 April 1907 -- 30 August 2001 ) was an inveterate inventor and improviser , in the forefront of developing agriculture and market gardening as a commercial enterprise .
Ava Muhammad ( born 1951 ) is an American Black Muslim .
John Derum ( born 9 January 1946 ) is an Australian stage , film and television actor .
Wouter Tebbens , ( born 6 May 1974 ) is a Dutch activist , researcher and social entrepreneur on Free Knowledge .
Sanjoy Sen ( born 12 December 1960 ) is a football manager who is currently managing Mohun Bagan in the I - League .
Egon Madsen ( born 24 August 1942 ) is a Danish ballet dancer , a former principal dancer with the Royal Ballet and Stuttgart Ballet , where he worked closely with the choreographer John Cranko .
Imre Finta ( 1911 - -2003 ) was the first person prosecuted under Canada 's war crimes legislation .
David Nachmias was born on 19 March 1966 in Bombay to a Greek family , but grew up in Athens .

Mykkele Thompson ( born 1993 ) is an American football free safety for the New York Giants of the National Football League .
M. E. Mitchell ( born 28 June 1934 ) is an Irish botanist and writer .
Nicholas Charles Williams ( born 1961 ) is an English painter and draughtsman .
Antonio Virgilio Savona ( 21 December 1919 -- 27 August 2009 ) was an Italian composer , arranger , and singer in the Italian vocal group , the Quartetto Cetra .
Georges Bess ( born 1947 ) is a comics artist and comic book creator , best known for his collaborations with Alejandro Jodorowsky .
Hal V. Barron ( born 1962 ) is an American clinician - scientist and drug developer currently serving as president of research and development at Calico .
Stan Seymour ( 16 May 1895 -- 24 December 1978 ) was a footballer who played for Newcastle United .

Summer Wesley ( born 1981 in Choctaw ) is an attorney , writer , and activist from Oklahoma .

Edmund John Niemann ( 1813 - -1876 ) was a prolific and highly successful British landscape artist working mostly in oils .
Anthony Ashley Cooper , 4th Earl of Shaftesbury ( 9 February 1711 -- 27 May 1771 ) was a British peer and philanthropist , who served as one of the leading figures in the foundation of the colony of Georgia and as Lord Lieutenant of Dorset from 1734 until his death .
Daniel Raymond ( 1786 - -1849 ) was the first important political economist to appear in the United States .

Todros ben Judah Halevi Abulafia ( 1247 -- after 1300 ) was a Jewish poet who wrote primarily in Hebrew .

Kelly Church , a fifth - generation basket weaver , was born in 1967 .

Maurice Benedict de Worms ( 1805 - 1867 ) was an Austrian plantation owner in Ceylon .
Sir Richard Carnac Temple , 2nd Baronet CB , CIE ( 15 October 1850 -- 3 March 1931 ) was the British Chief Commissioner of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands and an anthropological writer .
Emily Elizabeth Constance Jones ( 19 February 1848 -- 9 April 1922 ) was an English philosopher and educator .

Syed Nazeer Husain ( 1805 - 1902 ) was a religious leader of India .
Wenceslaus Linck ( Wenceslau Linck ) ( 1736 -- after 1790 ) was the last of the outstanding Jesuit missionary - explorers in Baja California .

William Sampson Handley MD , MS , FRCS ( 12 April 1872 -- 1962 ) was an English surgeon who influenced the development of cancer surgery .

Varol Akman ( born 8 June 1957 , Antalya , Turkey ) is the Chairperson of the Department of Philosophy and Professor of Computer Engineering in Bilkent University , Ankara .
Archbishop Emeritus Joachim N'Dayen ( born 22 December 1934 , in Loko ) is a former Roman Catholic Archbishop in the Central African Republic .
Bryan Crimmins ( 25 October 1919 -- 15 February 1998 ) was a former Australian rules footballer who played with Melbourne in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .
John Angus Macnab ( 1906 - -1977 ) was a British conservative politician who embraced Roman Catholicism under the influence of G. K. Chesterton and Hilaire Belloc , who was a close associate of William Joyce , and who later became noted as a Perennialist writer on Medieval Spain and translator of Latin and Greek poetry .

Reggie Fowler was born Reginald Dennis Fowler in February , 1959 , to Al and Eloise Fowler -- one of five children .
John Stuart Ingle ( 1933 - October 30 , 2010 ) was an American contemporary realist artist , known for his meticulously rendered watercolor paintings , typically still lifes .
Ida Bobach ( born 30 July 1991 in Silkeborg ) is a Danish orienteering competitor who was Junior World Champion in 2009 , and became triple Junior World Champion from 2010 , when she won the sprint , long distance and the relay .

Mitja Gaspari ( born 25 November 1951 ) is a Slovenian economist , banker , and politician .

Vasile Grecu ( 31 July 1885 -- 27 May 1972 ) was a Romanian philologist and Byzantinist .

Graham Cairns ( born 1971 , UK ) is an author and academic .

Eugenio Colombo ( born 1953 ) is an Italian saxophonist and flautist most associated with avant - garde jazz .

František Blažek ( 1863 - -1944 ) is a Czech - born architect who designed a great number of Bosnia and Herzegovina buildings during Austro - Hungarian period .

Jerzy Janiszewski ( born 11 March 1952 in Płock ) is a Polish artist , best known for designing the Solidarity logo in 1980 .

Lalla Ward ( born Sarah Ward ; 28 June 1951 ) is an English actress and author .

Carlos Morel ( 12 February 1813 -- 10 September 1894 ) was a prominent Argentine painter in the nineteenth century , known as the first truly Argentine painter .
Konstantin Tupikov ( born 25 April 1983 ) is a former competitive figure skater who represented Ukraine until 2005 and then decided to compete for Poland .
William Frere ( 1775 - -1836 ) , was an English lawyer and academic , a law - serjeant and Master of Downing College , Cambridge .
Einar Østby ( born 17 September 1935 ) is a former Norwegian cross - country skier who competed during the early 1960s .
Skaay was a blind , crippled storyteller of the Haida village of Ttanuu born c. 1827 at Qquuna .

Mark Fanning ( born 11 April 1991 ) is an Irish hurler who plays as a goalkeeper for the Wexford senior team .

Heinrich Köberle , born in 1946 , is a German athlete .

Lamberto Pignotti ( born 1926 in Firenze ) is an Italian poet , writer and visual artist .

Andrew Beerwinkel ( born 5 March 1993 in Saron , South Africa ) is a South African rugby union player , currently playing domestically with the Blue Bulls and in the Super Rugby competition with the Bulls .

James Barnor ( born 6 June 1929 ) is a pioneering Ghanaian photographer who has been based in London , UK , since the 1990s .
Dannielle Khan ( born 1 September 1995 ) is an English racing cyclist from Solihull , West Midlands , England , who currently rides for Abergavenny RC Women 's Team .
Edward Wingate ( c. 1606 -- August 1685 ) was an English politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1640 to 1648 .
Charles - Victor Dubois ( 1832 -- 1869 ) was a Belgian composer and harmonium player known mostly for improvisations and demonstrations .
Ludwig Karl von Kalckstein ( 10 March 1725 -- 12 October 1800 ) was a Prussian count and field marshal .
Elspeth Probyn ( born 1958 ) is a Professor of Gender and Cultural Studies at the University of Sydney .
Willem Boshoff ( born 1951 ) is a South African artist known primarily for his conceptual installations .
Anna Giordano Bruno ( born 13 December 1980 ) is a retired Italian track and field athlete who specialised in the pole vault .

Epameinondas Thomopoulos ( Greek : Επαμεινώνδας Θωμόπουλος , 1878 - January 4 , 1976 ) was a Greek artist who attended the academy and the first Greek impressionist .

Mirosław Jan Stasik ( born 27 January 1929 r. in Łódź ) is a Polish medical doctor and research toxicologist .
Matthew Bowden ( 1779 - -1814 ) served as surgeon in the Royal Lancashire Regiment and assistant surgeon on David Collins ' 1803 expedition to found a British settlement in Port Phillip , now part of Victoria , Australia .
Paul Matisse ( born 1933 ) is an artist and inventor .
Fritz Balogh ( 16 December 1920 -- 15 January 1951 ) was a German footballer .

Laraine Herring ( born 1968 ) is an American writer of both novels and nonfiction books .
Ragnar Bjarnason , also called Raggi Bjarna , ( born 22 September 1934 ) is an Icelandic singer .
Wang Xiaojun ( Chinese : 王晓军 ; born September 1952 ) is a lieutenant general of the People 's Liberation Army ( PLA ) of China .
Charlotte Eisler ( 2 August 1894 - 21 August 1970 ) was an Austrian singer , pianist and music teacher associated with the Second Viennese School .
Justin Clarke ( born 9 October 1984 ) , better known by his stage name Ghetts ( formerly Ghetto ) is an English Grime MC , from Plaistow , Newham , East London with Caribbean roots from Jamaica and Grenada .
Baron Carl von Rokitansky ( German : Carl Freiherr von Rokitansky , Czech : Karel Rokytanský ) ( 19 February 1804 -- 23 July 1878 ) , was a Bohemian physician , pathologist , humanist philosopher and liberal politician .

Øyvind Svenning ( born 29 January 1980 ) is a Norwegian football defender who currently plays for the Norwegian team Randaberg .
Scott Jeffery ( born 11 February 1977 ) is a Tasmanian Australian rules football field umpire in the Australian Football League .
Brennan Hesser ( born 1980 ) is an American television actress , best known for co - starring in Tori Spelling 's VH1 sitcom , So NoTORIous .
Matse Uwatse ( 10 May 1981 ) popularly known as Matse is a Nigerian radio presenter .
Brendon Feddema ( born 14 May 1974 ) is an Australian rules footballer who played for the Fremantle Dockers between 1996 and 1998 .
Dato ' Peter Velappan ( born 1 October 1935 ) is a Malaysian association football administrator who served as the General Secretary of the Asian Football Confederation from 1978 to 2007 .
Guerau de Espés del Valle ( Lérida , 1524 - -1572 ) was a Spanish nobleman and diplomat .
French musician Valentin Clastrier ( born 1947 ) is one of the few performers in the world specializing in contemporary music for the hurdy - gurdy ; before Clastrier , the instrument was used primarily in the performance of European Medieval and folk musics .
Geta Brătescu ( born 4 May 1926 , Ploiești ) is a Romanian visual artist .

Abu Nizam Muhammad Falaki Shirvani ( 1107 , Shamakhi -- 1157 , Shamakhi ) was a Persian poet from Shirvan ( today in Azerbaijan ) .
Walter Slezak ( German pronunciation : ( ˌvaltɐ ˈslɛzak ) ) ( 3 May 1902 -- 21 April 1983 ) was an Austrian - born character actor and singer who appeared in German films before migrating to the US in 1930 and featuring in numerous Hollywood productions .
Waldemar Pförtsch ( * 19 . September 1951 in Bamberg ) is a German professor , management advisor and specialized book author for business administration and international management .
Duarte de Eça ( born 1480 ) was the 3rd Captain - major of Portuguese Ceylon .
Alain Le Boulluec ( born 1941 ) is a contemporary French patristics scholar working mainly in the sphere of Clement of Alexandria and of Origen of Alexandria .
Ian Irvine ( born 1950 ) is an Australian fantasy and eco - thriller author and marine scientist .
Lawrence Otis Graham ( born 1962 ) is an African - American attorney , speaker , and New York Times best - selling author .
Prema Narayan ( born 4 April 1955 ) is a Model and Bollywood actress - dancer .
Alex Wise ( born c. 1968 ) is the host and executive producer of Sea Change Radio , a nationally - distributed interview - format radio show concerned with the advances being made toward a more environmentally sustainable world , economy , and future .
Marc Breuers ( born 10 April 1975 in New York ) is a former Barber Dodge Pro Series and Atlantic Championship driver .
Viththal Dattatreya Ghate ( Devanagari : विठ्ठल दत्तात्रेय घाटे ) ( 1894 - -1978 ) was an educationist and a Marathi writer from Maharashtra , India .
Heinz Insu Fenkl ( born 1960 ) is an author , editor , translator , and folklorist .
Chaim Loike ( born 1977 in New York ) is an American Rabbi who works for the Orthodox Union .
Earnest Olatunde Thomas ( 10 December 1922 -- 1981 ) , known as Tunde Nightingale or The Western Nightingale , was a Nigerian singer and guitarist , best known for his unique jùjú music style , following in the tradition of Tunde King .
Sydney Cohen CBE , FRS ( born 18 September 1921 ) is Emeritus Professor of Chemical Pathology , Guy 's Hospital Medical School and an authority on malaria .
Gene Youngblood ( born 30 May 1942 ) , is a theorist of media arts and politics , and a respected scholar in the history and theory of alternative cinemas .
Simon Rademan ( born Simon Petrus Rademan , on 22 February 1964 ) , is a South African fashion designer and stylist .
Kitty van Haperen ( 20 April 1976 ) is a retired Dutch athlete and bobsledder .
Ivan Obradović ( Serbian Cyrillic : Иван Обрадовић ; born 25 July 1988 ) is a Serbian footballer who plays for Belgian club Anderlecht , as a left back .
Niall Rigney ( born 1969 in Portlaoise , County Laois ) is an Irish retired hurling manager and player .
Alma Čardžić ( born 1968 ) is a Bosnian singer , best known internationally for her participation in the Eurovision Song Contests in 1994 and 1997 .
Sunil Batta ( born 12 June 1961 ) is an Indian film director , producer , scriptwriter and cameraman .
Johann Gottlieb Fleischer ( 15 October 1797 -- 22 April 1838 ) was a German botanist and ornithologist .
Anthony Flinn is a British chef , born in Liverpool in 1980 , and now based in Leeds .
Robert McRay ( born 1962 , Wausau , Wisconsin ) is an American television actor , sculptor , and personal trainer .
Jacob Kaufman ( 15 July 1847 -- 20 April 1920 ) was an important manufacturer and industrialist in Berlin / Kitchener , Ontario , Canada .
Ben Foskett ( born 1977 ) is a London and Paris - based British composer .
John Francis Yaxley ( born 13 November 1936 ) Birmingham , England , spent his career as a civil servant in the UK Colonial Office .
Peter Schreyer ( born 1953 ) is a German automobile designer for Hyundai Motor and Kia Motors , widely known for his design contributions to the Audi TT .
Costache Negri ( 1812 - -1876 ) was a Moldavian - born Romanian writer , politician and revolutionary .
Jenni Falconer ( born 12 February 1976 ) is a Scottish radio and television presenter best known for her roles on the ITV daytime show This Morning , where she is a regular travel reporter and is an occasional stand - in host .
Wu Changshun ( born January 1954 ) is the former police chief of the municipality of Tianjin , China .
James Peachey , 1st Baron Selsey ( 8 March 1723 -- 1 February 1808 ) , known as Sir James Peachey , Bt , between 1765 and 1794 , was a British politician and courtier .
Fatima Murtaza Bhutto ( Urdu : فاطمہ مُرتضیٰ بھُٹّو‎ ; born 29 May 1982 ) , known as Fatima Bhutto ( Urdu : فاطمہ بھٹو‎ ) , is a Pakistani poet and writer .
Michael D. Penner ( born 1969 ) is a Canadian lawyer and businessman .
Osama Mounir ( born in 1970 ) is a Christian Egyptian TV personality , his famous program is `` Ana Welnogoom We Hawak '' ( English : I , the stars and your love)(Arabic:أنا والنجوم وهواك ) which is a program about love on Nogoom FM radio channel .
Kit Osbourne ( born 1990 ) is an American professional wrestler , who currently works for Combat Zone Wrestling .
Colin Kirkus ( 19 June 1910 - 13 September 1942 ) , was one of the most influential climbers Britain has ever produced .
Simon Ghahary ( born 12 May 1972 ) is an English born artist , brand architect and lifestyle engineer from the United Kingdom known primarily for his unconventional speaker designs .
Chris Connolly ( born 25 March 1963 ) is a former Australian rules football player , coach and administrator , most notable for his six years as senior coach of the Fremantle Football Club in the Australian Football League .
Jamie N Commons ( born 22 October 1988 in Bristol , England ) is a British blues rock and folk musician based in New Cross , London .
Georges Hamel ( 20 January 1948 -- 26 February 2014 ) was a Canadian country music singer and songwriter from Quebec .
Andrija Prlainović ( Serbian Cyrillic : Андрија Прлаиновић ; born 28 April 1987 ) is a Serbian water polo player .
John Knewstub ( or Knewstubs ) ( 1544 - -1624 ) was an English clergyman , one of the participants in the Hampton Court Conference of 1604 representing the Puritan side .
Delores Ann Kildare ( 1934 - -2005 ) was an American poet known by the pen name D. Kildare .
Antonia Juhasz ( born 1970 ) is an American oil and energy analyst , author , journalist and activist .
Mark Fry ( born 4 November 1952 ) is an English painter and psychedelic folk musician .
Admir Haznadar ( born 25 July 1985 ) is a Bosnian - Dutch footballer who plays as a striker for K.V. Turnhout in Belgium .
Arthur Lett - Haines ( 1894 -- February 25 , 1978 ) , known as Lett Haines , was a British painter and sculptor who experimented in many different media , though he generally characterised himself as `` an English surrealist '' .
Rabbi Arnold Josiah Ford ( 23 April 1877 -- 16 September 1935 ) was the first black rabbi in America , and a prominent member of Harlem 's Black Jews community .
Aris Xevghenis ( Greek : Αρης Ξευγένης ; born 12 May 1981 ) is a Greek footballer who plays for Nafpaktiakos Asteras .
Leo Lerinc ( Serbian Cyrillic : Лeo Лepинц;Hungarian : Leo Lőrincz ) ( born 30 December 1975 ) is a retired Serbian football player of Hungarian descent .
Dvora Bochman ( Hebrew : דבורה בוצ'מן‎ ) ( born 1950 ) is an Israeli artist , painter , sculptor , graphic designer and art educator .
Idriss Ngari ( born 2 April 1946 ) is a Gabonese politician and army general .
Umberto Bindi ( 12 May 1932 - 24 May 2002 ) was an Italian singer - songwriter .
Leul Ras ( Prince ) Aserate Kasa ( also Aserate Kassa , Asrate Kassa and Aserate - Medhin Kassa ) GCVO ( 30 April 1922 -- 23 November 1974 ) was an army commander and a member of the nobility of the Ethiopian Empire .
Willoughby Bertie , 4th Earl of Abingdon ( 16 January 1740 -- 26 September 1799 ) was an English peer and music patron .
Patrick French ( born 1966 ) is a British writer and historian , based in London and Delhi .
Diana Page ( born 1965 ) is a painter , performance and installation artist originally from South Africa but currently residing in Istanbul , Turkey .
Ju Wen - bin ( Chinese : 朱文彬 , born on 5 July 1969 ) is a Taiwanese football player and manager .
Lode Van Den Bergh ( born 18 June 1920 ) , pseudonym Aster Berkhof and Piet Visser , is a Belgian writer .
Russell Haswell ( born 1970 , Coventry ) is a multidisciplinary artist .
Katja Demut ( born 21 December 1983 ) is a German track and field athlete who specialises in the triple jump .
Dr. Christopher B. Anderson ( born 31 December 1976 in North Carolina ) is an ecologist working in southern Patagonia 's Tierra del Fuego Archipelago , shared between Chile and Argentina .
Rachel Ter Horst ( born 20 March 1973 , in Enschede , Netherlands ) is a Dutch glamour model .
Julius Koch ( 1872 -- March 30 , 1902 ) , also known as Le Geant Constantin , was one of seventeen people in medical history who have surpassed eight feet in height .
Vice Admiral Sir Fabian Malbon , KBE ( born 1 October 1946 ) was the Lieutenant Governor of Guernsey from 2005 - -2011 .
Pablopavo ( born 30 March 1978 as Paweł Sołtys ) is a Polish reggae and raggamuffin vocalist , songwriter , and radio DJ . He has a radio show on Roxy FM called Tramwaj z Pragi .
Francesco Camaldo ( 24 October 1952 ) is an Italian priest of the Catholic Church , and is currently the assistant of Circolo San Pietro .
Ramon Vega ( born 14 June 1971 ) is a Swiss retired footballer of Spanish descent who played as a central defender .
Eran Biton ( Hebrew : ערן ביטון‎ ; born 16 January 1996 ) is an Israeli footballer who plays as a Central Midfielder .
Benjamin Abeles ( born 1925 ) is a physicist whose research in the 1960s in the USA on germanium - silicon alloys led to the technology used to power space probes such as the Voyager spacecraft .
Sandy Casar ( born 2 February 1979 ) is a French former professional racing cyclist , who competed as a professional between 2000 and 2013 , all for the Française des Jeux team .
Gary Imlach ( born 1960 , West Bridgford ) is a British author , journalist and broadcaster , specialising in sport .
Belinda Dever ( born 6 July 1977 ) is an Australian retired netball player , formerly playing for the Queensland Firebirds in the Commonwealth Bank Trophy .
Harry Fare ( 1 May 1896 -- 12 August 1963 ) was an English footballer who played in the Football League for Wigan Borough and Bury .
Kate Fischer , aka Katie Fischer ( born 30 November 1973 ) , is an Australian model and actress .
Sir John Voce Moore ( 1826 - -1904 ) was an English businessman and Lord Mayor of London .
Ênio Santos de Oliveira or simply Ênio ( born 11 March 1985 ) is a Brazilian central defender .
Maccus mac Arailt ( died 984 - 987 ? ) or Maccus Haraldsson was a Scandinavian or Norse - Gael king .
Mark Warburton ( born 6 September 1962 ) is an English professional football manager , who is the current manager of Scottish Championship club Rangers .
Göran Gentele ( 29 September 1917 -- 18 July 1972 ) was a Swedish actor , director , and opera manager .
Dr Marko Atlagić ( born 1949 ) is a Serbian historian and politician , originally from Croatia .
Paul F. Markham ( born c. 1931 ) is an American attorney who served as the United States Attorney for the District of Massachusetts from 1966 to 1969 .
Feng Zhengjie ( born 1968 in Sichuan Province , China ) is an artist based in Beijing and Jeju Island of South Korea .
Michael Lowenstern ( b. Chicago , Illinois , United States , 1968 ) in the Hyde Park neighborhood , is an American bass clarinetist and composer specializing in new music .
Edzard Ernst ( born 30 January 1948 ) is an academic physician and researcher specializing in the study of complementary and alternative medicine .
Alyona Andruk ( Ukrainian : Альона Андрук ; born 11 June 1987 ) is a Ukrainian road bicycle racer .
Wang Bao'an ( Chinese : 王保安 ; pinyin : Wáng Băo'ān ; born December 1963 ) is a former Chinese politician .
Chris Walas ( born 1955 ) is an American special effects / make - up artist and film director .
Archibald Stewart ( 30 December 1867 -- 29 May 1925 ) was an Australian trade unionist and ALP official .
Nils Christian Egede Hertzberg ( 26 October 1827 -- 8 July 1911 ) was the Norwegian theologian , educator and politician .
Árón Smith ( born 9 November 1989 ) is an Irish racing driver currently racing in the British Touring Car Championship .
Corrado Lorefice ( born 12 October 1962 ) is an Italian priest and the Archbishop of Palermo since 5 December 2015 .
Anne - Marie Minhall ( born 25 June 1965 ) is an English radio presenter who works for Classic fm , which is one of the United Kingdom 's three Independent National Radio stations , broadcasting classical music in a popular and accessible style .
John K. Beatty ( born c. 1821 ) , Irish uillean piper .
Milan Balažic ( born 19 October 1958 ) is a Slovenian political theorist , politician and diplomat .
Yankho Kamwendo ( born 1 November 1978 ) is a Swedish TV personality and actor .
Edmundo Murray ( b. 1955 in Buenos Aires ) , is a writer , born in a family with Argentine , Colombian , Irish and Swiss origins .
Jim Unger ( 21 January 1937 -- 26 May 2012 ) was a British Canadian cartoonist , best known for his syndicated comic strip Herman which ran for 18 years in 600 newspapers in 25 countries .
Nancy Bayley ( 28 September 1899 - 25 Novemeber 1994 ) was an American psychologist best known for her work on the Berkeley Growth Study and the subsequent Bayley Scales of Infant Development .
Frank Stronach , CM ( born Franz Strohsack ; 6 September 1932 ) is an Austrian and Canadian businessman and politician .
Obafemi Lasode ( born December 1955 ) is a Nigerian veteran film actor , songwriter , playwright , film producer and director .
Devarshi Kala Nath Shastry , ( b. 15 July 1936 at Jaipur , Rajasthan , India ) is a Sanskrit scholar honoured by the President of India ( 1998 ) .
Sir Henry Williams , 2nd Baronet ( c. 1635 -- February 1666 ) was a Welsh politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1660 to 1661 .
John Belisario ( 1820 - 1900 ) was an Australian dental surgeon who was a pioneer in the use of anaesthesia in dentistry .
Irving Milfred Mole , better known as Miff Mole ( 11 March 1898 -- 29 April 1961 ) was a jazz trombonist and band leader .
Jaume Morales Moltó ( Altea 21 June 1973 ) , sporting nickname Tato , is a Valencian pilota professional player in the ValNet company team .
Nicos Panayotopoulos ( born 1963 ) is a Greek journalist , screenwriter and novelist .
Geoff Leigh ( born 5 October 1945 ) is an English jazz and progressive rock musician , playing primarily soprano sax and flute .
Graeme Hawley ( born 28 November 1973 ) is an English actor known for his role as John Stape in the British soap Coronation Street .
Cai Mingzhao ( Chinese : 蔡名照 ; born June 1955 ) is a Chinese journalist and politician .
Philipp Bonadimann ( born 24 July 1980 ) is an Austrian alpine skier who won competed in two Winter Paralympics winning three medals in sitting events .
Alexander Arkadyevich Migdal ( Russian : Александр Арка́дьевич Мигдал ; born 22 July 1945 ) is a Russian --
Mujandjae Kasuto ( born 25 November 1985 ) is a Namibian amateur boxer who has competed twice at the Olympics .
Luka Grubor ( born 27 December 1973 ) is a retired rower , born in Zagreb , who competed internationally for Yugoslavia , Croatia and Great Britain , as well as for Oxford in the 1997 Boat Race .
Ebba Bielke ( 1570 - 1618 ) , was a Swedish baroness judged for high treason .
Bruno Toledo ( born 23 November 1973 ) is a Spanish retired long - distance runner who specialized in the 10,000 metres .
Jan Moretus , also Johann Moerentorf or Joannes Moretus , ( 2 May 1543 -- 22 September 1610 ) was a Flemish printer .
Sarah Hedley ( born Newcastle 1973 ) is a British author and journalist specialising in women 's consumer publishing .
Mateus Alonso Honorio , simply known as Mateus ( born 16 June 1983 ) , is a Brazilian footballer who plays for Iranian club Esteghlal .
Andres Marin ( born 22 April 1983 ) is a competitive ice climber .
Sayuri Osuga ( Japanese : 大菅小百合 , born 27 October 1980 ) is a Japanese speed skater and cyclist .
Frank Haydock ( born 29 November 1940 ) is an English former footballer who played at centre - half for several clubs , including Manchester United , Charlton Athletic and Portsmouth .
Lajos Pálmai ( 1866 - -1937 ) was a Hungarian politician , who served as Minister of Justice in the Counter - revolutionary Government of Arad during the Hungarian Soviet Republic .
Hubert Klausner ( 1 November 1892 -- 12 February 1939 ) was an Austrian officer and Nazi politician .
Kanwal Bharti ( born 4 February 1953 ) is an Indian Dalit writer and columnist .
Peter Storrie ( born 7 November 1952 ) is the Executive Vice - Chairman of A - League club Central Coast Mariners .
Aparecido Donizetti de Souza known as Donizetti or Doni ( born 10 June 1973 ) is a Brazilian footballer .
Corrado Giannantoni ( born 1950 ) is an Italian nuclear scientist .
Kim Wan - seop ( born 1963 ) is a South Korean writer , novelist , journalist , and educator .
Jerry Woodall ( born 1938 ) is an American inventor and scientist best known for his invention of the first commercially viable heterojunction material GaAlAs for red LEDs used in automobile brake lights and traffic lights , CD and DVD players , TV remote controls and computer networks .
Philip Packer FRS ( 24 June 1618 Groombridge , Kent - 24 December 1686 ) was a British barrister and architect .
Ram Sewak Sharma ( born 1955 ) is an Indian bureaucrat .
Juan Miguel López ( born 7 April 1967 ) is a Cuban former track and field athlete who specialised in the triple jump .
Chris Korwin - Kuczynski ( born 1953 ) is a former Canadian municipal politician .
Mark Timlin ( born 15 June 1944 , in Cheltenham ) is a British author best known for his series of novels featuring Nick Sharman , a former Metropolitan Police officer who takes up the profession of private investigator in South London .
Anthony Philip David Terry Frank Donald Stanley Gerry Gordon Stephen James Oatway ( born 28 November 1973 ) , more commonly known as Charlie Oatway , is an English former footballer .
Dean Bent ( born January 1971 ) , better known as Sweetie Irie , is a British reggae singer and DJ .
Stig Kleven ( born 12 January 1967 ) is a Norwegian sport wrestler .
Kathleen Stewart ( born 1958 Sydney ) is an Australian writer .
Gabriel Medina Pinto Ferreira ( born 22 December 1993 ) is a Brazilian professional surfer , also the 2014 WSL World Champion .
Pietro Redondi ( born 1950 ) is an Italian historian of science , known for his work on Galileo Galilei .
Neville Gorton ( 1 March 1888 -- 30 November 1955 ) was the 4th bishop of the restored see of Coventry in the modern era .
Alice Nzomukunda ( born 12 April 1966 ) is a Burundian politician and former Second Vice - President of the country , from 29 August 2005 to 5 September 2006 .

Maharshi Mehi was born on 28 April 1885 in a small village of Bihar , Majhua ( Khoskhsi Sharanpur ) , India .

Ion Vasile Oană ( born 23 July 1972 in Târgu Lăpuş ) is a Romanian retired football player , who played as a striker .
Felix Kiernan ( born 18 April 1929 ) was a Scottish footballer who played for Albion Rovers , Dumbarton and Stenhousemuir .
Sarita Joshi ( née Bhosle ) ( born 17 October 1941 ) is an Indian stage , television and film actress , and is a veteran actress of Gujarati theatre and Marathi theatre and also Marathi cinema .

Daniel Barone ( 21 August 1965 , Buenos Aires - ) is an Argentine film and television director .
Adesola Nunayon Amosu CFR ( born 1 August 1958 ) is a Nigerian Air Force , Air vice - marshal and the 19th Chief of Air Staff , CAS .
Seth Wilson ( 1914 -- December 11 , 2006 ) was one of the founding faculty of Ozark Christian College in Joplin , Missouri .
Moreno Suprapto or Moreno Soeprapto ( born 14 November 1982 in Jakarta ) is an Indonesian racing driver .
Mourad Souissi ( born 7 July 1984 ) is an Algerian athlete who competes in the decathlon and occasionally in the pole vault .
Steven Jeppesen ( born 22 April 1984 ) is a Danish - born Swedish professional golfer .
Hugh C. Barr ( 1878 - -1960 ) , of New York City , was a stamp dealer and auctioneer who started out in the stamp business in 1900 .
Hy Heath ( 1890 - 1965 ) was an American entertainer , songwriter , composer and author .
Sunita Rani ( born 4 December 1979 ) is an Indian athlete who won a gold medal in the 1500 m and a bronze medal in the 5000 m during the 14th Asian Games .
Svavar Gestsson ( born 26 June 1944 ) is an Icelandic politician and former minister for social affairs ( from February 1980 to May 1983 ) , Minister for Culture and Education ( 1988 - 1991 ) , Member of Parliament ( 1978 - 1999 ) , and Ambassador ( 1999 - 2009 ) .
Hugh Francis Brophy ( 1829 - June 11 , 1919 ) was a leading Fenian and staunch supporter of Irish independence .
Zuo Fen ( Chinese : 左芬 ; c. 255 - -300 ) was a Chinese woman poet of the Western Jin dynasty .
Tierney Thys ( born 1966 ) is an American marine biologist , science educator , and National Geographic explorer .
Meindert Dijkstra ( born 28 February 1967 ) is a Dutch former footballer who played primarily at right back .
Denis Alfred Peter Philp ( 10 November 1920 - 5 February 2006 ) , was a Welsh dramatist and antiques expert , best known for his television series , Collectors ' Club .
Jason Burke ( born 1970 ) is a British journalist and the author of several non - fiction books .
Ismail Isakovich Isakov ( born 11 June 1950 ) ( Russian : Исаков Исмаил Исакович ) is a Kyrgyzstan politician and Lieutenant General in the Kyrgyz military force .
John Quine ( 1857 - -1940 ) was a Manx clergyman , scholar , novelist and playwright .
Gilbert Austin ( 1753 - -1837 ) was an Irish educator , clergyman and author .
Jeffrey Brotman ( born 1943 ) is an American attorney and businessman .
Caroline Dale ( born 1965 ) is a widely recorded British cellist who has performed music for numerous films , including Truly , Madly , Deeply , Hilary and Jackie , Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas , as well as the 2005 adaptation of Jane Austen 's Pride and Prejudice and 2007 's Academy Award winner Atonement .
Andreas Almgren ( born 12 June 1995 ) is a Swedish track and field middle - distance runner .
Rabbi Dr. Harvey Belovski ( born 18 January 1968 ) , is a British orthodox rabbi , educator and organisational advisor .
Captain Mary Becker Greene ( 1867 - April 22 , 1949 ) , was steamboat captain of the Greene Line of river steamboats .
Benoit Dunoyer de Segonzac ( born 1962 ) is a virtuoso double bass player who performed with Jacques Loussier and Andre Arpino playing renditions by Johann Sebastian Bach / Eric Satie .
Antoinette Nana Djimou Ida ( born 2 August 1985 ) is a French heptathlete and pentathlete .
Taira no Norimori ( Japanese : 平教盛 たいら の のりもり ) ( 1128 - 1185 ) was the younger half - brother of Taira no Kiyomori and father - in - law of Fujiwara no Naritsune .
William E. Schaadt , better known as Bill Schaadt ( 1924 - -1995 ) was an artist , sign painter , collector and avid fly fisherman .
Camelia ( born 20 June 1974 , as Dayang Noor Camelia Abang Khalid ) is a Malaysian singer and model .
Miloš Stojčev ( Serbian Cyrillic : Милош Стојчев ; born 19 January 1987 ) is a Serbian - born footballer who plays for Atromitos .
