William Eifion Jones ( 1925 - -2004 ) was a Welsh marine botanist , noted for his study of marine algae .
Bruno Lucia ( born 27 January 1960 ) is an Australian stand - up comedian , actor and performer .
Calixte Dakpogan ( born 1958 ) is a Beninese sculptor known for his installations as well as his masks made out of diverse and original found materials .
Armando Latini ( born 20 May 1913 , date of death unknown ) was an Italian cyclist who competed in track cycling .
Roscoe James Irwin ( born 21 February 1984 ) is a singer - songwriter , trumpet player arranger / composer from Melbourne , Australia
Derek Paravicini ( born 26 July 1979 ) is a blind English autistic savant and a musical prodigy .
María Constanza Ceruti ( born 11 January 1973 ) is an Argentinian high - altitude archaeologist and anthropologist .
Matt Parsons ( born 18 June 1973 ) is an Australian retired professional rugby leaguefootballer of the 1990s and 2000s .
John Tartamella ( 1892 - - July 12 , 1966 ) was consigliere for over 30 years to Joseph Bonanno and his family .
Teo Chee Hean ( simplified Chinese : 张志贤 ; traditional Chinese : 張志賢 ; pinyin : Zhāng Zhìxián ; Pe̍h - ōe - jī : Tiuⁿ Chì - hiân ; born 27 December 1954 ) is a Singaporean politician .
Francesco Mauriello ( born 28 November 1993 ) is an Italian motorcycle racer .
Monica Babuc ( born 29 March 1964 , in Bardar ) is a politician and historian from the Republic of Moldova .
Georgi Obretenov , the youngest son of Tonka Obretenova , was born after 1849 .
Robert Krausz ( 1936 -- October 3 , 2002 ) was an Israeli commodities and futures trader .
Agnieszka Arnold ( born 24 September 1947 in Łowicz ) is a Polish documentary filmmaker born 1947 .
Mark Delpriora ( born 1959 ) is an American classical guitarist and composer .
Kostas Beglektsis ( Greek : Κώστας Μπεγλεκτσής , born 5 January 1995 ) , is a Greek footballer who currently plays for Football league 2 club Sparti F.C. , as a Striker .
Violina Linda Pedro ( born 1951 or 1952 ) is a bowls player from Tokelau .
Cihat Arslan ( born 9 February 1970 ) is a Turkish former footballer and currently a football manager .
George Bayoud ( born 1955 ) is a real estate investor in Dallas , Texas .
Patrick Masterson ( born 1936 , Dublin ) is a former president of University College Dublin and the European University Institute .
Darina Márquez Uribe ( born 28 July 1980 ) , known as Darina , is a Mexican pop / rock singer - songwriter .
Len Cormier ( 1924 -- June 16 , 2008 ) worked for many years in the U.S. aerospace industry , in government , large industry , and as a private entrepreneur .
Alexander Moosbrugger ( born 21 August 1972 in Bregenzerwald ) is an Austrian Composer , living since 2001 in Berlin .
Ghulam Nabi Firaq ( born 15 July 1922 ) is a Kashmiri poet , writer and an educationist .
Melanie Tem ( née Kubachko ; April 11 , 1949 -- February 9 , 2015 ) was an American horror and dark fantasy author .
Ben Stevens ( born 1959 ) is an American politician and former President of the Alaska State Senate .
Irina Wrona ( born 1974 in Düsseldorf ) is an actress from Germany .
Aakash Dahiya ( born 20 September 1983 ) is a Mumbai - based actor and casting director , who is known for his work in Bollywood films .
Andrus Rõuk ( born 28 September 1957 in Tallinn ) is an Estonian artist and poet .
Phil Madeira ( born 1952 ) is an American songwriter , producer , musician and singer from Nashville , Tennessee , United States .
Luisa Ranieri ( born 16 December 1973 ) is an Italian actress and TV presenter .
Dragan Skočić ( born 3 September 1968 ) is a Croatian football manager and former professional player who last managed Foolad F.C. in the Persian Gulf League .
Ken Strauss ( born 1953 ) is a physician / author who is known both for his writings as well as for his work promoting the careers and works of other artistically - inclined professionals .
Mark Phooi Peck Lye ( born 22 August 1962 ) is a Singaporean entrepreneur in the design industry .
Kweon Kab - yong ( born 3 October 1957 ) is a South Korean 6 dan professional Go player .
John Henry Barrow ( 1817 -- 22 August 1874 ) was a Congregational minister , journalist and South Australian politician .
José Tomás Errázuriz Urmeneta ( 1856 - 1927 ) was a Chilean landscape painter and diplomat .
Lazar Mojsov ( Macedonian : Лазар Мојсов ; 19 December 1920 -- 25 August 2011 ) was a Macedonian journalist , communist politician and diplomat from SFR Yugoslavia .
Berta Taracena ( born 1925 ) is a Mexican historian , cultural researcher and art critic .
Benton Johnson ( born 1928 ) is an American sociologist and professor emeritus of the University of Oregon 's Department of Sociology .
Dirck Helmbreker , Theodor Helmbreeker , or Teodoro Elembrech ( 1633 - -1696 ) was a Dutch Golden Age painter of Italianate landscapes .
Rolf Gerling ( born 15 December 1954 in Cologne ) is a German billionairre ranked # 512 worldwide in wealth by Forbes magazine .
Jim Spellman ( born 1968 ) is an American journalist and musician .
Stephen Sachs ( born 14 August 1959 ) is an award - winning stage director and playwright .
Donald Mackenzie Smeaton CSI ( 9 September 1848 -- 19 April 1910 ) , son of David James Smeaton , was a Scottish politician who was the Liberal MP for Stirlingshire from January 1906 until January 1910 .
Ola John ( born 19 May 1992 ) is a Dutch professional footballer who plays as a winger for English club Reading , on loan from Portuguese club Benfica .
Hannah Starkey ( born 1971 ) is a British photographer who specializes in staged settings of women in city environments .
Sallyanne Short ( born 6 March 1968 ) is a Welsh former sprinter who competed in the 100 metres and 200 metres .
Satwant Singh `` Sat '' Bains ( born 28 February 1971 ) is a British chef best known for being chef proprietor of the two - Michelin star Restaurant Sat Bains with Rooms in Nottingham .
Lee Kit ( born 1978 ) is a contemporary artist who currently lives and works in Hong Kong and Taipei .
Roger Swerts ( born 28 December 1942 ) is a Belgian former road bicycle racer .
Artur Orzech ( born 22 , February 1964 in Jelenia Góra ) is a Polish journalist , radio and television presenter and music broadcaster .
Ronny Huybrechts ( born 20 July 1965 ) is a Belgian darts player who won his two - year PDC tour card on the third day of the 2013 Tour Qualifying School .
Bruce Milne ( born 1957 ) is an Australian music entrepreneur closely linked to the Melbourne post - punk scene .
Corneliu Calotescu ( 1889 - -1970 ) was a Romanian Major - General during World War II . He served as Secretary - General to the Under - Secretary of State of Land Forces in 1940 .
Buyan Sechen Khan ( 1554 - -1604 ) was a Mongol khan of the Northern Yuan dynasty based in Mongolia and he was the eldest son of Jasaghtu Khan whom he succeeded .
Giovanni Prezioso born in 1957 in Boston to Dr. and Mrs. Fausto Maria Prezioso of Towson , Md , became General Counsel of the US Securities and Exchange Commission in April 2002 .
David Spelman ( born 1966 in Washington , D.C. , United States ) is an American , New York - based , record producer and curator working in recordings , films and live events
Liliana Popescu , née Barbulescu ( born 5 February 1982 ) is a Romanian middle distance runner , who specializes in the 800 metres .
Alfonso Rangel Guerra ( born 16 November 1928 , Monterrey , Nuevo León ) is a Mexican lawyer , educator , writer and administrator .
Valeriu Rudic ( born 18 February 1947 in Talmaza ) is a Moldovan microbiologist , chemist , biochemist and pharmacist who was selected member of Academy of Sciences of Moldova .
Georgy Mihailovich Kondratiev ( Russian : Георгий Михайлович Кондратьев , 1887 - -1958 ) Russian physicist , specialist in thermal measurements .
Amanda Royle ( born 1962 ) is a British actress who has appeared in a variety of British television shows including Agatha Christie 's Poirot , Campion , Rosemary & Thyme and Bulman .
Thomas Jeremiah Williams ( 1872 - 12 June 1919 ) was a Welsh barrister and Liberal politician .
John Blakemore ( born 1936 ) , is an English photographer who has worked in documentary , landscape , still life and hand made books .
Koena Mitra ( born 7 January 1984 ) is an Indian actress , model and beauty queen who appears in Bollywood films .
Flaka Surroi ( born 1964 ) is a notable publisher from the Republic of Kosovo .
George Edward Given Lyness , usually known as Given Lyness ( born 16 December 1937 in Belfast , Northern Ireland ) is an Irish former cricketer .
Zoe Beloff ( born 1958 ) is an artist residing in New York who works primarily in installation , film , and drawing .
Josie Lawrence ( born Wendy Lawrence ; 6 June 1959 ) is an English comedienne and actress best known for her work with the Comedy Store Players improvisational troupe , the television series Whose Line Is It Anyway ? and more recently her role as Manda Best in EastEnders .
Amy Yang , also known as Yang Hee - Young ( Korean : 양희영 , born 28 July 1989 ) is a Korean professional golfer , currently playing on the United States - based LPGA Tour and on the Ladies European Tour ( LET ) .
Barukh Binah ( Hebrew : ברוך בינה ) ( born 1950 in Tel Aviv ) is the current Israeli Ambassador to Denmark .
William Irwin Thompson ( born July 1938 ) is known primarily as a social philosopher and cultural critic , but he has also been writing and publishing poetry throughout his career and received the Oslo International Poetry Festival Award in 1986 .
Svend Olaf Wamnes Akstuft , known as Svend Wam ( born 5 May 1946 in Son ) is a Norwegian film director .
Olimpia Giustiniani ( 18 May 1641 -- 27 December 1729 ) was an Italian noblewoman of the houses of Giustiniani and Barberini .
Zafer Ergin ( born 30 August 1942 , Ankara ) is one of the mid-1990s Turkish actors who played in present Arka Sokaklar and gave an importance with Hırsız , being the main - role of Gülse Birsel .
Julian Holloway ( born 24 June 1944 ) is an English actor now based in Hollywood , California , United States .
Baltazar Adam Krčelić ( 5 February 1715 - 29 March 1778 ) was a Croatian historian , theologian and lawyer .
Beverley Jones ( born 17 October 1974 ) is a Paralympian from Wales competing in category F37 throwing events .
Colonel Balbir Singh Kular ( VSM , born 5 April 1945 ) is an Indian field hockey player ( half - back ) .
Paddy Farrell ( born 1913 , date of death unknown ) was an Irish footballer who played for Bohemians and Hibernian during the 1930s .
Kerstin Wohlbold ( born 11 January 1984 ) is a German handballer who plays for Thüringer HC as a middle back .
Kenneth Mburu Mungara , also known as Kennedy Mburu , ( born 7 September 1973 in Limuru ) is a Kenyan long distance runner who specialises in the marathon .
Lisa H. Schwartzman ( born 1969 ) is a philosophy professor and well known feminist and social / political philosopher currently teaching at Michigan State University .
Alonso de Estrada ( b. ca . 1470 , Ciudad Real , Spain , d. 1533 - 37 , Mexico City ) was a colonial official in New Spain during the period of Hernán Cortés 's government , and before the appointment of the first viceroy .
Phil Beer ( born 12 May 1953 in Exminster , Devon , England ) is an English multi - instrumentalist , composer , producer , and one half of English acoustic roots duo Show of Hands .
John McCaffary ( 1820 -- August 21 , 1851 ) was the only defendant to be executed by the State of Wisconsin .
Melvin Wandelaar ( born 2 January 1990 ) is a Dutch footballer who plays for SV Robinhood of the Surinamese Hoofdklasse .
Aigars Apinis ( 9 June 1973 in Aizkraukle ) is a Latvian athlete .
Robert Twycross ( born 29 January 1941 ) is a retired British physician and writer .
Joseph Sittler ( 1904 - -1987 ) was an American Lutheran theologian who taught at the Divinity School of the University of Chicago and the Lutheran School of Theology at Chicago .
Adjoua Flore Kouamé ( born 1964 , Abidjan ) is a novelist from Côte d’Ivoire .
Ahmad Madani ( 11 February 1928 -- 12 February 2006 ) was an Iranian politician , Commander of Iranian Navy ( 1979 ) , governor of the Khuzestan province ( 1979 - -80 ) and candidate in the first Iranian presidential election .
Gray O'Brien ( born Gerry O'Brien , 11 August 1968 ) is a Scottish television and film actor , best known for his portrayal of the villainous Weatherfield businessman Tony Gordon in the popular ITV soap opera Coronation Street from 2007 to 2010 , and as Dr Richard McCaig on the BBC medical drama Casualty from 1996 to 1998 .
Peter Skene Ogden ( alternately Skeene , Skein or Skeen ) , ( baptised 12 February 1790 -- September 1854 ) was a fur trader and a Canadian explorer of what is now British Columbia and the American West .
Alper Sendilmen ( born 4 July 1980 ) is a German rapper with Turkish origin , better known as Alpa Gun .
Charlwood Lawton ( 1660 - -1721 ) was an English lawyer and phrase - making pamphleteer , a Whig of Jacobite views .
Nalin Jayawardena ( Sinhala : නලින් ජයවර්ධන ) ( born 18 April 1957 ) is a popular Sri Lankan singer and vocalist .
Dave Thornton ( born 13 December 1979 ) is a stand - up comedian , actor and radio and TV presenter .
Joseph Alleine ( baptised 8 April 1634 -- 17 November 1668 ) was an English Nonconformist pastor and author of many religious works .
Aidan J. David ( born 23 December 1981 ) is a British actor , best known for playing James Arnold ( Arnie ) in the BBC school drama Grange Hill .
Ann - Britt Ryd Pettersson , born 19 March 1954 , is a Swedish news reporter at Sveriges Television .
Francis Dunham ( born 10 November 1793 in Wheathampstead , Hertfordshire ; died 1878 in St Albans , Hertfordshire ) was an English first - class cricketer associated with Marylebone Cricket Club ( MCC ) who was active in the 1810s .
Kevin Roth ( born 1957 in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania ) is an American folk singer and dulcimer player who has released forty - five albums .
Jonathan Lloyd Walker ( born 13 September 1967 ) is an English film and television actor and screenwriter who resides in Canada .
Paolo Maffei ( 1926 -- 1 March 2009 ) was an Italian astrophysicist and science writer .
Charles of Taranto ( 1296 -- 29 August 1315 ) was the eldest son of Philip I , Prince of Taranto and titular Latin Emperor of Constantinople , and his wife , Thamar Angelina Komnene , daughter of the Despot of Epirus , Nikephoros I Komnenos Doukas .
Archbishop Antônio de Macedo Costa ( 7 Aug 1830 - 20 Mar 1891 ) was Archbishop of São Salvador da Bahia and previously Bishop of Pará .
Wacław Iwaniuk ( born 17 December 1912 in Stare Chojno near Chełm Lubelski ) , died 4 January 2001 in Toronto .
Diego Carlos de Oliveira , known as Diego Carlos ( born 15 May 1988 in Campos Altos ) is a Brazilian football striker , who currently plays for FC Ufa .
Kévin Estre ( born 28 October 1988 ) is a French professional racing driver currently competing in the FIA World Endurance Championship with French squad OAK Racing .
Joab Houghton ( 1811 -- January 31 , 1876 ) was an American lawyer and judge who served as the first Chief Justice of New Mexico .
Prince Guillaume , Hereditary Grand Duke of Luxembourg ( given names : Guillaume Jean Joseph Marie ; born 11 November 1981 ) , has been heir apparent to the crown of Luxembourg since his father 's accession in 2000 .
Fio Zanotti ( born Fiorenzo Zanotti on 20 November 1949 ) is an Italian record producer , arranger , conductor , composer and multi - instrumentalist .
Polly Barber ( Polly Scovill ; 25 September 1803 -- 23 February 1898 ) , was born in Lower Canada and , at various times was a teacher , farmer , and businesswoman .
Yuriy Voronkin ( Russian : Юрий Воронкин ; born 18 May 1979 ) is a Russian hammer thrower .
Serhiy Tahirov ( Ukrainian : Сергій Тагіров born 2 January 1989 in Dnipropetrovsk , Ukraine ) is a Ukrainian weightlifter .
Kommissar Hjuler ( born 1967 in Detlev Hjuler ) works as a sound recordist in the field of Noise and Post - industrial music , visual artist , film maker and police officer at Flensburg , a town on the German border with Denmark .
Alain Mafart ( born in 1951 ) is a French military officer best known for his part in the bombing of the Rainbow Warrior .
Qin Jianxiao ( Chinese : 秦建孝 ; pinyin : Qín Jiànxiào ; born November 1962 ) is a former Chinese politician from Shanxi province .
Clayton Spencer ( born December 15 , 1954 ) is an American academic , policymaker , and attorney currently serving as the 8th President of Bates College , in Lewiston , Maine , the second women to hold the office .
Randy Blumer ( born October 21 , 1958 in Edmonton , Alberta ) is widely acknowledged as having started the multibillion dollar online poker industry with the launch of Planet Poker , the world 's first real money online poker room on January 1 , 1998 .
Douglass Sullivan - Gonzalez ( born 1956 ) is an expert on Central American history , particularly in the 19th century .
Eduardo Gallardo ( born 20 April 1969 ) is an Argentine handball coach .
Sir Robert Armstrong - Jones , CBE ( 2 December 1857 -- 31 January 1943 ) , born Robert Jones , was a Welsh physician and psychiatrist .
Yvonne Pavis ( b. 1890 ) was an English - born actress , writer , and producer .
Seán Duignan ( born 1936 ) is an Irish journalist , newsreader , political aide and writer .
Paul Gustav Eduard Speiser ( 1877 - -1945 ) was a German entomologist who specialised in Diptera .
Manazir Ahsan Gilani ( born September 1892 ) was an Islamic scholar from the Deobandi school of thought , which is one of the major Islamic schools in Indian subcontinent .
Virginia Ironside ( born 1945 in London , UK ) is a British journalist , agony aunt and author .
Helen Wyman ( born 4 March 1981 St Albans , Hertfordshire ) is a British cyclist for the KONA Factory Team .
Asher Quinn ( Asha ) ( born 22 September 1952 ) is an English singer - songwriter , multi - instrumentalist and mystical balladeer , first known as Denis Quinn on the New World Music label .
Valeriu Catînsus ( born 27 April 1978 in Chişinău , Moldavian SSR ) is a Moldovan footballer .
Shahn Majid ( born 1960 in Patna , Bihar , India ) is an English pure mathematician and theoretical physicist , trained at Cambridge University and Harvard and since 2001 a Professor of Mathematics at the School of Mathematical Sciences , Queen Mary , University of London .
Claude Duhamel ( born 1970 ) is a Canadian film , stage and television actor .
James Loomis Madden ( 1892 -- 1972 ) was acting chancellor of New York University from 1951 to 1952 .
Sir William Overend Priestley ( 24 June 1829 -- 11 April 1900 ) was a British physician and Conservative Party politician .
Mohibullah Samim ( born 1965 ) was appointed as the Governor of Paktika on 20 April 2010 .
Brett Sharman ( born 18 January 1987 ) is a professional South African rugby footballer .
Aloysius Atuegbu ( 29 April 1953 -- 25 May 2008 ) was a Nigerian football player .
Richard Read ( born 1957 ) is a two - time Pulitzer Prize - winning American journalist who was a senior staff writer and foreign correspondent for The Oregonian newspaper in Portland , Oregon .
Roger Shimomura ( born Roger Yutaka Shimomura in 1939 in Seattle , Washington ) is an American artist and a retired professor at the University of Kansas Lawrence , having taught there from 1969 to 2004 .
Natthakarn Chinwong ( Thai : ณัฐกานต์ ชินวงศ์ born 15 March 1992 ) is a Thai international footballer who plays as a midfielder .
Hans - Erik Eriksson ( born 1961 ) is a Swedish computer scientist , organizational theorist , co - founder of Open Training AB , and author , known for his 2000 work on `` Business modeling with UML . ''
Mark Burnett ( born 17 July 1960 ) is a British - born television producer based in Los Angeles and is currently the President of MGM Television and Digital Group .
Jesús Navas González ( Spanish pronunciation : ( xeˈsuz ˈnaβaz ɣonˈθaleθ ) ; born 21 November 1985 ) is a Spanish professional footballer who plays for English club Manchester City as a right winger .
Ray Hanania ( born 1953 ) is an Arab - American Palestinian Christian journalist and stand - up comedian .
Alberto Gallinetta ( born 16 April 1992 ) is an Italian football player who plays for Naxxar Lions in the Maltese Premier League , on loan from Juventus .
Tim Bowler ( born 14 November 1953 ) is an English author of books for children , teenagers and young adults .
An Jeong - geun ( Hangul : 안정근 ; born 20 November 1924 ) is a South Korean former sports shooter .
Ante Grgin ( born 1945 ) is a Serbian clarinetist and composer of Croatian origin .
Brian North Lee FSA , ( Syston , Leicestershire , 27 December 1936 - 24 February 2007 , London ) was a former teacher , Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London since 1978 and expert on bookplates , or `` ex - libris '' as he preferred to call them .
E. Norman Veasey ( born 1933 ) was a Chief Justice of the Delaware Supreme Court .
Kim Bong - han ( Chosŏn'gŭl : 김봉한 ; born 1916 ) is a North Korean medical surgeon at Pyongyang Medical University and Kyung - Rak institute ( KRI ) .

Przemysław Czajkowski ( born 26 October 1988 in Wysokie Mazowieckie ) is a Polish athlete specializing in the discus throw .
Frederick Locker - Lampson ( 1821 - -1895 ) was an English man of letters , bibliophile and poet .
Ney Yépez Cortés ( Quito , 1968 ) is an Ecuadorian writer , journalist , poet , songwriter , screen writer , lecturer , and teacher of Tai Chi , Reiki and Qi Gong .
Jesse K. Hines ( 1829 -- September 20 , 1889 ) was a Democratic member of the Maryland House of Delegates from Kent County and served as the Speaker of the House for the 1874 session .
Fred Lookout ( November 1865 -- August 28 , 1949 ) was a leader of the Osage Nation of Native Americans .
Niall Scannell ( born 8 April 1992 in Cork , Ireland ) is an Irish rugby union player for Munster in the Pro12 and European Rugby Champions Cup .
Bo Stief ( born 15 October 1946 ) is a Danish jazz and rock bassist , composer , and arranger born in Copenhagen .
Norbert Brami ( Arabic : نوربرت برامى‎ ; born 12 February 1937 ) is a Tunisian fencer .
Daryl Laub ( born 1925 ) is a television and radio personality who worked for stations in the Twin Cities region of Minnesota , USA , from the 1950s until his retirement in 1993 .
Mary GrandPré ( born February 13 , 1954 ) is an American illustrator best known for her cover and chapter illustrations of the Harry Potter books in their U.S. editions published by Scholastic .
Ellen Segal Huvelle ( born 1948 ) is a federal judge sitting in the United States District Court for the District of Columbia .
Jonathan Staley ( 1868 -- 1917 ) was an English footballer who played in the Football League for Derby County .
Rémy Noë ( born 8 December 1974 ) , is an English painter , a member of the international art movement Stuckism and co - founder of the Maidstone Stuckists .
Charlotte Lennox , née Ramsay ( c. 1730 -- 4 January 1804 ) was a Scottish author and poet .
Annabel Lamb ( born 1958 , Surrey ) is an English singer - songwriter .
Lillian Schoedler ( 1891 - 1963 ) was a secretary of the New York City Intercollegiate Bureau of Occupations , which eventually became the Bureau of Vocational Information .
Kev Hopgood ( born 25 August 1961 ) is a British comic artist who has been drawing comic books since 1984 .
Jade Laroche ( born 8 September 1989 ) is a French model , DJ and pornographic actress .
George Feilding , 1st Earl of Desmond ( c. 1614 -- 31 January 1665 ) was an Irish peer and the second son of William Feilding , 1st Earl of Denbigh .
Lucas Macie ( born 2 July 1960 in Maputo ) is a Mozambiquan - Swazi painter .
Graeme Allwright ( born 7 November 1926 ) is a singer - songwriter .
Vlado Jovanovski ( Macedonian : Владо Јовановски ; born 27 February 1967 ) is Macedonian actor .
Kathrin Böhm ( born 1969 ) is an artist whose work is defined by its collaborative nature and commitment to the public realm .
Yu Yuanhui ( Chinese : 余远辉 ; born January 1964 ) is a Chinese politician of ethnic Yao heritage who spent most of his career in Southwest China 's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region .
Berthold Maria Schenk Graf von Stauffenberg ( born 3 July 1934 ) is a German retired Bundeswehr general .
Ram Jethmalani born 14 September 1923 , is an Indian lawyer and politician .
Sir Rupert Mackeson , 2nd Baronet ( born 16 November 1941 ) is a British author and former soldier .
Carlos Micháns ( born Carlos Eduardo Micháns on 18 August 1950 ) is a Dutch composer of Argentine origin .
Sir Lancelot Oliphant , KCMG , CB ( 8 October 1881 -- 2 October 1965 ) was a British diplomat , Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Belgium , Minister - Plenipotentiary to Luxembourg and Director General of the Foreign Office .
Sue Coe ( born 28 November 1951 ) is an English artist and illustrator , working primarily in drawing and printmaking , often in the form of illustrated books and comics .
Cho U ( simplified Chinese : 张栩 ; traditional Chinese : 張栩 ; pinyin : Zhang Xu ; Wade -- Giles : Chang Hsu ; born on 20 January 1980 ) is a Taiwanese professional Go player .
Félicien Kabuga ( born 1935 ) is a Rwandan businessman , accused of bankrolling and participating in the Rwandan Genocide .
Everton Fox ( born 1964 ) is a British weather presenter , currently working for Al Jazeera English .
Sir Philip Carteret , 1st Baronet ( 1620 -- between 1663 and 1675 ) , also known as Philippe de Carteret III , was the 4th Seigneur of Sark .
V. S. Krishna Iyer ( 7 January 1922 -- 25 July 2011 ) was an Indian politician and independence movement activist from the state of Karnataka .
Ondoro Osoro ( born 3 December 1967 ) is a former Kenyan long - distance runner who competed mostly in cross country and road races .
Bartholomäus Gesius ( also : Göß , Gese , c. 1562 -- 1613 ) was a German theologian , church musician , composer and hymn writer .
Harry Collins ( born 13 June 1943 ) , is a British sociologist of science at the School of Social Sciences , Cardiff University , Wales .
Kenneth True Norris Jr. ( August 16 , 1930 - -September 21 , 1996 ) was an industrialist and philanthropist who lived in Huntington Beach , California .
Stephen Pevnick ( born 1944 ) is an American interdisciplinary artist who works in a variety of media , including interactive art , public art , permanent installations , and installations for the trade show industry .
Jaime Bonilla Valdez ( born 9 June 1950 ) is a Mexican politician and businessman affiliated to the National Regeneration Movement ( formerly to the Labor Party ) .
Denis Nagulin ( Russian : Дени́с Нагу́лин ; IPA : ( dʲɪˈnʲis nɐˈɡulʲɪn ) ; born 27 November 1992 ) is a Russian racing driver .
Sophia Kokosalaki ( born 1972 ) is a Greek fashion designer with her own label based in London .
James Francisco Freitas Iahnke ( born 16 August 1968 ) , known as James Freitas , is a Brazilian football manager who is the current assistant manager of Grêmio .
Tom Cichowski ( June 13 , 1944 -- September 17 , 2015 ) was a former professional American football player .
Mark David Hall ( born 22 February 1966 ) , is Herbert Hoover Distinguished Professor of Politics and Faculty Fellow in the William Penn Honors Program at George Fox University .
Dawood Hosni ( also spelled Daoud / Dawoud Housni or Hosny , Arabic : داود حسني‎ née David Haim ) was an Egyptian musician and composer born in 1870 in Cairo to a Karaite Jewish family .
Algimantas Kezys ( 1928 -- February 23 , 2015 ) was a photographer born in Lithuania who moved to the United States in 1950 .
Rabi Narayan Bastia was born on 2 October 1958 in the Indian state of Odisha and graduated in Science from Utkal University .
Ernst Hunter Wright ( 1892 - -1968 ) was a professor at Columbia , a chairman of English Institute at Columbia ( 1942 - -1946 ) , an author of many notable works , an editor - in - chief of Richards Cyclopedia for Juveniles .
Nikhil Upreti was born on 10 August 1980 , to Govinda Upreti and Bhoj Kumari Upreti in Piprabhitta of Sarlahi , Nepal .
John David Caute ( born 16 December 1936 in Alexandria , Egypt ) is a British author , novelist , playwright , historian and journalist .
Niall Carew ( born 1974 ) is an Irish retired Gaelic footballer and hurler .
Pandit Nilakantha Das , was born on 5 August 1884 in the village Sri Ramchandrapur of Puri district .
Margaret Pemberton , née Hudson ( born 10 April 1943 ) , is a British writer of women 's fiction since 1975 .
Janet Werner ( born 1959 , Winnipeg , Manitoba ) is a Montreal based artist .
Karine Costa is a French singer born in 1977 in Paris , particularly known for her songs from Disney films .
Elizabeth Neel ( b. 1975 , Stowe , Vermont ) is an American artist based in New York .
Rhiannon Lassiter ( born February 1977 ) is a children 's books author .
Danny Saber ( born 1966 ) is a Los Angeles , California musician , audio engineer , record producer , and remixer .
Low Sook Yee ( Chinese : 劉紓妤 ; pinyin : Liú Shúyu ; born 11 December 1989 ) or popularly known as Suki Low , is the winner in the One in a Million competition .
Sharman Kadish ( born 1959 ) is a contemporary scholar , author , and historian with particular expertise in Jewish British history and with several publications under her name .
Paul Mebus ( 9 June 1920 -- 11 December 1993 ) was a German footballer .
Marion William Dufilho ( 1916 - 1942 ) was an American military officer posthumously decorated for heroism during World War II . Dufilho was born 22 May 1916 in Opelousas , Louisiana , and graduated from the Naval Academy 2 June 1938 .
Patrick Matibini ( born 20 July 1959 ) is a Zambian politician , lawyer and former judge .
Andreas Wiegel ( born 21 July 1991 ) is a German footballer currently playing for MSV Duisburg as a striker .
Polidoro Caldara , usually known as Polidoro da Caravaggio ( c. 1499 -- 1543 ) was an Italian painter of the Mannerist period , `` arguably the most gifted and certainly the least conventional of Raphael 's pupils '' , who was best known for his now - vanished paintings on the facades of Roman houses .
Rudolf Baričević ( 1914 , Jablanac -- November 10 , 1999 , Zagreb ) was a member of the Croatian Home Guard who participated in the Battle of Stalingrad with the 369th Reinforced Infantry Regiment .
Emánuel Moór ( 19 February 1863 -- 20 October 1931 ) was a Hungarian composer , pianist , and inventor of musical instruments .
Willie Mathieson ( born 20 July 1943 ) is a Scottish former professional footballer who played in the left - back position for Rangers , amongst other clubs .
Hanna Karasiova ( Belarusian : Ганна Карасёва ; born 8 January 1978 ) is an athlete from Belarus .
Vasyl Virastyuk ( Ukrainian : Василь Вірастюк ; born 22 April 1974 ) , is a Ukrainian former strongman competitor .
Richard Laurence ( 1760 - -1838 ) was an English Hebraist and Anglican churchman .
Olaf Zinke ( born 9 October 1966 ) is a former speed skater .
Melina Marchetta ( born 25 March 1965 ) is an Australian writer and teacher .
Henry McKinstry ( born 1805 , Antrim , Ireland - died April 17 , 1871 ) was mayor of Hamilton , Ontario from 1859 to 1861 .
Duane Flatmo ( born 1957 ) is an American artist best known for his murals , label art and kinetic art sculptures in northern California .
Othman Al Omeir ( born 1950 ) is a Saudi - born British businessman , journalist and editor .
Arthur J. Samberg ( born 1941 ) was the chief executive officer , president and chairman of Pequot Capital Management , a hedge fund which at one point was the largest in the world at over $ 15 billion .
Khieu Kanharith ( born 13 September 1951 ) is the Cambodian Minister of Information .
Hugh Bourne ( 1772 - -1852 ) along with William Clowes was the joint founder of Primitive Methodism , the largest offshoot of Wesleyan Methodism and , in the mid nineteenth century , an influential Protestant Christian movement in its own right .
Mark Britnell ( born 1966 ) is Chairman and Senior Partner for the Global Health Practice of the professional services firm KPMG .
Swati Singh ( born 2 October 1987 ) is an Indian weightlifter who won the bronze medal in the women 's 53 kg weight class at the 2014 Commonwealth Games at Glasgow .
Marcin Maliński ( born 10 January 1973 ) is a retired Polish swimmer who won three medals in the 200 m and 400 m individual medley events at European World championships in 1995 .
David James Jones ( 22 December 1886 -- 23 July 1947 ) , was a Welsh philosopher and academic .
Captain Henry Meintjes ( 25 December 1892 -- ? ? ) was a World War I flying ace credited with eight aerial victories .
Kurt Hovelijnck ( born 2 June 1981 ) is a Belgian former professional road bicycle racer , who competed as a professional between 2005 and 2013 , competing for the Topsport Vlaanderen , Quick Step , Donckers Koffie - Jelly Belly and Crelan - Euphony squads .
Rev. Felix Biestek ( 1912 - -1994 ) was an American priest and professor who made significant contributions to the field of social work during its period of expansion following World War II . Biestek was born in Cicero , Illinois and graduated from Loyola University of Chicago in 1938 .
Malcolm Guthrie ( 10 February 1903 -- 22 November 1972 ) , professor of Bantu languages , is known primarily for his classification of Bantu languages ( Guthrie 1971 ) .
Said Suleiman Said ( born 15 June 1958 ) is a Tanzanian CUF politician and Member of Parliament for Mtambwe constituency since 2010 .
Jason Forbes ( born 27 October 1990 ) is a British actor and comedian best known for the CITV series Horrible Science , for playing PC Peasey in the Professor Branestawm movies on BBC One , and as a member of the award - winning sketch trio ' Daphne ' .
Nematullah Shahrani ( born 1941 ) is a prominent Afghan scholar .
Renette Pauline Soutendijk , known as Renée Soutendijk ( born 21 May 1957 ) , is a Dutch actress .
Jean Ranc ( 28 January 1674 -- 1 July 1735 ) was a French painter , mainly active in portraiture .
Charles E. Freeman ( born 1933 ) is an American attorney and first district justice of the Illinois Supreme Court .
Courtney Atkinson ( born 15 August 1979 ) is a professional Australian triathlete born in Mackay , Queensland .
Amos Townsend ( 1821 - March 17 , 1895 ) was a U.S. Representative from Ohio .
Anthony Hewitt ( born in 1971 ) is a classical pianist from the Lake District , England .
Mark Philippi ( born 21 March 1963 ) is an American world champion powerlifter and strongman competitor .
Zhong Huandi ( born 28 June 1967 in Yunnan ) is a retired Chinese long - distance runner who concentrated on the 3000 and 10,000 metres , and later the marathon .
Sandra Chambers , also known as Sandy Chambers or simply Sandy , ( born 11 April 1967 ) is a British dance music vocalist .
Glen Fukushima ( born 1949 ) is a Japanese American business leader and former public servant .
Avner Shats ( Hebrew : אבנר שץ‎ ; born 1959 ) is an Israeli author and poet .
Dirk Tazelaar ( born 13 January 1963 ) is a former Australian first class cricketer who played for Queensland .
N. Sasidharan ( born 1952 ) is an Indian Botanist .
Konrad Kolšek ( 1933 - -2009 ) was a Slovenian Yugoslav Colonel General who came to prominence during the Slovenian Independence War .
Yann Demange ( born 1976 or 1977 ) is a French film director .
Eric Lichtblau ( born 1965 ) is a United States journalist and Washington bureau reporter for The New York Times .
Ann Downer was born in Arlington , Virginia in 1960 and grew up in Manila and Bangkok and recalled avidly reading fantasy fiction .
Stanisław Kluza ( ( sta'ɲiswaf ' kluza ) , born 2 June 1972 in Warsaw ) is a Polish economist who , from July 14 to September 22 , 2006 , was the Finance Minister in the cabinet of Jarosław Kaczyński .
Heinrich Blyssen ( Latin Henricus Blissemius , Czech Jindřich Blyssem ) ( 1526 -- April 24 , 1586 ) was a German Jesuit controversialist against the Hussites of Bohemia .
Luis Sandrini ( 22 February 1905 -- 5 July 1980 ) was a prolific Argentine comic film actor and film producer .
Godfried Schalcken or Gottfried Schalken ( 1643 -- November 16 , 1706 ) , was a Dutch genre and portrait painter .
Catharina Ulrika Hjort af Ornäs ( 6 January 1767 - 11 January 1837 ) was a Swedish noblewoman and the victim of a murder case which was famous in contemporary Sweden .
Edevaldo Grimaldi ( born 6 June 1984 ) is a former Italian professional footballer .
María Teresita de Jesús Reyes Aleuanlli ( born 4 February 1950 in Osorno ) , known as Teresita Reyes , is a Chilean actress .
Henry Churchill King ( 1858 - -1934 ) was an American Congregationalist theologian , educator , and author .
Eliel Williams Lazo Linares ( known as Eliel Lazo or Gods Hands ) ( born 1 November 1983 in Havana ) is a Cuban percussionist , songwriter , composer , producer , jazz , rock , Latin and pop musician living in Denmark .
Nandlal Nehru ( 1845 -- 1887 ) was the Diwan of Khetri in Rajasthan .
Damir Zlomislić ( born 20 July 1991 ) is a Bosnian Croat footballer who plays for Istra 1961 in the Croatian First Football League , on loan from Rijeka .
Lauro Aguirre ( 1855 -- January 9 , 1925 ) was an engineer and journalist who was active during events that foreshadowed the Mexican Revolution .
Henry Bard , 1st Viscount Bellomont ( 1616 -- June 20 , 1656 ) was an English Royalist .
Bernard Jones ( born 27 September 1924 ) was an English footballer who played in the Football League for Port Vale .
Amedeo Minghi ( born 12 August 1947 ) is an Italian singer - songwriter , composer and producer .
Tim Gilissen ( Dutch pronunciation : ( ˈtɪm ˈɣilɪsə(n ) ) ) ( born 4 June 1982 ) is a Dutch former footballer who played as a Midfielder .
John L. Pennington ( 1829 -- July 11 , 1900 ) was an American politician and newspaper publisher .
Tony deBrum ( born 1945 ) is a Marshallese politician and government minister .
Richard Hadley ( born 29 March 1983 ) is an Australian rules footballer who played in the Australian Football League ( AFL ) .
Karen Matheson OBE ( born 11 February 1963 ) is a Scottish folk singer , who frequently sings in Scottish Gaelic .
Samson Oni ( born 25 June 1981 ) is a Nigerian - English high jumper .
Moon Sang - yun ( Hangul : 문상윤 ; born 9 January 1991 ) is a South Korean footballer who plays as a Midfielder for Jeonbuk Hyundai in the K League Classic .
Dzyanis Karolik ( Belarusian : Дзяніс Каролік ; Russian : Денис Каролик ; born 7 May 1979 ) is a retired Belarusian professional football player .
Leandro Rocha dos Santos , commonly known as Leandro ( born 13 December 1987 in São Paulo city , São Paulo ) is a Brazilian football player at the position of striker .
Mohamed Nafa ( Arabic : محمد نفاع‎ , Hebrew : מוחמד נפאע‎ ; born 15 May 1939 ) is a Druze Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Hadash from 1990 until 1992 .
George William Nicol ( 1810 - 1884 ) was the first African Colonial Secretary of Sierra Leone and was one of few African senior level colonial officials in Freetown during the 19th century .
Abba Kompaneyets ( Абе or Аба Гирш-Лейбович Компанеец , 1870 - -1946 ) was a Yiddish theatre troupe manager and actor in Russia , Latvia and Poland .
Svatopluk Sládeček is a Czech architect ( born 29 December 1969 in Zlín ) , well known for his `` figurative architecture '' .
La Prohibida ( in Spanish , The Forbidden Woman ) , previously `` ' La Perdida ' '' ( The Lost Woman ) is the stage name of Amapola López ( born Luis Herrero Cortés , 1971 ) , a Spanish transgender pop and electronic music singer .
Hreiðar Már Sigurðsson ( born 19 November 1970 ) is an Icelandic business manager working in international finance , and from 2003 to 2008 , was the CEO of Kaupthing Bank .
Cornel Lichtenberg was a Hungarian aurist ; born in 1848 at Szeged ; studied at Budapest and Vienna ( M. D. 1873 ) .
Bessie Thomashefsky ( 1873 -- July 6 , 1962 ) was a Russian - born Jewish American singer , actress and comedian , a star in Yiddish theater beginning in the 1890s .
Carl Donnelly ( born 13 January 1982 in Tooting , London ) is an English stand - up comedian and writer .
Jacob Joseph ( Hebrew : יעקב יוסף‎ 1840 --July 28 , 1902 ) served as chief rabbi of New York City 's Association of American Orthodox Hebrew Congregations , a federation of Eastern European Jewish synagogues .
Dr Chia Thye Poh ( born 1941 ) is a Singaporean former political prisoner .
Nikolaos Thon ( Greek : Νικόλαος Θων ; 1850 - -1906 ) was a Greek courtier and businessman .
Dimitris Horn ( Greek : Δημήτρης Χορν ) ( 9 March 1921 -- 16 January 1995 ) was a Greek theatrical and film performer of modern times .
Justin Keeler ( born 17 April 1978 ) is an English footballer who played in The Football League for Bournemouth .
John P. Hart , born 1960 , currently serves a president and CEO of the Impact Center , a nonpartisan nonprofit working to educate citizens , train activists , and develop leaders .
Marie Prins ( born 1948 , married name Marie Jordaan ) is a South African botanist .
Sheetal Khadun ; ( born 20 June 1989 ) is a Mauritian Beauty Pageant winner and former Miss Mauritius 2013 .
Yōzan Dirk W. Mosig ( born 1943 ) is a psychologist , historian , literary critic and ordained Zen monk noted for his critical work on H. P. Lovecraft .
Prince Kwidama ( born 23 March 1985 ) is a Dutch Antillean sprinter .
Adriano Passuello ( born 3 November 1942 ) is a retired Italian professional road cyclist .
Louise Bates Ames ( 29 October 1908 -- 31 October 1996 ) was an American psychologist specializing in child development .
Major Marc Dauphin ( born 6 February 1953 ) is a retired Canadian military surgeon .
Beatriz Kimpa Vita ( 1684 - -1706 ) , was a Kongo Empire prophet and leader of her own Christian movement , Antonianism , this movement taught that Jesus and other early Christian figures were from the Kongo Empire .
John Schneeberger ( born 1961 ) is a Zambian - born former physician who drugged and raped one of his female patients and his stepdaughter while pursuing a medical career in Canada .
William Stanyhurst ( 1602 -- 1663 ) was a Belgian Jesuit of Irish parentage .
Borislav Hazurov ( Bulgarian : Борислав Хазуров ; born 4 October 1985 ) is a Bulgarian footballer , who currently plays for Bansko as a striker .
Edmund F. Burton ( 1862 -- October 25 , 1921 ) was an American physician who left medicine for the study of Christian Science .
Uffa Fox , CBE ( 15 January 1898 -- 26 October 1972 ) was an English boat designer and sailing enthusiast .
Jordan Russolillo ( born 3 April 1984 ) is an American former professional soccer player
W. Scott Bales ( born 1956 ) is the Chief Justice of the Arizona Supreme Court .
Arthur H. Clark ( born 1924 ) is an award - winning Australian sculptor from Bundaberg , in Queensland .
Herbert Lawrence Bridgman ( 1844 -- September 24 , 1924 ) was an American explorer and journalist described as the `` Ulysses of journalists '' for his work organizing the Robert Peary expedition to the North Pole .
Peter Kopteff ( born 10 April 1979 ) is a Finnish former footballer who played in the position of left winger .
Ola Bjørnstad ( born 12 November 1940 ) is a Norwegian forester and civil servant .
Aviad Meitar ( born 1959 ) is the Chairman of Quadrant European Beverages Limited , the Pepsi bottler for Bulgaria .
Cara Readle ( born 8 January 1991 ) is a Welsh actress , known mainly for her role as Layla in The Story of Tracy Beaker from series three to five .
Erling Naper ( born 24 June 1936 ) is a Norwegian banker and civil servant .
M. S. Sundari Bai ( 1923 - -2006 ) , often credited as Sundari Bai or Sundarabai , was an Indian film actress and dancer who worked mainly in Tamil cinema from the 1940s to the 1970s .
Lee Tze - Fan ( Chinese:李澤藩 , 5 June 1907 Hsinchu , Japanese Taiwan - 10 July 1989 ) was a Taiwanese painter and art teacher .
Christopher Kier ( born 1959 in Toronto ) is an encaustic painter who graduated from the Ontario College of Art in 1987 .
Samuel Ledgard ( 1874 - -1952 ) was a Leeds entrepreneur who became a major West Yorkshire Independent bus operator .
Robert Ssentongo ( born 5 June 1986 ) is an Ugandan international footballer who plays for Ethiopian club Saint George , as a striker .
Monika Grimm ( born 18 May 1940 , Schönfels bei Zwickau ) is a German pop singer and actress .
Julia Simic ( Croatian : Julija Šimić ; born 14 May 1989 ) is a professional women 's footballer for VfL Wolfsburg .
Graham Molloy ( born 26 June 1947 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played for Melbourne in the VFL during the 1970s .
Johanna Hargreaves ( born 18 June 1963 ) is a British television actress who has been active since 1980 , best known for playing `` Stella '' in the 1983 teenage drama Johnny Jarvis and `` Linda Jordan '' in the 1992 police drama Between the Lines .
Zinovy Reichstein ( born 1961 ) is a Russian - born American mathematician .

Sarah Eadon ( born 9 October 1991 ) is a footballer currently playing for Newcastle United Women 's FC .
Dewi Muria Agung ( born 16 December 1985 ) , better known by her stage name Dewi Persik ( also spelled Dewi Perssik ) and nicknamed Depe after her monogram , is an Indonesian dangdut singer .

Oru Painkilikatha is a 1984 Indian Malayalam film , directed by Balachandra Menon and produced by Varada Balachandra Menon .

The Taifa of Carmona was a medieval taifa kingdom that existed for two distinct periods ; first from 1013 to 1066 when it was conquered by the Taifa of Seville , and secondly from around 1143 to 1150 when it was finally conquered by the Almohads .
Shu or Shu Han ( 221 - -263 ) was one of the three major states that competed for supremacy over China in the Three Kingdoms period ( 220 - -280 ) .
Roggenburg Abbey ( Kloster Roggenburg or Reichsstift Roggenburg ) is a Premonstratensian canonry in Roggenburg near Neu - Ulm , Bavaria , in operation between 1126 and 1802 , and again from its re - foundation in 1986 .
The Kingdom of Córdoba ( Spanish : Reino de Córdoba ; English often : Kingdom of Cordova ) was a territorial jurisdiction of the Crown of Castile from the time it was won from Muslim rule in 1236 during the Reconquista until Javier de Burgos ' provincial division of Spain in 1833 .
The Bourbon Restoration was the period of French history following the fall of Napoleon in 1814 until the July Revolution of 1830 .
Wettenhausen Abbey ( German : Kloster Wettenhausen , Reichsabtei Wettenhausen ) was an Imperial Abbey of Augustinian Canons until its secularization in 1802 - 1803 .

The K'iche ' kingdom of Q'umarkaj was a state in the highlands of modern - day Guatemala which was founded by the K'iche ' ( Quiché ) Maya in the thirteenth century , and which expanded through the fifteenth century until it was conquered by Spanish and Nahua forces led by Pedro de Alvarado in 1524 .

R. Michael Roberts ( born 1940 ) is an American biologist and a Curators ' Professor of animal science at the University of Missouri .
James R. Whelan ( July 27 , 1933 -- December 1 , 2012 ) was a journalist and historian who served as the first editor in chief of The Washington Times , holding the position from 1982 to 1984 .

Merrill Swain is a professor emerita of second - language education at the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education , University of Toronto .
Sherman Kent ( December 6 , 1903 -- March 11 , 1986 ) , was a Yale University history professor who , during World War II and through 17 years of Cold War - era service in the Central Intelligence Agency , pioneered many of the methods of intelligence analysis .
Hannele Ruohola - Baker is a Professor of Biochemistry and Associate Director of the Institute for Stem Cell and Regenerative Medicine at the University of Washington in Seattle , Washington .
Yoshito Kishi ( born 13 April 1937 in Nagoya , Japan ) is the Morris Loeb Professor of Chemistry at Harvard University .
Saba Valadkhan ( Persian : صبا ولدخان‎ ) is an Iranian American biomedical scientist , and an Assistant Professor and RNA researcher at Case Western Reserve University .
Salil Shetty ( born 3 February 1961 ) is an Indian human rights activist who currently serves as Secretary General of the human rights organization Amnesty International ( 2010 - -present ) .
Elmer Ellis ( July 27 , 1901 -- August 27 , 1989 ) was an American educator and fourteenth president of the University of Missouri , from 1955 to 1966 , and first president of the University of Missouri System .
Kees Klop ( 18 December 1947 , The Hague -- 31 August 2007 , The Hague ) was a Dutch professor of political ethics at Radboud University Nijmegen .
Roger Harrabin ( born 28 March 1955 ) is the BBC 's Environment Analyst , and one of their senior journalists on the environment and energy .
Paul Robert Magocsi ( born January 26 , 1945 , Englewood , New Jersey , United States ) is an American professor of history , political science , and Chair of Ukrainian Studies at the University of Toronto .
Hortense Spillers ( born 1942 ) is an American literary critic , Black Feminist scholar and the Gertrude Conaway Vanderbilt Professor at Vanderbilt University .
Juliet Morrow is an American archaeologist and a professor of Anthropology at Arkansas State University in Jonesboro , Arkansas .
Lisa Wedeen is Professor of Political Science at the University of Chicago specializing in comparative politics , the Middle East , political theory , and feminist theory .
From September 2006 until 2007 , Joschka Fischer was a senior fellow at the Liechtenstein Institute on Self - Determination , and as a visiting professor co - taught with Wolfgang F. Danspeckgruber at Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs , both at Princeton University .
Tali Sharot is an associate professor of cognitive neuroscience in the department of Experimental Psychology at University College London .
Emil Kang ( born 1968 in New York ) serves as the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill 's first Executive Director for the Arts , a senior administrative post created to help unify and elevate the performing arts at the University .
Matthew Flatt is an American computer scientist , currently a professor of computer science at the University of Utah in Salt Lake City .
Michael A. Arbib ( born 28 May 1940 in England ) is the Fletcher Jones Professor of Computer Science , as well as a Professor of Biological Sciences , Biomedical Engineering , Electrical Engineering , Neuroscience and Psychology at the University of Southern California ( USC ) .
George Drew Coble ( born December 18 , 1947 ) is a former professional baseball umpire who worked in the American League from 1979 to 1999 .
Paul Mayhew - Archer ( born 6 January 1953 ) is a British writer , producer and script editor for the BBC .
Frank van Harmelen ( born 1960 ) is a Dutch Computer Scientist and Professor in Knowledge Representation & Reasoning in the AI department at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam .
Min Zhuo ( born 1964 ) is a pain neuroscientist at the University of Toronto in Canada .
Christiane Linster is a Luxembourg - born behavioral neuroscientist and a professor in the Department of Neurobiology and Behavior at Cornell University .
Tata Subba Rao ( born 1942 ) is emeritus professor of statistics in the School of Mathematics , University of Manchester .
David Gabai , a mathematician , is the Hughes - Rogers Professor of Mathematics at Princeton University .
Alfred Rehder ( 4 September 1863 , Waldenburg , Saxony -- 25 July 1949 ) was a horticulturist and taxonomist who worked at the Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University .
Ray Pawson is Professor of Social Research Methodology in the School of Sociology and Social Policy at the University of Leeds .
Quentin Cooper ( born 1961 , Grimsby ) is a science journalist and facilitator , best known as the presenter of BBC Radio 4 's Material World .
Éric Falt ( born 22 August 1962 in Lyon , France ) is a French senior official at the United Nations .
James Jesus Angleton ( December 9 , 1917 -- May 11 , 1987 ) was chief of the Central Intelligence Agency 's Counterintelligence Staff from 1954 to 1975 .
Warren P. McGuirk ( January 2 , 1906 -- February 19 , 1981 ) was the dean of the School of Physical Education and Director of Athletics at the University of Massachusetts Amherst ( UMass ) from 1948 to 1971 , and an active figure in New England sports .
Helen Rodd is a Canadian zoologist and Associate professor at the University of Toronto .
Professor Raymond Viskanta is W. F. M. Goss Professor of Engineering at Purdue University .
Vikram Lal ( born 1942 ) is an Indian businessman , the former CEO of Eicher Motors , Indian commercial vehicle manufacturer based in New Delhi , India .
Miriam G. Sherin is a professor in the School of Education and Social Policy and the Learning Sciences Department at Northwestern University .
Robert W. Young ( May 18 , 1912 -- February 20 , 2007 ) , professor emeritus of linguistics at the University of New Mexico , was an American linguist known for his work on the Navajo language .
Richard Sennett ( born 1 January 1943 ) is the Centennial Professor of Sociology at the London School of Economics and University Professor of the Humanities at New York University .
Since 2005 Sophie Calle has taught as a professor of film and photography at European Graduate School in Saas - Fee , Switzerland .
Hans Wilhelm Schüßler ( February 28 , 1928 -- December 9 , 2007 ) was a German telecommunications engineer , professor at the University of Erlangen - Nuremberg , an IEEE Fellow and a pioneer in communications systems and digital signal processing .
Jack G. Downing was Deputy Director for Operations ( DDO ) for the Central Intelligence Agency from 1997 until July , 1999 .
Brady J. Deaton , ( born August 25 , 1942 ) is an American educator and was the Chancellor of the University of Missouri in Columbia , Missouri .
Norman Fairclough ( /ˈnɔːrmən ˈfɛərklʌf/ ; born 1941 ) is emeritus Professor of Linguistics at Lancaster University .
Jayanta Kumar Ghosh or Jaẏanta Kumāra Ghosha ( Bengali : জয়ন্ত কুমার ঘোষ , born May 23 , 1937 ) is an Indian statistician , currently emeritus professor at Indian Statistical Institute and a professor of statistics at Purdue University .
Oscar Shumsky , The Strad , April 1985 He taught at the Curtis Institute , Philadelphia , Peabody Conservatory , Baltimore , Yale University , and , from 1953 , the Juilliard School in New York .
Jeffrey Beall is a librarian and associate professor at Auraria Library at the University of Colorado , Denver .
Thomas Pavel ( born Toma Pavel , April 4 , 1941 in Bucharest , Romania ) is a literary theorist , critic , and novelist currently teaching at the University of Chicago .
Frank Dascoli ( December 26 , 1915 -- August 11 , 1990 ) was a professional baseball umpire who worked in the National League from 1948 to 1961 .
Ricardo Hausmann ( born 1956 ) is the current Director of the Center for International Development and a Professor of the Practice of Economic Development at the John F. Kennedy School of Government at Harvard University .
Morris Berthold Abram ( June 19 , 1918 -- March 15 , 2000 ) was an American lawyer , civil rights activist , and president of Brandeis University .
Deborah Paredez ( born December 19 , 1970 ) is an American poet , scholar , and Associate Professor of English at the University of Texas at Austin .
Hellmut Diwald ( 13 August 1924 -- 26 May 1993 ) was a German historian and Professor of Medieval and Modern History at the University of Erlangen - Nuremberg from 1965 to 1985 .
Karl Eugen Guthe ( 5 March 1866 - 10 September 1915 ) was a German - born American academic and physicist , notable for his work on aspects of electricity and for being the first Dean of the Graduate Department at the University of Michigan .
The workpapers of John Elof Boodin are maintained at the University of California Los Angeles Library Special Collections .
Erika Cremer ( 20 May 1900 in Munich , Germany -- 21 September 1996 in Innsbruck , which is today in Austria ) was a German physical chemist and Professor Emeritus at the University of Innsbruck who is regarded as the most important pioneer in gas chromatography , as she first conceived the technique in 1944 .
At the Technical University of Berlin , where Volmer worked for so many years , the Max Volmer Laboratory for Biophysical Chemistry was named in his honor .
George T. Flom Library at the University of Illinois at Urbana - Champaign contains the former personal library of Dr. Flom .
Zalman Usiskin is an educator best known as the Director of the University of Chicago School Mathematics Project .
Dr. Nafis Sadik ( born 1929 ) , currently Special Adviser to the UN Secretary General with additional responsibilities as Special Envoy for HIV / AIDS in Asia , and former head of the United Nations Population Fund ( UNFPA ) .
Aaron Dollar is an assistant professor of mechanical engineering at Yale University , where he conducts research on techniques to make a flexible robotic hand .
Zack Exley ( born December 5 , 1969 ) is a political and technology consultant , previously employed as the Chief Revenue Officer ( formerly Chief Community Officer ) at the Wikimedia Foundation .
Geert Mak studied constitutional law and the sociology of law at the Free University ( Vrije Universiteit ) and the University of Amsterdam ( Universiteit van Amsterdam ) .
Donhee Ham ( Hangul : 함돈희 ; Hanja : 咸燉憙 ; born January 8 , 1974 ) is a Gordon McKay Professor of Applied Physics and Electrical Engineering at Harvard University .
Mark Church is a commentator for BBC London 94.9 , reporting on all Surrey County Cricket Club 's matches .
Rudolf Löb ( November 21 , 1877 -- January 30 , 1966 ) was a German banker with Mendelssohn & Co. and consultant to the German and Russian governments .
Edna Greene Medford is a professor of history at Howard University , who specializes in 19th - century African - American history .
In 1956 , by taking first place in an examination given by the British Consulate in Istanbul , Orhan Boran found himself in London , where he worked for the Turkish service of the BBC .
Shelby D. Hunt ( born 1939 ) is an American organizational theorist , The Jerry S. Rawls and P. W. Horn Professor of Marketing at the Texas Tech University , and highly cited marketing researcher .
In 1960 , Stuart Hampshire was elected a member of the British Academy and became Grote Professor of the Philosophy of Mind and Logic at University College London , succeeding A. J. Ayer .
Bradley D. Harris ( born 1956 ) is a professor of recreational management with special assignments connected to the Nonprofit Management Minor at Brigham Young University ( BYU ) who previously worked for 22 years as a professional scouter .
Lincoln LaPaz ( February 12 , 1897 -- October 19 , 1985 ) was an American astronomer from the University of New Mexico and a pioneer in the study of meteors .
Igor Rodnianski ( born April 28 , 1972 , Ukrainian SSR , Soviet Union ) is an American mathematician at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology .
Professor Dame Jill Macleod Clark , DBE , RGN , FRCN ( born 11 June 1944 ) was formally Deputy Dean of the Faculty of Medicine , Health & Biological Sciences and Head of the School of Nursing & Midwifery , University of Southampton .
Dudley Brian Spalding , FRS FREng ( born 9 January 1923 ) was Professor of Heat Transfer and Head of the Computational Fluid Dynamics Unit at Imperial College , London .
Carlos Guerrero de Lizardi is a Mexican professor and researcher in economics with the Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher Education , currently the director of the masters program in economics and public policy at the Mexico City campus .
Hjalmar Heiberg ( 25 September 1837 -- 25 September 1897 ) was a Norwegian physician , and a professor of anatomy at the University of Oslo .
David Darts is an artist and Chair of the Department of Art and Art Professions at New York University .
Jan Pieter Krahnen ( born 31 August 1954 ) is Professor for corporate finance at the Goethe - University Frankfurt and director of the Center for Financial Studies and the Research Center SAFE .
Peter Trawny ( born December 17 , 1964 in Gelsenkirchen ) is a German philosopher and professor at the University of Wuppertal .
Roger Birnbaum ( born c. 1950 ) is an American film producer who owns the company Spyglass Entertainment and was co - CEO and co - Chairman of Metro - Goldwyn - Mayer .
George A. Rothrock ( 1932 -- 1993 ) was a professor of European history at the University of Alberta .
Arnold Buffum Chace ( November 10 , 1845 -- February 28 , 1932 ) was a textile businessman , mathematics scholar , and eleventh chancellor of Brown University in Providence , Rhode Island .
Silviu Berejan ( July 30 , 1927 in Bălăbăneşti -- November 10 , 2007 ) was a Bessarabian writer from Moldova and member of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova .
Marek Chrobak is a full professor at University of California , Riverside .
Steve Orlen ( 1942 -- November 16 , 2010 ) was an American poet and professor at the University of Arizona .
Kogila Moodley is a published academic and sociologist at the University of British Columbia , where she was the first holder of the David Lam Chair of Multicultural Studies .
Vadim Komkov ( 1919 - -2008 ) was born in Moscow , in Russia , and obtained a Ph.D. from the University of Utah in 1965 .
George C. Edwards III is University Distinguished Professor of Political Science and Jordan Chair in Presidential Studies at Texas A&M University and Distinguished Fellow at the Rothermere American Institute at the University of Oxford .
John Seiler Brubacher ( 1898 - -1988 ) was a professor at Yale University and author of many books on the subject of educational philosophy .
Simon Munzu ( born 1949 ) is the United Nations Secretary - General 's Deputy Special Representative for Côte d'Ivoire .
Robert Cover ( July 30 , 1943 -- July 1986 ) was a law professor , scholar , and activist , teaching at Yale Law School from 1972 until his untimely death at age 42 in 1986 .
Thomas Twetten ( born 1935 ) was a Central Intelligence Agency case officer .
Norman N. Holland ( born 1927 , New York City ) is an American literary critic and Marston - Milbauer Eminent Scholar Emeritus at the University of Florida .
René Emilio Ponce ( 1947 -- May 2 , 2011 ) was a senior military officer in the Salvadoran Army during the nation 's civil war , and minister of defense from 1990 to 1993 .
Theodore M. Brown is a professor of public health and policy , medical humanities and history at the University of Rochester .
Eva L. Baker is a Distinguished Professor at the University of California , Los Angeles , the former acting dean of the Graduate School of Education & Information Studies and current Director of the National Center for Research on Evaluation , Standards , and Student Testing ( CRESST ) .
Nathalie Chung ( born in 1962 in Toronto , Ontario ) is a Canadian news anchor and journalist for the Réseau de l'information ( RDI ) television network , a Canadian French language news channel owned by the Société Radio - Canada .
David Poeppel is Professor of Psychology and Neural Science at New York University ( NYU ) , a researcher who employs behavioral and cognitive neuroscience approaches to study the brain basis of auditory processing , speech perception and language comprehension .
Margaret Vogt ( May 26 , 1950 -- September 23 , 2014 ) , a native of Nigeria , served as Special Representative and Head of the United Nations Integrated Peacebuilding Office in the Central African Republic ( BINUCA ) until mid-2013 .
Helen Dodson Prince ( 1905 - -2002 ) was an astronomer who pioneered work in solar flares at the University of Michigan .
Kenneth E. Train ( born November 14 , 1951 ) is an Adjunct Professor of Economics at the University of California , Berkeley , USA .
Graeme Nicholson is a Canadian philosopher and Emeritus Professor of philosophy at the University of Toronto known for his research on ontology , hermeneutics , and anarchism .
Jason W. Fleischer is an American electrical engineer , an associate professor of electrical engineering at Princeton University .
Oswald Bayer ( German : ( ˈbaɪɐ ) ; born September 30 , 1939 ) is a German Lutheran theologian , and is Professor Emeritus of Systematic Theology at the Evangelical Theological Faculty of the Eberhard Karls University of Tübingen , Germany .
Matthew Zook ( born in Lancaster , Pennsylvania ) is an American geographer and professor in the Department of Geography , University of Kentucky .
Patricia Sawin is an Associate Professor at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill .
Mohammad Shaheen ( Arabic : محمد شاهين‎ ) has been a professor of English literature at the University of Jordan in Amman , Jordan since 1985 .
From 1982 until 1984 , Heaney was an artist - in - residence at the University of Washington in Seattle , and previously had taught at Wesleyan University in Middletown , Conn. The Joe Heaney Collection of the University of Washington Ethnomusicology Archives was established after Heaney 's death in 1984 .
Brian Weatherson is the Marshall Weinberg Professor of Philosophy at The University of Michigan .
Leonard B. Kaban , D.M.D. , M.D. , F.A.C.S. is the Walter C. Guralnick Professor and Chair of the Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery at the Massachusetts General Hospital / Harvard University .
Michael A. Barry ( born 1948 , in New York ) is a Princeton University professor and historian of the greater Middle East and Islamic world .
Barney Hall ( June 24 , 1932 -- January 26 , 2016 ) was an American sports commentator for Motor Racing Network , formerly calling NASCAR races .
Gebisa Ejeta ( born 1950 ) is an Ethiopian American plant breeder , geneticist and Professor at Purdue University .
Bernward Joerges ( born 1 September 1937 ) is a professor of sociology at Technical University of Berlin and director of the Metropolitan Research Group , Berlin .

Professor Ajith Kumar Siriwardena MBChB , M.D. , FRCS , Is the current professor of hepato - pancreatico - biliary surgery at the University of Manchester , and a consultant hepatobiliary surgeon at the Manchester Royal Infirmary .
Brad Troemel received a BA in Visual Critical Studies from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago , and an MFA from New York University NYU Steinhardt .
The Reverend Ira Condict ( February 21 , 1764 -- June 1 , 1811 ) was an American Presbyterian and Dutch Reformed minister who served as the third president of Queen 's College ( now Rutgers University ) in New Brunswick , New Jersey .

Robert Muller ( March 11 , 1923 -- September 20 , 2010 ) was an international civil servant with the United Nations .
Jes Bertelsen studied History of Ideas ( `` Idehistorie '' ) at Aarhus University , Denmark with founder of this interdisciplinary study , Danish philosopher Professor Johannes Sløk .
Władysław Czapliński ( 3 October 1905 in Tuchów -- 17 August 1981 in Wrocław ) was a Polish historian , a professor of the University of Wrocław , author of many popular books about Polish history .
Stephen Semmes is Noah Harding Professor of Mathematics at Rice University .
Hans Reiss Ph.D. ( born 19 August 1922 in Mannheim , Germany ) is Professor Emeritus of German at the University of Bristol .

Peter D. Eimas ( 1934 -- October 28 , 2005 ) was an expert in psychology and cognitive sciences and a professor at Brown University .

Andrew Szanton honed his approach to memoir writing for a number of years as an instructor at the Extension School of Harvard University .
Steven A. Moore is the Bartlett Cocke Regents Professor in Architecture at the University of Texas at Austin School of Architecture .
Edward Champlin is a Professor of Classics , Cotsen Professor of Humanities , and former Master of Butler College at Princeton University .
Jean - Sélim Kanaan ( July 28 , 1970 - August 19 , 2003 ) was a United Nations ( UN ) diplomat , Egyptian , Italian and French national , who was killed in the Canal Hotel bombing in Baghdad , Iraq , along with Sérgio Vieira de Mello and other members of his staff .
Katie Trumpener is the Emily Sanford Professor of Comparative Literature and English at Yale University .

Catherine Dauvergne took up the Deanship of the Peter A. Allard School of Law at the University of British Columbia in July , 2015 .
John Sharpless is a member of the faculty of the University of Wisconsin - Madison and a former political candidate .
Paul Starr ( May 12 , 1949 ) is a Pulitzer Prize - winning professor of sociology and public affairs at Princeton University .
John T. Schuessler is an American businessman , the former chairman , CEO and president of the fast food chain Wendy 's International , Inc. He started with the company in 1976 and retired in 2006 .
Augustus Thorndike ( 1896 - -1986 ) , was the chief of surgery at Harvard University from 1931 to 1962 and a pioneer in sports medicine .

Carrozza was a dark - coated bay or brown filly bred by the British national Stud and leased for racing purposes to the British monarch , Elizabeth II . The filly was sired by Dante the winner of the 1945 Epsom Derby out of the mare Calash , a daughter of Hyperion .

The Institut Montaigne is a French think tank founded by Claude Bébéar in 2000 , with the aim to promote both competitiveness and social cohesion and to help shape public policy to improve both economic and social environments in France .
The Academy of Fine Arts Vienna was founded in 1692 as a private academy modelled on the Accademia di San Luca and the Parisien Académie de peinture et de sculpture by the court - painter Peter Strudel , who became the Praefectus Academiae Nostrae .
2.13.61 , Inc. is a publisher and record company founded by musician Henry Rollins and named after his date of birth ( February 13 , 1961 ) .
Founded in 1960 by two Australians , driver Jack Brabham and designer Ron Tauranac , the team won four Drivers ' and two Constructors ' World Championships in its 30-year Formula One history .
Plan B Entertainment Inc. , more commonly known as Plan B , is an American file production company founded in November 2001 by Brad Pitt , Brad Grey , and Jennifer Aniston .
House of Anansi Press is a Canadian publishing company , founded in 1967 by writers Dennis Lee and Dave Godfrey .
The Aerial Experiment Association ( AEA ) was a Canadian - American aeronautical research group formed on 30 September 1907 , under the leadership of Dr. Alexander Graham Bell .
Aller Media was founded in Copenhagen in 1873 by Carl Aller and his wife Laura Aller .
Vitebsk Museum of Modern Art ( Russian : Витебский Музей Современного Искусства ) was an art museum in Vitebsk , Belarus organized in 1918 by Marc Chagall , Kazimir Malevich and Alexander Romm .

In 2003 , Mathis Wackernagel , PhD , and Susan Burns founded Global Footprint Network , an international think - tank headquartered in Oakland , California , with offices in Geneva and Brussels .
Polaris Partners was founded in 1995/1996 by Jon Flint , Terry McGuire , Steve Arnold , who were partners of Burr , Egan , Deleage & Co. ( BEDCO ) .
Decca Records began as a British record label established in 1929 by Edward Lewis .
The Bromsgrove Guild of Applied Arts ( 1898 - -1966 ) was a company of modern artists and designers associated with the Arts and Crafts Movement , founded by Walter Gilbert .
Fuzzy Door Productions or The Spotted Door is the production company of television producer Seth MacFarlane .
Huntley & Palmers was founded in 1822 by Joseph Huntley as J. Huntley & Son .
The Stanford Financial Group was a privately held international group of financial services companies controlled by Allen Stanford , until it was seized by United States ( U.S. ) authorities in early 2009 .
The We Are Family Foundation ( WAFF ) is an American 501(c)(3 ) nonprofit organization founded in 2001 by musician Nile Rodgers in the wake of the September 11 , 2001 attacks .

JXTA ( Juxtapose ) is an open source peer - to - peer protocol specification begun by Sun Microsystems in 2001 .
Filmation 's founders and principal producers were Lou Scheimer , Hal Sutherland and Norm Prescott .
Holiday Magic was a multi - level marketing organization , founded in 1964 , by William Penn Patrick ( 1930 - -1973 ) in the United States .
Front Sight Firearms Training Institute , also known as Front Sight and as Front Sight Resorts was founded in 1996 by Ignatius Piazza .
Huawei was founded in 1987 by Ren Zhengfei , a former engineer in the People 's Liberation Army .

Ocean Healing Group ( OHG ) was founded in 2007 by Frank Bauer and paralyzed professional surfer Christiaan Bailey .
The Berrics is a privately owned , indoor skatepark owned by professional skateboarders Steve Berra and Eric Koston .
Established in 1957 by editor - director Gerry Anderson and cinematographer Arthur Provis , following the liquidation of their employer Polytechnic Films , AP Films ( `` Anderson Provis '' ) was set up .
The Yes Men are a culture jamming activist duo and network of supporters created by Jacques Servin and Igor Vamos .
The Standard Steel Casting Company , commonly referred to as Thurlow Works , was a steel production and steel casting facility founded in Chester , Pennsylvania in 1883 by shipbuilder John Roach .
Founded in 2007 , Josh Levy and Ross Cohen launched BeenVerified in 2009 and began advertising on national television .
Ice Age Entertainment is a record label created and owned by southern rapper Mike Jones and business partner Ray `` Mello '' Moore .
Mandalay Entertainment Group is an American entertainment company founded in 1995 by Peter Guber , with interests in motion pictures , television , sports entertainment and new media .
Experimenter Publishing was an American media company founded by Hugo Gernsback in 1915 .

Alberto - Culver was purchased and reorganized in 1955 by Leonard H. Lavin who was an entrepreneur and manufacturer 's representative for various other companies .
The Barakzai dynasty was established by Dost Mohammad Khan after the Durrani dynasty of Ahmad Shah Durrani was removed from power .
Les XX was a group of twenty Belgian painters , designers and sculptors , formed in 1883 by the Brussels lawyer , publisher , and entrepreneur Octave Maus .

The Southern Historical Society was a public organization founded by Confederate Major General Dabney H. Maury in 1868 - 1869 .
Filmways , Inc. ( also known as Filmways Pictures and Filmways Television ) was a television and film production company founded by both American film executive Martin Ransohoff and Edwin Kasper in 1952 .

The Center for Law and Social Policy ( CLASP ) is an American organization , based Washington , D.C. , that advocates for policies aimed at improving the lives of low - income people .

Hay Automobiltechnik based in Bockenau , Germany , is an automotive corporation from Germany which is the largest European producer of flywheels , hot rolled seamless rings and final drive gears and crown wheels for differential gears .

Dave Smith Motors is a car dealership in Kellogg , Idaho , that attracts customers from all over the country .
