Bright Shining City Productions is an independent film and media production company established in Austin , Texas by Polish - American film director and producer Mariusz Kotowski in 2005 .
W.S. Darley & Co. is a designer , manufacturer and distributor of firefighting , defense and emergency services equipment , based in Itasca , Illinois , USA .
Bacardi Limited is headquartered in Hamilton , Bermuda , and has a 16-member board of directors led by the original founder 's great - great grandson , Facundo L. Bacardí .
The MIT Press is a university press affiliated with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology ( MIT ) in Cambridge , Massachusetts ( United States ) .
Gericom was an Austrian computer equipment manufacturer , based in Linz , Upper Austria .
Harris + Hoole is a British coffeehouse company headquartered in London .
The holding company KHD Humboldt Wedag International AG , based in Cologne , Germany employs more than 750 employees worldwide , including customer service centers in the Americas , India , Russia , and the Asia - Pacific region .
Dreyer 's Grand Ice Cream Holdings , Inc. , a subsidiary of Nestlé , is a United States - based producer of ice cream and frozen yogurt founded in 1928 as Edy 's Grand Ice Cream in Oakland , California by Joseph Edy and William Dreyer .
Central University of Technology , Free State or Central University of Technology is a University of Technology in Bloemfontein in the Free State province of South Africa .
In 1850 , Buffet Crampon established its headquarters at Mantes - la - Ville .
Sunsuper is a public offer super fund company based in Brisbane , Queensland , Australia .
McRae 's was a mid - range regional department store chain founded and based in Jackson , Mississippi , with locations in Mississippi , Alabama , Louisiana , and Florida .
Leisure Learning Unlimited , Inc. , is a privately owned continuing - education firm in Houston , Texas .
CityZen was a formal dining restaurant located in the Mandarin Oriental Washington hotel in Washington , D.C. , in the United States .
Jacob & Josef Kohn , also known as J. & J. Kohn , was an Austrian furniture maker and interior designer in Vienna .
Founded in 1898 , it consists today of several cooperatives of independent supermarkets all operating under the umbrella organisation Edeka Zentrale AG & Co KG , with headquarters in Hamburg .
Samarco is hosted in Belo Horizonte , the capital of Minas Gerais .
The Media - Saturn - Holding GmbH ( MSH ) is a german holding and the Number One consumer electronics retailer in Europe with its Headquarter in Ingolstadt , Germany .
GE Lighting is a division of General Electric headquartered in Nela Park , East Cleveland , Ohio , United States , employing 17,000 people and tracing its origins to Thomas Edison 's work on lighting .
Euronext NV is a European stock exchange seated in Amsterdam , Brussels , London , Lisbon and Paris .
Böttcher America is headquartered in Belcamp , Maryland United States and employs over 200 employees .
TrønderEnergi is a power company based in the municipality Trondheim , Norway that operates hydroelectric power plants and wind farms , as well as the power grid in parts of the county Sør - Trøndelag .
CN Marine was a Canadian ferry company headquartered in Moncton , New Brunswick .
Kashmir Crown Bakeries ( KCB ) is a food making business based in Bradford .
Xaar plc is a company supplying industrial inkjet printheads and is based in Cambridge .
The Melbourne Steam Traction Engine Club was established in Melbourne over 45 years ago and is located at 1200 Ferntree Gully Rd Scoresby , Victoria , Australia .
Berns Salonger is a restaurant and entertainment venue , in Berzelii Park , in central Stockholm , Sweden .
The Hotel2Tango ( sometimes referred to as Thee Mighty Hotel2Tango and abbreviated H2 T ) is a 24-track analogue recording studio situated in the Mile End district of Montreal , Quebec .
Rupayatan is a residency school at Bhavnath , Junagadh in Gujarat , India .
Future Shorts is a short film label based in London .
21st Amendment Brewery is a restaurant and brewery located in the South Park neighborhood of San Francisco , California , two blocks from AT&T Park .
Aarni was founded in 1998 , in Finland , by Master Warjomaa ( occasionally known as Mahatma M. Warjomaa ) .
Frederieke Saeijs is playing on a Pietro Guarneri violin ( Venice , 1725 ) , Ex - Reine Elisabeth , kindly lent to her by the Dutch National Music Instrument Foundation .
Jan Beyzym ( 15 May 1850 , Volhynia -- 2 October 1912 , Madagascar ) was a Polish Jesuit priest who was beatified on 18 August 2002 by Pope John Paul II .
Edward Blishen ( 29 April 1920 -- 13 December 1996 ) was an English author and broadcaster .
Robert Riviere ( 30 June 1808 , London -- 12 April 1882 , London ) was an English bookbinder of Huguenot descent .
Meng Jiao ( Chinese : 孟郊 ; Wade -- Giles : Meng Chiao ; 751 - -814 ) was a poet of the Tang Dynasty , in China .
Thomas Hood ( 23 May 1799 -- 3 May 1845 ) was an English poet , author and humourist , best known for poems such as `` The Bridge of Sighs '' and `` The Song of the Shirt '' .
Romain Mesnil ( born 13 June 1977 in Le Plessis - Bouchard ) is a retired , French pole vaulter .
Giancarlo Sbragia ( 14 March 1926 -- 28 June 1994 ) is an Italian actor , voice actor , stage director and playwright .
Horst Tappert ( 26 May 1923 − 13 December 2008 ) was a German movie and television actor who played Inspector Stephan Derrick in the television drama Derrick .
Maria Pawlikowska - Jasnorzewska , née Kossak ( 24 November 1891 -- 9 July 1945 ) , was a Polish poet known as the Polish Sappho and `` queen of lyrical poetry '' of Poland 's interwar period .
Charles de Grimaldi - Régusse ( 1612 - 1687 ) was a French aristocrat , landowner and politician .
Muhammad Husayn Tabataba'i or Seyed Mohammad Hossein Tabataba'i ( Persian : علامه سید محمد حسین طباطبائی‎‎ , 16 March 1903 -- 7 November 1981 ) was one of the most prominent thinkers of philosophy and contemporary Shia Islam .
Jules Basdevant ( April 15 , 1877 -- March 17 , 1968 in Anost ) was a French law professor .
Rosellen Brown ( born May 12 , 1939 ) is an American author , and has been an instructor of English and creative writing at several universities , including the School of the Art Institute of Chicago and the University of Houston .
Richard Neville Aldworth Neville ( 1717 - -1793 ) , until 1762 Richard Neville Aldworth , was an English politician and diplomat .
Thomas Haynes Bayly ( 13 October 1797 -- 22 April 1839 ) was an English poet , songwriter , dramatist , and miscellaneous writer .
Antoni Lange ( 1863 -- 17 March 1929 ) was a Polish poet , philosopher , polyglot ( 15 languages ) , writer , novelist , science - writer , reporter and translator .
Charles Jean Jacques Joseph Ardant du Picq ( 19 October 1821 -- 18 August 1870 ) was a French Army officer and military theorist of the mid - nineteenth century whose writings , as they were later interpreted by other theorists , had a great effect on French military theory and doctrine .
Auguste - Louis Bertin d'Antilly ( 1763 - -1804 ) was a French dramatist and journalist whose patriotic songs and topical libretti were prominent during the French Revolution , but who emigrated from France under Napoleon .
Mariano Artigas ( 1938 - -2006 ) was a Spanish physicist , philosopher , and theologian .
Rony Brauman , born June 19 , 1950 , in Jerusalem , is a French physician specializing in tropical diseases .
Luis Galiana y Cervera ( 8 June 1740 -- 1771 ) was a Spanish Dominican theologian , philologist and writer .
Carl August Friedrich Mahn ( September 9 , 1802 -- January 27 , 1887 ) was a German philologist and language teacher and researcher .
Susy Delgado ( born 20 December 1949 ) is a Paraguayan poet in Spanish and Guarani .
José Sanchis Sinisterra ( born June 28 , 1940 ) is a Spanish playwright and theatre director .
Aurel Rău ( born 7 November 1930 in Bistriţa - Năsăud County ) is a Romanian poet , novelist , translator and essayist .
Alfred Schnittke ( Russian : Альфре́д Га́рриевич Шни́тке , Alfred Garrievič Šnitke ; November 24 , 1934 -- August 3 , 1998 ) was a Soviet and Russian composer .
Carlo Cassola ( 17 March 1917 -- 29 January 1987 ) was an influential Italian novelist and essayist .
Amico Aspertini ( c. 1474 -- 1552 ) , also called Amerigo Aspertini , is an Italian Renaissance painter whose complex , eccentric , and eclectic style anticipates Mannerism .
Avram Iancu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( aˈvram ˈjaŋku ) ; 1824 -- September 10 , 1872 ) was a Transylvanian Romanian lawyer who played an important role in the local chapter of the Austrian Empire Revolutions of 1848 - -1849 .
Luis García Berlanga Martí ( born 12 June 1921 in Valencia , Spain ; died 13 November 2010 ) was a Spanish film director and screenwriter .
Jean - Joseph Gaume ( 5 May 1802 -- 19 November 1879 ) was a French Roman Catholic theologian and author .
Robert J. H. Morrison ( born January 6 1961 ) is a Canadian author , editor , academic , and professor of English at Queen 's University , Kingston , Ontario .
Vahan Terian ( Armenian : Վահան Տերյան ; January 28 , 1885 -- January 7 , 1920 ) was an Armenian poet , lyrist and public activist .
Abbas Zakour ( Arabic : عباس زكور‎ ; Hebrew : עבאס זכור‎ , born 30 December 1965 ) is an Israeli Arab politician and a former member of the Knesset for the United Arab List .
Shanthi Williams is an Indian actress who has played supporting roles in Tamil and Malayalam movies and serials .
Klaus Wiegand ( born 16 August 1941 ) was a Major general in the East German People 's Army .
Yuri Rost ( Russian : Юрий Рост , born February 1 , 1939 in Kiev , Ukraine ) is a photographer , journalist , author and traveller .
Emanuel Swedenborg ( /ˈswiːdənˌbɔːrɡ/ ; Swedish pronunciation ; born Emanuel Swedberg on 29 January 1688 ; died 29 March 1772 ) was a Swedish scientist , philosopher , theologian , revelator , and mystic .
Luise Mühlbach was the pen name of Clara Mundt ( 1814 Neubrandenburg -- 1873 ) , a German writer best known for her works of historical fiction which enjoyed a wide popularity that was short - lived .
Michel Tapié ( Michel Tapié de Céleyran , 26 February 1909 -- 30 July 1987 ) was an internationally active French critic , curator , and collector of art . He was an early and influential theorist and practitioner of `` tachisme '' , which is generally regarded as the European equivalent of abstract expressionism .
Louis Lachenal ( 17 July 1921 -- 25 November 1955 ) , a French climber born in Annecy , Haute - Savoie , was one of the first two mountaineers to climb a summit of more than 8,000 meters .
Anatole Jakovsky ( 13 August 1909 -- 24 September 1988 ) was a French art critic who wrote substantially , collected widely , and established a museum in Nice for Naïve art , Musée international d'Art naïf Anatole Jakovsky .
Lord William Powlett ( baptized 18 August 1666 - - 25 September 1729 ) was an English MP .
Alexandre Vuillemin ( 1812 - 1880 ) was a prominent 19th century French cartographer and editor based in Paris .
Shiva Kumar Rai ( Nepali : शिव कुमार राई ) is a Nepali writer and politician from Darjeeling , India .
Manuel Sánchez Arcas ( 1897 - -1970 ) was a Spanish Modernist architect .
Michael Palme ( born 1943 in Prague - died February 10 , 2010 in Wiesbaden ) was a German journalist with particular interest in sports .
Louis René Étienne Tulasne , a.k.a . Edmond Tulasne ( September 12 , 1815 - December 22 , 1885 ) was a French botanist and mycologist born in Azay - le - Rideau .
Pilar Rubio Fernández ( born March 17 , 1978 ) is a Spanish reporter and TV presenter .
Shaun Whiteside ( born 1959 ) is a Northern Irish translator of French , Dutch , German , and Italian literature .
Antoine Dauvergne ( 3 October 1713 -- 11 February 1797 ) was a French composer and violinist .
Christiane Wilhelmine Sophie von Kühn ( March 17 , 1782 -- March 19 , 1797 ) was the love interest and eventual fiancée of the German Romantic poet and philosopher Friedrich von Hardenberg , known to many simply as Novalis .
Sitor Situmorang ( October 2 , 1923 -- December 21 , 2014 ) was an Indonesian poet , essayist and writer of short stories .
Peter Nansen ( 20 January 1861 - 31 July 1918 ) was a Danish novelist , journalist , and publisher .
Rama Vij ( Hindi : रमा विज , Punjabi : ਰਮਾ ਵਿਜ ) is an Indian film actress who works in Hindi and Punjabi movies and TV serials .
Vincent Delerm ( born 31 August 1976 ) is a French singer - songwriter , pianist and composer .
Jules - Claude Ziegler ( 1804 - 1856 ) was a French painter , ceramicist and photographer of the French school .
Duiliu Zamfirescu ( 30 October 1858 -- 3 June 1922 ) was a Romanian novelist , poet , short story writer , lawyer , nationalist politician , journalist , diplomat and memoirist .
Renaud Barbaras ( born in 1955 ) is a French contemporary philosopher .
Vida Ognjenović ( Serbian : Вида Огњеновић , pronounced ( ʋǐːda oɡɲěːnoʋitɕ ) ; born August 14 , 1941 in Dubočke village , Nikšić municipality ) is a famous Serbian theater director , playwright , writer , drama professor and diplomat .
Ana Alcaide ( born 1976 , Madrid , Spain ) is a Spanish performer , composer and music producer who carries out research on ancient traditions and cultures .
Francesco Ottavio Magnocavalli , also spelled Magnocavallo ( 1707 - -1789 ) was an Italian architect and writer .
Marie Losier ( born in France ) is a French filmmaker and curator who 's worked in New York City for 20 years .
André Almuró ( 1927 - -2009 ) was a French radio producer , composer and film director .
Yu Chi - hwan ( 1908 - -1967 ) , also known by his pen name Cheongma , was a leading twentieth - century Korean poet .
Manuel González - Hontoria y Fernández - Ladreda ( 31 January 1878 -- 26 October 1954 ) was a Spanish politician and diplomat who served two times as Minister of Estate during the reign of Alfonso XIII .
Aaron ben Joseph ha - Levi was a Spanish Talmudist and critic ; a direct descendant of Zerahiah Ha - Levi , and probably , like him , a native of Girona , Spain ; flourished at the end of the thirteenth century ; died before 1303 .
Alain Guy ( August 11 , 1918 -- November 7 , 1998 ) was a French philologist and hispanist .
Charles Antoine Coysevox ( 29 September 1640 -- 10 October 1720 ) , French sculptor , was born at Lyon , and belonged to a family which had emigrated from Franche - Comté , a Spanish possession at the time .
Lorenz Oken ( 1 August 1779 -- 11 August 1851 ) was a German naturalist , botanist , biologist , and ornithologist .
Roger Lockyer ( born 1928 ) is an English historian , professor , and writer .
Dame Margaret Drabble , Lady Holroyd DBE FRSL ( born 5 June 1939 ) , is an English novelist , biographer and critic .
Filippo Salvatore Gilii ( Spanish : Felipe Salvator Gilij ) ( 1721 - -1789 ) was an Italian Jesuit priest who lived in the Province of Venezuela ( in present day central Venezuela ) on the Orinoco River .
Princess Marie Bonaparte ( 2 July 1882 -- 21 September 1962 ) was a French author and psychoanalyst , closely linked with Sigmund Freud .
Aleko Konstantinov ( Bulgarian : Алеко Константинов ) ( 1 January 1863 -- 11 May 1897)(NS : 13 January 1863 -- 23 May 1897 ) was a Bulgarian writer , best known for his character Bay Ganyo , one of the most popular characters in Bulgarian fiction .
Jean Victor Marie Moreau ( 14 February 1763 -- 2 September 1813 ) was a French general who helped Napoleon Bonaparte to power , but later became a rival and was banished to the United States .
Milan Vidmar ( 22 June 1885 -- 9 October 1962 ) was a Slovene electrical engineer , chess player , chess theorist , philosopher , and writer .
Ėrnest Lʹvovich Radlov ( 1854 - 1928 ) was a Russian neo - Kantian philosopher and historian of philosophy , a friend and editor of Vladimir Solovyov .
Félix Ziem ( February 26 , 1821 -- November 10 , 1911 ) was a French painter in the style of the Barbizon School .
Carlo Maria Giulini , Cavaliere di Gran Croce OMRI ( Italian pronunciation : ( ˈkarlo maˈriːa dʒuˈliːni ) ; 9 May 1914 -- 14 June 2005 ) was an Italian conductor .
Francesca Caccini ( 18 September 1587 -- after 1641 ) was an Italian composer , singer , lutenist , poet , and music teacher of the early Baroque era .
Reem Bassiouney ( Arabic : ريم بسيوني‎ Rīm Basyūnī ; March 6 , 1973 ) is an Egyptian author and professor of sociolinguistics , currently teaching at The American University in Cairo .
George Hardinge ( 1743 - -1816 ) was an English judge , writer and Member of Parliament .
Karel Poláček ( 22 March 1892 -- 21 January 1945 ) was a Czech writer , humorist and journalist of Jewish descent .
Miguel Pacheco ( born 5 September 1931 ) is a Spanish former racing cyclist .
Berthe Weill ( Paris 1865 -- 1951 ) was a French art dealer who played a vital role in the creation of the market for twentieth - century art with the manifestation of the Parisian Avant - Garde .
Frank Calvert ( 1828 - -1908 ) was an English expatriate who was a consular official in the eastern Mediterranean region and an amateur archaeologist .
James Krüss ( 31 May 1926 -- 2 August 1997 ) was a German writer of children 's and picture books , illustrator , poet , dramatist , scriptwriter , translator , and collector of children 's poems and folk songs .
Jacinto Esteva Grewe ( Barcelona , Spain , 1936 - Barcelona , Spain , September 9 , 1985 ) was a Spanish film director one of the founders of the Barcelona School of Film ..
Rafa Villar ( Cee , Galicia , 1968 - ) is a Galician writer noted especially in the field of poetry .
Philippe Petit ( French pronunciation : ​(filip pəti ) ; born 13 August 1949 ) is a French high - wire artist who gained fame for his high - wire walk between the Twin Towers of the World Trade Center in New York City , on the morning of August 7 , 1974 .
Christine Westermann ( born 2 December 1948 in Erfurt ) is a German television and radio host , journalist and author .
Sir George Toulmin ( 17 March 1857 -- 21 January 1923 ) was an English journalist , newspaper proprietor and Liberal Party politician .
Dmitri Baltermants ( Russian : Дмитрий Николаевич Бальтерманц , May 13 , 1912 -- 1990 ) was a prominent Soviet photojournalist .
Łukasz Orbitowski ( born 1977 ) is a Polish essayist and fantasy and horror writer .
Jesper Ewald ( 24 December 1893 in Vordingborg -- 30 August 1969 in Copenhagen ) was a Danish author , journalist and translator .
Ardengo Soffici ( April 7 , 1879 -- August 12 , 1964 ) , was an Italian writer , painter , poet , sculptor and intellectual .
Joaquim Vayreda i Vila ( born 1843 in Girona , Spain ; died 1894 in Olot , Spain ) was a Spanish painter .
Heinrich Eduard Jacob ( 7 October 1889 -- 25 October 1967 ) was a German and American journalist and author .
Zareh Mutafian ( Armenian : Զարեհ Մութաֆյան ; March 15 , 1907 - May 11 , 1980 ) was a French - Armenian painter .
Pierdomenico Baccalario ( born 6 March 1974 ) is an Italian author of young adult fiction , best known for his Ulysses Moore series .
Manu Katché ( born 27 October 1958 , in Saint - Maur - des - Fossés ) is a French musician of Ivorian origin .
Aleksis Kivi ( pronunciation ) , born Alexis Stenvall , ( 10 October 1834 -- 31 December 1872 ) was a Finnish author who wrote the first significant novel in the Finnish language , Seven Brothers ( Finnish title : Seitsemän veljestä ) .
André Hornez ( 12 May 1905 -- 9 March 1989 ) was a French lyricist and screenwriter .
Günter Kochan ( 2 October 1930 -- 22 February 2009 ) was a German classical composer .
Alfred Landé ( 13 December 1888 - -30 October 1976 ) was a German - American physicist known for his contributions to quantum theory .
Margaret Harvey ( 1768 - -1858 ) was an English poet and scholar from Newcastle , England .
Francis Wurtz ( born 3 January 1948 in Strasbourg ) was a French Member of the European Parliament from 1979 until 2009 .
Francesco Bonatelli ( 1830 - 1911 ) was a 19th - century Italian philosopher of the Roman Catholic spiritualist tradition .
Tudor Vianu ( Romanian : ( ˈtudor viˈanu ) ; January 8 , 1898 -- May 21 , 1964 ) was a Romanian literary critic , art critic , poet , philosopher , academic , and translator .
Between 2006 and 2013 , Jérôme Sans was also the Global Cultural Curator for Le Méridien Hotels & Resorts ; and , in 2012 , he created the French cultural magazine L’Officiel Art as creative director and editor - in - chief .
Ramesh Deo ( born 30 Jan 1929 ) is an Indian film and television actor who has worked in more than 285 Hindi Films , 190 Marathi Films , 30 Marathi Dramas with over 200 shows in his long career .
Claud Lovat Fraser ( 15 May 1890 London -- 18 June 1921 , Dymchurch ) was an English artist , designer and author .
Elsebeth Egholm ( born 17 September 1960 ) is a Danish journalist and best - selling author who writes mainly crime fiction novels .
John Jenyns ( c. 1660 -- 1717 ) , of Hayes and Bedford Row , St Andrew Holborn , Middlesex , was an English politician .
Géza Ottlik ( 9 May 1912 -- 9 October 1990 ) was a Hungarian writer , translator , mathematician , and bridge theorist .
Maurice Hauriou ( 17 August 1856 -- 12 March 1929 ) was a French jurist and sociologist whose writings shaped French administrative law in the late 19th and early 20th century .
Antonin Gadal ( 1877 - -1962 ) was a French mystic and historian who dedicated his life to study of the Cathars in the south of France , their spirituality , beliefs and ideology .
Hans Jendretzky ( July 20 , 1897 in Berlin -- July 2 , 1992 in Berlin ) was a German communist politician .
Peeter Sauter ( born March 11 , 1962 in Tallinn ) is an Estonian author .
Frederic Leighton , 1st Baron Leighton PRA ( 3 December 1830 -- 25 January 1896 ) , known as Sir Frederic Leighton between 1878 and 1896 , was an English painter and sculptor .
Anton Torello ( Spanish : Antoni Torelló i Ros , 30 June 1884 , Sant Sadurní d'Anoia -- 1960 , Los Angeles ) was a Catalan double bass player .
Richard Hathwaye ( fl . 1597 - 1603 ) , was an English dramatist .
Clement Walker ( died 1651 ) was an English lawyer , official and politician .
Dimcho Debelyanov ( Bulgarian : Димчо Дебелянов ) ( 28 March 1887 -- 2 October 1916 ) was a Bulgarian poet and author whose death in the First World War cut off his promising literary career .
Wiera Gran , real name Dwojra Grynberg ( 20 April 1916 -- 19 November 2007 ) was a Polish singer and actress .
Jean - Baptiste - Camille Corot ( French : ( ʒɑ̃ ba.tist ka.mij kɔ.ʁo ) ; July 16 , 1796 -- February 22 , 1875 ) was a French landscape and portrait painter as well as a printmaker in etching .

Anne Curzan earned a B.A. in Linguistics from Yale University ( summa cum laude ) and an M.A. and a Ph.D. in English Language and Literature from the University of Michigan .
Isabella Santacroce ( born April 30 , 1970 in Riccione ) is an Italian novelist .

Florence Quentin ( 5 September 1946 ) is a French César Award winning director and screenwriter .
Ioan Mirea ( 1912 - 1987 ) was a Romanian painter and graphic artist , member of the Iron Guard .

Gaetano Filangieri ( 22 August 1752 -- 21 July 1788 ) was an Italian jurist and philosopher .
Ingo Petzke ( born 18 September 1947 in Belm near Osnabrück in Germany ) is an internationally acknowledged German film scholar , filmmaker and author .
Octav Onicescu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( okˈtav oniˈt͡ʃesku ) ; August 20 , 1892 -- August 19 , 1983 ) was a Romanian mathematician , member of the Romanian Academy , and founder of the Romanian school of probability theory and statistics .
Encarna Sant - Celoni i Verger ( Tavernes de la Valldigna , La Safor , 1959 ) is a Valencian narrative writer , poet and translator .

Jacques Fouroux ( 24 July 1947 -- 17 December 2005 ) was a French rugby union player and coach .
Benjamin Schmolck ( 21 December 1672 -- 12 February 1737 ) was a German Lutheran composer of hymns .
Francisco de Artiga , a celebrated Spanish landscape and historical painter , was born at Huesca , about 1650 .
Jordi Soler i Galí ( born 7 June 1949 ) , known by the stage name Toti Soler , is a Spanish guitarist , singer and composer , one of the most important figures of contemporary music in Catalonia .
François Feuardent ( 1539 -- 1 January 1610 ) was a French Franciscan theologian , and preacher of the Ligue .

Kundara Johny is an Indian actor in Malayalam cinema .
In addition to writing novels , Tõnu Õnnepalu has translated works into Estonian from the French language by such authors as François Mauriac , Charles Baudelaire and Marcel Proust and has written for such English language publications as the Poetry Society .

Luca Giordano ( 18 October 1634 -- 12 January 1705 ) was an Italian late Baroque painter and printmaker in etching .

David William Mitchell ( 4 August 1813 -- 1 November 1859 ) was an English zoologist and illustrator .
Alessandro Bertolotti ( born in 1960 ) is an Italian writer and photographer .
Petar Preradović ( 19 March 1818 -- 18 August 1872 ) was a Croatian poet , writer , and military general in the Austro - Hungarian Army .

Antonio Álvarez Alonso ( 11 March 1867 - 22 June 1903 ) was a Spanish pianist and composer .

Shifra Horn ( Hebrew : שפרה הורן ‎ ) ( born 1951 ) is an Israeli author .
Leoš Janáček ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈlɛoʃ ˈjanaːt͡ʃɛk ) , baptised Leo Eugen Janáček ; 3 July 1854 -- 12 August 1928 ) was a Czech composer , musical theorist , folklorist , publicist and teacher .
Gajala is an Indian film actress , who has appeared in Tamil , Malayalam and Telugu films .
John Harrison ( 3 April ( O.S. 24 March ) 1693 - - 24 March 1776 ) was a self - educated English carpenter and clockmaker who invented the marine chronometer , a long - sought after device for solving the problem of calculating longitude while at sea .
Conchita Montes ( 13 March 1914 -- 18 October 1994 ) was a Spanish film actress .
Károly Pap ( September 24 , 1897 -- January 31 , 1945 ) was a Jewish - Hungarian writer .
Xabier Lete Bergaretxe ( Oiartzun , Gipuzkoa , April 5 , 1944 - Donostia , December 4 , 2010 ) was a Basque writer , poet , singer and politician .
François Béranger ( 1937 , Amilly , Loiret -- 2003 ) was a French singer .
Jean - Baptiste - Joseph Gobel ( 1 September 1727 -- 12 April 1794 ) was a French Roman Catholic cleric and politician of the Revolution .
Francesco Maria Richini ( also spelled Ricchini ) ( 9 February 1584 -- 24 April 1658 ) was an Italian Baroque architect .
Trần Văn Khê ( 24 July 1921 - 24 June 2015 ) was a Vietnamese musicologist , academic , writer , teacher and performer of traditional music .
Count Edward Bernard Raczyński ( December 19 , 1891 -- July 30 , 1993 ) was a Polish diplomat , writer , politician and President of Poland in exile ( between 1979 and 1986 ) .
Giulia Niccolai ( born 1934 ) is an Italian photographer , poet , novelist and translator .
Wilhelm Koenen ( April 7 , 1886 -- October 19 , 1963 ) was a communist and an East German politician .
Sebastian Petrycy of Pilzno ( 1554 - -1626 ) was a Polish philosopher and physician .
Philippe Tailliez ( French : ( tɑje ) ; 15 June 1905 , Malo - les - Bains -- 26 September 2002 , Toulon , France ) was a friend and colleague of Jacques Cousteau .
Francisco Alejandro Gattorno Sánchez ( Spanish pronunciation : ( fɾanˈsisko ɣaˈtorno ) ; born October 12 , 1964 ) , better known in the show business world plainly as Francisco Gattorno , is a Cuban - Mexican actor .
Natale Conti or Latin Natalis Comes , also Natalis de Comitibus and French Noël le Comte ( 1520 - -1582 ) was an Italian mythographer , poet , humanist and historian .
Lee Garim ( Hangul : 이가림 ; born 1943 ) is a South Korean writer .
Bartolomé de Torres Naharro ( c. 1485 , Torre de Miguel Sesmero , Extremadura -- c. 1530 ) was a Spanish dramatist and Leonese language writer of Jewish converso descent .
Helene Christaller ( ( ˈkʁɪstalɐ ) , née Heyer : 31 January 1872 , in Darmstadt -- 24 May 1953 , in Jugenheim / Bergstraße ) was a German Protestant writer mostly of youth books , especially for girls .
Eugenia Rico is a Spanish novelist , poet and journalist .
The Liber Memorialis is an ancient book in Latin featuring an extremely concise summary -- a kind of index -- of universal history from earliest times to the reign of Trajan .
Aldo Andreotti ( 15 March 1924 -- 21 February 1980 ) was an Italian mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry , on the theory of functions of several complex variables and on partial differential operators .
Anna Proclemer , sometimes credited Anna Vivaldi ( 30 May 1923 -- 25 April 2013 ) , was an Italian stage , film and television actress and voice actress .
George Bryant Britton ( 1863 -- 11 July 1929 ) was an English boot and shoe manufacturer and Liberal Party Member of Parliament .
Fra Serafino Razzi ( Marradi 1531 - Florence 1613 ) , was an Italian Dominican monk who in 1563 published a large collection of carnival songs in the lauda ( song ) genre .
Jean - Baptiste Belin de Fontenay I ( 1653 - -1715 ) , also called `` Jean - Baptiste Belin the Elder '' , was a French painter who specialized in flowers .
Moshe Vilenski ( Hebrew : משה וילנסקי‎ , also , `` Vilensky '' and `` Wilensky '' ; April 17 , 1910 -- January 2 , 1997 ) was a Polish - Israeli composer , lyricist , and pianist .
Petar Omčikus ( French : Pierre Omcikous ; Serbian Cyrillic : Петар Омчикус ) , Sušak , October 6 , 1926 ) is a Serbian painter and member of the Serbian Academy of Sciences and Arts , who lives and works in Paris , France .
Céleste Boursier - Mougenot ( born 1961 , Nice , France ) is a modern French artist .
Jean - Baptiste Rousseau ( 6 April 1671 -- 17 March 1741 ) was a French dramatist and poet , particularly noted for his short cynical epigrams .
Jean - François Cail ( 1804 - -1871 ) was a French entrepreneur and industrialist who was a key figure in French industrialization .
Máire Mullarney ( 1 September 1921 -- 18 August 2008 ) was an Irish environmentalist , educationalist and Esperanto advocate .
Diego Núñez de Avendaño was the son of the prominent Spanish jurist and author Pedro Núñez de Avendaño .
Albert Laprade ( 29 November 1883 - 9 May 1978 ) was a French architect , perhaps best known for the Palais de la Porte Dorée .
Georges de Feure ( real name Georges Joseph van Sluijters , 6 September 1868 -- 26 November 1943 ) was a French painter , theatrical designer , and industrial art designer in the symbolism and Art Nouveau styles .
Elvira Lindo ( born 23 January 1962 in Cádiz , Spain ) is a Spanish journalist and writer .
James Laver , CBE , FRSA ( 14 March 1899 -- 3 June 1975 ) was an English author , critic , art historian , and museum curator who acted as Keeper of Prints , Drawings and Paintings for the Victoria and Albert Museum between 1938 and 1959 .
Éric Charden ( born Jacques Puissant ; 15 October 1942 -- 29 April 2012 ) was a French singer and songwriter , most famous for his collaboration with Annie Gautrat alias Stone with whom he formed Stone et Charden .
Tell Aristide Frédéric Antoine Chapel ( July 1 , 1849 - August 11 , 1932 ) was a French General during World War I.
Christopher Wormell ( born 1955 ) is an English print - maker , principally known for his illustrated books .
Francisco Ribera ( 1537 - -1591 ) was a Spanish Jesuit theologian , identified with the Futurist Christian eschatological view .
Maciej Stryjkowski ( also referred to as Strykowski and Strycovius ; ca . 1547 -- ca . 1593 ) was a Polish historian , writer and a poet , notable as the author of Chronicle of Poland , Lithuania , Samogitia and all of Ruthenia ( 1582 ) .
Gerhard Benkowitz ( 2 June 1923 -- 29 June 1955 ) was a school teacher and a resistance activist against the one party dictatorship of the German Democratic Republic .
Andrea Bajani ( born August 16 , 1975 in Rome ) is an Italian writer and journalist .
Joseph Philippe de Clairville ( 1742 - -July 31 , 1830 ) was a notable French botanist and entomologist , who was mainly active in Switzerland .
James Essinger ( born 5 September 1957 ) is a freelance writer and British author of numerous financial and business management books , but may be best known for his book about the evolution of English language and spelling , Spellbound :
Jacques de Guyse ( Latin : Iacobus de Guisia ) ( 1334−1399 ) was a Franciscan monk and historian of the late 14th century .
Jaume Plensa ( Catalan pronunciation : ( ˈʒawmə ˈpɫɛnsə ) ; born 1955 ) is a Spanish artist and sculptor .
Tommaso Bisagno ( 5 April 1935 -- 18 January 2014 ) was an Italian academic and politician .
Serge Delaive ( born 1965 in Liège , Belgium ) is a poet and novelist writing in the French language .
Antonio Burgos Belinchón ( born 1943 in Seville , Spain ) is a Spanish traditionalist - conservative journalist , novelist , and multi - media writer .
Wilhelm Furtwängler ( January 25 , 1886 -- November 30 , 1954 ) was a German conductor and composer .
Roberto Calasso ( born 30 May 1941 in Florence ) is an Italian writer and publisher .
Sharankumar Limbale ( Marathi : शरणकुमार लिंबाळे ) ( born - June 1 , 1956 ) is a Marathi language author , poet and literary critic .
Mustafa Imamović ( born 1941 in Gradačac ) is a Bosnian historian of state and law .
Diego Medrano Fernández ( Oviedo , Spain , 1978 ) is a Spanish poet , narrator and regular columnist of Asturian newspaper El Comercio .
Maria Petre ( born August 15 , 1951 ) is a Romanian politician and economist , member of the Democratic Party ( PD ) , part of the European People 's Party--
P. K. Venukuttan Nair ( 1931 -- 26 November 2012 ) was an Indian theatre personality and Malayalam film actor .
Muddu Babu Shetty ( 1938 - -23 January 1982 ) , aka M. B. Shetty or Shetty , was an Indian stuntman and action choreographer cum actor in 1970s Hindi cinema .
Ingo Niermann ( born 1969 , Bielefeld , Germany ) is a German novelist , writer , and artist .
Jean - Baptiste du Casse ( August 2 , 1646 -- June 25 , 1715 ) was a French buccaneer , admiral , and colonial administrator who served throughout the Atlantic World during the 17th and 18th centuries .
Gérard Manset ( also known as Manset ; born 21 August 1945 in Saint - Cloud , Hauts - de - Seine ) is a French singer - songwriter , painter , photographer and writer .
Heinz - Günther Nesselrath ( 9 November 1957 in Jülich ) is a German philologist .
Roberto Lago Soto ( Spanish pronunciation : ( ro'βerto ' laɣo ' soto ) ; born 30 August 1985 ) is a Spanish professional footballer who plays for Getafe CF as a left back .
Joachim Latacz ( born 4 April 1934 ) is a German classical philologist .
Dan Petrașincu ( born Angelo Moretta , 2 June 1910 -- 1997 ) was an Italian - Romanian anthropologist , writer and translator .
Franco Sacchetti ( Italian pronunciation : ( ˈfraŋko sakˈketti ) ; c. 1335 -- c. 1400 ) , was an Italian poet and novelist .
Monika Treut ( born April 6 , 1954 in Mönchengladbach , North Rhine - Westphalia , Germany ) is a German lesbian filmmaker .
Lin Shaohua ( simplified Chinese : 林少华 ; traditional Chinese : 林少華 ; pinyin : Lín Shàohuá ; born 1952 ) is a Chinese translator and author .
Billy Collins attended Archbishop Stepinac High School in White Plains and received a B.A. in English from the College of the Holy Cross in 1963 ; he received his M.A. and Ph . D in Romantic Poetry from the University of California , Riverside .
Moolchand was a prolific character actor in Hindi and Panjabi cinema who was active from 1950 to his death in the late-1980s .
Gervase Phinn ( born 27 December 1946 , Rotherham , South Yorkshire , England ) is an English author and educator .
Jacques Mesrine ( French pronunciation : ​(mesʁin ) ; 28 December 1936 -- 2 November 1979 ) was a French criminal .
Sébastien Chabal , born 8 December 1977 in Valence , Drôme , is a retired French rugby union player .
Xu Zhimo ( Chinese : 徐志摩 ; pinyin : Xú Zhìmó ; Wade -- Giles : Hsü Chih - mo , January 15 , 1897 -- November 19 , 1931 ) was an early 20th - century Chinese poet .
Clément Juglar ( 15 October 1819 -- 28 February 1905 ) was a French doctor and statistician .
Maja Classen ( born December 28 , 1974 in Heidelberg ) is a German film director and screenwriter , primarily known for her 2006 documentary on the Berlin techno scene , Feiern .
Jacques - Philippe Le Bas or Lebas ( 8 July 1707 - 14 April 1783 ) was a French engraver .
Birgit Hein ( born August 6 , 1942 ) is a German film director , producer and screenwriter who has made experimental films with her husband Wilhelm Hein since the 1960s .
Joseph Bonnet ( 17 March 1884 -- 2 August 1944 ) was a French composer and organist .
Heinz Berggruen ( 6 January 1914 -- 23 February 2007 ) was a German art dealer and collector who sold 165 works of art to the German federal government to form the core of the Berggruen Museum in Berlin , Germany .
Marc - Théodore Bourrit came of a family which was of French origin but had taken refuge at Geneva for reasons connected with religion .
Charles Lalo ( 24 February 1877 -- 1 April 1953 ) was a French writer on aesthetics .
Lara Comi ( born 18 February 1983 ) is an Italian Member of European Parliament .
Pepe Moreno ( born 1959 , given name : Saturnino ) is a Spanish comic book artist , writer and video game developer who has been drawing professionally in Spain , other countries in Europe and in the US since the 1970s .
Rudolf Oeser ( 13 November 1858 - 3 June 1926 ) was a German journalist and liberal politician .
Bidia Dandaron ( Vidyadhara , Russian : Бидия Дандарович Дандарон ) ( December 28 , 1914 , Soorkhoi , Kizhinga , Buryatia -- October 26 , 1974 , Vydrino , Buryatia ) was a major Buddhist author and teacher in the USSR .
Carlos Fradique Mendes is a fictional Portuguese adventurer .
Étienne Balibar ( born 23 April 1942 ) is a French philosopher and a Distinguished Professor of French & Italian and Comparative Literature at the University of California Irvine .
Peter Angermann ( born 1945 in Rehau , Bavaria ) is a German painter based in Nuremberg .
Eija - Riitta Korhola ( née Nieminen , born on 15 June 1959 in Lahti ) is a Finnish politician and former Member of the European Parliament .
Frederick William Beechey ( 17 February 1796 -- 29 November 1856 ) was an English naval officer and geographer .
Fabrizio Gatti ( born 9 March 1966 ) is an Italian investigative journalist and author .
Fabio Volo , pseudonym of Fabio Bonetti , ( born 23 June 1972 ) is an Italian writer , actor , voice acting , radio and television presenter and screenwriter .
Henry Hoare II ( 1705 - -1785 ) , known as Henry the Magnificent , was an English banker and garden owner - designer .
Ferenc Erkel ( Hungarian : Erkel Ferenc Hungarian pronunciation : ( ˈɛrkɛl ˈfɛrɛnt͡s ) , German : Franz Erkel ; November 7 , 1810 -- June 15 , 1893 ) was a Hungarian composer , conductor and pianist .
Valéry Mayet ( 2 January 1839 , Lyon -- 1909 ) was a French entomologist .
Alonso Miguel de Tovar , sometimes ( less correctly ) called Tobar ( 1678 - -1758 ) was a Spanish baroque painter , appointed court painter by Philip V in 1723 .
Harvey J. Graff ( born June 19 , 1949 ) is a comparative social historian as well as a professor of English and History at Ohio State University .
Erik Bánki ( born May 26 , 1970 ) is a Hungarian politician , member of the National Assembly ( MP ) from 1998 to 2012 and since 2014 .
Shinichi Hoshi ( 星 新一 Hoshi Shin'ichi , September 6 , 1926 -- December 30 , 1997 ) was a Japanese novelist and science fiction writer .
Louis de Bouillé ( Martinique , 1 May 1769 - 20 November 1850 ) was a French general .
Guido Baccelli ( 1830 - 1916 ) was an Italian physician and statesman .
Aksel Jørgensen ( 1883 - -1957 ) was a Danish painter and wood engraver .
Marcus Birro ( born 15 June 1972 in Göteborg , Sweden ) is a Swedish - Italian ( Italian citizen ) poet , author and columnist .
Djida Tazdaït ( born April 8 , 1957 in Timri Tala - Tazert , French Algeria ) is a French activist who seated in the European Parliament from 1989 to 1994 .
Thomas Rainsborough ( 1610 -- 29 October 1648 ) , or Rainborowe , was a prominent figure in the English Civil War , and was the leading spokesman for the Levellers in the Putney Debates .
Harold Orton ( 23 October 1898 -- 7 March 1975 ) was a Dialectologist and Professor of English Language and Medieval Literature at the University of Leeds .
In 1992 the federal state of North Rhine - Westphalia and WDR ( West German broadcasting corporation ) managed to get Dieter Kosslick to come from Hamburg to the Rhine to head up the barely one - year - old `` Filmstiftung NRW '' as its executive director .
Ugo Pirro ( April 20 , 1920 -- January 18 , 2008 ) was an Italian screenwriter and novelist .
Olga Scheinpflugová ( 3 December 1902 -- 13 April 1968 ) was a Czech actress and writer .
Robert Franz Schmidt ( born 16 September 1932 in Ludwigshafen ) is a German physiologist and professor emeritus .
Jean Barbeyrac ( French : ( baʁbɛʁak ) ; 15 March 1674 -- 3 March 1744 ) was a French jurist .
Francesco Borromini , byname of Francesco Castelli ( 25 September 1599 -- 2 August 1667 ) , was an Italian architect born in today 's Ticino who , with his contemporaries Gian Lorenzo Bernini and Pietro da Cortona , was a leading figure in the emergence of Roman Baroque architecture .
Alberto Juzdado López ( born August 20 , 1966 in Madrid ) is a Spanish long - distance runner .
Cezar Baltag ( 26 July 1939 in Mălineşti - Hotin -- 26 May 1997 in Bucharest ) was a Romanian poet .
Baron Béla Bánhidy de Simánd ( February 17 , 1836 -- June 18 , 1890 ) was a Hungarian politician and Member of Parliament .
Karl Otto Paetel ( 23 November 1906 , Berlin -- 4 May 1975 , New York ) was a German political journalist .
Carl Julius Fritzsche ( 17 October 1808 , Neustadt -- 8 June 1871 ) was a German pharmacist and chemist .
Jean Léonard Marie Poiseuille ( French : ( pwazœj ) ; 22 April 1797 -- 26 December 1869 ) was a French physicist and physiologist .
Robert Strother Stewart ( 16 May 1878 -- 15 November 1954 ) was an English lawyer , colonial judge and Liberal Party politician .
Sven Olof Joachim Palme ( Swedish : Olof Palme ; pronounced ( ˈʊlɔf palˈmɛ ) ; 30 January 1927 -- 28 February 1986 ) was a Swedish Social Democratic politician , statesman and prime minister .
Roberto Cassinelli ( born December 10 , 1956 ) is an Italian politician and lawyer , Member of the Italian Chamber of Deputies .
Hella Wuolijoki ( née Ella Marie Murrik ; July 22 , 1886 -- February 2 , 1954 ) , known by the pen name Juhani Tervapää , was an Estonian - born Finnish writer known for her Niskavuori series .
Azad Bilgrami ( 1704 - 1786 ) was a scholar of Arabic , Persian and Urdu languages in 18th century India .
Sevda Sevan ( Armenian : Սևդա Սևան , November 6 , 1945 - May 16 , 2009 ) was a prominent Armenian - Bulgarian writer , the Ambassador of Armenia in Bulgaria from 1994 to 2005 .
Georges Pallu ( 1869 - 1948 ) was a French screenwriter and film director active in the silent and early sound eras .
Priya Raman is a Malayalam actress and film producer .
Rajanala Nageswara Rao better known as R. Nageswara Rao ( Telugu : రాజనాల నాగేశ్వరరావు ) ( 1928 - -1959 ) was a famous Telugu film actor .
Madeleine Pelletier ( 18 May 1874 -- 29 December 1939 ) was a French physician , psychiatrist , first - wave feminist , and socialist activist .
Grażyna Miller ( Jedwabne , 29 January 1957 -- 17 August 2009 ) was a Polish poet and translator who lived in Italy .
Archana Joglekar is an Indian actress and classical dancer who has appeared in numerous Marathi and Hindi films and television serials .
Liu Yumin ( simplified Chinese : 刘玉民 ; traditional Chinese : 劉玉民 ; pinyin : Liǘ Yùmín ; born February 1951 ) is a Chinese novelist who was the vice president of Shandong Literature and Art Association .
Johannes Zorn ( 1739 Kempten - 1799 ) was a German pharmacist , botanist and botanical illustrator .
Hans Knappertsbusch ( 12 March 1888 -- 25 October 1965 ) was a German conductor , best known for his performances of the music of Richard Wagner , Anton Bruckner and Richard Strauss as well as his unique public persona and conducting style .
Benjamin Brierley ( often known as Ben Brierley ) ( 26 June 1825 -- 18 January 1896 ) was an English weaver and writer in Lancashire dialect .
Đuro Daničić ( born Đorđe Popović ; Serbian Cyrillic : Ђуро Даничић , pronounced ( dʑǔːrɔ dânit͡ʃit͡ɕ ) ; April 4 , 1825 -- November 17 , 1882 ) , was a Serbian and Croatian philologist , translator , linguistic historian and lexicographer .
Jonathan Castro Otto ( born 3 March 1994 ) , commonly known as Jonny , is a Spanish professional footballer who plays for Celta de Vigo as a right or left back .
Ingrid Mathilda Malling ( early pseudonym Stella Kleve ) was a Swedish novelist born January 20 , 1864 , on Oskar Farm in southern Sweden and died in Copenhagen in 1942 .
Jean - Jacques Lebel is a French artist , poet , poetry publisher , political activist and scholar born in Paris in 1936 .
Pedro Erquicia López de Montenegro ( born 24 March 1943 in San Sebastián ) is a Spanish journalist and news anchor .
Giulio Alessandrini ( Latin Julius Alexandrinus or Julius Alexandrinus von Neustein ; 1506 -- 25 August 1590 ) was an Italian physician , author , and poet .
Fritz Köster ( February 2 , 1855 -- 1934 ) was a German anarchist editor and trade unionist .
Giovanni Antonio Magini ( in Latin , Maginus ) ( 13 June 1555 -- 11 February 1617 ) was an Italian astronomer , astrologer , cartographer , and mathematician .
Jean - Antoine Gleizes ( 1773 - -1843 ) was a French writer and advocate of vegetarianism .
Orfeo Boselli , or Bosselli , ( 1597 - -1667 ) was an Italian sculptor working in Rome .
Ludwig Loewe ( November 27 , 1837 -- September 11 , 1886 ) was a German merchant , manufacturer , philanthropist and a member of the Reichstag .
Seweryn Chomet , FInstP ( 6 May 1930 in Drohobycz , Poland -- 24 July 2009 in London , England ) was a physicist , author , journalist , historian , publisher , prolific translator of Russian scientific journals into English , and former visiting research fellow of King 's College London .
John Olav Egeland ( born 2 November 1951 ) is a Norwegian journalist and editor .
Adolphe Perraud ( 7 February 1828 -- 18 February 1906 ) was a French Cardinal and academician .
Enrique González Morales , better known as Quique González , is a Spanish singer / songwriter known throughout the continent for his approachable and natural writing style .
Tor Obrestad ( born 12 February 1938 ) is a Norwegian novelist , poet and documentary writer .
Louis Claude Noisette ( 2 November 1772 at Chatillon - 9 January 1849 ) was a French botanist and agronomist , son of Joseph Noisette , gardener to the Count of Provence , the future Louis XVIII .
Henry Harvey Vivian ( 20 April 1868 -- 30 May 1930 ) was an English trade unionist , and Liberal Party politician and campaigner for industrial democracy and co - partnership , especially noted for his work in co - partnership housing .
Pierre Séguier ( French : ( pjɛʁ seɡje ) ; 28 May 1588 -- 28 January 1672 ) was a French statesman , chancellor of France from 1635 .
Alberto Basso ( born Turin , 21 August 1931 ) is an Italian musicologist .
The Professor of English at University College London , John Mullan , has written : `` In Spitting Image and probably the middle - class imagination , Norman Tebbit was given an Essex drag on his vowels which he hardly possessed .
Sirkka - Liisa Konttinen ( b.27 March 1948 ) is a Finnish photographer who has worked in Britain since the 1960s .
In September 2014 , the Anna Kavan Society organized a one - day symposium at the Institute of English Studies in association with Liverpool John Moores University Research Centre for Literature and Cultural History and Peter Owen Publishers .
Bilge Umar ( born 1936 ) is a Turkish writer , researcher and jurist born in Karşıyaka , İzmir in Turkey .
Menachem Elon ( Hebrew : מנחם אלון ) ( November 1 , 1923 -- February 6 , 2013 ) was an Israeli jurist and Professor of Law specializing in Mishpat Ivri , Orthodox rabbi , and a prolific author on traditional Jewish law ( halakha ) .
Nacho Barahona ( born in Madrid ) is a Spanish film editor with over 225 TV series episodes , 14 short films , numerous advertisements and 3 documentaries to his credit , as well as 8 nominations and awards in film - making .
Mohamed Talbi ( Arabic : محمد الطالبي‎ ) , ( born in Tunis , September 16 , 1921 ) is a Tunisian historian and professor .
Anthony Rich ( 1803 -- 4 April 1891 ) was an English solicitor , author , antiquary and gentleman .
Đinh Trọng Đoàn , pen name Ma Văn Kháng ( Đống Đa , Hanoi , 1 December 1936 ) is a Vietnamese writer .
John Brailsford the elder ( fl . 1712 - 1739 ) , was an English poet .
Albert Messiah ( 23 September 1921 , Nice -- 17 April 2013 ) was a French physicist .
Joan Margarit i Consarnau ( Catalan pronunciation : ( ʒuˈan mərɣəˈɾit i kunsərˈnaw ) ) ( born in Sanaüja , May 11 , 1938 ) is a Catalan poet , architect and retired Professor .
Arnaldo Azzi ( 23 December 1885 , Ceneselli - 25 November 1957 ) was an Italian general and politician .
Shernaz Patel is an Indian film and theatre actor , who works in Hindi and English films , most known for her roles in films like Black ( 2005 ) and Guzaarish ( 2010 ) and English language theatre in Mumbai .
Henrik Fexeus ( born September 29 , 1971 in Örebro , Sweden ) is a Swedish mentalist , author and TV - host .
Albert Mathiez ( 10 January 1874 , La Bruyère , Haute - Saône -- 25 February 1932 ) was a French historian , known for his Marxist interpretation of the French Revolution .
Marie - Dominique Philippe ( September 8 , 1912 in Nord ( French department ) -- August 26 , 2006 in Loire ) was a Dominican philosopher and theologian .
Alberto Sansimena Chamorro ( born 26 May 1985 ) , known as Tete , is a Spanish footballer who plays for Cypriot club AEK Larnaca F.C. as a winger .
Edward Rider Cook ( 4 June 1836 -- 21 August 1898 ) was an English soap manufacturer and Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1885 to 1886 .
Manuela Gretkowska ( 6 October 1964 ) is a Polish writer , screenwriter and politician .
Wawrzyniec Grzymała Goślicki ( Latin : Laurentius Grimaldius Goslicius ; between 1530 and 1540 -- 31 October 1607 ) was a Polish nobleman , Bishop of Poznań ( 1601 - -1607 ) , political thinker and philosopher best known for his book De optimo senatore ( 1568 ) .
Jean - Claude Killy ( born 30 August 1943 ) also known as Gilette is a former French World Cup alpine ski racer .
Odoardo Fialetti ( May 18 , 1573 - 1638 ? ) was an Italian painter and printmaker who began his training during the late Renaissance , and showed distinct mannerist sensibilities in his mid - career , adopting a much looser and more dynamic style in his later life .
Joseph Addison ( 1 May 1672 -- 17 June 1719 ) was an English essayist , poet , playwright , and politician .
Robert Hugh Benson AFSC KC*SG KGCHS ( 18 November 1871 -- 19 October 1914 ) was an English Anglican priest who in 1903 was received into the Roman Catholic Church in which he was ordained priest in 1904 .
García de Toledo Osorio , 6th Marquis of Villafranca , ( 25 April 1579 in Naples -- 21 January 1649 in Madrid ) , Prince of Montalbano , 3rd Duke of Fernandina was a Spanish - Italian nobleman , military and a Grandee of Spain .
Grażyna Chrostowska ( 20 September 1921 , Lublin - 18 April 1942 , Ravensbrück ) , was a Polish poet and an activist of the Polish underground during the Second World War .
Francesc Eiximenis ( ) ( OFM ) was a Franciscan Catalan writer who lived in the 14th - century Crown of Aragon .
Stanley Tiffany CBE ( 11 June 1908 -- 19 March 1971 ) was an English Labour Co - operative politician .
Philibert Joseph Roux ( April 26 , 1780 -- March 24 , 1854 ) was a French surgeon born in Auxerre .
Peter Schlechtriem ( March 2 , 1933 in Jena -- April 23 , 2007 in Freiburg i m Breisgau ) was a German jurisprudential scholar .
Biju Menon ( born 9 September 1970 ) is an Indian film actor who has starred in over a 100 Malayalam films , along with a couple of Tamil and Telugu films .
Janice Rebibo ( née Silverman ; January 31 , 1950 -- March 11 , 2015 ) was an American - born Israeli poet who began writing in Hebrew in the mid-1980s .
Count Nicolò Carandini ( December 6 , 1896 -- March 18 , 1972 ) was the first Italian ambassador to Britain after World War II .
Aelius Festus Aphthonius was a Latin grammarian of the 4th or 5th century , possibly of African origin , and considered to be one of the most important classical rhetoricians .
Milan Rúfus ( December 10 , 1928 -- January 11 , 2009 ) was a Slovak poet , essayist , translator , children 's writer and academic .
Francisco Agustín Silvela y Blanco ( August 28 , 1803 -- September 20 , 1857 ) was a Spanish exile who returned to become a prominent lawyer and politician following the turmoil after the Peninsular War and restoration of the House of Bourbon in Spain following the French occupation .
Edward Smith - Stanley , 13th Earl of Derby KG ( 21 April 1775 -- 30 June 1851 ) , styled Lord Stanley from 1776 to 1832 and known as The Lord Stanley from 1832 to 1834 , was an English politician , landowner , builder , farmer , art collector and naturalist .
Victor Banerjee ( born Partho Sarathi Banerjee , 15 October 1946 ) is an Indian actor who appears in English , Hindi , Bengali and Assamese language films .
William Wilkie Collins ( 8 January 1824 -- 23 September 1889 ) was an English novelist , playwright , and short story writer .
Mieczysław Jastrun born as Mojsze Agatstein ( 29 October 1903 -- 22 February 1983 ) was a Polish poet and essayist of Jewish origin .
Louis - Anne - Jean Brocq ( February 1 , 1856 -- December 18 , 1928 ) was a French dermatologist born in Laroque - Timbaut , a village in the department of Lot - et - Garonne .
Pierre Lhande Heguy ( Basque : Pierre Allande Hegi ) was born in Bayonne , France on 9 July 1877 and died 17 April 1957 in Tardets , Soule .
Sir Samuel Morland , 1st Baronet ( 1625 -- 30 December 1695 ) , or Moreland , was an English academic , diplomat , spy , inventor and mathematician of the 17th century , a polymath credited with early developments in relation to computing , hydraulics and steam power .
Devendra Satyarthi ( 1908 - 2003 ) was an Indian folklorist and writer of Hindi , Urdu , Punjabi literature .
Victoria , Lady Welby ( 1837 - -1912 ) , more correctly Lady Welby - Gregory , was a self - educated English philosopher of language , musician and water - colour artist .
Charles Edward Horn ( 21 June 1786 -- 21 October 1849 ) was an English composer and singer .
Borja Cobeaga Eguillor ( born in 1977 ) is a Spanish film director and screenwriter .
Mahmut Celâl Bayar ( 16 May 1883 -- 22 August 1986 ) was a Turkish politician , statesman , and the third President of Turkey .
Ahmed Abdel Muti Hijazi ( Arabic : أحمد عبد المعطي حجازي‎ ) ( born in 1935 in Al - Menoufiya , Egypt ) is an Egyptian contemporary poet .
Luis Antonio García Navarro ( 30 April 1941 in Chiva , Valencian Community , Spain -- 10 October 2001 in Madrid , Spain ) , was a Spanish conductor .
Friedrich Marx ( April 22 , 1859 -- October 17 , 1941 ) was a German classical philologist born in Bessungen -- today part of the city of Darmstadt .
Bassam Frangieh ( Arabic : بسام فرنجيه ) is a scholar of contemporary Arabic literature and culture .
Manfred Schnelldorfer ( born 2 May 1943 in Munich , Bavaria , Germany ) is a German figure skater , and a World and Olympic champion .
Folke Lars - Olov Strömstedt , ( 23 May 1935 , Gävle - 4 July 2009 ) , better known as Lasse Strömstedt , was a Swedish writer who wrote of and about his own life in prison and drug abuse .
Jean - Pierre Talbot ( French : ( talbo ) ; born 12 August 1943 ) is a Belgian actor , best known for his lead role of Tintin in the movies Tintin and the Golden Fleece and Tintin and the Blue Oranges .
Karl Dönitz ( German : ( ˈdøːnɪts ) ; 16 September 1891 -- 24 December 1980 ) was a German admiral who played a major role in the Naval history of World War II . Dönitz succeeded Adolf Hitler as the head of state of Germany .
Nicolae Iorga ( Romanian pronunciation : ( nikoˈla.e ˈjorɡa ) ; sometimes Neculai Iorga , Nicolas Jorga , Nicolai Jorga or Nicola Jorga , born Nicu N. Iorga ; January 17 , 1871 -- November 27 , 1940 ) was a Romanian historian , politician , literary critic , memoirist , poet and playwright .
Christian Tramitz ( born 29 July 1955 in Munich ) is a German - Austrian actor , comedian , voice actor and author .
Sir Geoffrey Wilkinson FRS ( 14 July 1921 -- 26 September 1996 ) was a Nobel laureate English chemist who pioneered inorganic chemistry and homogeneous transition metal catalysis .
Iftikhar Hussain , popularly known by his pen name Muztar Khairabadi ( Urdu : مضطر خیرآبادی‎ ) ( born 1862 - -died 1927 ) , was an Indian Urdu poet .
Moritz Pasch ( 8 November 1843 , Breslau , Prussia ( now Wrocław , Poland ) -- 20 September 1930 , Bad Homburg , Germany ) was a German mathematician specializing in the foundations of geometry .
Ludwig Eichrodt ( February 2 , 1827 , Durlach bei Karlsruhe -- February 2 , 1892 , Lahr ) was a German poet and dramatist .
Sebastián de Eslava y Lazaga ( 1684 in Enériz , Navarre -- June 21 , 1759 in Madrid ) was a Spanish general and colonial official .
Alfred Weber ( 30 July 1868 -- 2 May 1958 ) was a German economist , geographer , sociologist and theoretician of culture whose work was influential in the development of modern economic geography .
Henri Marie Bouley ( 17 May 1814 -- 2 December 1885 ) was a pioneering French veterinarian and pathologist .
Pierre Hadot ( French : ( ado ) ; February 21 , 1922 -- April 24 , 2010 ) was a French philosopher and historian of philosophy specializing in ancient philosophy , particularly Neoplatonism .
Esad Mekuli ( Montenegrin Cyrillic : Есад Мекули ) ( 17 December 1916 , Plav , Kingdom of Montenegro -- 6 August 1993 , Pristina , FR Yugoslavia ) was an Albanian poet and scholar .
Carl Benedict Hase ( French : Charles Benoît Hase ; May 11 , 1780 -- March 21 , 1864 ) , French Hellenist , of German extraction , was born at Sulza near Naumburg .
Joachim Hoffmann ( December 1 , 1930 -- February 8 , 2002 ) was a German historian and scientific director of the German Armed Forces Military History Research Office .
Alejandra Lazcano ( Spanish pronunciation : ( aleˈxandɾa lasˈkano ) ; born on December 31 , 1984 in Mexico City , Mexico ) is a Mexican actress known for her roles in soap operas , like Acorralada and Pobre Diabla .
Gabriel Loire ( April 21 , 1904 -- December 25 , 1996 ) was a French stained glass artist of the twentieth century whose extensive works , portraying various persons or historical scenes , appear in many venues around the world .
Antonio Fernández Bordas ( 1870 - -1950 ) was a Spanish violinist and musical teacher .
Gérard Moussay ( 16 August 1932 , Brecé ( Mayenne - 1 February 2012 in Paris ) was a French catholic missionary . He was also a specialist on Cam and Minangkabau languages .
Tadeusz Kantor ( 6 April 1915 -- 8 December 1990 ) was a Polish painter , assemblage artist , set designer and theatre director .
Franz Johann Joseph Bock ( 1823 - -1899 ) was a German theologian , archaeologist , and art historian .
Alf Larsen ( 22 July 1885 , Tjøme -- 12 December 1967 ) was a Norwegian poet , essayist and magazine editor .
Niels Henrik Abel ( Norwegian : ( ˈɑːbɛl ) ; 5 August 1802 -- 6 April 1829 ) was a Norwegian mathematician who made pioneering contributions in a variety of fields .
Teja Singh ( Punjabi : ਤੇਜਾ ਸਿੰਘ ) was an Indian Sikh scholar , teacher , author and translator .
Robert Liddell ( 13 October 1908 -- 23 July 1992 ) was an English literary critic , biographer , novelist , travel writer and poet .
Eloísa Gómez - Lucena is a Spanish contemporary writer .
Jean Gaspard de Vence ( 6 April 1747 -- 12 March 1808 ) was a French privateer , admiral and Maritime Prefect of Toulon .
Jean Baptiste Gustave Planche ( 16 February 1808 -- 18 September 1857 ) was a French art and literary critic .
Andrzej Kot ( 21 November 1946 , Lublin ) is a Polish designer , calligrapher , typesetter , typographer , book illustrator .
Leandro Carro Hernáez ( 1890 - -1967 ) was a Spanish communist leader who was active in the Communist Party of the Basque Country before the Spanish Civil War ( 1936 - -39 ) , and later was a member of the Basque government in exile .
Jesús Javier Corpas Mauleón is a Spanish writer born in Estella , Navarre , Spain .
Jean de La Chapelle ( 24 October 1651 -- 29 May 1723 ) was a French writer and dramatist .
Shiv Pandit made his screen debut in 2011 with the critically & commercially successful Hindi film ' Shaitan ' where he got noticed and was nominated for the Filmfare Award for Best Male Debut .
Charles Edmund Brock ( 5 February 1870 -- 28 February 1938 ) was a widely published English line artist and book illustrator , who signed his work C. E. Brock .
Joaquín Bau Nolla was born to a bourgeoisie Catalan family .
Élian Périz Toyas ( born 1 April 1984 ) is a Spanish runner who specializes in the 800 metres .
Adriana Louvier ( Spanish pronunciation : ( aˈðɾjana luˈβjer ) ; born Adriana Louvier Vargas on September 18 , 1980 in Mexico City , Mexico ) , is a Mexican actress and TV presenter .
Claude Garache ( born 1929 or 1930 ) is a French artist .
Włodzimierz Perzyński ( 1877 - 1930 ) was a Polish writer and dramatist , who was a member of the Young Poland movement .
Born in Paris , Véronique Tadjo was the daughter of an Ivorian civil servant and a French painter and sculptor .
Augustin de Beaulieu ( 1589 - -1637 ) was a French general , who in 1619 led an armed expedition to the East Indies composed of three ships ( 275 crews , 106 cannons ) and called the `` Fleet of Montmorency '' , after its sponsor the Admiral Montmorency .
Louis - Ernest Barrias ( 13 April 1841 -- 4 February 1905 ) was a French sculptor of the Beaux - Arts school .
Jean - Baptiste Fossin ( 1786 - -1848 ) was a French silver and goldsmith and jeweler .
Éric Halphen ( born 10 October 1959 ) is a French judge best known as the investigating magistrate in the Parisian low - cost housing scandals of the 1990s .
Jean Alexandre Buchon ( 21 May 1791 -- 29 August 1849 ) was a French scholar born at Menetou - Salon ( Cher ) .
Max Seydewitz ( December 19 , 1892 -- February 8 , 1987 ) was a German politician ( SPD , SAPD and SED ) .
Roberto de Mattei ( born 21 February 1948 , in Rome , Italy , Europe ) is an Italian Roman Catholic historian and author .
Mario Brelich ( 1910 - 1982 ) was an Italian author born in Budapest to an Italian father and Hungarian mother .
Magdalena Álvarez Arza Is Spanish Politician , who from 2004 to 2009 served as Minister of Public Works ( Fomento ) .
Helene Ahrweiler , née Glykatzi ( Greek : Ελένη Γλύκατζη-Αρβελέρ ; French : Hélène Ahrweiler , pronounced : ( aʁvɛlɛʁ ) ) is an eminent Greek university professor and Byzantinologist .
John Turner Hopwood ( 1829 -- 1 Jan 1900 ) was an English Conservative Party politician , and barrister .
Dieter Dorn ( born 31 October 1935 in Leipzig ) is a German theatre director , also for the opera , the manager of the Münchner Kammerspiele from 1983 to 2001 and now manager of the Bavarian Staatsschauspiel .
Giuseppe Jappelli ( 14 May 1783 -- 8 May 1852 ) was an Italian neoclassic architect and engineer who was born and died in Venice .
Utpal Dutt ( Bengali : উৎপল দত্ত Utpôl Dôtto , listen ) ( 29 March 1929 -- 19 August 1993 ) was an Indian actor , director , and writer - playwright .
Joseph ben Abraham Gikatilla ( 1248 -- after 1305 ) ( Hebrew : יוסף בן אברהם ג'יקטיליה‎ , Spanish : Chiquitilla , `` the little '' ) was a Spanish kabbalist , student of Abraham Abulafia .
Juan Antonio Cebrián ( 1965 - -2007 ) was a Spanish journalist , writer and broadcaster .
Rosendo Mercado Ruiz ( born 23 February 1954 , Madrid , Spain ) is a Spanish rock singer and songwriter .
Ignacio José de Allende y Unzaga ( January 21 , 1769 -- June 26 , 1811 ) , born Ignacio Allende y Unzaga , was a captain of the Spanish Army in Mexico who came to sympathize with the Mexican independence movement .
Isabella Camera d'Afflitto is an Italian academic and translator .
Stefano Stefani ( Vicenza , 29 September 1938 ) is an Italian politician and leading member of the regional secessionist Liga Veneta--
René Rapin ( 1621 - -1687 ) was a French Jesuit and writer .
Sir Matthew Decker , 1st Baronet ( 1679 -- 18 March 1749 ) was an English merchant and writer on trade .
Michel Fourniret ( born 4 April 1942 ) is a convicted French serial killer who confessed in June and July 2004 to kidnapping , raping and murdering nine girls in a span of 14 years from the 1980s to the 2000s .
Alice Albinia ( born London , 1976 ) is an English journalist and author whose first book , Empires of the Indus , won several awards .
Robert Cibis ( born 21 March 1973 ) is a German film director and film producer .
Antoni Ribas i Piera ( 27 October 1935 -- 3 October 2007 ) was a Catalan Spanish film director and screenwriter .
Philip III of Spain ( Spanish : Felipe III `` el piadoso '' ; 14 April 1578 -- 31 March 1621 ) was King of Spain ( as Philip III in Castile and Philip II in Aragon ) and Portugal ( Portuguese : Filipe II ) .
Veljo Tormis ( born 7 August 1930 in Kuusalu ) is an Estonian composer , regarded as one of the greatest living choral composers and one of the most important composers of the 20th century in Estonia .
Awnsham Churchill ( 1658 - -1728 ) was an English bookseller and Whig radical , a Member of Parliament in the reign of Queen Anne .
Joseph Eyles ( c.1690 - -1740 ) , of Bishopsgate , London , was an English politician and son of Sir Francis Eyles , 1st Baronet ( died 1716 ) .
Laura Freixas ( born 1958 ) is a Spanish novelist , short story writer , and newspaper columnist .
Marie - Esprit - Léon Walras ( French : ( valʁas ) ; December 16 , 1834 -- January 5 , 1910 ) was a French mathematical economist .
Kaori Ekuni ( 江國 香織 Ekuni Kaori , born 21 March 1964 ) is a Japanese author .
Nicoletta Vallorani ( born 1959 ) is an Italian science fiction writer .
Marie - Célie Agnant ( born 1953 , Port - au - Prince , Haiti ) is a French - speaking Quebecer , who has lived in Canada since 1970 .
Maria Konopnicka ( Polish pronunciation : ( ˈmarʲa kɔnɔpˈɲit͡ska ) ) née Wasiłowska ( May 23 , 1842 -- October 8 , 1910 ) was a Polish poet , novelist , writer for children and youth , a translator , journalist and critic , as well as an activist for women 's rights and Polish independence .
Professor Eberhard Kolb ( born 8 August 1933 , Stuttgart ) is a historian , best known for his research of the German history of the nineteenth and twentieth centuries .
Murali Mohan Maganti ( Telugu : మురళి మోహన్ మాగంటి ) ( born 24 June 1940 ) is an Indian film actor , producer , politician and a business executive from Telugu cinema .
Francesco Molinari - Pradelli ( born July 4 , 1911 Bologna , died July 8 , 1996 Bologna ) was a prominent Italian opera conductor .
Fulgencio Coll Bucher ( born July 18 , 1948 ) is a Spanish general who served as Chief of the General Staff of the Spanish Army .
Werner Nachtigall ( born June 7 , 1934 in Saaz , Czechoslovakia ) is a German zoologist and biologist .
Taqi al - Din Muhammad ibn Ahmad al - Fasi ( Arabic : تقي الدين أبي الطيب محمد بن أحمد الفاسي‎ , 1373 CE/775 AH -- 1429 CE/832 AH ) was a Muslim scholar , hafith , faqih , historian , and Maliki qadi ( judge ) in Mecca .
Bengt Hambraeus ( b. Stockholm , Sweden , January 29 , 1928 ; d. Glen Roy , Ontario , ( in Glengarry County ) , near Montreal , Quebec , Canada , September 21 , 2000 ) was a Swedish organist , composer and musicologist .
Meghana Raj is an Indian film actress , who works mainly in Malayalam and Kannada films and occasionally in the other South Indian languages .
Christian Hoffmann von Hoffmannswaldau ( baptised December 25 , 1616 -- April 4 , 1679 ) was a German poet of the Baroque era .
John Scott - Waring ( at first John Scott ) ( 1747 - -1819 ) was an English political agent of Warren Hastings , publicist and Member of Parliament .
Juan O'Neylle ( 1765 -- February 24 , 1809 ) was a Spanish Field Marshal ( Mariscal ) of Spanish - Irish descent .
Francisco Aguirre de la Hoz ( born 1943 , in Ávila , Spain ) is a Spanish lawyer and former politician .
Javier Cercas ( born 1962 in Ibahernando ) is a writer and professor of Spanish literature at the University of Girona , Spain .
Heinrich Decimator ( c. 1544 , Gifhorn - 1615 ) was a German Protestant theologian , astronomer and linguist of Mühlhausen in Thuringen .
Léon Pignon ( April 19 , 1908 -- April 4 , 1976 ) was the French high commissioner in Indochina from October 1948 until December 1950 .
Ralf Rothmann ( born May 10 , 1953 in Schleswig , Schleswig - Holstein ) is a German novelist , poet , and dramatist .
Uwe Nettelbeck ( 7 August 1940 -- 17 January 2007 ) was a German record producer , journalist and film critic .
Jacques de Vaucanson ( February 24 , 1709 -- November 21 , 1782 ) was a French inventor and artist who was responsible for the creation of impressive and innovative automata and machines such as the first completely automated loom .
Anabela Basalo ( Serbian : Анабела Басало ) ( born September 4 , 1972 in Zenica , SR Bosnia and Herzegovina , SFR Yugoslavia ) is a Serbian writer .
Anna Ovena Hoyer ( born : Anke Hanß , aka Anna Ovena Hoyers , Swedish : Anna Orena Höijer ) ( Koldenbüttel on Ejdersted peninsula 1584 -- 27 November 1655 ) was a writer and poet , originally German ; active in Sweden from 1632 .
