Tommy Fallot ( 4 October 1844 -- 3 September 1904 ) was a French pastor who is known as the founder of Social Christianity in France .
Emanuele Severino ( February 26 , 1929 in Brescia , Italy ) is one of the most important contemporary Italian philosophers .
Giuseppe Sarti ( also Sardi ; baptised 1 December 1729 -- 28 July 1802 ) was an Italian opera composer .
Pedro Cornejo de Pedrosa ( Salamanca , Spain , 1536 -- 31 March 1618 ) was a Spanish Carmelite , theologian , and professor of the University of Salamanca ( cf . Salmanticenses ) .
Gustave Roussy ( 24 November 1874 -- 30 September 1948 ) was a Swiss - French neuropathologist born in Vevey , Switzerland .
Jostein Gaarder ( Norwegian : ( ˈjuːstaɪn ˈɡɔːrdər ) ; born 8 August 1952 ) is a Norwegian intellectual and author of several novels , short stories and children 's books .
Vincent Cespedes ( born September 14 , 1973 in Aubervilliers , Seine - Saint - Denis ) is a French philosopher and writer .
Gabriel Liiceanu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( ɡabriˈel li.iˈt͡ʃe̯anu ) ; b. May 23 , 1942 , Râmnicu - Vâlcea ) is a Romanian philosopher .
Comminianus ( also referred to as Cominianus or Comminian ) was a Latin grammarian of the late fourth century .
Conrad Wiene ( 3 February 1878 -- 1934 ) was an actor , screenwriter , film producer and director of Austrian and German silent film .
Eckart von Hirschhausen ( born August 25 , 1967 in Frankfurt am Main , Germany ) is a German physician and comedian .
Gabriele Krone - Schmalz ( born 8 November 1949 , Lam , District of Cham , Bavaria ) is a German broadcast journalist and author .
Robert de Cotte ( 1656 -- 15 July 1735 ) was a French architect - administrator , under whose design control of the royal buildings of France from 1699 , the earliest notes presaging the Rococo style were introduced .
Pedro Agerre , best known as Axular , is one of the main Basque writers of the 17th century .
Raimondo Spiazzi OP ( 18 January 1918 - 14 October 2002 ) was an Italian Catholic theologian , advisor to Pius XII , and Mariologist with over 2,500 publications .
Luc Moullet ( French : ( mulɛ ) ; born 14 October 1937 in Paris ) is a French film critic and filmmaker , and a member of the Nouvelle Vague or French New Wave .
William Edward Robinson ( 1863 -- 10 May 1927 ) was an English merchant and Liberal Party politician .
Hideshi Hino ( 日野日出志 Hino Hideshi , born April 19 , 1946 ) is a Japanese manga artist who specializes in horror stories .
Célestin - François Nanteuil - Lebœuf , known as Célestin Nanteuil , ( 11 July 1813 -- 6 September 1873 ) was a French painter , engraver and illustrator closely tied to the Romantic movement in France .
François Marie Charles Fourier ( /ˈfʊəriˌeɪ , -iər/ ; French : ( fuʁje ) ; 7 April 1772 -- 10 October 1837 ) was a French philosopher and an influential early socialist thinker later associated with `` utopian socialism '' .
István Gaál ( 25 August 1933 -- 25 September 2007 ) was a Hungarian film director , editor and screenwriter .
Hermann - Josef Tenhagen ( born 22 January 1963 ) is the Editor - in - Chief of Finanztest , the German monthly magazine dealing with financial issues published by Stiftung Warentest , the German consumer organisation .
Muhammed Fethullah Gülen ( born 27 April 1941 ) is a Turkish preacher , former imam , and writer .
Jan Evangelista Purkyně ( Czech : ( ˈjan ˈɛvaŋɡɛlɪsta ˈpurkɪɲɛ ) ; also written Johann Evangelist Purkinje ) ( 17 December or 18 December 1787 -- 28 July 1869 ) was a Czech anatomist and physiologist .
Ingebjørg Dahl Sem ( born 27 August 1936 ) is a Norwegian Christian writer .
Pieter Winsemius , professor emeritus ( born 7 March 1942 in Voorburg ) is a Dutch scientist on Sustainable Development .
Louis - Antoine Jullien ( 23 April 1812 -- 14 March 1860 ) was a French conductor and composer of light music .
Poul Erik Tøjner ( born 25 February 1959 ) is a Danish museum director and art critic .
Alejandro Ferrant Vázquez ( Madrid , 1897 - -1976 ) was a Spanish architect .
Stas Misezhnikov ( Hebrew : סטס מיסז'ניקוב‎ ; Russian : Стас Мисежников , born 28 February 1969 ) is an Israeli politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Yisrael Beiteinu and as the country 's Minister of Tourism .
Alexandre Joseph Émile Brumpt ( 10 March 1877 , in Paris -- 8 July 1951 ) was a French parasitologist .
Sir Harry Bullard DL ( 1841 -- 26 December 1903 ) was an English brewer and Conservative politician .
Xu Beihong ( Chinese : 徐悲鴻 ; pinyin : Xú Bēihóng ; 19 July 1895 -- 26 September 1953 ) was a Chinese painter born in Yixing , Jiangsu province .
Thierry Schaffauser is a French sex worker , social activist , writer and actor .
Pascal Engel ( French : ( ɑ̃ʒɛl ) ; born 1954 ) is a French philosopher , working on the philosophy of language , philosophy of mind , epistemology and philosophy of logic .
Viktor Pivovarov ( Russian : Виктор Пивоваров ; born 1937 ) , along with Ilya Kabakov and Erik Bulatov , was one of the leading artists of the Moscow Conceptualist artistic movement of the 1970s .
Michel Sabbah ( Arabic : ميشيل صباح‎ ; born 19 March 1933 in Nazareth , Mandatory Palestine ) was the Archbishop and Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem from 1987 to 2008 , the first non - Italian to hold this position in more than five centuries .
Dick Rivers ( born Hervé Fornieri , 24 April 1945 ) is a French singer and actor who has been performing since the early 1960s .
Eugen V. Witkowsky ( Евге́ний Влади́мирович Витко́вский ; born June 18 , 1950 ) is a Russian fiction and fantasy writer , literary scholar , poet , and translator .
Peter of Eboli or Petrus de Ebulo ( flourished ca . 1196 - -1220 ) was a didactic versifier and chronicler who wrote in Latin .
Alfredo Alvar Ezquerra ( Granada , 1960 ) is a Spanish historian , research professor at the Spanish National Research Council ( CSIC ) and modern history specialist .
Anna Kingsford , née Bonus ( 16 September 1846 -- 22 February 1888 ) , was an English anti - vivisection , vegetarian and women 's rights campaigner .
Karl Sudhoff ( 26 November 1853 , Frankfurt am Main - 8 October 1938 , Salzwedel ) was a German historian of medicine , important in establishing that field as a legitimate discipline for research and teaching within faculties of medicine .
Ilan Halimi ( Hebrew : אילן חלימי‎ ) was a young French Jewish man of Moroccan descent who was kidnapped on 21 January 2006 by a group called the Gang of Barbarians and subsequently tortured , over a period of three weeks , resulting in his death .
Rita Bhaduri ( Bengali : রীতা ভাদুড়ি , Hindi : रीटा भादुड़ी ) is an Indian film and now television actress .
Luca Serianni ( Italian pronunciation : ( ˈluːka seˈrjanni ) ) ( born 30 October 1947 ) is an Italian linguist and philologist .
Albert Guinovart ( Catalan pronunciation : ( əɫˈβɛrt ɣinuˈβart ) ) ( born 1962 in Barcelona ) is a Spanish- Catalan composer .
Inka Parei ( born 1967 in Frankfurt ) is a German writer who lives in Berlin .
Thomas Piketty ( French : ( tɔˈma pikɛˈti ) ; born on 7 May 1971 ) is a French economist who works on wealth and income inequality .
Samuel Thomas Spry ( 25 July 1804 -- 29 June 1868 ) was an English Whig politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1832 to 1841 and who changed party and sat for four years again as a Conservative from 1843 .
Johann Gottlob von Quandt ( 9 April 1787 -- 19 June 1859 ) was a German artist , art scholar and collector .
Alexander William Kinglake ( 5 August 1809 -- 2 January 1891 ) was an English travel writer and historian .
Pierre Kast ( 22 September 1920 , Paris -- 20 October 1984 ) was a French screenwriter and film and television director .
Émile Bollaert was French High Commissioner of Indochina from 1947 to 1948 .
Mathieu Jaboulay ( July 5 , 1860 -- November 4 , 1913 ) was a French surgeon born in Saint - Genis - Laval , a city in the department of Rhône .
Mitro Repo ( born September 3 , 1958 ) is a Finnish Orthodox Christian priest .
Wolfgang Stresemann ( 1904 - -1998 ) was a German jurist , orchestra leader , conductor and composer .
Eugène Burnouf ( April 8 , 1801 -- May 28 , 1852 ) was an eminent French scholar and orientalist who made significant contributions to the deciphering of Old Persian cuneiform .
Jean - Baptiste Berthier ( 1721 - -1804 ) was an officer ( Lieutenant - Colonel ) in the French Corps of Topographical Engineers during the reigns of Louis XV and Louis XVI .
António Mendes Correia ( 1888 - 1960 ) was a Portuguese anthropologist , physician and scientist .
Christian Norberg - Schulz ( 23 May 1926 - - 28 March 2000 ) was a Norwegian architect , author , educator and architectural theorist .
Count Leopoldo Cicognara ( 17 November 1767 , in Ferrara -- 5 March 1834 ) was an Italian archaeologist and writer on art .
Kang Full ( or Kang Pool , Hangul : 강풀 ) is the pen name of Kang Do - young ( born December 7 , 1974 ) , a South Korean webcomic artist .
Merab Mamardashvili ( Georgian : მერაბ მამარდაშვილი , Russian : Мера́б Константи́нович Мамардашви́ли ; September 15 , 1930 -- November 25 , 1990 ) was a Georgian philosopher , Doctor of Sciences ( 1968 ) , Professor ( 1972 ) .
Sreekumar Achary ( born 5 January 1951 ) , better known by his stage name Jagathy Sreekumar , is an Indian film actor known for his work in Malayalam cinema .
Gerd Arntz ( 11 December 1900 in Remscheid -- 4 December 1988 in The Hague ) was a German Modernist artist renowned for his black and white woodcuts .
Anne Pingeot ( born 13 May 1943 in Clermont - Ferrand , Puy - de - Dôme ) is a French art historian specialising in French sculpture of the 19th century and author of several books and catalogues .
Aleksander Kamiński ( January 28 , 1903 - March 15 , 1978 ) was a Polish school teacher , form tutor , author of Polish Cub Scout and Brownie method , writer , historian , Scoutmaster ( harcmistrz ) , and during the occupation of Poland by Nazi Germany , wartime resistance leader under the codenames :
Krikor Peshtimaldjian ( Armenian : Գրիգոր Փեշտիմալջյան , Born Constantinople , Ottoman Turkey 1778 - died Constantinople , Ottoman Turkey January , 1839 ) was a prominent ethnic Armenian philosopher , educator , translator , and linguist .
Jiří Weil ( IPA : ( jɪr̝iː vaɪl ) ; 6 August 1900 , Praskolesy -- 13 December 1959 , Prague ) was a Czech writer .
Ramón Melendi Espina is a Spanish pop singer with rock , flamenco , and rumba influences .
Said Nafa ( Arabic : سعيد نفاع‎ , Hebrew : סעיד נפאע‎ , also Said Naffaa , born 1 April 1953 ) is a politician and lawyer .
Emmanuel Monick ( January 10 , 1893 , Le Mans , France -- December 23 , 1983 ? ) was a French politician and banker .
Alexandre Boucher ( 10 April 1770 -- 30 December 1861 ) was a French violinist , who performed through Europe ; he was noted for having a resemblance to Napoleon .
Kjell Heggelund ( born 16 December 1932 ) is a Norwegian literary researcher , lecturer , editor , manager , lyricist , translator and literary critic .
José Luis Madrid is a retired Spanish screenwriter , producer and film director .
David Dacko ( French pronunciation : ​(david dako ) ; 24 March 1930 -- 20 November 2003 ) was the 1st President of the Central African Republic from 14 August 1960 to 1 January 1966 , and 3rd President from 21 September 1979 to 1 September 1981 .
Tadeusz Iwiński ( pronounced ( taˈdɛuʂ iˈviɲski ) ; born October 28 , 1944 in Piastów ) is a Polish politician .
Evgeny Morozov ( Russian : Евгений Морозов , Belarusian : Яўгені Марозаў ) is a writer and researcher of Belarusian origin who studies political and social implications of technology .
Marie - Joseph Frédéric Villot ( 31 October 1809 -- 27 May 1875 ) , a French engraver and friend of the prominent Romantic painter Eugène Delacroix , was also an art historian , who served as paintings curator of the Louvre Museum from 1848 to 1861 .
Christian Enzensberger ( 24 December 1931 -- 27 January 2009 ) was a German Professor of English studies , author and a translator of English literature into German language .
Din Mehmeti ( 1932 -- 12 November 2010 ) was an Albanian poet from Kosovo .
Catherine Delcroix ( born 1955 ) is a French sociologist whose work employs methods drawn from sociology and biographic tools .
Jimmy Liao ( Chinese : 廖福彬 ; pinyin : Liào Fúbīn , born November 15 , 1958 ) is a Taiwanese illustrator as well as a picture book writer .
Martin Rinkart , or Rinckart ( 23 April 1586 -- 8 December 1649 ) was a German Lutheran clergyman and hymnist .
Michael Brynntrup ( born 1959 ) is a German experimental filmmaker and media artist living in Berlin .
Zahid Hasan ( Bengali : জাহিদ হাসান , born October 4 ) is a Bangladesh actor who has performed in film , television and theatre .
Rodoljub Čolaković ( Serbian Cyrillic : Родољуб Чолаковић ; 7 June 1900 -- 30 March 1983 ) was a Bosnian Serb and Yugoslav politician .
Clara Zetkin ( née Eissner ; 5 July 1857 -- 20 June 1933 ) was a German Marxist theorist , activist , and advocate for women 's rights .
Vanessa Bauche ( Spanish pronunciation : ( baˈnesa ˈβautʃe ) ) ( born 18 February 1973 ) is a Mexican television and film actor .
Zsófia Balla ( born 15 January 1949 ) is a Romanian - born Hungarian poet and essayist .
Peter Latz ( born 1939 ) is a German landscape architect and a professor for landscape architecture at the Technical University of Munich .
Wilhelm Gass ( November 28 , 1813 -- February 21 , 1889 ) was a German theologian born in Breslau .
Kathleen Winter ( born 1960 ) is an English - Canadian short story writer and novelist .
Frédéric Boilet ( born 16 January 1960 , in Épinal , France ) is a French cartoonist and a manga artist .
Dame Hermione Lee , DBE , FBA , FRSL ( born 29 February 1948 , Winchester ) ) is President of Wolfson College , Oxford , and was lately Goldsmiths ' Professor of English Literature in the University of Oxford and Professorial Fellow of New College .
František Langer ( 3 March 1888 -- 2 August 1965 ) was a Czech playwright , military physician , script writer , essayist , literary critic and publicist .
Matilde Camus ( September 26 , 1919 -- April 28 , 2012 ) was a Spanish poet who also wrote non - fiction .
Peter Frankenberg ( * 1947 in Bad Honnef , North Rhine - Westphalia , Germany ) is a German researcher , professor and politician ( CDU ) .
Henri George Doll ( 13 August 1902 , Paris , France -- 25 July 1991 , Montfort - l'Amaury , France ) was a French - American scientist .
Edgar Neville Romrée , Count of Berlanga de Duero ( 28 December 1899 -- 23 April 1967 ) was a Spanish playwright and film director , a member of the `` other '' Generation of ' 27 .
Jean Claude Eugène Péclet ( 10 February 1793 -- 6 December 1857 ) was a French physicist .
Miguel Romero García , better known as Miguel Romero Esteo ( born 1930 , Montoro , Córdoba ) is a Spanish writer and university professor , whose work is part of the so - called Spanish post - war theatre .
Claude Dulong - Sainteny or Marguerite - Claude Badalo - Dulong or Claude Dulong , is a French historian born in Limoges on 12 June 1922 .
Antonio García - Trevijano Forte ( born 18 July 1927 in Granada ) is a Spanish republican , a political activist , and an author .
Kaspar Hauser ( 30 April 1812 ( ? ) -- 17 December 1833 ) was a German youth who claimed to have grown up in the total isolation of a darkened cell .
Liviu Rebreanu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( ˈliviw reˈbre̯anu ) ; November 27 , 1885 -- September 1 , 1944 ) was a Romanian novelist , playwright , short story writer , and journalist .
Antoine - Augustin Bruzen de La Martinière or de la Martiniere , born at Dieppe in 1683 and died in The Hague on 19 June 1746 , was a French polymath .
Simon Hammelburg ( Amsterdam , February 28 , 1952 ) is a Dutch entertainer , songwriter , author and journalist .
Gertrud Bäumer ( 12 September 1873 , Hagen - Hohenlimburg , Westphalia -- 25 March 1954 , Bethel ) was a German politician who actively participated in the German civil rights feminist movement .
Juan Ignacio Diego Palacios ( born May 18 , 1960 Castro Urdiales , Cantabria ) is a Spanish politician , engineer and member of the Partido Popular .
Gerhard Lauer ( born November 14 , 1962 ) is a German Literary scholar .
Andrés Palomino Robles ( born 1978 , Barcelona ) is a Spanish comics artist , screenwriter and stand - up comedian , best known for his work on the webcomic Las Crónicas PSN .
Armand de Gontaut , baron de Biron ( 1524 -- July 26 , 1592 ) was a celebrated French soldier of the 16th century .
Sebalter was born in the Italian - speaking canton of Ticino .
William Chester Minor , also known as W. C. Minor ( June 1834 -- March 26 , 1920 ) was an American army surgeon and one of the largest contributors of quotations to the Oxford English Dictionary .
José María Alvira ( 1864 Zaragoza , Aragon , Spain - 1938 Madrid , ) was a composer Spanish , singing teacher , composer and pianist .
Kazimierz Bujnicki ( 30 November 1788 in Krasław ( nowadays Krāslava ) - 14 July 1878 in Dagda , Latvia ) was a Polish writer .
Norman Hudis ( 27 July 1922 -- 8 February 2016 ) was an English writer for film , theatre and television and is most closely associated with the first six of the Carry On ... film series , for which he wrote the screenplays ; beginning with Carry on Cabby ( 1963 ) he was replaced by Talbot Rothwell .
Thomas Bach ( born on 29 December 1953 in Würzburg ) is a German lawyer and former fencer .
Kodai no Kimi ( 小大君 , dates unknown , also known as Koōkimi ) was a Japanese Waka poet and noble from the middle Heian period .
Ahmed Dabbah ( Arabic : احمد ذباح‎ , Hebrew : אחמד דבאח‎ ; born 27 January 1955 ) is an Israeli Arab politician who served as a member of the Knesset for Kadima between 2012 and 2013 , the party 's first non - Druze Arab MK .
Juraj Baraković ( 1548 -- August 1 , 1628 ) was a Croatian Renaissance poet from Zadar .
Unni Mary is a film actress and producer who works mainly in Malayalam films .
Pierre Delanoë ( 16 December 1918 -- 27 December 2006 ) , born Pierre Charles Marcel Napoleon Leroyer in Paris , France , was a French songwriter / lyricist who wrote for dozens of singers such as Edith Piaf , Charles Aznavour , Petula Clark , Johnny Hallyday , and Mireille Mathieu .
Dominik Kuhn ( pseudonym : Dodokay ; born September 16 , 1969 ) is a German producer , language artist , comedian , director and musician .
François d'Orbay ( 1634 - -1697 ) was a French draughtsman and architect who worked closely with Louis Le Vau and Jules Hardouin Mansart .
Ida Baccini ( 1850 - -1911 ) was an Italian writer for children .
Neri Parenti ( born 26 April 1950 , in Florence ) is an Italian film director and writer .
Pope Pius IX ( Italian : Pio IX ; 13 May 1792 -- 7 February 1878 ) , born Giovanni Maria Mastai - Ferretti , reigned from 16 June 1846 to his death in 1878 .
Yaron Zelekha ( Hebrew : ירון זליכה‎ , born July 20 , 1970 ) is an Israeli economist .
Karl Loewenstein ( Munich , November 9 , 1891 -- Heidelberg , July 10 , 1973 ) was a German philosopher and political scientist , regarded as one of the prominent figures of Constitutional law in the twentieth century .
Louis Amable Crapelet , a French water - colour painter , born at Auxerre in 1822 , studied under Corot , Durand - Brager , and Séchan .
Bettina von Arnim ( the Countess of Arnim ) ( 4 April 1785 -- 20 January 1859 ) , born Elisabeth Catharina Ludovica Magdalena Brentano , was a German writer and novelist .
Gustave Goublier ( 15 January 1856 - -27 October 1926 ) was a French composer of popular mélodies , notably Credo du paysan , La voix des chênes and L'Angélus de la mer .
Martha Julia López Luna ( Spanish pronunciation : ( ˈmartaˈxulja ) ; born February 24 , 1973 ) is a Mexican actress .
Clare Winnicott née Britton ( 1906 - 1984 ) was an English social worker and psychoanalyst , who helped establish the profession of social worker .
Kazimierz Andrzej Jaworski ( 1897 - 1973 ) was a Polish poet , translator and publisher .
Francesca Simon , the author of Horrid Henry books , was born in St Louis ; she grew up in California and attended both Yale and Oxford universities where she majored in medieval studies and Old English .
Carl Heinrich Louis Held ( 1 December 1851 -- 17 April 1927 ) was a German photographer and a pioneer of photojournalism .
Robert Needham Philips DL ( 1815 -- 28 February 1890 ) was an English merchant and manufacturer in the Lancashire textiles business , a Liberal Party politician , and the grandfather of the Whig historian G. M. Trevelyan .
Keld Helmer - Petersen ( 20 August 1920 -- 6 March 2013 ) was a Danish photographer who achieved his international breakthrough in 1948 when he published 122 Farvefotografier/122 Colour Photographs , a collection of experiments with shapes inspired by Albert Renger - Patzsch and the poetic realism of the Neue Sachlichkeit movement .
Filippo Acciaiuoli ( 1637 -- 8 February 1700 ) was an Italian composer , librettist , theater manager , machine designer , and poet .
André Boulanger ( 26 July 1886 -- 9 September 1958 ) was a French professor of literature and Latin scholar who shared his activity between archeology and the teaching profession .
Jean Poyer ( alt : Poyet ) , was a French miniature painter and manuscript illuminator of the late 15th century .
Théophraste Renaudot ( 1586 -- 25 October 1653 ) was a French physician , philanthropist , and journalist .
José Mamerto Gómez Hermosilla ( 11 May 1771 , Madrid -- 31 March 1837 ) was a Spanish Hellenist , journalist and writer .
Jagannath Prasad Das(J. P. ) ( born 26 April 1936 ) is an eminent litterateur from Odisha who has dominated the Odia literary scene for over forty years .
Darko Macan ( born 1966 ) is a Croatian author and illustrator who has created and collaborated on comics , essays and science fiction and fantasy .
Mikheil Saakashvili ( Georgian : მიხეილ სააკაშვილი , IPA : ( mɪχɛɪl sɑɑkʼɑʃvɪlɪ ) ; Ukrainian : Міхеїл Саакашвілі ; born 21 December 1967 ) is a Ukrainian and former Georgian politician .
Charles - Nicolas Cochin ( 22 February 1715 -- 29 April 1790 ) was a French engraver , designer , writer , and art critic .
Ramon Pichot Gironès ( Catalan pronunciation : ( rəˈmom piˈtʃɔt ) ; 1871 -- 1 March 1925 ) was a Catalan and Spanish artist .
Aleksandrs Mirskis ( Russian : Александр Мирский , born 20 March 1964 ) is a Latvian politician of Russian and Jewish descent .
N. Kuttikrishna Pillai , better known as N. K. Desam ( Malayalam : എൻ. കെ. ദേശം ; born October 31 , 1936 ) , is a Malayalam - language poet and literary critic from the south Indian state of Kerala .
Henri Donnedieu de Vabres ( 8 July 1880 - 14 February 1952 ) was a French jurist who took part in the Nuremberg trials after World War II . He was the primary French judge during the proceedings , with Robert Falco as his alternate .
Edmond - Frédéric Le Blant ( 12 August 1818 , Paris -- 5 July 1897 , Paris ) was a French archaeologist and historian .
Xavier Niel ( born 25 August 1967 ) is a French entrepreneur and businessman , active in the telecommunications and technology industry and best known as founder and majority shareholder of the French Internet service provider and Mobile operator Iliad trading under the Free brand ( France 's second - largest ISP , and third mobile operator ) .
Louis Chedid ( born 1 January 1948 , in Ismaïlia ) is a French singer - songwriter of Lebanese origin .
Mohamed Nagui ( Arabic : محمد ناجي‎ ) , an award - winning Egyptian writer and novelist , is the author of several well - known novels , including ' Al - Affendy ' , ' Morning Song ' and ' Travel Night ' .
Dolon Roy ( also spelt as Dolon Ray ) is a Bengali actress , based in Kolkata , India .
Domènec Balmanya i Perera ( Catalan pronunciation : ( duˈmɛnəɡ bəɫˈmaɲə ) ) ( December 29 , 1914 -- February 14 , 2002 ) , also referred to as Domingo Balmaña , is a former Spanish footballer and manager who spent most of his playing career at FC Barcelona .
Diego de Pesquera was a 16th - century Spanish sculptor of the Sevillian and Granadan schools .
Jules Alexandre Daveau ( 29 February 1852 , Argenteuil -- 24 August 1929 ) was a French botanist known for his investigations of Portuguese flora .
Sir Thomas Miller , 5th Baronet ( c. 1735 - -4 September 1816 ) , was an English politician , MP for Lewes 1774 - -1778 and Portsmouth 1806 - -1816 .
Eduard Pons Prades ( December 19 , 1920 -- May 28 , 2007 ) , also known as Floreado Barsino , was a Spanish writer and historian , specializing in the 20th - century history of Spain .
Jean - Jacques Nattiez , OC , CQ , FRSC ( French : ( natje ) ; born December 30 , 1945 , Amiens , France ) is a musical semiologist or semiotician and professor of Musicology at the Université de Montréal .
Jean - Jacques Beineix ( born 8 October 1946 ) is a French film director and generally seen as the best example of what came to be called the cinéma du look .
Gareth Hale ( born 15 January 1953 , South London ) is an English comedian and actor , who is best known as one half of the comedy duo Hale and Pace , with his friend and comic partner Norman Pace .
Henryk Grynberg ( born in 1936 in Warsaw ) is a Polish - Jewish writer and actor who survived the Nazi occupation .
Eduard Lasker ( originally Jizchak Lasker ; 14 October 1829 -- 5 January 1884 ) was a German politician and jurist .
Jan Boerstoel ( born 3 November 1944 , The Hague ) is a Dutch writer and poet who is perhaps best known for his song texts , especially for cabaret .
Bas Böttcher ( born 1974 in Bremen , Germany ) is a German slam poet .
Jean de Maillard ( born 15 August 1951 in Saint - Germain - en - Laye , Yvelines ) is a French magistrate in Blois .
Jonathan Garb ( Hebrew : יהונתן גארב , born 1967 ) is an Israeli scholar of Kabbalah .
Since her international breakthrough , Anggun has released five English - language studio albums and six French - language studio albums , as well as a soundtrack album to the Danish film Open Hearts ( 2002 ) .
Travers Christmas Humphreys , QC ( 15 February 1901 -- 13 April 1983 ) was an English barrister who prosecuted several controversial cases in the 1940s and 1950s , and later became a judge at the Old Bailey .
Francisco Zumel ( ca . 1540 - 1607 ) was a Spanish philosopher and ecclesiastic .
Arthur Atherley ( 12 June 1772 -- 1 October 1844 ) was an English Member of Parliament , serving the Southampton constituency three times , as Whig , Liberal and Reformer .
Amleto Vespa ( 1888-c.1941 ) was a mercenary and secret agent of Italian origin , who worked in Manchuria from 1922 to 1940 , first for a local warlord , and then for the Empire of Japan .
Yann Lovelock ( born 11 February 1939 ) is an English writer and translator who later became a Buddhist interfaith worker .
Kokichi Shimoinaba ( April 29 , 1926 -- February 17 , 2014 ) was a Japanese politician and police chief .
David Harsent ( born in Devon on 9 December 1942 ) is an English poet and TV scriptwriter .
Raffaele Ciferri ( 30 May 1897 , Fermo -- 12 February 1964 , Pavia ) was an Italian botanist , agriculturalist and mycologist .
Rocío Banquells ( Spanish pronunciation : ( roˈsi.o βaŋˈkels ) ; born María del Rocío Banquells Nuñez on June 22 , 1958 in Monterrey , Nuevo León , Mexico ) is a Mexican pop singer and actress , best known for her work on television , the stage and cinema of Mexico and Latin America .
Jordi Ramisa ( born 6 October 1960 ) is a Catalan architect , a sculptor and a drawing professor .
Otto Toeplitz ( 1 August 1881 -- 15 February 1940 ) was a German Jewish mathematician working in functional analysis .
Cesare Balbo , Conte di Vinadio ( 21 November 1789 -- 3 June 1853 ) , was an Italian writer and statesman .
Krystyna Krahelska `` Danuta '' ( 24 March 1914 - 2 August 1944 ) - was a Polish poet , ethnographer , member of the Home Army , and a participant in the Warsaw Uprising .
Sir Frederic Madden KH ( 16 February 1801 -- 8 March 1873 ) was an English palaeographer .
José Eduardo Verástegui Córdoba ( Spanish pronunciation : ( eˈðwarðo βeˈɾasteɣi ) ; born May 21 , 1974 ) is a Mexican actor , model , and singer .
Napoleone Colajanni ( Castrogiovanni , April 27 , 1847 -- Castrogiovanni , September 2 , 1921 ) was an Italian writer , journalist , criminologist , socialist and politician .
Conrad Alexandre Gérard de Rayneval ( 12 December 1729 -- 16 April 1790 ) , also known as Conrad Alexandre Gérard , was a French diplomat , born at Masevaux in upper Alsace ( now Haut - Rhin ) .
Madame Ravissa de Turin ( b. late 18th century ; died February 20 , 1807 ) was an Italian singer and composer .
Esperanza Roy ( born 22 November 1935 , in Madrid ) , is a Spanish actress .
Hannu Mäkelä ( born 18 August 1943 in Helsinki , Finland ) is an author of more than 100 books in Finnish : novels , collections of short stories , edited anthologies and children 's books .
Pierre Gattaz ( born September 11 , 1959 in Boulogne - Billancourt , France ) is a French business executive .
Saint Alonso de Orozco Mena ( 17 October 1500 -- 19 September 1591 ) was a Spanish Roman Catholic priest from the Augustinian order .
Isidora Sekulić ( Serbian Cyrillic : Исидора Секулић , 16 February 1877 -- 5 April 1958 ) was a Serbian prose writer , novelist , essayist , adventurer , polyglot and art critic .
Jürgen Roland , born Jürgen Schellack ( 25 December 1925 -- 21 September 2007 ) was a German film director .
Eusebio Poncela ( born 15 September 1947 , Madrid ) is a Spanish actor .
José Miguel Vilar - Bou ( born April 5 , 1979 , Alfafar , Valencia ) is a contemporary Spanish novelist , short story writer , and journalist , specializing in horror fiction , science - fiction and fantasy .
Jan Stanisław Bystroń ( 20 December 1892 in Kraków - 18 November 1964 in Warsaw ) was a Polish sociologist and ethnographer .
Ignacio Jordán Claudio de Asso y del Río ( June 4 , 1742 -- May 21 , 1814 ) was a Spanish diplomat , naturalist , lawyer and historian .
Thomas Holcroft ( 10 December 1745 -- 23 March 1809 ) was an English dramatist and miscellaneous writer .

Roger Leenhardt ( 23 July 1903 , Montpellier -- 4 December 1985 , Paris ) was a French writer and filmmaker .
Vincas Mickevičius ( October 19 , 1882 -- July 17 , 1954 ) , better known by his pen name Vincas Krėvė - Mickevičius , was a Lithuanian writer , poet , novelist , playwright and philologist .
Günther Uecker , also known as Guenther Uecker , ( born 13 March 1930 ) is a German sculptor , op artist and installation artist .
Paolo Frisi ( 13 April 1728 -- 22 November 1784 ) was an Italian mathematician and astronomer .
Teofilo Folengo ( Italian pronunciation : ( teˌɔːfilo foˈleŋɡo ) or ( foˈlɛŋɡo ) ) ( November 8 , 1491 -- December 9 , 1544 ) , who wrote under the pseudonym of Merlino Coccajo or Merlinus Coccaius , was one of the principal Italian macaronic poets .
Pierre - Laurent Brenot ( 8 July 1913 -- 8 May 1998 ) , was a French painter who also had a great activity in fashion and advertising .
Féréol Bonnemaison ( died 1827 ) was a French portrait painter , lithographer , restorer , and art dealer .
Charles Jennens ( 1700 -- 20 November 1773 ) was an English landowner and patron of the arts .
Denis Scheck ( born 15 December 1964 ) is a German literary critic and journalist .
Álvaro Jardón ( born November 13 , 1977 in Oviedo , Asturias ) is a Spanish bassist , who played in the Power metal bands WarCry and Darna .
Richard Pare ( born 20 February 1948 in Portsmouth , England ) is an English photographer known for his work documenting Soviet modernist architecture .
Conrad Felixmüller ( 21 May 1897 -- 24 March 1977 ) was a German expressionist painter and printmaker .
Pál Schmitt ( Hungarian : Schmitt Pál , Hungarian pronunciation : ( ˈʃmitː ˈpaːl ) ; born 13 May 1942 ) is a Hungarian Olympic fencer and politician who served as President of Hungary from 2010 to 2012 .
Charles James Barnett ( 31 October 1796 - -31 December 1882 ) was an English amateur cricketer who played first - class cricket from 1820 to 1837 and a Whig politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1831 to 1835 .
Byung - Chul Han , also spelled Pyŏng - ch'ŏl Han , ( born 1959 in Seoul ) is a South Korean author , cultural theorist , and professor at the Universität der Künste Berlin ( UdK ) in Berlin .
Emil du Bois - Reymond ( 7 November 1818 -- 26 December 1896 ) was a German physician and physiologist , the discoverer of nerve action potential , and the father of experimental electrophysiology .
John Baker Holroyd , 1st Earl of Sheffield ( 21 December 1735 -- 30 May 1821 ) was an English politician who came from a Yorkshire family , a branch of which had settled in the Kingdom of Ireland .
Nahum Barnea ( Hebrew : נחום ברנע‎ ) ( born 1944 ) is an Israeli journalist .
Eric Burgess ( 1920 -- March 2005 ) was an English freelance consultant , lecturer and journalist , who wrote about the Pioneer program of space missions since the first tests in 1957 .
Didier Eribon ( born 10 July 1953 ) is a French author and philosopher , and a historian of French intellectual life .
Diego Marani ( born 1959 in Ferrara ) is an Italian novelist , translator , and newspaper columnist .
Marghanita Laski ( 24 October 1915 -- 6 February 1988 ) was an English journalist , radio panellist and novelist : she also wrote literary biography , plays and short stories .
Felice Picano graduated cum laude from Queens College in 1964 with English department honors .
Jas Gawronski ( born on 7 February 1936 ) is an Italian journalist and politician .
Arturo Toscanini ( Italian : ( arˈtuːro toskaˈniːni ) ; March 25 , 1867 -- January 16 , 1957 ) was an Italian conductor .
Dr. László Kákosy ( Budapest , 15 August 1932 -- Budapest , 29 January 2003 ) was a Hungarian Egyptologist , a member of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences .
Nahum Sokolow ( Nahum ben Joseph Samuel Sokolow , Hebrew : נחום ט ' סוקולוב‎ Nachum ben Yoseph Shmuel Soqolov , Yiddish : סאָקאָלאָוו‎ , 10 January 1859 -- 17 May 1936 ) was a Zionist leader , author , translator , and a pioneer of Hebrew journalism .
Yves Ternon ( French : ( tɛʁnɔ̃ ) ; born in 1932 in Saint - Mandé , France ) is a French physician and medical historian , as well as an author of historical books about the Jewish Holocaust and the Armenian Genocide .
Enric Marco ( born 1921 in Barcelona ) is an impostor who claimed to have been a prisoner in Nazi German concentration camps Mauthausen and Flossenburg in World War II . He was awarded the Creu de Sant Jordi by the Catalan government in 2001 and wrote a book on his experiences .
Vittorio Bottego ( Italian pronunciation : ( vitˈtɔrjo ˈbɔtteɡo ) ; Parma July 29 , 1860 -- Daga Roba March 17 , 1897 ) was an Italian army officer and one of the first Western explorers of Jubaland in the Horn of Africa ( now part of Somalia ) , where he led two expeditions .
Alain Lombard ( born 4 October 1940 , Paris ) is a French conductor .
Prosper - René Blondlot ( 3 July 1849 -- 24 November 1930 ) was a French physicist , best remembered for his mistaken `` discovery '' of N rays , a phenomenon that subsequently proved to be illusory .
Cristina del Valle ( born 1 August 1962 ) is a Spanish singer and activist .
Jean - François - Benjamin Dumont de Montigny , or Dumont de Montigny , was a colonial officer and farmer in French Louisiana in the 18th century .
Ernst Sellin ( May 26 , 1867 in Alt Schwerin -- January 1 , 1946 in Epichnellen bei Eisenach ) was a German Protestant theologian .
Simone Waisbard was a French explorer who spent years in South and Central America , studying remnants of the many ancient civilizations and tribes that have lived there .
María Concepción Enma Iranzo Martín ( born 1 February 1959 ) is a pharmaceutical biochemist and Spanish politician .
François Magendie ( 6 October 1783 -- 7 October 1855 ) was a French physiologist , considered a pioneer of experimental physiology .
Maurice Quentin de La Tour ( 5 September 1704 -- 17 February 1788 ) was a French Rococo portraitist who worked primarily with pastels .
Amalie Skram ( 22 August 1846 -- 15 March 1905 ) was a Norwegian author and feminist who gave voice to a woman 's point of view with her naturalist writing .
Zorayr Khalapyan ( Armenian : Զորայր Երվանդի Խալափյան 1 August 1933 -- 18 August 2008 ) , was an Armenian writer , novelist , dramaturgist .
Raúl Hernández Garrido ( born 1964 ) is a Spanish playwright .
Yusuf al - Khal ( Arabic : يوسف الخال‎ ; December 25 , 1917 -- 1987 ) was a Lebanese poet of Syrian descent .
Doctor Pedro Barriere ( ? in Cuba -- May 18 , 1827 in Milingo , El Salvador ) was a Spanish colonial official in the province of El Salvador .
Emilio Prados ( March 4 , 1899 - April 24 , 1962 ) was a Spanish poet and editor , a member of the Generation of ' 27 .
Riad Sattouf ( Arabic : رياض سطوف‎ ; born 5 May 1978 ) is a French cartoonist , comics artist , and film director of Franco - Syrian origin .
Jean Baptiste Charles Dancla ( 19 December 1817 -- 10 October 1907 ) was a French violinist , composer and teacher .
Suchitra Krishnamoorthi also provided the singing voice of Princess Jasmine in the Hindi dub of Disney 's Aladdin .
Adolfo Suárez González , Duke of Suárez , Grandee of Spain KOGF OCIII ( Spanish pronunciation : ( aˈðolfo ˈswaɾeθ ) ; 25 September 1932 -- 23 March 2014 ) was a Spanish attorney and politician .
Jean - Pierre Changeux ( French : ( ʃɑ̃ʒø ) ; born 6 April 1936 ) is a French neuroscientist known for his research in several fields of biology , from the structure and function of proteins ( with a focus on the allosteric proteins ) , to the early development of the nervous system up to cognitive functions .
António Lobo Antunes , GCSE , MD ( Portuguese pronunciation : ( ɐ̃ˈtɔniu ˈloβu ɐ̃ˈtunɨʃ ) ) ; born 1 September 1942 ) is a Portuguese novelist and medical doctor .
Ivana Brlić - Mažuranić ( pronounced ( ǐv̞ana bř̩ːlit͡ɕ maʒǔranit͡ɕ ) ; 18 April 1874 -- 21 September 1938 ) was a Croatian writer .
Paul Jacques Malouin ( 27 June 1701 Caen -- 3 January 1778 Versailles ) was a French chemist and physicist .
Giovanni Ruffini ( 1807 , Genoa - 1881 ) was an Italian poet of the early 19th century .
Percy Grainger 's father , John Grainger ( 1854 - -1917 ) , was an English - born architect who emigrated to Australia in 1877 .
Edgar Reitz ( born 1 November 1932 ) is a German filmmaker and Professor of Film at the Staatliche Hochschule für Gestaltung ( State University of Design ) in Karlsruhe .
Hermann Staudinger ( 23 March 1881 -- 8 September 1965 ) was a German chemist who demonstrated the existence of macromolecules , which he characterized as polymers .
Friedrich Gustav Emil Martin Niemöller ( German : ( ˈniːmœlɐ ) ; 14 January 1892 -- 6 March 1984 ) was a German anti - Nazi theologian and Lutheran pastor .
Aurelio Saffi ( August 13 , 1819 -- April 10 , 1890 : full name Marco Aurelio Saffi ) was an Italian politician , active during the period of Italian unification .
Zang Kejia ( Chinese : 臧克家 ; pinyin : Zāng Kèjiā ; 8 October 1905 -- 5 February 2004 ) was a Chinese poet .
Rafael Rivelles ( 23 December 1898 -- 3 December 1971 ) was a Spanish actor born in El Cabañal ( also El Cabanyal ) , a small town in the province of Valencia , Spain .
Gilles de Corbeil ( Latin : Egidius de Corbolio or Egidius Corboliensis ; also Aegidius ) was a French royal physician , teacher , and poet .
Victor , Prince Napoléon , titular 4th Prince of Montfort ( Napoléon Victor Jérôme Frédéric Bonaparte ; 18 July 1862 -- 3 May 1926 ) was the Bonapartist pretender to the French throne from 1879 until his death in 1926 .
Giovanni Battista Ramusio ( Italian pronunciation : ( dʒoˈvanni batˈtista raˈmuːzjo ) ; July 20 , 1485 -- July 10 , 1557 ) was an Italian geographer and travel writer .
Minissha Lamba ( born 18 January 1985 ) is an Indian actress who appears in Hindi films .
According to lawyer Alun Jones , representant of the Spanish justice during Spain 's request to Great Britain for the extradition of Augusto Pinochet , Augusto Pinochet had planned an attack against Carlos Altamirano just after Franco 's funerals in 1975 .
Margie Sudre ( born 17 October 1943 in Vinh , Vietnam ) is a French politician and Member of the European Parliament for France 's `` Outre - mer '' .
Hans Hermes ( 12 February 1912 -- 10 November 2003 ) was a German mathematician and logician , who made significant contributions to the foundations of mathematical logic .
Camille Bombois ( February 3 , 1883 -- June 6 , 1970 ) was a French naïve painter especially noted for paintings of circus scenes .
Hristo Smirnenski ( Bulgarian : Христо Смирненски ) , born as Hristo Izmirliev , ( September 17 , 1898 OS - June 18 , 1923 ) was a Bulgarian poet and prose writer .
Gottlob Ernst Schulze ( 23 August 1761 -- 14 January 1833 ) was a German philosopher , born in Heldrungen ( modern - day Thuringia , Germany ) .
Israel Zolli ( September 27 , 1881 ‒ March 2 , 1956 ) , born Israel Anton Zoller , was an Austro - Hungarian Italian doctorate professor of philosophy and author .
Haig Acterian ( also known under his pen name Mihail ; March 5 , 1904 - -c . August 8 , 1943 ) was a Romanian film and theater director , critic , dramatist , poet , journalist , and fascist political activist .
Cesare Pascarella ( 28 April 1858 - 8 May 1940 ) , was an Italian dialect poet and a painter .
Nuccio Cusumano , ( born Stefano Cusumano October 16 , 1948 ) is an Italian politician whose most recent political appointment was to the Italian Senate ( April 26 , 2006 - April 28 , 2008 ) on the roster of the UDEUR party as one of thirty representatives for the Campania constituency .
Arthur Rosenberg ( 1889 - -1943 ) was a German Marxist historian and writer .
Jean - François Jarjavay ( 1815 - -1868 ) was a French anatomist and surgeon who was a native of Savignac - les - Églises in the department of Dordogne .
José Olaguer Feliú y Ramírez ( October 25 , 1857 - November 21 , 1929 ) was a Spanish Lieutenant General , Minister of War and politician .
WHNK is a silent broadcast radio station licensed to Parkersburg , West Virginia , serving Metro Parkersburg .
The Tata Indica is a supermini car produced by the Indian manufacturer Tata Motors since 1998 .
Hugh Conaghan ( born 6 May 1926 ) is a former Irish Fianna Fáil politician and transport official .
Oscar Wendt ( born 24 October 1985 ) is a Swedish footballer who currently plays as a left back for Borussia Mönchengladbach and the Swedish national team .
John Kingsman Beling ( October 29 , 1919 -- November 5 , 2010 ) was a retired Rear Admiral of the United States Navy whose final assignment was as Commander , Iceland Defense Force in the early 1970s .
Vice - Admiral Lord Hugh Seymour ( 29 April 1759 -- 11 September 1801 ) was a senior British Royal Navy officer of the late 18th century who was the fifth son of Francis Seymour - Conway , 1st Marquess of Hertford and became known for being both a prominent society figure and a highly competent naval officer .
The 1st Battalion 9th Marines ( 1/9 ) was an infantry battalion of the United States Marine Corps .
Henry Washington Benham ( April 17 , 1813 -- July 1 , 1884 ) was an American soldier and civil engineer who served as a general in the Union Army during the American Civil War .
Albert Arthur GM was a Flying Officer with the Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve during World War II . In 1944 , he was awarded the George Medal ( GM ) .
The 48th ( South Midland ) Division was an infantry division of the British Army , part of the Territorial Force raised in 1908 .
Frank Ebenezer Hill ( July 31 , 1880 - -September 23 , 1932 ) was a United States Navy Ship 's Cook First Class received the Medal of Honor for actions on board the USS Bennington ( PG-4 ) off San Diego , California during a boiler explosion which killed 62 enlisted men and one officer .
George Simmons ( 2 May 1785 -- 5 March 1858 ) was a British Army officer who served in the Napoleonic Wars and was wounded at the Battle of Waterloo while serving with the 95th Regiment of Foot ( Rifles ) .
General Sir Henry Brackenbury GCB KCSI PC ( 1 September 1837 -- 20 April 1914 ) was a British Army officer who was assistant to Garnet Wolseley in the 1870s and became part of his ' Ring ' of loyal officers .
Major - General Sir Alfred Edward Turner KCB ( 3 March 1842 -- 20 November 1918 ) was a British Army officer of the late nineteenth century , who served in administrative posts in Ireland .
Richard B. Landolt is a retired Rear Admiral of the United States Navy .
Lieutenant - Colonel Edward Arthur Butler ( 4 July 1843 -- 16 April 1916 ) was an English ornithologist and British Army officer .
Frank Bruce ( 20 August 1879 -- 17 May 1919 ) was a sailor and an officer in the United States Navy who served during World War I.
General Sir Alfred Reade Godwin - Austen KCSI , CB , OBE , MC ( 17 April 1889 -- 20 March 1963 ) was a British Army officer .
Brigadier General Pedro N. Rivera , M.D. ( born 1945 ) is a retired United States Air Force officer who in 1994 became the first Hispanic to be named medical commander in the Air Force .
Vice - Admiral the Hon . Charles Orlando Bridgeman ( 5 February 1791 -- 13 April 1860 ) was a Royal Navy officer who saw active service in the Napoleonic Wars and the Greek War of Independence .
Stephen R. Lorenz ( born 1951 ) , is a retired United States Air Force four - star general who currently serves as president and chief executive officer of the United States Air Force Academy Endowment .
158th Regiment Royal Armoured Corps ( South Wales Borderers ) ( 158 RAC ) was a short - lived armoured regiment of the British Army 's Royal Armoured Corps serving in India during World War II .
Henry J. Hendrix , PhD ( born 1966 ) is an active duty United States Navy Captain who is serving as the Director of the Naval History and Heritage Command .
Vice Admiral Kevin M. McCoy is a native of Long Island , New York and joined the United States Navy in 1977 .
Brigadier Sir Charles Loftus Bates KCMG CB DSO ( 1863 - -1951 ) was a British Army officer who served in the Second Boer War and the First World War .
Henry Pinckney McCain ( January 23 , 1861 -- July 25 , 1941 ) was an officer in the United States Army who served as Adjutant General of the U.S. Army from 1914 to 1918 .
Amos Yaron ( Hebrew : עמוס ירון‎ ; born April 1 , 1940 ) was Israel Defense Forces Major General and former head of the Manpower Directorate .
F 2 Hägernäs , Roslagens Flygflottilj , Roslagen Air Force Wing , or simply `` F 2 '' , is a former Swedish Air Force wing with the main base located on the east coast of Sweden just north of the capital Stockholm .
The Bergslagen Artillery Regiment ( Swedish : Bergslagens artilleriregemente ) , designation A 9 , was an artillery regiment of the Swedish Army , which was active from 1943 to 2000 .
51st Infantry Brigade and Headquarters Scotland is an Adaptable Force Brigade of the British Army .
The 16th The Queen 's Lancers was a cavalry regiment of the British Army , first raised in 1759 .
Rev. Walter Colton ( May 9 , 1797 -- 1851 ) was a Chaplain for the United States Navy , the Alcalde of Monterey , and the author of Three Years in California and Deck and Port .
Lord Aubrey Beauclerk ( c. 1710 -- 22 March 1741 ) was an officer of the Royal Navy .
John Minor Maury ( 1795 -- 23 June 1824 ) was a lieutenant in the United States Navy .
Ralph Chandler ( 23 August 1829 -- 9 February 1889 ) was a Rear Admiral of the United States Navy .
Ian Samuel CMG CVO ( 20 August 1915 -- 26 December 2010 ) was a Royal Air Force pilot , British diplomat , and director of chemical and agrochemical trade associations .
The 22nd Guards Brigade was an infantry brigade of the British Army that saw very distinguished active service during the Second World War .
Erhard Milch ( 30 March 1892 -- 25 January 1972 ) was a German field marshal who oversaw the development of the Luftwaffe as part of the re - armament of Germany following World War I , and served as founding Director of Deutsche Luft Hansa .
The Border Regiment was a line infantry infantry regiment of the British Army , which was formed in 1881 under the Childers Reforms by the amalgamation of the 34th ( Cumberland ) Regiment of Foot and the 55th ( Westmorland ) Regiment of Foot .
Rear Admiral Edward Ellsberg , OBE ( November 21 , 1891 -- January 24 , 1983 ) was an officer in the United States Navy and a popular author .
Bolden Reush Harrison ( April 26 , 1886 -- January 26 , 1952 ) was a United States Navy seaman received the Medal of Honor for actions during the Moro Uprising .
Patrick McGunigal ( May 30 , 1876 -- January 19 , 1936 ) was a sailor in the United States Navy who received the Medal of Honor for his actions during World War I.
Edward C. Daly born 27 April 1914 in Pink Hill , North Carolina , enlisted in the United States Navy 13 February 1934 .

Philip Joseph Cox ( 28 September 1922 - 14 November 2014 ) was a Royal Navy officer of the Second World War who was awarded the Distinguished Service Cross for his actions against enemy submarines .
Jonathan Scott Gration is an American retired Major General of the United States Air Force , who worked as a policy advisor to President Barack Obama .
The Chief of Naval Personnel ( CNP ) is responsible for overall manpower readiness for the United States Navy .
John Otto Siegel ( April 21 , 1892 -- August 15 , 1943 ) was a United States Navy Boatswain 's Mate Second Class who earned the Medal of Honor for extraordinary heroism while serving on board of the Mohawk ( YT-17 ) during World War I.
Abbas Babaei ( Persian : عباس بابایی‎‎ ) ( 5 December 1950 -- 6 August 1987 ) was an Iranian pilot and Brigadier General in the Islamic Republic of Iran Air Force , during the Iran - Iraq War .
Francis Amasa Walker ( July 2 , 1840 -- January 5 , 1897 ) was an American economist , statistician , journalist , educator , academic administrator , and military officer in the Union Army .
Henry Louis Bouquet , generally known as Henry Bouquet ( 1719 -- 2 September 1765 ) was a prominent British Army officer in the French and Indian War and Pontiac 's War .
General Sir George Alexander Weir KCB , CMG , DSO ( 1 December 1876 -- 15 November 1951 ) was a British Army officer who served in the Second Boer War and World War I.
Lieutenant General Gerardus Johannes Berenschot ( Solok , July 24 , 1887 -- Kemayoran , Batavia ( Jakarta ) , October 13 , 1941 ) was Commander - in_Chief of the Koninklijk Nederlands Indisch Leger ( Royal Netherlands East Indies Army ; KNIL ) .
Richard Stout ( 1836 -- August 6 , 1896 ) was a Union Navy sailor during the American Civil War and a recipient of the United States military 's highest decoration , the Medal of Honor for his actions at the Battle of Stono River .
The Vice Chief of Naval Operations ( VCNO ) is the second highest - ranking commissioned officer in the United States Navy .
Richard George Voge ( 4 May 1904 -- 1948 ) , born in Chicago , Illinois , was an officer in the United States Navy .
The 88th Regiment of Foot ( Connaught Rangers ) ( `` the Devil 's Own '' ) was an infantry Regiment of the British Army , one of eight Irish regiments raised and garrisoned in Ireland .
Major - General Thomas Brodie , CB , CBE , DSO ( 20 November 1903 -- 1 September 1993 ) was a British Army soldier who saw service in World War II , Palestine and the Korean War .
General William Twiss , ( 1745 -- 14 March 1827 ) , was a British Army Royal Engineer , responsible for the design of many military defences .
The 33rd Army Tank Brigade ( later 33rd Tank Brigade ) was an armoured brigade formation of the British Army raised during World War II .
Major - General John Harold Owen Wilsey CB CBE DSO ( 1904 -- 20 July 1961 ) was a British Army officer who commanded 2nd Division .
General Sir William Houston , 1st Baronet GCB GCH ( 10 August 1766 -- 8 April 1842 ) was a General in the British Army and the Governor of Gibraltar .
William Michael Crose ( February 8 , 1867 -- April 4 , 1929 ) was a United States Navy Captain and the seventh Naval Governor of American Samoa , from November 10 , 1910 to March 14 , 1913 .
856 Naval Air Squadron ( 856 NAS ) was a Naval Air Squadron of the Royal Navy 's Fleet Air Arm .
The 43rd ( Monmouthshire ) Regiment of Foot was an infantry regiment of the British Army .
Brigadier General Philip Maud CMG , CBE ( 8 August 1870 -- 28 February 1947 ) was an English officer of the British Army , who is most notable for setting the Maud Line , an imaginary border in Kenya , which set the original position of the disputed Ilemi Triangle .
The 58th Special Operations Wing ( 58 SOW ) is a combat unit of the United States Air Force stationed at Kirtland Air Force Base , New Mexico .
Admiral George Losack ( d. 19 September 1829 ) was an officer of the British Royal Navy who saw service in the American Revolutionary War the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars .
Admiral Sir John Borlase Warren , 1st Baronet GCB GCH PC ( 2 September 1753 -- 27 February 1822 ) was a British Royal Navy officer , politician and diplomat .
Franklin Wharton ( July 23 , 1767 -- September 1 , 1818 ) was the third Commandant of the United States Marine Corps .
Wayne Maurice Caron ( November 2 , 1946 -- July 28 , 1968 ) was a United States Navy sailor and a recipient of the United States military 's highest decoration -- the Medal of Honor -- for his actions in the Vietnam War .
Eugene L. Tattini ( born April 5 , 1943 ) is a retired Lieutenant General in the United States Air Force and served as Deputy Director of the Jet Propulsion Laboratory from July 2001 to September 2013 .
Konrad Zeller ( 9 September 1911 -- 24 January 1996 ) was a Major der Reserves in the Wehrmacht during World War II , and one of only 882 recipients of the Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves .
Major Friedrich Lang ( 12 January 1915 -- 29 December 2003 ) was a German World War II Luftwaffe Stuka ace .
Capt Wilma Leona Jackson was the third Director of the United States Navy Nurse Corps , serving in that position from 1954 to 1958 .
Lieutenant Commander John Eldridge , Jr. , USN ( 10 October 1903 -- 2 November 1942 ) was a United States Navy officer who received the Navy Cross posthumously for his role in the U.S. invasion of the Solomon Islands during World War II .
Alan Hardaker ( 29 July 1912 − 4 March 1980 ) was an English football administrator for the Football League , a wartime Royal Navy officer , and previously an amateur footballer .
Major - General Sir John Charles Ardagh KCMG KCIE CB ( 9 August 1840 -- 30 September 1907 ) , was an Anglo - Irish officer of the British Army , who served as a military engineer , surveyor , intelligence officer , and colonial administrator .
Renato Sandalli ( 25 February 1897 -- 23 October 1968 ) was an Italian Air Force general that led Regia Aeronautica between 27 July 1943 to 18 June 1944 .
Major - General Anthony Peter Grant Peterkin CB OBE ( born 6 July 1947 ) is a retired senior British Army officer .
Admiral James Vashon ( 9 August 1742 -- 27 October 1827 ) was a British officer of the Royal Navy .

Edward Eden Bradford joined the Royal Navy as a cadet in 1872 , serving on the modern ironclad battleships Hercules , Monarch , and Sultan in the Channel Fleet .

Anthony A. Smalley ( 1836 -- 24 January 1894 ) was an ensign in the United States Navy during the American Civil War .
Lieutenant - Colonel William Blacker ( 1 September 1777 -- 25 November 1855 ) was a British Army officer , Commissioner of the Treasury of Ireland , and author .
The 317th Troop Carrier Group is an inactive United States Air Force unit .
William Faxon ( 1822 - -1883 ) was a journalist who served as chief clerk of the United States Navy from 1861 to 1866 and as United States Assistant Secretary of the Navy from 1866 until 1869 .
The Palestine Regiment was an infantry regiment of the British Army that was formed in 1942 .
The 87th ( Royal Irish Fusiliers ) Regiment of Foot was an infantry regiment of the British Army , formed in 1793 and amalgamated into the Princess Victoria 's ( Royal Irish Fusiliers ) in 1881 .
The Glider Pilot Regiment was a British airborne forces unit of the Second World War which was responsible for crewing the British Army 's military gliders and saw action in the European Theatre of World War II in support of Allied airborne operations .
The 82nd Regiment of Foot ( Prince of Wales 's Volunteers ) was an infantry regiment of the British Army , created in 1793 and amalgamated into The Prince of Wales 's Volunteers ( South Lancashire Regiment ) in 1881 .
The 27th Armoured Brigade was an armoured brigade of the British Army that served in World War II and played a crucial role in the D - Day landings on 6 June 1944 and the following Battle of Normandy until disbandment in late 1944 .

Commander , U.S. Fleet Forces Command ( COMFLTFORCOM ) , is the title of the United States Navy officer who serves as the commanding officer of the United States Fleet Forces Command .
Joe Fowler ( July 9 , 1894 - December 6 , 1993 ) was a rear admiral of the United States Navy , who after his retirement had an important role in overseeing the construction of Disneyland and Walt Disney World .
The 86th ( Royal County Down ) Regiment of Foot was an infantry regiment of the British Army , formed in 1793 and amalgamated into The Royal Irish Rifles following the Childers Reforms in 1881 .
Field Marshal Sir John Forster FitzGerald , GCB ( c.1785 -- 24 March 1877 ) , was a soldier from Ireland who served as an officer in the British Army .

Admiral The Honourable Henry John Rous ( 23 January 1795 -- 19 June 1877 ) was an officer of the British Royal Navy , who served during the Napoleonic Wars , and was later a Member of Parliament and a leading figure in horse racing .
Richard Franchot ( June 2 , 1816 -- November 23 , 1875 ) was a U.S. Representative from New York and then an officer in the Union Army during the American Civil War .
Francis Cogswell ( August 19 , 1887 -- September 22 , 1939 ) was a captain in the United States Navy who served in World War I and was a Navy Cross recipient .
James E. McPherson ( born c. 1955 ) is a retired United States Navy officer , and served as the 39th Judge Advocate General of the Navy , from 2004 to 2006 .
Richard F. Abel is a retired Brigadier General in the United States Air Force .
Guy II of Ponthieu ( c. 1120 - -25 December 1147 ) was the son of William III of Ponthieu and Helie of Burgundy .

Ambroise Vollard ( 3 July 1866 -- 21 July 1939 ) is regarded as one of the most important dealers in French contemporary art at the beginning of the twentieth century .

Jean - Paul Clébert ( born 23 February 1926 -- 21 September 2011 ) was a French writer .

Louis Marchegay ( 5 October 1869 Rochefort -- 15 September 1933 , Saint - Germain - de - Prinçay ) , was a French politician .
Christian Bouchet ( born 17 January 1955 in Angers , Maine - et - Loire ) is a French far right journalist and politician .
