Fily Dabo Sissoko was a Malian author and political leader , born 15 May 1900 at Horokoto ( French Soudan , now in Mali 's Bafoulabé Cercle ) .
Joseph Malègue ( 8 December 1876 -- 30 December 1940 ) , was a French catholic novelist , principally author of Augustin ou le Maître est là ( 1933 ) and Pierres noires .
Edmond François Valentin About ( 14 February 1828 -- 16 January 1885 ) was a French novelist , publicist and journalist .
Auguste Mercier ( 8 December 1833 , Arras -- 3 March 1921 , Paris ) was a French general and Minister of War at the time of the Dreyfus Affair .
Robert Plagnol is a French actor , who starred as ' Boris Vilde ' in the French TV series Résistance .
Brigitte Catillon ( born 20 July 1951 ) is a French actress and screenwriter .
Dieter Aderhold ( 27 November 1939 -- 19 June 1989 ) was a German cathedratic and politician .
Louis - Jean Pin ( born 1734 , date of death unknown ) was a French comic - actor and theatre director .
Jean Lorrain ( 9 August 1855 in Fécamp , Seine - Maritime -- 30 June 1906 ) , born Paul Alexandre Martin Duval , was a French poet and novelist of the Symbolist school .
Jean Luchaire ( 21 July 1901 -- 22 February 1946 ) was a French journalist and politician who became the head of the French collaborationist press in Paris during the German military occupation .
Jonkheer Andries Cornelis Dirk de Graeff ( 7 August 1872 -- 24 April 1957 ) was a Governor General of Dutch East Indies and a Dutch minister for foreign affairs .
Baron Jacques d'Adelswärd - Fersen ( 20 February 1880 -- 5 November 1923 ) was a French novelist and poet .
Henri - Pierre Roché ( 28 May 1879 -- 9 April 1959 ) was a French author who was deeply involved with the artistic avant - garde in Paris and the Dada movement .
Paul Jules Barbier ( 8 March 1825 -- 16 January 1901 ) was a French poet , writer and opera librettist who often wrote in collaboration with Michel Carré .
Jacques - Antoine Manuel ( 10 December 1775 -- 20 August 1827 ) was a French lawyer , politician , and noted orator .
Emanuel de Witte ( 1617 - -1692 ) was a Dutch perspective painter .
Guillaume Le Breton ( sometimes also called Gabriel ) was a French dramatist of the sixteenth century .
Antonio Juliano ( born 1 January 1943 ) is a former Italian footballer who played as a midfielder .
Pierre Louis de Lacretelle ( 9 October 1751 -- 5 September 1824 ) was a French lawyer , politician and writer .
Jacques - Louis Hénon ( 31 May 1802 , Lyon - 28 March 1872 , Montpellier ) was a French republican politician .
Muriel Cerf ( 4 June 1950 , Paris -- 19 May 2012 Anet ) was a French novelist and travel writer .
Yin Xiangjie ( born 15 February 1969 ) is a Chinese Mandopop singer , host , and actor .
Michel Noir(born 19 May 1944 ) is a French politician .
Frédéric Pagès ( French : ( paʒɛs ) ; born 1950 ) is a French journalist noted for his work with the satirical weekly , Le Canard enchaîné .
Philippe Clay ( March 7 , 1927 -- December 13 , 2007 ) , born Philippe Mathevet , was a French mime artist , singer and actor .
Heinrich Krone ( 1 December 1895 in Hessisch Oldendorf -- 15 August 1989 in Bonn ) was a German Christian - Democratic politician .
Maryse Wolinski ( born in Algiers on 3 May 1943 ) is a French writer and journalist .
Rémi Mathis FRSA , ( born 20 November 1982 ) is a French historian , curator , and free - culture advocate .
Gerhard Noodt ( September 4 , 1647 -- August 15 , 1725 ) was a Dutch jurist , born in Nijmegen .
Pierre Joffroy ( born 1929 in Lorraine , France ) is a French author , dramaturge and journalist who wrote for Paris Match , Libération and L'Express .
Shin Kyeong - nim ( Hangul : 신경림 ) is a South Korean writer who is known as a `` poet of the people ''
Joris van Overeem ( born 1 June 1994 ) is a Dutch footballer who plays as a midfielder for AZ in the Dutch Eredivisie .
Bärbel Beuermann ( born 16 September 1955 ) is a German politician ( The Left ) , and was a member of the Landtag of North Rhine - Westphalia as a list MP since the state election held on 9 May 2010 .
Jean de Boishue ( born 1943 ) is a French aristocrat , politician and author .
Louis Mélennec de Beyre ( born 18 March 1941 , Guilvinec , Finistère ) is a French lawyer , doctor , singer and historian writing and performing as Louis Mélennec and active in Breton nationalism .
Baroness Hélène van Zuylen van Nijevelt van de Haar or Hélène de Zuylen de Nyevelt de Haar , née de Rothschild ( 21 August 1863 -- 17 October 1947 ) , was a French socialite , author , a sporting figure in Parisian life and a member of the prominent Rothschild banking family of France .
Themistocles Gluck ( 30 November 1853 in Iaşi , Moldavia ; -- 25 April 1942 in Berlin ) was a German physician and surgeon .
Jean Malaurie ( born December 22 , 1922 ) is a French cultural anthropologist , geographer , physicist , and writer .
Pierre Antoine Monneron ( 16 January 1747 -- 8 June 1801 ) was a French merchant , banker , writer and politician .
Kirsten Lühmann ( born 1964 ) is a German politician with the Social Democratic Party of Germany ( SPD ) , deputy federal chairwoman of the German Civil Service Federation and , since the German federal elections of 2009 , a member of parliament for the SPD .
Jean - Noël Pancrazi is a French author born in Sétif , Algeria , on April 28 , 1949 .
Valérie Benguigui ( 6 November 1965 -- 2 September 2013 ) was a French actress and theater director .
Dominique Laffin ( June 3 , 1952 in Saint - Mandé , Val - de - Marne , France -- June 12 , 1985 in Paris ) was a French actress , who has appeared in 19 films between 1975 and 1985 .
Gabrielle Wittkop ( née Menardeau ) ( 1920 - 2002 ) was a French writer .
Marie - Jean Hérault de Séchelles ( 20 September 1759 -- 5 April 1794 ) was a French judge and politician who took part in the French Revolution .
Désiré Guillaume Édouard Monnais ( 27 May 1798 -- 25 February 1868 ) was a French journalist , theater director , playwright and librettist .
Pascale Fonteneau ( born April 29 , 1963 ) is a French - born journalist and novelist in Belgium .
Maurice Le Glay ( 1868 -- 3 April 1936 ) was a French Army officer and author of works on Morocco .
Yola d'Avril ( 1907 -- 1984 ) was a French - born actress , who appeared in numerous American productions between 1925 and 1953 .
Saint - Amand Bazard ( 18 September 1791 -- 29 July 1832 ) was a French socialist , the founder of a secret society in France corresponding to the Carbonari of Italy .
Ernest Chénière ( born April 26 , 1945 in Rivière - Salée , Martinique ) is a French politician who represented the department of Oise in the French National Assembly from 1993 - 1997 .
Julia Reda ( born 30 November 1986 ) is a German politician and activist .
Simon Tyssot de Patot ( 1655 - -1738 ) was a French writer and poet during the Age of Enlightenment who penned two very important , seminal works in fantastic literature .
Ingo Friedrich ( born January 24 , 1942 , in Kutno - Wartheland ) is a former German ( Bavarian ) Member of the European Parliament .
Sylvia Löhrmann ( born March 1 , 1957 , Essen , Germany ) is a German politician .
Louis Tirlet ( 14 March 1771 , Moiremont - 29 November 1841 , Fontaine - en - Dormois ) was a French général de division and artillery specialist during the Napoleonic Wars .
Paterne Berrichon - the pseudonym of Pierre - Eugène Dufour , born 10 January 1855 at Issoudun and died 30 July 1922 at La Rochefoucauld - was a French poet , painter , sculptor and designer .
Ursula Caberta y Diaz ( born 22 March 1950 ) is a German politician , former State of Hamburg government official and was the Commissioner for the Scientology Task Force of the Hamburg Interior Authority .
Fabienne Keller ( born in 1959 in Sélestat , Bas - Rhin ) was the mayor ( Union for French Democracy ) of Strasbourg , France , from March 2001 to March 2008 .
Paul Bert ( 17 October 1833 -- 11 November 1886 ) was a French zoologist , physiologist and politician .
Seyhan Kurt is a French - Turkish poet , writer and sociologist .
André Salmon ( 4 October 1881 , Paris -- 12 March 1969 , Sanary - sur - Mer ) was a French poet , art critic and writer .
Knut Fleckenstein ( born 20 December 1953 in Bad Nauheim ) is a German politician who serves as an MEP for the Social Democratic Party of Germany .
Ange - Élisabeth - Louis - Antoine Bonnier d'Alco ( 1750 in Montpellier -- 28 April 1799 ) was a French diplomat during the French Revolution .
Pierre - Joseph Cambon ( 10 June 1756 -- 15 February 1820 ) was a French statesman .
Jacques Doillon ( born 15 March 1944 ) is a French film director .
Štefan Harabin ( born 4 May 1957 ) is a former Slovak judge and politician , member of the HZDS party and former Minister of Justice of Slovakia from 4 July 2006 to 23 June 2009 .
Jean de la Roque ( 1661 -- December 8 , 1745 ) was a French traveller and journalist born in Marseille .
Louis - Mathias , Count de Barral ( 26 April 1746 -- 7 June 1816 ) was a French church figure .
Kwee Tek Hoay ( Chinese : 郭德懷 ; pinyin : Guō Déhuái ; 31 July 1886 -- 4 July 1951 ) was an ethnic Chinese Malay - language writer of novels and drama , and a journalist .
Gaston Bardet ( 1907 - -1989 ) was a French architect and writer .
Jean Pelet , known as Pelet de la Lozère ( Saint - Jean - du - Gard , 23 February 1759 -- Paris , 26 January 1842 ) was a French politician .
Florent Chrestien ( January 26 , 1541 -- October 3 , 1596 ) was a French satirist and Latin poet .
Henri Serre ( born 26 February 1931 ) is a French actor who is best known as Jim , a `` vivid , melancholy , and finally tragic figure '' in François Truffaut 's Jules and Jim .
Jean - Jacques Servan - Schreiber , often referred to as JJSS ( 13 February 1924 , in Paris -- 7 November 2006 , in Fécamp ) , was a French journalist and politician .
Alex van Warmerdam ( born 14 August 1952 ) is a Dutch screenwriter , film director , and actor .
Hermann Scheer ( April 29 , 1944 -- October 14 , 2010 ) was a Social Democrat member of the German Bundestag ( Parliament ) , President of Eurosolar ( The European Association for Renewable Energy ) and General Chairman of the World Council for Renewable Energy .
Hermann Nuding ( born Oberurbach 3 July 1902 : died Stuttgart 31 December 1966 ) was a German politician , political party official ( KPD ) and , after 1945 , an opponent of German re - armament .
Jacques Mallet du Pan ( 1749 -- 10 May 1800 ) was a French journalist , who took up the Royalist cause during the French Revolution .
René de Ceccatty ( born 1 January 1952 in Tunis ) is a French writer , translator and editor .
Pierre Abelin ( May 16 , 1909 -- May 23 , 1977 ) was a French Christian Democratic politician , parliamentarian and government minister .
Roger Vailland ( October 16 , 1907 - May 12 , 1965 ) was a French novelist , essayist , and screenwriter .
Antoine - Adrien Lamourette ( 31 May 1742 - -11 January 1794 ) was a French politician .
Paul Ferrier ( 29 March 1843 - September 1920 ) was a French dramatist , who also provided libretti for several composers , especially Varney and Serpette .
Pascale Boistard ( born 4 January 1971 ) is a French politician and current State Secretary for Women 's Rights .
Jakob Smits or Jacob Smits ( Rotterdam , 9 July 1855 - Achterbos ( Mol ) , 15 February 1928 ) was a Dutch - Flemish painter .
Henri Desfontaines ( 12 November 1876 , Paris -- 7 January 1931 , Paris ) was a French film director , actor and scriptwriter .
Jacob Geel ( November 12 , 1789 -- November 11 , 1862 ) was a Dutch scholar , critic and librarian .
Armand Trousseau ( 14 October 1801 -- 23 June 1867 ) was a French internist .
Alice David ( born 22 March 1987 ) is a French actress , known for the television series Bref ( 2011 ) and the film Babysitting ( 2014 ) .
André Lassagne ( 23 April 1911 - 3 April 1953 ) was a member of the French resistance during World War II . The secretary general of `` L'Armée Secrète '' ( AS ) , he was arrested ( along with Jean Moulin ) on June 21 , 1943 in Caluire - et - Cuire ( Rhône ) .
André Velter ( born 1945 ) , French poet , was born in Signy - l'Abbaye in the Ardennes région and was educated in Charleville and Paris .
Mah Laqa Bai ( 7 April 1768 -- 1824 ) , born Chanda Bibi , and sometimes referred to as Mah Laqa Chanda , was an Indian 18th century Urdu poet , courtesan and philanthropist based in Hyderabad .
Caroline de Barrau ( 1828 - -88 ) was a wealthy French educationalist , feminist , author and philanthropist .
Jean De Briac ( 15 August 1891 -- 18 October 1970 ) was a French film actor .
Marcel Herrand ( 8 October 1897 -- 11 June 1953 ) was a French stage and film actor best remembered for his roles in swashbuckling or historical films .
Jules Camille Victor Pomaret , known as Jules Nadi ( Nadi , the anagram of his wife , Dina ) ( 19 May 1872 -- 7 November 1928 ) was a French politician who represented Drôme in southeastern France .
Michel Tronchay ( October 1668 -- October 30 , 1733 ) was a French Catholic priest , writer , philosopher , and the secretary of French historian Louis - Sébastien Le Nain de Tillemont .
Gaël Morel ( born 25 September 1972 ) is a French film director , screenwriter and actor .
Alain - René Lesage ( French pronunciation : ​(alɛ̃ ʁəne ləsaʒ ) ; 6 May 1668 -- 17 November 1747 ; older spelling Le Sage ) was a French novelist and playwright .
Pierre - Jean Samot ( born August 21 , 1934 in Fort - de - France , Martinique ) is a politician from Martinique who served in the French National Assembly from 2002 - 2003 .
Willem Godschalck van Focquenbroch ( 1640 -- June 1670 ) was a Dutch poet and playwright .
Walter Behrendt ( September 18 , 1914 in Dortmund -- July 23 , 1997 ) was a German politician of the Social Democratic Party ( SPD ) and president of the European parliament ( 1971 - -1973 ) .
Franz - Olivier Giesbert ( born January 18 , 1949 in Wilmington , Delaware ) is a French journalist and author .
Anne Bignan ( 1795 - -1861 ) was a French poet and translator .
Erich Lüth ( b. February 1 , 1902 in Hamburg , d. April 1 , 1989 ) was a German writer and film director .
Charles - Louis de Secondat , Baron de La Brède et de Montesquieu ( /ˈmɒntᵻskjuː/ ; French : ( mɔ̃tɛskjø ) ; 18 January 1689 -- 10 February 1755 ) , generally referred to as simply Montesquieu , was a French lawyer , man of letters , and political philosopher who lived during the Age of Enlightenment .
Jacky Nercessian ( or Nersessian ( Armenian : Ժաքի Ներսեսյան ) , b. November 16 , 1950 ) is a French actor who is ethnically Armenian .
Yvan Goll ( born Isaac Lang ; 29 March 1891 -- 27 February 1950 ) was a French - German poet who was bilingual and wrote in both French and German .
Jean - François Roger , sometimes called François Roger ( 17 April 1776 , Langres -- 1 March 1842 ) , was a French politician , journalist , poet and dramatic author .
Sylvie Joly ( 18 October 1934 -- 4 September 2015 ) was a French actress and comedian .
Renée Faure ( 4 November 1919 in Paris -- 2 May 2005 in Clamart , Hauts de Seine ) was a French stage and film actress .
Peter Høeg ( born 17 May 1957 ) is a Danish writer of fiction .
Léon - Paul Fargue ( 4 March 1876 -- 24 November 1947 ) was a French poet and essayist .
Fanny Cottençon ( born 11 May 1957 ) is a French actress , born in Port - Gentil , Gabon ( then in French Equatorial Africa ) .
Edmond de Goncourt ( May 26 , 1822 -- July 16 , 1896 ) , born Edmond Louis Antoine Huot de Goncourt , was a French writer , literary critic , art critic , book publisher and the founder of the Académie Goncourt .
Sébastien Japrisot ( 4 July 1931 -- 4 March 2003 ) was a French author , screenwriter and film director , born in Marseille .
Marie - Louise Damien ( December 5 , 1889 -- January 31 , 1978 ) , better known by the stage name Damia , was a French singer and actress .
Lucie Jeanne ( born 13 March 1976 ) is a French television actress .
Jean - Baptiste Alphonse Karr ( 24 November 1808 -- 29 September 1890 ) was a French critic , journalist , and novelist .
Antoine Omer Talon ( 20 January 1760 in Paris--18 August 1811 in Gretz ) was a French counter - revolutionary .
Pierre Clément Eugène Pelletan ( 29 October 1813 -- 13 December 1884 ) was a French writer , journalist and politician .
Adèle Exarchopoulos ( French pronunciation : ​(adɛl ɛgzaʁkɔpulɔs ) ; born 22 November 1993 ) is a French actress .
Yi Ho - woo ( Hangul : 이호우 ) was a South Korean poet and journalist .
Hervé Morin ( born 17 August 1961 in Pont - Audemer , Eure ) is a French politician , leader of the New Center party and a former French Minister of Defence .
Yiannis Ritsos ( Greek : Γιάννης Ρίτσος ; 1 May 1909 -- 11 November 1990 ) was a Greek poet and left - wing activist and an active member of the Greek Resistance during World War II .
François Nourissier ( Paris , 18 May 1927 - -Paris , 15 February 2011 ) was a French journalist and writer .
Pierre Edmond Teisserenc de Bort ( 17 September 1814 at Châteauroux -- 29 July 1892 in Paris ) , was a French writer and politician .
Christian Jacq ( born April 28 , 1947 ) is a French author and Egyptologist .
Count Honoré Joseph Antoine Ganteaume ( La Ciotat , 13 April 1755 -- Aubagne , 28 July 1818 ) was a French Navy officer and Vice - admiral .
Christian Pineau ( French pronunciation : ​(kʁistjɑ̃ pino ) ; 14 October 1904 , in Chaumont - en - Bassigny , Haute - Marne , France -- 5 April 1995 , in Paris ) was a noted French Resistance fighter .
Michel Houellebecq ( French : ( miʃɛl wɛlbɛk ) ; born Michel Thomas ; 26 February 1958 or 1956 ) is a French author , filmmaker , and poet .
Jean Malonga ( February 25 , 1907 , Kibouende , French Congo -- 1985 ) is credited as one of the earliest of the modern Republic of Congo writers .
Ben Vautier ( born on July 18 , 1935 in Naples , Italy ) , also known simply as Ben , is a French artist .
Peter Wittig ( born 11 August 1954 ) is a German diplomat and has been Germany 's Ambassador to the United States since April 30 , 2014 .
Isidore Isou ( January 29 , 1925 -- July 28 , 2007 ) , born Isidor Goldstein , was a Romanian - born French poet , film critic and visual artist .
Spyridon Lambros or Lampros ( Greek : Σπυρίδων Λάμπρος ) ( 1851 - -1919 ) was a Greek history professor and , briefly , Prime Minister of Greece .
Jean Murat ( Périgueux , 13 July 1888-Aix - en - Provence , 5 January 1968 ) was a French actor .
Max Jacob ( French : ( maks ʒakɔb ) ; 12 July 1876 -- 5 March 1944 ) was a French poet , painter , writer , and critic .
Betty Mars ( born Yvette Baheux , 30 July 1944 in Paris - died 20 February 1989 in Paris ) was a French singer and actress , best known for her participation in the 1972 Eurovision Song Contest .
Christophe Hondelatte ( born 17 December 1962 in Bayonne , France ) is a French television and radio host who has worked for BFMTV since fall 2014 .
Benoît Régent ( 19 August 1953 - 21 October 1994 ) was a French motion - picture actor .
Marianne Birthler ( born 22 January 1948 in Friedrichshain , Berlin ) is a German human rights advocate and politician of the Alliance ' 90/The Greens .
Jan van der Heyden ( March 5 , 1637 , Gorinchem -- September 12 , 1712 , Amsterdam ) was a Dutch Baroque - era painter , draughtsman , printmaker , a mennonite and inventor who significantly contributed to contemporary firefighting .
Félix Deschange ( 9 August 1832 , Rouvrois - sur - Othain - ? ) was a French republican politician .
André Chevrillon ( 3 May 1864 -- 9 July 1957 ) was a French writer , a nephew of Taine , who chose England and the Orient as objects of study .
Christine Carère ( 27 July 1930 -- 13 December 2008 ) , born Christine de Borde , was a French film actress .
Antoine Pesne ( French pronunciation : ​(pɛːn ) ) ( 29 May 1683 -- 5 August 1757 ) was a French - born court painter of Prussia .
Éric Degbegni , better known as Éric Blanc ( born October 10 , 1965 in Cotonou , Benin ) , is a French impersonator and comedian .
Nolwenn Korbell (; born 3 February 1968 in Quimper , Finistère ) , is a French Breton singer - songwriter and actress .
Jacques Defermon des Chapelieres ( 15 November 1752 - 20 July 1831 ) was a French statesman during the French Revolution and a supporter of Napoleon Bonaparte and the French Empire .
Roger Blin ( Neuilly - sur - Seine , France , 22 March 1907 -- Évecquemont , France , 21 January 1984 ) was a French actor and director notable for staging world premieres of Samuel Beckett 's Waiting for Godot in 1953 and Endgame ( play ) in 1957 .
Yves Cochet is a French politician , member of Europe Écologie--
Marie Louise Lévêque de Vilmorin ( 4 April 1902 -- 26 December 1969 ) was a French novelist , poet and journalist .
Paul Frankeur ( 29 June 1905 - 27 October 1974 ) was a French actor who appeared in films by Jacques Tati ( Jour de fête ) and Luis Buñuel ( The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie and The Phantom of Liberty ) .
Wladimir Yordanoff ( born 28 March 1954 ) is a French actor of Bulgarian origin .
Marc Augier ( nom de plume : Saint - Loup ) ( born 19 March 1908 in Bordeaux -- died 16 December 1990 in Paris ) was a French far right politician , writer and mountaineer .
Jean Georges Lefranc de Pompignan ( 22 February 1715 in Montauban -- 29 December 1790 in Paris ) was a French clergyman , younger brother of Jean - Jacques Lefranc , Marquis de Pompignan .
Margot Anand ( born July 27 , 1944 ) is a French author , teacher , seminar leader and public speaker .
Gilles Clément ( born at Argenton - sur - Creuse , Indre , France in 1943 ) , is a French gardener , garden designer , botanist , entomologist and writer .
Yi In - seong ( Hangul : 이인성 , hanja : 李仁星 ) is a South Korean modern novelist .
Pierre Bertaux ( 8 October 1907 in Lyon -- 14 August 1986 in Saint - Cloud , Hauts - de - Seine ) was a noted Resistant and French Germanist .
Jean - Baptiste Jourdan , 1st Comte Jourdan ( 29 April 1762 -- 23 November 1833 ) , enlisted as a private in the French royal army and rose to command armies during the French Revolutionary Wars .
Denys Kostyuk ( born 13 March 1982 ) is a Ukrainian professional road bicycle racer , who rides for the Kolss BDC Team .
Vasyl Vasyltsiv ( Ukrainian : Васи́ль Васи́льців ; born June 26 , 1987 ) is an Ukrainian singer and composer .
Daily at Dawn was an Australian sitcom that screened in 1981 on the Seven Network .
The Law & Harry McGraw is an American TV series that ran on CBS from September 27 , 1987 to February 10 , 1988 .
My Friend Rabbit is currently aired on Qubo , 1TV , Boomerang , Treehouse TV , Fuji TV , KBS2 and Playhouse Disney ( UK & Ireland ) and was awarded the Pulcinella Award for Best Preschool TV Series 2008 , and the Alliance of Children 's Television award for Best Preschool Series 2009 .
Totally Busted is an adult hidden camera practical joke series that ran original episodes from 2003 to 2006 on Playboy TV .
`` Lift Off with Ayshea '' is a British TV show , produced by Granada Television for the ITV network , which ran for 144 editions spanning eight series , between November 1969 and December 1974 .
Kachorra is an Argentinian family telenovela , produced by Telefe and RGB Entertainment in 2002 , and protagonized by Natalia Oreiro and Pablo Rago .
Jackpot Bowling ( also known as Phillies Jackpot Bowling and Jackpot Bowling Starring Milton Berle ) was a professional bowling show on NBC from January 9 , 1959 to March 13 , 1961 .
House Doctor is a television programme , originally broadcast on Channel 5 in the UK .
Cartoon Sushi is an animation showcase program that aired on MTV from 1997 to 1998 .
Forbes on Fox is an American business analysis program , the third show of the Cost of Freedom business block , on Saturdays at 11:00 a.m. ET on the Fox News Channel .
A Very British Airline is a British documentary television series that was first broadcast on BBC Two on 2 June 2014 .
The Philco Television Playhouse is an American anthology series that was broadcast live on NBC from 1948 to 1955 .
Family Theater is a dramatic anthology radio show which aired on the Mutual Broadcasting System in the United States from February 13 , 1947 to September 11 , 1957 .
Second Verdict is a six - part BBC television series from 1976 , of dramatised documentaries in which classic criminal cases and unsolved crimes from history were re - appraised by fictional police officers .
Divine Design was a Canadian interior design show which airs on W Network in Canada and HGTV in the United States .
The Ann Sothern Show is an American sitcom starring Ann Sothern that aired on CBS for 93 episodes .
Uned 5 ( `` Unit 5 '' ) was a BAFTA award - winning teenage magazine show , broadcast live every week on Welsh channel S4C.
Sounds Good is a Canadian music television miniseries which aired on CBC Television in 1976 .
The Comic Strip Presents ... debuted on 2 November 1982 , the opening night of Channel 4 .
Major League Baseball on ABC is the de facto title of a program that televises Major League Baseball games on the American Broadcasting Company ( ABC ) .
The Journey of Allen Strange is an American television series that aired on Nickelodeon 's SNICK block of programming for three seasons from 1997 to 2000 .
Quick on the Draw was an American game show that aired on the now - defunct DuMont Television Network .
The Hartmans ( also known as The Hartmans ( at Home ) ) is an American television sitcom that aired live on NBC on Sunday nights from February 27 to April 24 , 1949 .
Y'a pas photo was a French television program shown on TF1 from September 1997 , produced by Loribel and animated by Laurent Fontaine and Pascal Bataille , with help from Sophie Thalmann , Sabrina Kléber , and Georges Chétochine .
Austin City Limits ( ACL ) is an American public television music program recorded live in Austin , Texas , by Public Broadcasting Service ( PBS ) member television station KLRU , and broadcast on many PBS stations around the United States .
PB&J Otter is an American animated children 's television series which premiered on Playhouse Disney on March 15 , 1998 .
Alan Davies Après - Ski is a British comedy television series that broadcasts on BBC Two from 7 to 21 February 2014 to coincide with the beginning , middle and end of the 2014 Winter Olympics .
Manzilein Apani Apani is an Indian television series that aired on Zee TV , based on the lives of two cousin brothers :
Arthur Godfrey 's Talent Scouts ( also known as Talent Scouts ) was an American radio and television variety show which ran on CBS from 1946 until 1958 .
Auction Kings is a reality television series produced by Authentic Entertainment for the Discovery Channel .
Cuore contro cuore ( Heart to heart ) is a 2004 Italian television series directed by Riccardo Mosca , produced by Taodue and broadcast on Canale 5 during the summer of 2010 .
Best Friends Whenever is an American multi - camera sitcom developed for Disney Channel , created by Jed Elinoff and Scott Thomas and executive produced by Jed Elinoff , Scott Thomas , and Michael B. Kaplan .
Gary & Mike is a television show that aired on UPN in 2001 and Comedy Central in 2003 .
Surviving the Cut was a military documentary / reality television series produced by 2 Roosters Media for the Discovery Channel .
A Place for Everything was a Canadian television nature series which aired on CBC Television from 1964 to 1966 .
The Big Fat Quiz of the Year is an annual British television programme broadcast in the last or first week of the year on Channel 4 .
Hidden Palms is an American teen drama television series that ran from May 30 until July 4 , 2007 , on The CW in the United States .
Shafted was a short - lived British quiz show on ITV , presented by Robert Kilroy - Silk , based on game theory .
O Dono do Mundo ( English : The Owner of the World ) is a Brazilian telenovela produced and broadcast by Rede Globo in 1991 and 1992 .
Liocracy was a Canadian television comedy series , which aired on The Comedy Network in 2001 and 2002 .
Pangarap na Bituin ( lit . The Star We Dreamt ) is a Filipino primetime TV series produced by ABS - CBN , from September 3 , 2007 to December 7 , 2007 .
I Polykatoikia ( The Block of Flats ) ( Greek : H Πολυκατοικία ) , is a popular Greek Comedy television series , originally broadcast on Mega Channel and lasting for three seasons , from October 6 , 2008 until May 27 , 2011 .
Is There Life After Youth ? is a Canadian talk show television miniseries which aired on CBC Television in 1974 .
Theatre Canada , subtitled Canadian Short Stories , is a Canadian dramatic television series which aired on CBC Television in 1970 .
Jumping Ship ( also known as Horse Sense 2 ) is the 2001 sequel to the Disney Channel Original Movie , Horse Sense .
A - List Listings is an American reality television series that debuted October 24 , 2012 , on E!.
Komplottet ( ' The Ploy ' ) was a Norwegian television show that aired on TV3 from 1996 to 1998 and in a revived version in 2003 .
A Show from Two Cities was a Canadian variety television miniseries which aired on CBC Television from 1963 to 1964 .
Win Your Wish List is a BBC National Lottery game show that is broadcast on BBC One since 27 December 2014 .
Preston Pig is a children 's cartoon show , which aired on CITV .
Garnock Way was a short - lived Scottish soap opera , produced by Scottish Television for the ITV network , running from 1976 to 1979 .
The Mike O'Malley Show was an American sitcom on NBC that aired only two episodes .
Ffeil ( File ) is a Welsh - language television news programme for children and young people , produced by BBC Cymru Wales for S4C.
Triple Zero Heroes is an Australian observational documentary series that airs on the Seven Network .
Please Give Me a Job ! is a Malaysian reality television programme produced by Red Communications and 8TV which features 10 fresh graduates vying for job placements in various companies .
The Great Canadian Escape is a Canadian outdoor instructional television miniseries which aired on CBC Television in 1977 .
The Krypton Factor is a British game show produced by Granada for broadcast on ITV .
Suddenly Susan is an American television sitcom that aired on NBC from September 19 , 1996 , until December 26 , 2000 .
Bored to Death is an American comedy series that ran on HBO from September 20 , 2009 to November 28 , 2011 .
Perfect Weapon is a British TV series for the National Geographic Channel .
How Much Is Enough ? is a game show that aired on Game Show Network from January 8 , 2008 to March 28 , 2008 .
La Patrona is a Spanish - language telenovela produced by Telemundo and Argos Comunicación .
Jane the Virgin is an American satirical romantic comedy - drama television series developed by Jennie Snyder Urman , that debuted on The CW on October 13 , 2014 .
California Dreams is an American teen sitcom that aired on NBC from September 12 , 1992 to December 14 , 1996 , as part of the network 's Saturday morning block , TNBC .
Behind the Music is a television series on VH1 .
Great Performances , a television series devoted to the performing arts , has been telecast on Public Broadcasting Service ( PBS ) public television since 1972 .
Live on Tape is a late night comedy sketch show that aired on Saturday nights at 10 pm on KLJB - TV in Davenport , Iowa from 1987 to 1989 , and repeated through 1990 .
Comedy World Cup is a British television comedy panel game produced by Open Mike Productions for Channel 4 .
Sonny Spoon is a detective program aired in the United States on the NBC television network in 1988 .
Bram & Alice is a television sitcom that aired on CBS from October 6 to 27 , 2002 .
The Michael Richards Show is a sitcom that debuted on NBC in 2000 .
Fear , Stress & Anger is a British sitcom that aired on BBC Two in 2007 .
Radiolab is a radio program produced by WNYC , a public radio station in New York City , and broadcast on public radio stations in the United States .
Children 's Ward ( retitled The Ward from 1995 to 1998 ) is a British children 's television drama series produced by Granada Television and broadcast on the ITV network as part of its Children 's ITV strand on weekday afternoons .
Dough Re Mi was an American game show that aired on NBC from February 24 , 1958 to December 30 , 1960 .
Star Awards 2003 was an awards ceremony part of the annual Star Awards held by MediaCorp Channel 8 in December 2003 .
Cold Case is an American police procedural television series which ran on CBS from September 28 , 2003 to May 2 , 2010 .
Hum Aapke Hain In Laws was a Hindi language fictional comedy series which premiered on January 14 , 2013 on satellite network , SAB TV .
Mi segunda madre ( English title : My second mother ) is a Mexican telenovela produced by Juan Osorio and broadcast by Canal de las Estrellas in 1989 .
Ultimate Force is a British television action series that was shown on ITV , which deals with the activities of Red Troop of the SAS ( Special Air Service ) .
Strange Hill High is a children 's animated series for CBBC .
Despatch Box was a late night political analysis television programme produced by the BBC and broadcast on BBC Two between 1998 and 2002 .
Custe o Que Custar ( in English , Whatever it Takes , represented by the acronym CQC ) was a Brazilian television comedy show , produced by Eyeworks and aired weekly by Rede Bandeirantes since March 17 , 2008 .
Million Dollar Password is an updated version of the game show Password on CBS , which was hosted by Regis Philbin and ran from June 1 , 2008 to June 14 , 2009 .
Crossing Jordan is an American television crime / drama series that aired on NBC from September 24 , 2001 to May 16 , 2007 .
4thought.tv is a British documentary television program , which has aired weekdays at 7:55pm on Channel 4 since 5 July 2010 .
Bar Rescue is an American reality TV series that premiered on Spike on July 17 , 2011 .
Dirty Soap is an American reality television series that debuted on E ! on September 25 , 2011 .
Tree Fu Tom is a live - action / CGI CBeebies children 's television program which has been shown on BBC and CBeebies in the UK and Sprout and NBC Kids in the USA .
Fern Britton Meets ... is a British television talk show presented by Fern Britton which was first aired on BBC One during the four Sundays of Advent from 29 November to 20 December 2009 .
Europe This Week is a business news show aired on CNBC Europe and on CNBC World in the US , co - presented by Guy Johnson and Louisa Bojesen , from 6 pm to 6:30pm CET ( 12 pm to 12:30pm EST ) on Fridays .
Human Planet was originally screened in the UK on BBC One each Thursday at 8 pm over eight weeks , starting from 13 January 2011 .
Pardon My Genie ( 1972 - -73 ) was a children 's comedy series produced by British ITV contractor Thames Television , and written by Bob Block who later created Rentaghost .
Aguamarina , is an American telenovela produced by Telemundo .
Phred on Your Head Show is an American children 's television series that aired from 1999 to 2002 on the Noggin television channel ( now Nick Jr. ) .
Main Street Mysteries is a television series airing on Investigation Discovery hosted by Craig Lemons .
A Hatful of Music was a Canadian musical variety television series which aired on CBC Television in 1960 .
I 'm with Busey was a comedy / documentary television show which aired on Comedy Central in the summer of 2003 .
Glenview High is an Australian television drama series produced by the Reg Grundy Organisation for the Seven Network between 1977 and 1978 .
Flying Wild Alaska is a documentary television series that aired on Discovery Channel in 2011 and 2012 .
Children 's Cinema is a Canadian children 's film television series which aired on CBC Television from 1969 to 1975 .
Idea Jalsa is a music reality series on Indian classical music aired on Zee TV .
Adelaide Tonight was a nightly variety show , running four days a weekat 9.30 pm on Nine Network , NWS-9 Adelaide .
1000 Ways to Die is an anthology television series that premiered on Spike on May 14 , 2008 , and ended on July 15 , 2012 .
Bet ng Bayan ( Bet of the Nation ) is a Philippine reality talent show that currently airs on GMA Network .
Micallef Tonight was a short - lived Aria Award -- winning Australian variety show that aired on the Nine Network in 2003 .
Angela 's Eyes is an American television crime drama that premiered on July 16 , 2006 on Lifetime , running for 13 episodes .
On 12 March 2006 , ITV began simulcasting Toonattik on the CITV Channel , allowing younger Sky Digital , Virgin Media and Freeview viewers to access the show through the children 's section of the EPG for the first time .
Artit Ching Duang ( Thai : อาทิตย์ชิงดวง ; rtgs : Athit Ching Duang `` Feuding Sun '' ) is a Thai lakorn produced and broadcast in Royal Thai Army Radio and Television Channel 5 .
Creepschool is a Swedish , French and Canadian animated series by Alphanim , Cinar , Happy Life and France 3 about four kids who find themselves at a spooky boarding school .
December Bride is an American sitcom that aired on the CBS television network from 1954 to 1959 , adapted from the original CBS radio network series that aired from June 1952 through September 1953 .
The Jennie Project is a Disney Channel Original Movie that was released in the summer of 2001 .
The Money Club was a business news talk show aired weekdays from 7 to 7:30 PM ET on CNBC until c. 1997 .
Good Game is an Australian television gaming programme produced by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation ( ABC ) , airing on ABC2 .
Sineserye Presents is a Philippine primetime soap opera broadcast by ABS - CBN .
Donald Duck Presents is a television series that aired on The Disney Channel beginning in 1983 and which featured classic Disney animated shorts .
The Jeselnik Offensive was an American late - night television program that aired on Comedy Central .
The Adventures of Champion is an American children 's Western series that aired from September 23 , 1955 to March 3 , 1956 for 26 episodes on CBS .
The Kelly File is an American news television program hosted by journalist and former attorney Megyn Kelly on the Fox News Channel .
`` Fucking Boyfriend '' is the name of a song by American duo The Bird and the Bee .
`` Crazy Water '' is a song by Elton John with lyrics written by Bernie Taupin .
Vratićeš se Satane is the third album by the Serbian noise - rock band Klopka Za Pionira , released in 2005 ( see 2005 in music ) on the Ne - ton independent label .

`` Shining Light '' is a song by Ash , which was released as the first single from their album Free All Angels .

Are You Okay ? is the fourth album by art - funk ensemble Was ( Not Was ) .
The Dark Masquerade is an EP album by Destini Beard that blends her original lyrics and vocals with previously recorded songs from Midnight Syndicate and a previously unreleased remix .
Willie Remembers is the fifth album of the group Rare Earth .
Avantcore is a single by underground hip hop artist Busdriver from his album Fear of a Black Tangent .
Atomic Arena is a 1988 heavy metal album released by the Christian metal band Barren Cross .
Doom of Destiny , released in 2007 , is the eleventh full - length album by the German power metal band Axxis .
Andrew Wells is a fictional character in the television series Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Angel , played by Tom Lenk .
`` Moro Mou '' ( My Baby ) is a song released by Greek - Swedish duo Antique .
My New Time is the third studio album by the Dutch gothic metal band Autumn .
Tale Spinnin ' is the sixth album by Weather Report , recorded and released in 1975 , featuring the addition of Leon `` Ndugu '' Chancler on the drums .
`` Sanomi '' was the Belgian entry in the Eurovision Song Contest 2003 , which ranked second in the Contest , performed in a constructed language by the six - piece band Urban Trad .
`` Kehidupan '' ( `` Life '' ) is a 1988 single by God Bless from their third album , Semut Hitam ( Black Ants ) .
Love - Itis is a song written by Harvey Scales and Albert Vance ( with Rudy Jacobs also initially acknowledged as a co - writer ) , originally recorded by Harvey Scales and The Seven Sounds .
`` Soldier 's Plea '' is a 1962 single released by singer Marvin Gaye as Tamla 54063 , and was the last non - charted early single Marvin released prior to releasing his first hit single , `` Stubborn Kind of Fellow '' , later that year .
`` I Do n't Ever Want to See You Again '' is a song performed by American contemporary R&B singer Uncle Sam .
`` Who Do You Think You 're Foolin ' '' is a song by American singer Donna Summer from her album The Wanderer .
`` Please Come Home for Christmas '' is a Christmas song , released in 1960 , by the American blues singer and pianist Charles Brown .
Live at Carlos 1 is a live album by the American jazz violinist Billy Bang recorded in 1986 and released on the Italian Soul Note label .
`` Dance the Way I Feel '' is the debut single from British synthpop band Ou Est Le Swimming Pool .
`` Boľavé námestie '' ( English : Sore Square ) is the debut solo single by the female singer Marika Gombitová released on OPUS in 1977 .
Accept the Fact is the third studio album from power metal band Warmen .
Looking for ... the Best of David Hasselhoff is an album released by David Hasselhoff in 1995 .
`` Let Me Take You Dancing '' is a song co - written and recorded by Canadian artist Bryan Adams .
`` Heaven Knows I 'm Missing Him Now '' is the twenty - third single by 1960s British girl singer Sandie Shaw , and her final single of that decade , marking the end of a string of singles which had made her the most successful British female singer of that era .
`` Suddenly I See '' is a song by Scottish singer - songwriter KT Tunstall and is featured on her debut album , Eye to the Telescope .
Mental Jewelry is the first album the band Live released under the name Live , released on December 31 , 1991 .
`` El Mareo '' is a song by South American band Bajofondo featuring vocals by the famous Argentine rock musician Gustavo Cerati .
El Kilo is the third album by Orishas , a Cuban hip hop group based in France .
The Pops Goes Country is the title of the first collaborative recording by guitarist Chet Atkins and Arthur Fiedler and the Boston Pops orchestra .
Buster Goes Berserk is the second album from Buster Poindexter , an alter ego of singer David Johansen .
Sound Pieces is an album by American jazz composer , conductor and arranger Oliver Nelson featuring performances recorded in 1966 for the Impulse ! label .
A Hostage and the Meaning of Life is an album by the rock band Brazil that deals with themes of technology , dehumanization , and frustration .
I Know You 're Married But I 've Got Feelings Too is the second full - length album of Canadian - American singer - songwriter Martha Wainwright .
Zero Set was a turning point for Moebius and Plank , a fact lamented by Steven and Alan Freeman in their book The Crack In The Cosmic Egg .
The Healing Process is the second studio album by the Canadian deathcore band Despised Icon .
5th Dog Let Loose is the second album by rapper Flesh - n - Bone from the rap group Bone Thugs - n - Harmony .

R. Rahman , penned by former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi and performed by several leading Tamil artistes of over three generations .

Yama Buddha was born in Leguwa , Dhankuta , the son of a Nepalese politician Ambika Prasad Adhikari .
Anne Ewing was born Ann Drayton Heuser on November 19 , 1930 in the upstairs bedroom of her family 's home located in Wytheville , Virginia .
William Francis Barry was born in London , England , to Irish Catholic parents ( from Liscarroll , Co. Cork ) on 21 April 1849 .
Juan Vargas was born on an egg ranch in National City , California , where he grew up very poor .
Blanche Whiffen , better known as Mrs. Thomas Whiffen , ( 1845 - -1936 ) was an American actress born in London .
Dietmar Feichtinger ( born 18 November 1961 in Bruck an der Mur ) is an Austrian architect established since 1989 in Paris .
Lisa Nankivil ( born 1958 , Minneapolis , Minn. ) is a contemporary American painter and printmaker .
Edward Leigh Chase was born in Elkhart Lake , Sheboygan County , Wisconsin , the third child of Grace ( née Metcalfe ) and chemist Charles Denison Chase .
Gian - Franco Kasper ( born 24 January 1944 in St. Moritz ) is a Swiss ski official who has been president of the International Ski Federation ( FIS ) since 1998 .
Nevio Pizzolitto ( born August 26 , 1976 in Montreal , Quebec ) is a Canadian soccer player who most recently played for Montreal Impact in the North American Soccer League .
Patrick Tolhoek ( born Yerseke , 26 June 1965 ) is a retired Dutch professional cyclist .
Zeynab Jalalian ( Zeynep Celaliyan , Persian : زينب جلاليان‎‎ ; born 1982 in Maku ) , is a Kurdish Iranian , often wrongly described as a political activist .
Oscar Cullmann ( 25 February 1902 , Strasbourg -- 16 January 1999 , Chamonix ) was a Christian theologian in the Lutheran tradition .
Riva Lehrer ( born in 1958 in Cincinnati , Ohio ) is an American painter , writer , teacher , and speaker .
Urs Noel Glutz von Blotzheim ( born December 18 , 1932 , in Solothurn ) is a Swiss zoologist , who is primarily known for his ornithological work .
Jenny Fulle ( born in San Francisco , California ) is an American woman who , at the age of eleven , became the first girl to play Little League baseball legally in the United States .
Laurie Simmons was born in 1949 on Long Island , New York , the daughter of Dorothy `` Dottie '' , a housewife , and Samuel Ira `` Sam '' Simmons , a dentist .
Harry Benjamin Inigo Triggs was born in Chiswick , London , on 28 February 1876 , to parents James Triggs , carpet agent , and his wife Celia Anne , née Bryant .
Cary Lawrence is a Canadian actress born May 28 , 1964 in Montreal and is best known for her role as Davenport on Nickelodeon 's hit show Space Cases .
José Ramón Carabante ( born 1952 in Málaga ) is a Spanish businessman , who owned the Hispania Racing Formula One team .
Tashu Kaushik was born in Kanpur , Uttar Pradesh , to Rakesh Goud , a businessman .
Dagmar Bláhová ( born 8 March 1949 ) , Liberec , Czechoslovakia ) is a Czech - born Australian television actress notable for her appearance as original character Maria Ramsay in the popular Australian television soap opera , Neighbours .
Ali Merdan ( 1904 - -1981 ) ( Kurdish : عه‌لی مه‌ردان‎ ) is a Kurdish musician who was born in Kirkuk , widely regarded as the man who revolutionized the maqam .
Lucy Clarkson ( born 6 July 1982 , Rotherham , South Yorkshire ) is an English model .
Linda Nagata ( born November 7 , 1960 in San Diego , California ) is a Hawaii - based American author of speculative fiction , science fiction , and fantasy novels , novellas , and short stories .
Noora Laukkanen ( born February 3 , 1993 in Helsinki ) is a Finnish swimmer who competes in the Women 's 400 m Individual Medley .
Roger Greenwald was born in New Jersey , where his father , a physicist , worked at the Fort Monmouth Signal Labs .
Dhalia was born in Medan , northern Sumatra , on 10 February 1925 , to Tengku Katam .

Chase was born in Somersworth , New Hampshire , on March 8 , 1888 , to public accountant Harvey Stuart Chase and Aaronette Rowe .

Phil Chard ( born 16 October 1960 in Corby ) is an English former footballer who is a former manager of Northampton Town .

Roberto Chiappa ( born 11 September 1973 ) is an Italian track cyclist born in Terni .
Nicolas Gisin ( born 1952 ) is a Swiss physicist and professor at the University of Geneva working on quantum information and communication , .
Ishi ( c. 1861 -- March 25 , 1916 ) was the last member of the Yahi , a group of the Yana of the U.S. state of California .

Leach was born in Sidmouth , Devon , the youngest of three children and the son of William Edmund Leach and Mildred Brierley .

Benjamin Ruggles Woodbridge ( March 5 , 1739 -- March 8 , 1819 ) of South Hadley , Massachusetts , practiced medicine and law , was a colonel in the Massachusetts militia during the American Revolutionary War , and was a commander at the Battle of Bunker Hill .

Pan Bouyoucas ( born 16 August 1946 in Lebanon ) is a Greek - Canadian author , playwright and translator .
Daniel Walker Howe ( born January 10 , 1937 in Ogden , Utah ) is an American historian , who specializes in the early national period of U.S. history , with a particular interest in its intellectual and religious dimensions .
Ladislaus von Rabcewicz ( * June 12 , 1893 , in St. Kunigund ( Slovene : Sveta Kungota ) , nearby Maribor ; † December 19 , 1975 ) was an Austrian engineer and university professor at the Vienna University of Technology .
Tsui Ping 's family originates from Jiangsu , China , but she was born in Harbin in 1938 , where the family resided while her father was on business .
Ching - Yun Hu ( Chinese : 胡瀞云 ) is a Taiwanese born classical pianist , winner of the 2008 Arthur Rubinstein International Piano Competition , Founder and Artistic Director Yun - Hsiang International Music Festival in Taipei and Winner of the 2012 Golden Melody Award for Best Classical Album .
Otelo Saraiva de Carvalho was born in Lourenço Marques , Portuguese Mozambique ( now Maputo , Mozambique ) , of Luso - Goan ( Portuguese India ) ancestry .
Salomon Garf ( 6 December 1879 , Amsterdam -- 27 August 1943 , Auschwitz ) was a Dutch painter and graphic artist ; known for his portraits and still lifes .
Billy Newton - Davis ( born April 26 , 1951 in Cleveland , Ohio , United States ) is a Canadian R&B , jazz and gospel singer - songwriter .
Harvey Walden IV ( born December 21 , 1966 in Chicago , Illinois ) is a former United States Marine drill instructor , author , actor and television host .
Lim Nee Soon ( Chinese : 林義順 ; pinyin : Lín Yìshùn ; born November 12 , 1879 - died March 20 , 1936 ) was a Singaporean merchant who promoted social and community matters , and was a respected community leader in Singapore .
José Horacio Chiorazzo ( born June 9 , 1976 in Buenos Aires ) is an Argentine striker .
Dyego Rocha Coelho or simply Coelho ( born 22 March 1983 in São Paulo ) , is a Brazilian right - back who currently plays for Atlético Sorocaba .
Born in Oakland , Mississippi , Dunbar Rowland was the youngest son of physician William Brewer Rowland and Mary Bryan Rowland .
Shaam was born on 4 April 1977 in Madurai , Tamil Nadu , into a Tamil - speaking family ; his father hails from Madurai , while his mother is from Tirupattur .
Scipione Rebiba was born in the village ( borgo , vico ) of San Marco d'Alunzio , in Sicily .
Oksana Shachko ( Ukrainian : Оксана Шачко ; born Khmelnytskyi 31 January 1987 ) is a Ukrainian artist and activist with FEMEN .
Ian Rubin ( born 17 April 1973 in Odessa , Ukraine ) is an Australian former rugby league footballer of the 1990s .
Dr. Theodorus van Kooten ( Leeuwarden , 22 October 1749 -- Bennebroek , 1 February 1813 ) was a Dutch poet , professor and politician .
Nick Nuyens ( born 5 May 1980 in Lier ) is a Belgian former professional road racing cyclist who last rode for UCI ProTeam Cannondale - Garmin .
Benoit Valentin ( born December 8 , 1992 in Écully ) is a French freestyle skier , specializing in halfpipe .
Born in Lista , Vest - Agder , Odd Starheim was the son of ship captain Kjetil Starheim and his wife Amalie , née Leonhardsen .

Nic Nolan ( born 1 May 1958 in Chiswick , London , England ) is an Australian broadcast journalist and communications consultant .
Tom Denney ( born November 23 , 1982 ) is an American musician from Ocala , Florida .
Mike Ring ( born 13 February 1961 ) is a former English footballer who played in the Football League for Brighton & Hove Albion , Hill City , Bolton Wanderers and Aldershot .
Celso Murilo , born Celso Pereira Levenhagen ( 9 March 1940 , Baependi ) , is a Brazilian musician , composer and arranger .

Stephanie Chambers ( born 9 March 1971 ) is an English actress , born in Birmingham , Warwickshire .
Khaled Mattawa was born in Benghazi , the second largest city in Libya where he spent his childhood and early teens .

Eddie Steeples was born and raised in Spring , Texas , and was the oldest of eight children .

Séverine Vandenhende ( born January 12 , 1974 in Dechy ) is a French judoka , world champion and olympic champion .

Moussa Konaté ( 1951 -- 30 November 2013 ) was a Malian writer who was born in Kita .

Jan De Cock ( born in Etterbeek 2 May 1976 ) is a contemporary Belgian visual artist .
Paul Kempeneers ( born in Tienen on December 9 , 1935 ) is a Belgian philologist and linguist .

Jitka Burianová ( born 17 January 1977 in Prostějov ) is a retired Czech sprinter who specialised in the 400 metres .

Born in New York City , Constance Binney was educated at Westover School , a private college preparatory boarding school for girls in Middlebury , Connecticut and in Paris , France .

François Dompierre ( born July 1 , 1943 in Ottawa , Ontario ) is a Canadian musician and composer , best known as a composer of film scores .
Thomas Monro was born 1759 , in London , youngest son of Dr John Monro ( 9th of Fyrish ) and Elizabeth Culling Smith .
Harvey Pitt ( b. Brooklyn , New York , February 28 , 1945 ) was the 26th chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) , serving from 2001 - 2003 .
Gigi Padovani was born in Alba in 1953 , and has worked as a reporter for La Stampa for many years , writing articles on domestic politics and society as well as collaborating with other newspapers and magazines .

Hector Rason was born in Cleeve , Somerset in England on 18 June 1858 .
Craig Whitington ( born September 3 , 1970 in Brighton ) is a former professional footballer , who played for Crawley Town , Bridgeport , Scarborough , Huddersfield Town and Rochdale . He has had two children Naomi and Charlie .
Mateusz Żytko ( born November 27 , 1982 in Wrocław ) is a Polish footballer who currently plays for Cracovia in the Polish Ekstraklasa .
Karin Okolie ( Bulgarian : Карин Околие , born May 1st , 1994 in Sofia ) is a Bulgarian athlete who specialises in the 100 metres and 200 metres sprint events .
Jonathan Kovacs ( 1982 , Los Angeles ) , known as J - five , is an American singer .
Tony Bircumshaw ( born 8 February 1945 in Mansfield , England ) is a former footballer who played in the full back position .
Elvin Beqiri ( born 27 September 1980 in Shkodër ) is a former Albanian footballer , who spend the mayority of his career playing Vllaznia Shkodër .
Lene Løseth ( born 26 November 1986 in Ålesund ) is a Norwegian alpine skier who races for Spjelkavik IL .
Wajihuddin Ahmed was born into an Urdu - speaking practising lawyer family in New Delhi , British India , on 1 December 1938 .
Rachel Thevenard is a Canadian actress born in Waterloo , Ontario , attended Waterloo Collegiate Institute , and who first appeared in MTV 's Skins in January 2011 as Michelle .
Angelis Borges ( born Angelis Cunha Borges on 11 May 1985 in Uberlândia , Minas Gerais ) , is known for winning the Brazilian version of reality TV Fazenda de Verão broadcast by Rede Record .
Luca Brecel ( born 8 March 1995 in Dilsen - Stokkem ) is a professional Belgian snooker player .
Robert A. Siegel ( 1913 - -1993 ) , of New York City , was an auctioneer of philatelic material , particularly rare postage stamps and covers .
Hans Georg Feichtinger was born in Wiener Neustadt where he graduated from the Gymnasium and received the Matura `` summa cum laude '' in 1969 .
Elaine Princi ( born 14 December 1946 in Chambersburg , Pennsylvania ) is a contemporary American actress .
Kristy Borza ( born May 29 , 1986 in Beaver , Pennsylvania ) is an assistant coach for the University of Pittsburgh 's Division I women 's tennis team .
Martha - Bryan Allen ( also known as Martha Bryan - Allen ) , was born on April 30 , 1903 , to Bryan H. and Rebecca D. Allen of Louisville , Kentucky .
Sean Roycroft ( born 29 August 1985 in Stirling ) is a Scottish professional footballer , who is currently without a club .
Davor Slamnig ( born 13 March 1956 in Zagreb ) is a Croatian writer and musician .
Eugeniusz Knapik ( born July 9 , 1951 in Ruda Śląska ) is a Polish pianist and composer of classical music best known for his 1980 chamber piece String Quartet No . 1 .
Roger Maris was born Roger Eugene Maras on September 10 , 1934 in Hibbing , Minnesota , later Anglicizing his last name to `` Maris '' .
Ian Christe ( born 1970 in Biel / Bienne , Switzerland ) is an author , disc jockey and the publisher of Bazillion Points Books .
Emmanuel Benbihy ( born 6 November 1969 , Paris ) is a feature - length film producer who created and launched the Cities of Love franchise starting with Paris , je t'aime and more recently New York , I Love You .
Barbara Niedernhuber ( nicknamed Babsi , born on 6 June 1974 in Berchtesgaden ) is a German luger who competed from 1994 to 2006 .
Amadou Konte ( born 13 January 1981 in Bamako ) is a Malian - French footballer who previously plays for Minyor Pernik in the Bulgarian A Professional Football Group .
Jiří Stránský ( born 12 August 1931 in Prague ) is a Czech author , playwright , translator , former political prisoner of the communist regime , and human rights advocate .
Péter Pál Pálfy ( Debrecen , 23 August 1955 ) is a Hungarian mathematician , working in algebra , more precisely in group theory and universal algebra .
Lars Lewen ( born October 7 , 1975 in Stockholm ) is a Swedish freestyle skier , specializing in ski cross and a former alpine skier .
Rudolf Seydel ( May 27 , 1835 -- December 8 , 1892 ) was a German philosopher and theologian born in Dresden .
The daughter of Donald and Claire ( Weill ) Lehman , a wealthy Jewish family , Kathy Acker was born in New York City on April 18 .
Gilberto Serembe ( Milan , 17 December 1955 ) is an Italian conductor and professor .
Mel Henke ( Chicago , August 4 , 1915 - Los Angeles , March 31 , 1979 ) was an American jazz pianist , Chicago band leader , composer , arranger and jingle writer .
She was born Anne Raven Wilkinson in New York City on November 2 , 1935 to Anne James Wilkinson and Dr. Frost Bernie Wilkinson , a dentist .
Viktor Khokhljuk ( Ukrainian : Віктор Миколайович Хохлюк ) ( born 22 March 1971 in Rovenky , Luhansk Oblast , Ukrainian SSR ) is a former Ukrainian journalist .
Phill Niblock ( born 2 October 1933 , in Anderson , Indiana ) is a composer , filmmaker , videographer , and director of Experimental Intermedia , a foundation for avant - garde music based in New York with a parallel branch in Ghent , Belgium .
Bárbara Rebolledo Aguirre ( born in Talca on 22 January 1973 ) is a Chilean television presenter .
Pier Francesco Fiorentino ( Florence , 1444/1445 -- after 1497 ) , was a 15th - century painter , active in San Gimignano for much of his mature life , depicting religious - themed subjects .
Sébastien Pérez ( born 24 November 1973 in Saint - Chamond , Loire ) is a French professional football player who started his career for AS Saint - Étienne as a central midfielder .
Oppian ( Ancient Greek : Ὀππιανός , Oppianós ; Latin : Oppianus ) , also known as Oppian of Anazarbus , of Corycus , or of Cilicia , was a 2nd - century Greco - Roman poet during the reign of the emperors Marcus Aurelius and Commodus .
Alex Napa ( born 23 February 1976 in Rarotonga ) in Cook Islands is a footballer and manager , who plays as a Defender .
Bleibtreu was born during his family 's refuge in Marseille from wartime bombing , Marcel Bleibtreu became a radical thinker as a child .
June Wilkinson ( born 27 March 1940 in Eastbourne ) is an English model and actress , known for her appearances in Playboy magazine and in films of the 1960s .
Spock 's mixed human - Vulcan heritage serves as an important plot element in many of the character 's appearances .
Francesco Mazzaferro ( born 1940 in Gioiosa Ionica ) , also known as Ciccio , is an Italian criminal and a member of the ' Ndrangheta in Calabria .
Tom Curle ( born 3 March 1986 , Bristol ) is a former English professional footballer .
Born on 15 July 1897 in Evansville , Indiana , Charlie Wiggins was the son of a coal miner .
Perry Blake ( born May 10 , 1970 ) is an Irish singer and songwriter from Sligo , known for the delicate , downtempo , melancholic style of his songs and his soft singing voice .
Vishnu Prabhakar was born on 21 June 1912 , in the Miranpur village of Muzaffarnagar district in Uttar Pradesh .
Nathaniel James Speas , known as Nate James , ( born 15 September 1979 , Lakenheath ) is a British singer - songwriter .
Adrián Annus ( born 28 June 1973 in Szeged ) is a Hungarian hammer thrower , who was stripped of his gold medal at the 2004 Summer Olympic Games in Athens for a doping violation in a highly publicized scandal .
Béla Fleck was born in New York City , and is named after Hungarian composer Béla Bartók , Austrian composer Anton Webern and Czech composer Leoš Janáček .
Shimonovitch ( later David Shimoni ) was born in Babruysk in Belarus ( then part of the Russian Empire ) to Nissim Shimonovitch and Malka Fridland Although he lived in Ottoman Palestine for a year in 1909 , he did not immigrate to British - administered Palestine until 1920 .
Simon Law ( born 28 May 1961 , Luton , England ) is a producer , keyboardist and songwriter for Soul II Soul .
Juliano Mineiro Fernandes ( born 14 February 1986 in Rio de Janeiro ) , simply known as Juliano Mineiro or formerly Juliano , is a Brazilian footballer who plays for Kashiwa Reysol .
Ditte Kotzian ( born 9 March 1979 , in Berlin ) is a German diver .
Mamnoon Hussain hails from an Urdu - speaking family of shoe traders and was born in Agra , UP during the British rule .
Henry Ernest , Count of Stolberg ( 20 July 1593 in Schwarza -- 4 April 1672 in Ilsenburg ) was a German nobleman .
Sieglinde Hofmann ( born 14 March 1945 in Bad Königshofen , Lower Franconia ) was a militant and member of both the Socialist Patients ' Collective and the Red Army Faction .
Dagmar Neubauer , née Rübsam ( born 3 June 1962 in Suhl ) is a retired German sprinter who specialized in the 400 metres .
Massimo Mazzucco ( born 20 July 1954 in Turin ) is an Italian filmmaker who is known for producing documentary films such as The New American Century and Cancer -The Forbidden Cures .
Eckhard Leue ( born March 20 , 1958 in Magdeburg ) is an East German sprint canoer who competed in the late 1970s and early 1980s .
Kawahara Keiga ( Japanese : 川原慶賀 , also known as Taguchi Takumi or Toyosuke , Nagasaki , 1786 - -1860 ? ) was a late Edo period Japanese painter of objects , social scenes , landscapes and portraits at the Dutch Factory of Dejima , and at Edo , Kyoto and Nagasaki .
Alan Gane ( born 11 June 1950 in Chiswick , England ) is an English former amateur footballer and manager .
Carl Gustaf Ekman was born in Munktorp ( now Köping Municipality ) in Västmanland County to farmer and soldier Carl Ekman and Josefina Säfström .
William Steel Creighton ( April 3 , 1902 , Philadelphia -- July 23 , 1973 , Alexandria Bay ) was an American myrmecologist and taxonomist .
Pearce Quigley ( born in Salford , Lancashire , England ) is an English actor of the stage and screen .
Ernest Francillon ( born 10 July 1834 in Lausanne ) , was the Swiss manager of Longines watches and an entrepreneur .
Shirley Winters ( born February 27 , 1958 ) is a convicted murderer and arsonist from upstate New York .
Niels Kerstholt ( Utrecht , April 2 , 1983 ) is a Dutch Short track speed skater .
Davi José Silva do Nascimento , or simply Davi ( born 10 March 1984 in Fortaleza ) , is a Brazilian striker .
Barry Greenstein ( born December 30 , 1954 in Chicago , Illinois ) is an American professional poker player .
Abbas Bayat ( Persian : عباس بيات‎ , born 14 July 1947 in Tehran ) is an Iranian businessman .
Wong Yim Kwan ( Chinese : 黃炎堃 ; Jyutping : wong4 jim4 kwan1 ; born 1 August 1992 in Hong Kong ) , is a Hong Kong footballer who currently plays for Hong Kong First Division League club Sun Pegasus .
Mohammad Samimi ( Persian : محمد صمیمی ‎ , born 29 March 1987 in Shahrekord ) is an Iranian discus thrower .
Will Saul ( born 1978 , Glastonbury , England ) is a DJ , music producer and the founder of Simple Records and Aus Music ( in that order ) .
Evelyne Elien ( born March 24 , 1964 in Basse - Terre , Guadeloupe ) is a former French athlete who specialised in the 400 meters .
Iñigo Landaluze Intxaurraga ( born May 9 , 1977 in Getxo , Basque Country ) is a professional road bicycle racer , currently under suspension .
Edward Victor ( born 1887 in England - 17 April 1964 ) , born Edward Neuschwander was a notable stage magician .
Iva Bittová was born on 22 July 1958 in the town of Bruntál , Czech Silesia , in what was then the Republic of Czechoslovakia .
Alfred Clive Hulme was born in the city of Dunedin , New Zealand , to a clerk and his wife .
Emma Nevada was born in Alpha , California to Maria O'Boy Wixom and Dr. William Wallace Wixom , who was the physician for the gold mine camp there .
Dan Sperber ( born June 20 , 1942 , Cagnes - sur - Mer ) is a French social and cognitive scientist .
Jóbson Leandro Pereira de Oliveira ( born 15 February 1988 in Conceição do Araguaia ) is a Brazilian footballer who plays for Botafogo de Futebol e Regatas .
Martyn Rogers ( born in Bristol ) is an ex - professional footballer .
Diao Yinan ( Chinese : 刁亦男 ; pinyin : Diāo Yìnán ; born 1969 in Xi'an , Shaanxi ) is a Chinese director , screenwriter and occasional actor .
Jean Balue ( c. 1421 -- October 5 , 1491 ) was a French cardinal and minister of Louis XI . He was born of very humble parentage at Angles - sur - l'Anglin in Poitou , and was first patronized by the bishop of Poitiers .
Corentin de Chatelperron , born in Vannes in 1983 , is a French engineer , adventurist and manager of the `` Gold of Bengal '' project .
Juan Manuel Gárate Cepa ( born 24 April 1976 in Irun ) is a Spanish professional road racing cyclist , who last rode for the Belkin Pro Cycling team .
P. Bhaskaran was born on 21 April 1924 in Kodungallur , Thrissur district .
Carlo D'Este ( born 1938 in Oakland , California ) is an American military historian and biographer , author of several books , especially on World War II . He is a retired U.S. Army Lieutenant Colonel .
Fred Callaghan ( born 19 December 1944 ) is a former footballer who played as a left back in the Football League during the 1960s and 1970s , primarily with Fulham , for whom he made almost 300 league appearances .
George Alec Effinger ( January 10 , 1947 -- April 27 , 2002 ) was an American science fiction author , born in Cleveland , Ohio .

Helen Weaver ( born 1931 , Madison , Wisconsin ) is an American writer and translator .
Kateřina Jacques was born Kateřina Pajerová in the central Bohemian town of Mělník .
Romuald Hazoumè ( born 1962 in Porto Novo ) is an artist from the Republic of Bénin , best known for his work La Bouche du Roi , a reworking of the 1789 image of the slave ship Brookes .
Błażej Augustyn ( Polish pronunciation : ( ˈbwaʐɛj au̯ˈɡustɨn ) ; born 26 January 1988 in Strzelin ) is a Polish footballer who currently plays for Scottish club Heart of Midlothian .
Laurent de Palmas ( born 29 October 1977 in Miramas , Provence - Alpes - Côte d'Azur ) is a French retired footballer who played as either a right or left back .

Rodney Jack ( born 18 September 1972 in Kingstown , Saint Vincent and the Grenadines ) is a professional football player from Saint Vincent and the Grenadines .
Tanguturi Prakasam Pantulu ( 23 August 1872 -- 20 May 1957 ) was an Indian politician and freedom fighter , chief minister of the Madras Presidency , and subsequently became the first chief minister of the new Andhra state , created by the partition of Madras State along linguistic lines .
Kevin Kash is a Brooklyn - born actor who has appeared in various film , television , and theater roles .
Marianne Nölle ( born 1938 ) is a German serial killer from Cologne .
Esther Ouwehand ( born June 10 , 1976 in Katwijk ) is a Dutch politician and former marketing manager .

Janusz Pekowski ( born 22 November 1945 in Golub - Dobrzyń ) is a Polish football player and coach .

Moses Sofer was born in Frankfurt am Main , on September 24 , 1762 , during the Seven Years ' War .

Paul Ehrenfest was born and grew up in Vienna in a Jewish family from Loštice in Moravia .
Jim Novy , whose birthname was Shimeon Novodvorsky , grew up in Knyszyn , Poland .

James Carlile ( 1784 -- 1854 ) was a Scottish clergyman from Paisley .

Cecil Kellaway was born on 22 August 1890 in Cape Town , South Africa , where he gained an early interest in theatre acting , much to the displeasure of his parents .

John Fremont Hill ( October 29 , 1855 in Eliot , Maine -- March 16 , 1912 ) was an American capitalist and politician .

Nancy Grace was born in Macon , Georgia , the youngest of three children , to factory worker Elizabeth Grace and Mac Grace , a freight agent for Southern Railway .
Daniel Sully was born on September 6 , 1855 , at Providence , Rhode Island .

Gualtiero Jacopetti was born in Barga , in Northern Tuscany , in 1919 .

Karim Ghazi ( born January 6 , 1979 in Algiers ) ( Arabic : كريم غازي‎ ) is an Algerian footballer .
Toomas Vitsut ( born January 1 , 1960 in Tallinn ) is an Estonian politician , the Chairman of the City Council of Tallinn since 2005 .
Charlene Drew Jarvis ( born July 31 , 1941 in Washington , D.C. , as Charlene Rosella Drew ) is an American educator and former scientific researcher and politician who served as the president of Southeastern University until March 31 , 2009 .

Chris Manak , better known by his stage name Peanut Butter Wolf , is an American disc jockey and producer from San Jose , California .
Martin Havelka ( born 10 July 1958 , Karlovy Vary ) is Czech actor .
Rıdvan Dilmen ( born on 15 August 1962 in Nazilli ) is a former Turkish footballer who most notably played for Fenerbahçe and the Turkish national football team .
Hajro Ulqinaku is an Albanian writer from Ulcinj , Montenegro .
Lynn Margulis was born in Chicago , to a Jewish , Zionist family .
Jorge Manuel ( born July 19 , 1980 ) is a Cuban - American fashion designer based in Miami .

Steve Jameson was born in 1973 at Fort Knox , Kentucky , USA , and grew up in nearby Elizabethtown ; he was the oldest of seven children of parents Hugh Jameson and Mary Jo Jameson .

Wood was born in Long Beach , California , the son of Donna Wood , a finance professional , and Thomas Mills Wood , Sr . , a variety performer and accountant .
David McGuire ( born 27 September 1980 in Bellshill ) is a Scottish footballer who currently plays for junior club Lanark United .
Caroline Brunet ( born March 20 , 1969 in Quebec City , Quebec ) is a Canadian sprint kayaker who competed from the late 1980s to 2004 .

Phil Barney ( real name : Philippe Baranés , born February 2 , 1957 in Annaba , Algeria ) is a French singer - songwriter .
Claude Poirier ( born October 26 , 1938 in Montreal , Quebec ) is a negotiator and crime reporter for the Quebec - based Canadian French - language television network TVA .
Bert Hardy rose from humble working class origins in Blackfriars .
Madeline Hurlock ( December 12 , 1899 -- April 4 , 1989 ) was a silent film actress , hailing from Federalsburg , Maryland .
Piero Milesi ( Milan , 1953 ; Levanto , 2011 ) was an Italian musician , composer , and music arranger .
Meta von Salis was born in 1855 on her family 's estate , Marschlins Castle , in Igis , Graubünden .
Harald Lindberg ( 2 November 1871 , Helsinki -- 13 March 1963 , Helsinki ) was a Finnish botanist of Swedish parentage .

Mikhail Mamiashvili ( born 1963 in Konotop , Ukrainian SSR ) is a Russian wrestler of Georgian origin .
Salvatore Lo Piccolo ( born in Palermo , July 20 , 1942 ) , also known as the Baron ( il Barone ) , is a Sicilian mafioso and one of the most powerful bosses of Palermo , Sicily .

Jean Paul was born at Wunsiedel , in the Fichtelgebirge mountains ( Franconia ) .
Chad Deering ( born September 2 , 1970 , in Garland , Texas ) is a retired American soccer player .

Chris Wherry ( born 1973 ) is a professional road racing cyclist from Boulder , Colorado .
Richard E. Council ( born October 1 , 1947 in Tampa , Florida ) , sometimes credited as Richard Council , is an American film , television and stage actor .
František Patočka ( October 22 , 1904 , Turnov -- March 14 , 1985 , Prague ) was a Czech microbiologist and serologist .
Heiko Scholz ( born 7 January 1966 at Görlitz ) is a former German footballer who is now manager of Lokomotive Leipzig .
Melissa Mueller ( born November 16 , 1972 in Waukesha , Wisconsin ) is an American pole vaulter .

Witold Zalewski ( 4 January 1921 in Siedlce - 2009 ) is a Polish writer , publicist and prosaist .
Robina Williams ( born in a small village in Cheshire ) is an English author .
James B. McClintock ( born Ann Arbor , MI ) is an American professor of biology at the University of Alabama at Birmingham and studies various aspects of marine biology in Antarctica .
Jair Marrufo ( born June 7 , 1977 in El Paso , Texas ) is an American soccer referee of Mexican descent .
Víctor Hugo García Hernández ( born 11 June 1994 in Cúa ) is a right footed Venezuelan footballer who plays as defender in F.C. Porto B.

Alberto Ongarato ( born 24 July 1975 in Padua ) is an Italian road racing cyclist , who rode most recently for Vacansoleil - DCM .
Georges Jacob ( Cheny , Burgundy , 6 July 1739 -- 1814 , master 1765 ) was one of the two most prominent Parisian master menuisiers , producing carved , painted and gilded beds and seat furniture and upholstery work for the French royal châteaux , in the early Neoclassical style that is usually associated with Louis XVI .
Takashi Koizumi ( 小泉堯史 Koizumi Takashi ) ( November 6 , 1944 , Mito ) is a Japanese film director .
Aled Haydn Jones ( born 9 August 1976 in Aberystwyth , Wales ) is a Welsh radio editor , presenter and former radio producer .
Martin Aigner ( born February 28 , 1942 in Linz ) is an Austrian mathematician , professor at Freie Universität Berlin since 1974 , with interests in combinatorial mathematics and graph theory .
Leon Glass was born in Brooklyn , NY where he attended Erasmus Hall High School ( Class of 1959 ) and majored in Chemistry at Brooklyn College ( Class of 1963 ) .
Helena Javornik ( born 26 March 1966 , in Celje ) is a Slovenian long - distance runner who has specialized in all distances from 1500 metres to the marathon race .
Herbert Bentwich ( originally Bentwitch ) ( 1856 , Whitechapel -- 1932 , Jerusalem ) was a British Zionist leader and lawyer .
Željko Cupan ( born 30 December 1963 , in Zagreb ) is a former Croatian football player .
Nicola Cornick ( b. Yorkshire , England ) is a British writer of historical romance novels since 1998 and a historian specialising in public history .
Michael Manring ( born June 27 , 1960 in Annapolis ) is an American bass guitarist from the San Francisco Bay Area , ( Northern California ) .

Jim Sanborn ( born Herbert James Sanborn Jr. , November 14 , 1945 in Washington , D.C. ) is an American sculptor .
