Johnson was born in Stockton , California , the son of Ruth Alice ( née Fairchild ) and Ernest Lamont Johnson , who was a realtor .
Robert Wertheimer ( b : Montreal , Quebec , Canada ) is an award - winning writer , producer , director and executive producer of film and television productions .
Born in Kitzbühel , Austria , Peter Aufschnaiter went to high school in Kufstein .
Born in Vranje , Lazar Đorđević joined MFK Košice in summer 2013 .
Lee Dainton ( born 22 August 1973 in Pontypool , Wales ) is a professional skateboarder , daredevil and one quarter of the Dirty Sanchez crew .
Shimon Levinson was born in Jerusalem during the British Mandate era in 1933 .
Iveta Mukuchyan was born in Yerevan , Armenia ( then part of the Soviet Union ) on 14 October 1986 .
Nuno Filipe Sousa Rolão Dias Silva ( born 24 September 1976 in Castelo Branco ) , simply known as Rolão , is a Portuguese professional footballer who plays for Atlético as a Defender ( Centre back ) .
Christa Zechmeister ( born 4 December 1957 in Berchtesgaden ) is a German former alpine skier and the youngest person ever to win a World Cup race , as well as the youngest to stand on the podium .
Lajos Kósa ( born March 14 , 1964 ) is a Hungarian economist and politician , who served as Mayor of Debrecen between 1998 and 2014 .
Olena Burkovska ( Ukrainian : Олена Бурковська ; born on 9 August 1981 in Yahotyn , Kyiv Region ) is Ukrainian long - distance runner who competes in marathons .
Daniela Malusardi ( born January 17 , 1956 in Nettuno ) is an Italian choreographer , teacher and dancer .
Heinz Kiessling studied piano , composition and conducting , after World War II at the Nuremberg Conservatory from 1949 and started his career in 1949 as a pianist and got to play in different concerts around the world .
Deborah Drever ( born August 15 , 1988 ) is a Canadian politician who was elected in the 2015 general election to the Legislative Assembly of Alberta , representing the electoral district of Calgary - Bow .
Mikko Huhtala ( born March 30 , 1952 in Lapua ) is a Finnish wrestler ( Greco - Roman style ) .
Dale Furutani ( born December 1 , 1946 , in Hilo , Hawaii ) is the first Asian American to win major mystery writing awards .
Tsai was born to Gerald Tsai Sr . and Ruth Tsai in Shanghai , where he lived as a child .
Srećko Juričić ( born 30 December 1954 in Volosko near Opatija ) is a former Croatian football player and currently sporting director in HNK Rijeka .
Elmer Truesdell Merrill ( 1860 -- 20 April 1936 ) was an American Latin scholar , born at Millville , Massachusetts .
Ksenia Gaydarzhi ( Russian : Ксения Сергеевна Гайдаржи ; born 8 February 1995 in Moscow ) is a Russian tennis player .
Walter Learning was born in 1938 in the small village of Quidi Vidi in Newfoundland .
Ian Ayre is the current chief executive officer of Liverpool Football Club .
Anto Jakovljević ( born 25 September 1962 in Banja Luka ) is a former Bosnian association footballer .
Lysimachus and his brothers grew up with the status of Macedonians ; all these brothers enjoyed with Lysimachus prominent positions in Alexander 's circle and , like him , were educated at the Macedonian court in Pella .
Mohamed Bouhizeb ( Arabic : محمد بوحيزب‎ ; born in Oran ) is a former Algerian football player .
Leo Rubinfien ( born 1953 , Chicago , Illinois ) is an American photographer and essayist .
Cédric Berthelin ( born 25 December 1976 in Courrières ) is a retired French football player who last played with Oostende in the Belgian Pro League .
Mark Hilditch ( born 20 August 1960 in Shaw and Crompton , Lancashire ) is a former English footballer who played as a striker .
Eduard Herzog ( August 1 , 1841 -- March 26 , 1924 ) was a Swiss Catholic theologian and cleric who was a native of Schongau , Canton Lucerne .
Irene Marie ( born August 22 , 1950 in Miami Beach , Florida ) is a former fashion model and founder of the eponymous South Beach model agency Irene Marie Models .
Thierry Marx was born and raised in Paris in the area of Ménilmontant .
Odilon Redon was born in Bordeaux , Aquitaine , to a prosperous family .
Afroditi Krassa ( born 1974 ) is a British Product Designer and Interior Designer and founded her own design consultancy Afroditi Krassa LTD in 2002 in London .
Thomas Dos Santos , born 13 March 1992 in Bayonne , France is a French - Portuguese professional footballer .
Tisca Chopra was born in Kasauli , Himachal Pradesh into a Punjabi family of educationists .
Peter Bernhard Wilhelm Heine , better known as Wilhelm ( or William ) Heine ( January 30 , 1827 in Dresden -- October 5 , 1885 in Lößnitz bei Dresden ) was a German - American artist , world traveller and writer .

Riad Ahmadov graduated from the Baku State University Law School with honors ( Cum Laude)in 1979 .
Riadh Sidaoui ( رياض الصيداوي ) ( born in Bou Hajla , 14 May 1967 ) is a Tunisian writer and political scientist who has a Swiss nationality .

Susanne Wenger was born as the daughter of Swiss and Austrian parents , attended the School of Applied Arts in Graz and the Higher Graphical Federal Education and Research Institute and then studied at the Academy of Fine Arts Vienna alongside , among others , Herbert Boeckl .
Black Radical Mk II ( born Felix Joseph 1971 ) is a British hip hop artist from Tottenham , London , England .
Mario Tronti ( born 24 July 1931 , in Rome ) is an Italian philosopher and politician , considered as one of the founders of the theory of operaismo in the 1960s .
Wolfgang Seifen ( born 1956 , in Bergheim ) is a German organist and composer .
Saint Honestus ( Spanish : San Honesto , French : Saint Honest ) was , according to Christian tradition , a disciple of Saturninus of Toulouse and a native of Nîmes .

Cindy Fabre ( born 26 September 1985 in Cosne - Cours - sur - Loire , Nièvre ) is a French beauty queen who has competed at the Miss Europe , Miss Universe , and Miss World pageants .
Christian Alexander ( born Christian Ivanov Ivanov , April 14 , 1990 in Athens ) is a Bulgarian - American actor , best known for his role as Kiefer Bauer on the American daytime drama General Hospital .
Harold Jarman ( born May 4 , 1939 in Bristol , England ) is a former professional footballer and first - class cricketer , who played for Bristol Rovers , Newport County and Gloucestershire County Cricket Club .
George Thorogood ( born February 24 , 1950 ) is an American musician , singer and songwriter from Wilmington , Delaware .
Artur Szpilka , who used to be a fan of Polish football team Wisła Kraków , was noticed as a potential natural boxing talent by a boxing coach during a pre - arranged brawl with fans of the opposing KS Cracovia football club outside a disco in Wieliczka .
Sergey Snegov ( Russian : Серге́й Алекса́ндрович Сне́гов ) ( 20 August 1910 , Odessa -- 23 February 1994 ) , real surname Kozeryuk ( Russian : Козерюк ) , was a Soviet science fiction writer .

Di Botcher is a Welsh actress born in Port Talbot .
Masha Novoselova ( Maria Novoselova , Маша Новоселова ; born 31 January 1985 in Tula , Soviet Union ) is a Russian fashion model , considered one of the Russian Supermodels of recent years .

Alexander Anoprienko is a Professor of the Computer Engineering Department of the Donetsk National Technical University ( DonNTU ) .

Ludwig Philippson ( 28 December 1811 , at Dessau -- 29 December 1889 , at Bonn ) was a German rabbi and author , the son of Moses Philippson .
Stefan Drzewiecki ( July 26 , 1844 in Kunka , Podolia , Russian Empire ( today Ukraine , formerly Polish -- Lithuanian Commonwealth ) -- April 23 , 1938 in Paris ) was a Polish scientist , journalist , engineer , constructor and inventor , working in France , and in the Russian Empire during the partitions of Poland .
Josef Nešvera ( Praskolesy ( Beroun District ) , 1842-Olomouc , 1914 ) was a Czech opera composer .
Ludwig Pfandl ( 22 September 1881 , Rosenheim -- 27 June 1942 , Kaufbeuren ) was a German biographer , Hispanist and Romance studies scholar .

Gaetano Cima ( Cagliari , 1805 -- Cagliari , 1878 ) was an Italian architect , exponent of the neoclassical movement .
Adam Ludwig Lewenhaupt ( 15 April 1659 , Copenhagen -- 12 February 1719 Moscow ) was a Swedish general .
Menahem Azariah da Fano ( also called Immanuel da Fano , and Rema MiPano ) ( 1548 , Fano -- Mantua , 1620 ) was an Italian rabbi , Talmudist , and Kabbalist .
Willem van den Blocke moved on 18 June 1584 to Danzig ( Gdańsk ) , the center of the Vistula delta Mennonites , carrying with him a recommendation by Stephen Báthory , the king of Poland .
Necdet Öztorun ( 1924 , Konya - 7 October 2010 , Ankara ) was a Turkish general .
Giovanni Gaetano Bottari ( 15 January 1689 , Florence -- 5 June 1775 , Rome ) was Vatican librarian and counsellor to Pope Clement XII .
Thomas Taggart ( November 17 , 1856 -- March 6 , 1929 ) was a U.S. political figure , serving as mayor of Indianapolis and influential in state and national politics .
Billy Waters ( c. 1778 - -1823 ) was a black man who busked in London in the nineteenth century by singing , playing the violin and entertaining theatre goers with his `` peculiar antics '' .
Luciano Frigerio ( Desio , 21 May 1928 -- Sanremo April 11 , 1999 ) , was a designer , artist and Italian musician .
Alfred Laliberté ( 19 May 1878 - 13 January 1953 ) was a Canadian sculptor and painter based in Montreal .
Salvatore Sabella ( July 7 , 1891 -- 1962 ) was the Sicilian Mafia boss of Philadelphia , Pennsylvania during the 1920s .
Lorenzo De Ferrari ( 14 November 1680 -- 28 July 1744 ) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period , active mainly in his native city of Genoa .
Dean Benjamin McLaughlin ( born October 25 , 1901 , Brooklyn , Queens , New York CIty ; died December 8 , 1965 , Ann Arbor , Michigan , US ) was an American astronomer .
Adolfo Leoni ( Gualdo Tadino , 13 January 1917 -- Massa , 19 October 1970 ) was an Italian professional road bicycle racer .
Johannes Hintz was injured in a car - accident on 14 May 1944 in Paris and died on 21 May 1944 .
Federico Rauch ( né Friedrich Rauch 1786 - 1829 ) was a colonel of Argentina .
Juan Hipólito Vieytes ( San Antonio de Areco , Buenos Aires Province , 6 August 1762 -- San Fernando , Argentina , 5 October 1815 ) , was an Argentine merchant and soldier .

Antonio Segura ( June 13 , 1947 in Valencia -- January 31 , 2012 ) was a Spanish comics writer .
Edmund Leser ( 1 May 1853 , Münster -- 11 December 1916 , Frankfurt am Main ) was a German surgeon remembered for describing the Leser - Trélat sign ( named with Ulysse Trélat- 1828 - 1890 ) .
Koloman Wallisch ( born 28 February 1889 in Lugosch , Austria - Hungary , today Lugoj , Romania ; died 19 February 1934 in Leoben , Austria ) was a socialist labor leader in Austria .

Jacqueline Auriol ( November 5 , 1917 , Challans , Vendée -- February 11 , 2000 , Paris ) was a French aviator who set several world speed records .
John Henry Raap ( August 1 , 1840 -- April 23 , 1897 ) was an entrepreneur and wholesale liquor retailer in Chicago in the 19th century .
Anton Oberbeck ( March 25 , 1846 -- October 23 , 1900 ) was a German physicist from Berlin .
Ernst Adolf Coccius ( September 19 , 1825 -- November 24 , 1890 ) was a German ophthalmologist who was a native of Knauthain , which today is part of the city of Leipzig .
Hans von Arnim ( 14 September 1859 , Groß Fredenwalde -- 26 May 1931 , Vienna ) was a German - Austrian classical philologist , who specialized in studies of Plato and Aristotle .
Jean - Joseph Weerts ( 1 May 1846 , Roubaix - 28 Septembre 1927 , Paris ) was a French painter of Belgian origin who worked in the Academic style .
Gaston Baty ( May 26 , 1885 , Pélussin , Loire -- October 13 , 1952 ) , whose full name was Jean - Baptiste - Marie - Gaston Baty , was a French playwright and director .
Alice of Norfolk died at Bungay , Suffolk , shortly before 30 January 1352 , as the result of an assault by her husband , for which crime he and some of his retainers were indicted .
Giulio Cesare Corradi ( Parma , c.1650 - Venice , 1701 or 1702 ) was an Italian opera librettist .
Anton Reichenow ( August 1 , 1847 in Charlottenburg -- July 6 , 1941 in Hamburg ) was a German ornithologist and herpetologist .
Pedro Diez Canseco Corbacho ( January 31 , 1815 in Arequipa , Peru -- April 3 , 1893 in Chorrillos , Peru ) was a Peruvian soldier and politician who became interim President of Peru on three occasions : 1863 , 1865 and 1868 .
Ādolfs Skulte ( Kiev , October 28 , 1909 -- Riga , March 20 , 2000 ) was a Latvian composer and pedagogue .
Artur Beul ( born 9 December 1915 , Einsiedeln , Switzerland -- died 9 January 2010 , Küsnacht ) was a Swiss songwriter .
Born in Long Island , Win Coates was a photojournalist who worked in the United States , Nicaragua , and India .
Moritz Wagner ( Bayreuth , 3 October 1813 -- Munich , 31 May 1887 ) was a German explorer , collector , geographer and natural historian .
Ian Hogbin was born in Bawtry , Yorkshire , England and died at Potts Point , Sydney , Australia .
Eduard Eelma was arrested by NKVD in Tallinn in summer 1941 , sentenced to death and executed in a prison in Kirov on 16 November 1941 .
Pierre Schneiter was born in Reims , elder son of Charles Albert Schneiter , a vintner , and Jeanne Marie Alice Sart .
Eduardo González Valiño , nicknamed Chacho ( born 14 April 1911 in A Coruña ; died 21 October 1979 in A Coruña ) was a Spanish association footballer .
Ajita Wilson ( 1950 ? -- May 26 , 1987 in Rome , Italy ) was an American actress who starred in European exploitation and hardcore films in the 1970s and 1980s .
Wacław Berent ( Warsaw , 28 September 1878 -- 19 November or 22 November 1940 , Warsaw ) was a Polish novelist , essayist and a literary translator from the Art Nouveau period , publishing under pen names S.A.M. and Wł .
Columbano Bordalo Pinheiro ( Lisbon , 21 November 1857 -- Lisbon , 6 November 1929 ) , who is usually referred to as Columbano , was a Portuguese Realist painter .
Aage Eriksen ( born May 5 , 1917 in Notodden , died June 17 , 1998 in Notodden , Telemark ) was a Norwegian wrestler and Olympic medalist in Greco - Roman wrestling .
Professor Marcus Hartog died in Paris on 21 January 1924 .
Doriano Romboni ( 8 December 1968 in Lerici , Italy -- 30 November 2013 in Latina , Italy ) was an Italian Grand Prix motorcycle road racer .
José Américo de Almeida ( January 10 , 1887 , in Areia -- March 10 , 1980 , in João Pessoa ) was a Brazilian writer , a politician , a lawyer and a teacher .
J. Maurice Reymond de Broutelles ( or just Maurice Reymond , sometimes also given as `` de Brouteilles '' , April 25 , 1862 -- November 17 , 1936 ) was a Swiss sculptor , painter , and engraver who worked in Paris , France .
Robert Weltsch ( 20 June 1891 , Prague -- 22 December 1982 , Jerusalem ) was a journalist , editor and prominent Zionist .

The church of Santi Giovanni e Paolo in Rome was founded either by Pammachius or his father .
Renzo Zorzi ( 12 December 1946 , Ziano di Fiemme-- 15 May 2015 , Magenta , Lombardy ) was a racing driver from Italy who participated in 7 Formula One Grands Prix between 1975 and 1977 .
John M. Coyne Sr . ( November 11 , 1916 -- July 21 , 2014 ) was the mayor of Brooklyn , Ohio from 1948 to 1999 .
Vicent Andrés Estellés ( Valencian pronunciation : ( biˈsɛn anˈdɾes esteˈʎes ) ) ( 4 September 1924 in Burjassot , Valencia -- 27 March 1993 in Valencia ) was a Spanish journalist and poet .
Luca della Robbia ( 1399/1400 - -1482 ) was an Italian sculptor from Florence , noted for his glazed terracotta roundels , in a technique he apparently developed himself .

Abbé Alexandre - Auguste Robineau ( 23 April 1747 , Paris - 13 January 1828 , Paris ) was a French painter , composer , violinist , conductor , and Catholic priest .
Hans Collaert or Jan Collaert I or Johannes Collaert ( c. 1525/1530 -- 1580 ) was an early Flemish engraver , father of the engravers Jan Collaert II ( Antwerp 1561 - 1620/1628 ) and Adrian Collaert ( Antwerp c1555/65 - 1618 ) .
Antoine - Martin Chaumont de La Galaizière ( 22 January 1697 , Namur - 3 October 1783 , Paris ) , marquis de La Galaizière , chancellor of Lorraine , was a French nobleman active at the court of Lorraine .
Adolf Schreyer ( July 9 , 1828 Frankfurt - am - Main -- July 29 , 1899 Kronberg i m Taunus ) was a German painter , associated with the Düsseldorf school of painting .
Yitzhak Gruenbaum ( Polish : Izaak Grünbaum , Hebrew and Yiddish : יצחק גרינבוים , born 1879 died 1970 ) was a noted leader of the Zionist movement among Polish Jewry between the two world wars and of the Yishuv in Mandatory Palestine , and the first Interior Minister of Israel .
Étienne Buffet ( Marie Étienne Pierre Paul Aimé Buffet ) was born in Paris on 5 June 1866 and died in Paris on 3 December 1948 .
William Dunkel ( born New Jersey 26 March 1893 , died Kilchberg , ZH 10 September 1980 ) was a Swiss architect and painter .
Sidney Parsons ( c. 1893 -- April 22 , 1955 ) was a Canadian politician , mayor of Edmonton , Alberta , and candidate for election to the Legislative Assembly of Alberta .
Anna Ida Birgit Åkesson , born March 24 , 1908 in Malmö , died March 24 , 2001 in Stockholm , was a choreographer , dancer and dance researcher .
Bon - Claude Cahier de Gerville ( 30 November 1751 , Bayeux -- 15 February 1796 , Bayeux ) was a notable figure in the French Revolution .
Pierre Jamet ( 21 April 1893 in Orléans -- 17 June 1991 in Gargilesse - Dampierre ) was a French harpist and pedagogue .
Shoghi Effendi 's death came unexpectedly in London , on 4 November 1957 , as he was travelling to Britain and caught the Asian Flu , during the pandemic which killed two million worldwide , and he is buried there in New Southgate Cemetery .
Dr. Wilhelm Lautenbach ( * August 26 1891 in Zwinge ; † May 24 1948 in Davos ) was a German official at the Economics Ministry at the beginning of the 1920s .
Frank Debenham , OBE ( 26 December 1883 -- 23 November 1965 ) was Emeritus Professor of Geography at the Department of Geography , Cambridge University and first director of the Scott Polar Research Institute .
John Edgar Colwell Hearne ( 4 February 1926 , Montreal , Canada - 12 December 1994 , Stony Hill , Jamaica ) was a white Jamaican novelist , journalist , and teacher .
Zdenko Runjić ( 26 October 1942 -- 27 October 2004 ) was a Croatian songwriter based in Split .
Oton Iveković was born on 17 April 1869 in Klanjec , where he finished elementary school .
Luana Walters ( July 22 , 1912 - May 19 , 1963 ) was a motion picture actress from Los Angeles , California .
John Gilbert Winant OM ( February 23 , 1889 -- November 3 , 1947 ) was an American politician with the Republican party after a brief career as a teacher in Concord , New Hampshire .
George Gund II ( April 13 , 1888 -- November 15 , 1966 ) was an American banker , business executive , and real estate investor who lived in Cleveland , Ohio in the early and middle part of the 20th century .
Montserrat Roig i Fransitorra ( Catalan pronunciation : ( munsəˈrat ˈrɔtʃ ) ; Barcelona , June 13 , 1946 -- November 10 , 1991 ) was a Spanish writer of novels , short stories and articles .
Conrad Faber von Kreuznach ( born c. 1500 in Kreuznach , Germany ; died between 10 September 1552 and 15 May 1553 in Frankfurt am Main ) was a German painter and woodcuts designer formerly known as Master of Holzhausen - portraits .
Henry Marchant ( April 9 , 1741 -- August 30 , 1796 ) was American lawyer from Newport , Rhode Island and United States federal judge .
Hector Giacomelli ( April 1 , 1822 in Paris -- December 1 , 1904 in Menton ) , was a French watercolorist , engraver and illustrator , best known for his paintings of birds .
Fritz Winter ( 22 September 1905 in Altenbögge ( now part of Bönen ) -- 1 October 1976 in Herrsching ) was a German painter of the postwar period best known for his abstract works in the Art Informel style .
Adolph Ignatievich Rosner , known as Ady Rosner and also Eddie Rosner ( May 26 , 1910 in Berlin -- August 8 , 1976 in West Berlin ) was a Polish and Soviet Jazz musician called `` The White Louis Armstrong '' or `` Polish Louis Armstrong '' in different sources .
In 1984 , at age 49 , Richard Brautigan had moved to Bolinas , California , where he was living alone in a large , old house that he had bought with his earnings years earlier .
Antoine René Boucher , more commonly known as René Boucher , ( 1732 , Paris , France -- 1811 , Paris , France ) was a French magistrate and a French revolutionary who served as Mayor of Paris in 1792 .
Francesco Guardi was born in Venice into a family of nobility from Trentino .
Mahir Çayan ( 15 March 1946 in Samsun - 30 March 1972 , Kızıldere ) was a Turkish politician and the leader of People 's Liberation Party - Front of Turkey ( Turkish : Türkiye Halk Kurtuluş Partisi - Cephesi ) .
Emeric Tauss Torday ( 7 April 1897 in Budapest -- 27 January 1987 in París ) was a Hungarian painter trained in Budapest , Prague and Paris known for a number of paintings on display in museums both in Hungary and abroad .
Erol Günaydın died on October 15 , 2012 , in a hospital in Istanbul .
While Pupienus marched to Ravenna , where he oversaw the campaign against Maximinus , Balbinus remained in Rome , but failed to keep public order .
Hanka Ordonówna ( born Maria Anna Pietruszyńska ; September 25 , 1902 in Warsaw -- September 8 , 1950 in Beirut ) also known as ' Ordonka ' , was a Polish singer , dancer and actress .
Dionýz Ilkovič ( 18 January 1907 in Šarišský Štiavnik -- 3 August 1980 in Bratislava ) was a Slovak physicist and physical chemist .
Helga M. Novak ( pseudonym for Maria Karlsdottir ; 8 September 1935 -- 24 December 2013 in Rüdersdorf ) was a German - Icelandic writer .
Giorgio Gandini del Grano ( died 1538 ) was an Italian painter of the Parma school of painting .
Pietro Mengoli ( 1626 , Bologna -- June 7 , 1686 , Bologna ) was an Italian mathematician and clergyman from Bologna , where he studied with Bonaventura Cavalieri at the University of Bologna , and succeeded him in 1647 .
Khan Shushinski ( Azerbaijani : Xan Şuşinski ) , born Isfandiyar Aslan oglu Javanshir ( 20 August 1901 , Shusha -- 18 March 1979 , Baku ) , was an Azerbaijani khananda folk singer .
Georges Jacquot ( born in Nancy in 1794 , died in Paris in 1874 ) was a French sculptor of the 19th century .
Arnold Marc Gorter ( 1866 , Almelo -- 1933 , Amsterdam ) , was a 19th - century landscape painter from the Northern Netherlands .
Doug Berrie is a former Scottish footballer who played as a full back for Dundee United and Forfar Athletic .
Veikko Aleksanteri Heiskanen ( 23 July 1895 in Kangaslampi -- 23 October 1971 in Helsinki ) was a famous Finnish geodesist .
Henderson Chambers ( May 1 , 1908 in Alexandria , Louisiana -- October 19 , 1967 in New York City ) was an American jazz trombonist .
Kurt Eberhard ( born September 12 , 1874 in Rottweil - died September 8 , 1947 in Stuttgart ) was a German officer .
Tuomo Mannermaa ( b. 29 September 1937 Oulu , Finland ; d. 19 January 2015 Espoo , Finland ) was professor emeritus of ecumenical theology at University of Helsinki .
Ignaz Bösendorfer ( July 28 , 1796 -- April 14 , 1859 ) was an Austrian musician and piano manufacturer , who in 1828 founded the Bösendorfer company in Vienna - Josefstadt .
Ferdinand Hart Nibbrig ( 1866 , Amsterdam -- 1915 , Laren ) , was a Dutch painter and Theosophist .
Arturo Araujo Fajardo ( 1878 in Suchitoto -- December 1 , 1967 in San Salvador ) was the president of El Salvador from March 1 , 1931 to December 2 , 1931 .
Ewald Kooiman ( June 14 , 1938 in Wormer , North Holland -- January 25 , 2009 in Hurghada ) , was a Dutch organist .
Laurens Craen ( c. 1620 , The Hague -- c.1670 , Middelburg ) , was a Dutch Golden Age still life painter .
Reteos Berberian ( Armenian : Ռեթէոս Պէրպէրեան , 1848 , Constantinople , Ottoman Turkey -- 1907 , Üsküdar , Ottoman Turkey , also Reteos Perperian ) was an Armenian educator , pedagogue , principal , writer , poet , and founder of the prestigious Armenian school Berberian Varjaran ( school ) .
Lawrence Beyerlinck ( April 1578 , Antwerp -- 22 June 1627 , Antwerp ) was a Belgian theologian and ecclesiastical writer and encyclopedist .
Muhsin al - Barazi ( Arabic : محسن البرازي‎ ) ( Hama , 1904 -- Damascus , 14 August 1949 ) was a Syrian lawyer , academic and politician .
Pope Felix I ( died 30 December 274 ) was the Bishop of Rome or Pope from 5 January 269 to his death in 274 .
Dagoberto Godoy Fuentealba ( July 22 , 1893 in Temuco -- September 8 , 1960 in Santiago de Chile ) was a Chilean pilot and the first person to fly over the Andes .
Gerrit Cornelis Berkouwer ( 8 June 1903 , Amsterdam -- 26 January 1996 , Voorhout ) was for years the leading theologian of the Reformed Churches in the Netherlands ( GKN ) .
William de Vere ( died 1198 ) was Bishop of Hereford and an Augustinian canon .
In 1965 after holding some key positions in Belarusian regions and in Minsk Pyotr Masherov became the first secretary of the Communist party in Belarus .
John O'Hara died from cardiovascular disease in Princeton , New Jersey , and is interred in the Princeton Cemetery .
Benedikt Roezl ( 13 August 1823 , Horomeritz ( Bohemia , Austrian Empire ) - 14 October 1885 , Prague ) was a traveller , gardener and botanist ( sometimes Benedict or Benito Roezl as called by the Indians ) .
Luigi Dottesio ( 14 January 1814 in Como -- 11 October 1851 in Venice ( then called Venezia ) ) was an Italian patriot who was very active in the distribution of anti - Austrian pamphlets , before and after 1848 .
Sir Henry Harwood died in Goring - on - Thames in 1950 .
Antoine Gouan ( 15 November 1733 -- 1 September 1821 ) was a French naturalist who was a native of Montpellier .
Leopold Kohr ( 5 October 1909 in Oberndorf bei Salzburg , Austria -- 26 February 1994 in Gloucester , England ) was an economist , jurist and political scientist known both for his opposition to the `` cult of bigness '' in social organization and as one of those who inspired the small is beautiful movement .
Victor Nehlig ( 1830 , Paris -- 1909 , New York City ) was a French - born American painter .
Henry Honychurch Gorringe ( August 11 , 1841 -- July 7 , 1885 ) was a United States naval officer who attained national acclaim for successfully completing the removal of Cleopatra 's Needle from Alexandria , Egypt to Central Park , New York City .
Orazio Michi `` dell'Arpa '' ( also Mihi ; Alife , Campania , 1594 -- Rome , 26 October 1641 ) was an Italian composer , and , as his nickname `` of the harp '' suggests , harpist .
Marcello Dudovich ( 21 March 1878 in Trieste -- 31 March 1962 in Milan ) was an Italian painter , illustrator , and poster designer .
Georgios Jakobides ( Γεώργιος Ιακωβίδης , 11 January 1853 in Lesbos -- 13 December 1932 in Athens ) was a painter and one of the main representatives of the Greek artistic movement of the Munich School .
Gustav Stühmer was killed on 16 February 1944 near Narva , Estonia during the Battle of Narva when he used his body to shield his commanding officer Franz Griesbach from grenade splinters .
Hippolyte - Victor Collet - Descotils was a French chemist , born November 21 , 1773 in Caen , and died December 6 , 1815 in Paris .
Ottokar Domma ( pseudonym ; properly Otto Häuser ) ( 20 May 1924 , Karlovy Vary , Czechoslovakia -- 15 July 2007 , Woltersdorf ) was a German journalist and writer specialising in satire .
Lucius J. Henderson ( 1861 , Aldo , Illinois - 18 February 1947 , New York City ) was an American silent film director of the early silent period involved in over 70 film productions .
Heinrich Bulthaupt ( October 26 , 1849 -- August 20 , 1905 ) was a German poet , dramatic author , and lawyer , as well as librarian of his native town , Bremen .
Gustav Karl Laube ( 8 February 1839 , Teplitz -- 12 April 1923 , Prague ) was a Bohemian German geologist and paleontologist .
Matko Laginja ( August 10 , 1852 in Klana near Kastav -- March 18 , 1930 in Zagreb ) was a Croatian lawyer and politician .
Grigol Orbeliani was born into a prominent aristocratic family in the Georgian capital of Tiflis ( Tbilisi ) , three years after the Russian government deposed the Bagrationi dynasty of Georgia and annexed their kingdom .
Silja Walter ( 23 April 1919 -- 31 January 2011 ) was a Swiss author and Benedictine nun in the Fahr Abbey in Switzerland .
Robert Adler died in a Boise , Idaho nursing home of heart failure at age 93 years old .
Michael Annals was born in what was then Harrow , Middlesex ( later incorporated into Greater London ) on 21 April 1938 .
Kåre Østerdal ( 1917 , Rana , Norway -- 1973 ) was a Norwegian skier from Nordland .
Cengaver Katrancı ( 1964 -- October 30 , 1972 ) was a Turkish boy , who lived in West Berlin , in district of Kreuzberg .
André Vandernoot ( born 2 June 1927 , Brussels ; died 6 November 1991 , Brussels ) was a Belgian conductor .
Carl Christoffer Gjörwell ( the younger ) ( 19 January 1766 Stockholm -- 14 November 1837 ) was a city architect in Stockholm , Sweden .
Filippo Scannabecchi ( 1352 -- c. 1410 ) , known as Lippo di Dalmasio , was an Italian painter from Bologna , a son of Dalmasio Scannabecchi .
Vincent Houška or Hauschka ( born Mies , Bohemia : 21 January 1766 -- 1840 in Vienna ) was a composer and musician who played mandolin and cello .
Vladimir Savčić ( born 6 June 1948 in Niš , Serbia , FPR Yugoslavia - died 20 March 2009 in Belgrade , Serbia ) was a Serbian singer .
Wilmot Redd ( aka Wilmot Read and Wilmot Reed ) ( early 17th century - September 22 , 1692 ) was one of the victims of the Salem witch trials of 1692 .
Henry Scrope , 3rd Baron Scrope of Masham KG ( c.1370 -- 5 August 1415 ) , a favourite of King Henry V , was beheaded on 5 August 1415 for his involvement in the Southampton Plot .
Luigi Scevola ( born Brescia , 1770 - died Milan , 1819 ) was an Italian dramatist .
Antoine - George - Prosper Marilhat , usually known as Prosper Marilhat , ( 26 March 1811 , Vertaizon -- 13 September 1847 , Paris ) was an Orientalist painter .
Melchior Goldast ab Haiminsfeld ( Goldastus)(6 January 1576 or 1578 - Gießen , 1635 ) was a Swiss jurist , and an industrious though uncritical collector of documents relating to the medieval history and constitution of Germany .
Siebe Johannes ten Cate ( 27 February 1858 , Sneek - 19 December 1908 , Paris ) was a Dutch - Frisian painter in the Impressionist style , who spent most of his working life in France .
Renato Righetto ( January 30 , 1921 in Campinas , São Paulo , Brazil -- November 18 , 2001 in Campinas , São Paulo , Brazil due to Alzheimer 's disease ) was a Brazilian basketball referee .
Joseph Rusling Meeker ( born in Newark , New Jersey , 21 April 1827 ; died in St. Louis , Missouri , 27 September 1887 ) was a United States painter .
Johann Martin Miller ( 3 December 1750 in Jungingen -- 21 June 1814 in Ulm ) was a German theologian and writer .
Luciano Pozo González , better known as Chano Pozo ( January 7 , 1915 in Havana -- December 3 , 1948 in New York City ) was an Afro - Cuban jazz percussionist , singer , dancer and composer .
Francesco Ruggieri ( Cremona , c. 1630 -- 28 October 1698 ) ( also known as Rugier , Ruggeri , Ruggerius ) was perhaps an apprentice of Nicolò Amati , another important luthier in Cremona Italy , although other sources call this association into question .
Frans Snyders or Frans Snijders ( 11 November 1579 , Antwerp -- 19 August 1657 , Antwerp ) was a Flemish painter of animals , hunting scenes , market scenes and still lifes .
Josef Kalousek ( April 2 , 1838 in Vamberk -- November 22 , 1915 in Praha ) , was a Czech historian , professor of Czech history on Univerzita Karlova in Prague .
George Demetrescu Mirea ( 1852 , Câmpulung - 12 December 1934 , Bucharest ) was a Romanian portrait painter , muralist and art teacher .
Avichi Meiyappa Chettiar ( Tamil : அவிச்சி மெய்யப்ப செட்டியார் ; 28 July 1907 -- 12 August 1979 ) , also known as A. V. Meiyappan or AVM , was an Indian film producer , director and philanthropist who established AVM Productions in Vadapalani , Chennai .
William G. Bonelli ( 1895 - -1970 ) was a California Republican politician who became a member of the state Board of Equalization who fled to Mexico to avoid arrest on a corruption indictment .
Antoine Brice ( 26 May 1752 , Brussels , then in the Austrian Netherlands -- 23 January 1817 , Brussels ) was a Belgian painter .
Giovanni Battista Sassi ( 1679 in Milan -- 1762 in Milan ) was an Italian painter , active mainly in Milan and other areas of Lombardy , who painted in a late - Baroque or Rococo style .
After Shah Jahan 's vassals had been devastated by the alarming expansion of Ahmednagar during the reign of the Nizam Shahi boy - prince Murtaza Shah III , the emperor dispatched Aurangzeb , who in 1636 brought the Nizam Shahi dynasty to an end .
Hermann Hugo Paul Haupt ( 25 November 1858 in Görlitz -- 15 December 1926 in Baltimore , Maryland ) was a Semitic scholar , one of the pioneers of Assyriology in the United States .
Jacob Palaeologus , born Giacomo da Chio ( Chios , c. 1520 -- Rome , March 23 , 1585 ) was a Dominican friar who renouinced his religious vows and became an antitrinitarian theologian .
Rita Cetina Gutiérrez ( 1846 - -1908 ) was a Mexican teacher , poet and feminist who promoted secular education in the nineteenth century in Mérida , Yucatán .
Clarence Crane Brinton ( Winsted , Connecticut , 1898 - Cambridge , Massachusetts , September 7 , 1968 ) was an American historian of France , as well as an historian of ideas .
Araceli Gilbert de Blomberg ( 1913 in Guayaquil , Ecuador -- 1993 in Quito ) , was an Ecuadorian artist .
David de Haen ( 1585 , Amsterdam -- 1622 , Rome ) , was a Dutch Caravaggesque painter and draughtsman , active in Rome between 1615 and 1622 .
Giuseppe Avanzi ( August 30 , 1645 - May 29 , 1718 ) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period , mainly active in Ferrara .
Tito Lusiardo ( September 13 , 1896 - June 24 , 1982 in Buenos Aires ) was an iconic Argentine film actor and tango singer of the classic era .
Frederick Wallace Edwards FRS ( 28 November 1888 in Fletton , Peterborough -- 15 November 1940 in London ) , was an English entomologist who specialised in Diptera .
Francesco Fortugno ( Brancaleone , September 15 , 1951 -- Locri , October 16 , 2005 ) was an Italian politician and the Vice President of the Regional Assembly of Calabria .
Wenzel Lorenz Reiner ( Czech : Václav Vavřinec Reiner ; 8 August 1686 or 1689 -- 9 October 1743 ) was a Baroque painter who lived and died in Prague , Bohemia .
Moritz Heyne ( June 8 , 1837 , Weißenfels - March 1 , 1906 , Göttingen ) was a German Germanic linguist ( Germanist ) .
Prof David George Ritchie ( 1853 - -1903 ) was a Scottish philosopher who had a distinguished university career at Edinburgh , and Balliol College , Oxford , and after being fellow of Jesus College and a tutor at Balliol College was elected professor of logic and metaphysics at St Andrews .
Luigi Silori was born in Rome in 1921 , only son .
Antonio Vallisneri ( Trassilico,3 May 1661 -- Padua,18 January 1730 ) was an Italian medical scientist , physician and naturalist .
Johannes Jacobus , or J.J. Beijnes ( Haarlem,1814 -- Haarlem,1888 ) was a Dutch businessman and entrepreneur who , along with his brother Antonie Johannes ( A.J. ) Beijnes , was creditted with growing the Haarlem factory Beijnes into an international manufacturer of train and tram wagons .
Joachim Feller ( 30 November 1638 - 15 April 1691 ) was a German professor at the University of Leipzig and from 1675 head of its university library .
Thomas Benolt ( died 8 May 1534 ) was a long - serving officer of arms at the College of Arms in London .
Peter Henlein ( also spelled Henle or Hele ) ( 1485 - August 1542 ) , a locksmith and clockmaker of Nuremberg , Germany , is often considered the inventor of the watch .
Roger Broders ( born Paris , France , 1883 , died , Paris , 1953 ) was a French illustrator and artist best known for his travel posters promoting tourism destinations in France , typically fashionable beaches of the Côte d'Azur and skiing resorts in the French Alps in the early 20th century .
Joseph Charles Bequaert was an American naturalist of Belgian origin , born 24 May 1886 in Torhout ( Belgium ) and died on 12 January 1982 in Amherst , Massachusetts .
Nazareno Strampelli ( May 29 , 1866 , Crispiero , Castelraimondo - January 23 , 1942 , Rome ) was an Italian agronomist and plant breeder .
Jean Gehret ( January 10 , 1900 , Geneva , Switzerland - May 24 , 1956 , Paris , France ) was an actor and director , appearing in a few films directed by Jean Renoir , including La Chienne ( 1931 ) and Madame Bovary ( 1933 ) .
Josephus Nicolaus Laurenti ( 4 December 1735 , Vienna -- 17 February 1805 , Vienna ) was an Austrian naturalist and zoologist of Italian origin .
From the 1940s on , he also worked as a cultural promoter , establishing a number of cultural institutions especially in his home state of Guanajuato including the Museo de Arte Olga Costa - José Chávez Morado , named after himself and his wife , artist Olga Costa .
José Adriano Pequito Rebelo ( born 21 May 1892 in Gavião , Portugal - died 22 January 1983 in Lisbon ) was a Portuguese writer , politician and aviator .
Giulia Gonzaga joined a convent in Naples in 1535 ( at age 22 ) , and there met Juan de Valdés in 1536 .
Julien Duvivier ( 8 October 1896 , Lille -- 29 October 1967 , Paris ) was a French film director .
Jacob Neefs ( ( alternate spelling of surname : Neeffs and alternative first names : Jakob , Jacques and Jacobus ) ) ( Antwerp , 1610 -- Antwerp , after 1660 ) was a Flemish etcher , engraver and publisher .
Henri Konow was born on 7 February 1862 in Copenhagen , Denmark , the son of the diplomat and ship - owner Hans Jacob Hesselberg Konow and Ida Marie West .
Marlinde Massa ( 7 July 1944 ; Stuttgart--2 July 2014 ) was a German field hockey player .
Marcello Venusti ( 1512/5 -- 15 October 1579 ) was an Italian Mannerist painter active in Rome in mid 16th century .
Heinrich Pudor ( Aug 31 , 1865 in Loschwitz ( near Dresden ) -- Dec. 22 1943 in Leipzig ) was a German Volkish - nationalist pundit and a pioneer of nudist culture in Germany .
Charles McClung McGhee ( January 23 , 1828 -- May 5 , 1907 ) was an American industrialist and financier , active primarily in Knoxville , Tennessee , in the latter half of the nineteenth century .
Emil Gabrovitz ( also known 1875 - 1947 in Budapest ) was a Hungarian football player .
Luis Rechani Agrait ( June 22 , 1902 in Aguas Buenas , Puerto Rico -- December 12 , 1994 in San Juan , Puerto Rico ) , was a Puerto Rican poet , journalist , and playwright .
On 24 March 2012 Vince Lovegrove died , aged 65 , in a car accident at Federal , near Bangalow , New South Wales about 20 km west ( inland ) of Byron Bay .
Carola Stern ( born Ahlbeck 14 November 1925 : died Berlin 19 January 2006 ) was the name under which Erika Assmus reinvented herself as a serious journalist and ( subsequently ) author and politically committed television presenter , after she was obliged to relocate at short notice from East Germany to West Germany in 1951 .
Emil Zsigmondy 's grave is a few miles away from the accident site in the small cemetery of Saint - Christophe - en - Oisans in the Dauphiné Alps .
Cesare Mariani ( January 13 , 1826 in Rome -- 1901 ) was an Italian painter and architect of the late-19th century , active in Rome and Ascoli Piceno .
Renato Ziggiotti ( born in Campodoro , Padua , Italy on October 9 , 1892 - died in Albarè di Costermano in April 19 , 1983 ) was a Catholic Roman Priest of the Salesians of Don Bosco , who was the 5th Rector Major of that Order between 1952 and 1965 .
Caspar de Robles or Gaspard di Robles ( 1527 , Madrid , Spain -- 1585 , Antwerp ) , also known as Billy in Artois , was Stadholder of Friesland and Groningen at the beginning of the Eighty Years ' War ( reign : 1568 to 1576 ) .
Peter Zhang Bairen ( February 14 , 1915 -- October 12 , 2005 ) was the unofficial Bishop of Hanyang , China .
Ataur Rahman Khan was born in 1907 at Balia village in Dhamrai thana of Dhaka district .
John Thach died on April 15 , 1981 , in Coronado , California , four days before his 76th birthday , and was buried at Fort Rosecrans National Cemetery in San Diego .
Claude Bowes - Lyon , 13th Earl of Strathmore and Kinghorne ( Redbourn , England 21 July 1824 -- Bordighera , Italy 16 February 1904 ) , styled The Honourable Claude Bowes - Lyon from 1847 to 1865 , was a British peer .
Jakob Meyer zum Hasen ( 1482 in Basel -- 1531 in Basel ) was the bürgermeister of the city of Basel from 1516 to 1521 .
Laurette Luez died on September 12 , 1999 in Milton , Florida , aged 71 , from undisclosed causes .
Marie - Madeleine Guimard ( 27 December 1743 , Paris -- 4 May 1816 ) was a French ballerina who dominated the Parisian stage during the reign of Louis XVI .
Charles Caryl Coleman ( 1840 , Buffalo , New York--1928 , Capri , Italy ) was an American - born Italian painter .
Anna Elisabeth of Anhalt - Bernburg ( 19 March 1647 in Bernburg -- 3 September 1680 in Bernstadt , now Bierutów ) , was a princess of Anhalt - Bernburg by birth and by marriage Duchess of Württemberg - Bernstadt .
Florence Oberle died at the Little Romano Sanitarium in North Glendale , California , in 1943 .
Siegfried Popper ( 5 January 1848 , Prague -- 19 April 1933 , Prague ) was an eminent naval architect in late - nineteenth- and early twentieth - century middle Europe .
Arthur Conolly ( 2 July 1807 , London - 17 June 1842 , Bukhara ) ( sometimes misspelled Connolly ) was a British intelligence officer , explorer and writer .
Karl Friedrich Nebenius ( 29 September 1784 , Rhodt - 8 June 1857 in Karlsruhe ) was a Baden minister and author of their 1818 constitution .
Henri Renaud ( 20 April 1925 in Villedieu - sur - Indre -- 17 October 2002 in Paris ) was a French jazz pianist and record company executive .
Maria Paternò Arezzo ( December 11 , 1869 , Ragusa Ibla , Sicily -- December 28 , 1908 , Messina ) , Princess of Castellaci , was an Italian noblewoman and philanthropist who is renowned for her charity bequest to build a hospital for the poor in her city of birth .
Boris Meissner ( August 10 , 1915 Pskov - September 10 , 2003 Cologne ) was a German lawyer and social scientist , specializing in international law and Eastern European history and politics .
Arthur Middleton ( June 26 , 1742 -- January 1 , 1787 ) , of Charleston , South Carolina , was a signatory of the United States Declaration of Independence .
Émile Cartailhac ( 15 February 1845 , Marseille -- 26 November 1921 , Geneva ) was a French prehistorian , one of the founding fathers of the studies of the cave art . He is perhaps best remembered because of his involvement with the Altamira paintings .
Manlio Rho ( 1901 -- 1957 ) was a painter born in Como , Italy .
Ralph Cudworth ( 1617 -- 26 June 1688 ) was an English philosopher , the leader of the Cambridge Platonists .
Misia Sert ( born Maria Zofia Olga Zenajda Godebska ; March 30 , 1872 -- October 15 , 1950 ) was a pianist of Polish descent who hosted an artistic salon in Paris .
Moncef Chelli , born 11 February 1936 in Tunis and died 18 March 1994 in Paris , was a Franco - Tunisian philosopher and writer .
Gregory of Heimburg ( Gregorius Heimburgensis ) ( b. at Würzburg in the beginning of the fifteenth century ; d. at Tharandt near Dresden , August , 1472 ) was a German jurist , humanist and statesman .
Murdock MacKinnon ( March 15 , 1865 in Brooklyn -- October 12 , 1944 in Charlottetown ) was a Canadian politician and served as the 11th Lieutenant Governor of Prince Edward Island .
After Stalin 's death in 1953 Lina Stern was allowed to return to Moscow and in 1954 - -1968 she headed the Department of Physiology at Biophysics Institute .
Tsewang Samanla was one among three Indians who died on Mount Everest in 1996 Mount Everest disaster .
Otto Unverdorben ( 13 October 1806 - 28 November 1873 ) was a German chemist and merchant who was born in Dahme / Marke .
Giulio Turcato ( Mantua , 16 March 1912 -- Rome , 22 January 1995 ) was an Italian artist , belonging to both figurative and abstract expressionist currents .
Paolo Luigioni ( 9 February 1873 , Rome - 6 May 1937 , Rome ) was an Italian entomologist .
Theodor Adrian von Renteln ( September 15 , 1897 in Khodz , Georgia , then Russian Empire -- 1946 in Soviet Union ( disputed ) ) was an activist and politician in Nazi Germany .
She was born Victoria de los Ángeles López García in the porter 's lodge of the University of Barcelona to Bernardo Lopez Gómez ( or Gamez ) , a university caretaker , and Victoria García .
Karl Weinbacher ( 23 June 1898 in Stettin -- 16 May 1946 in Hamelin ) was a German manager and war criminal who was executed after conviction by a British war tribunal .
Walter Bornschein was killed on 27 April 1944 when he was hit by enemy fire while flying over Schweinfurt .
Inés Rodena ( April 20 , 1905 in Havana , Cuba -- April 15 , 1985 in Miami , USA ) was a Cuban radio and television writer .
Martin Weber ( 9 December 1890 in Frankfurt am Main -- 27 February 1941 ) was a German architect who designed Catholic churches .
Abdelkader Ben Bouali ( 25 October 1912 in Sendjas , Chlef Province -- 23 February 1997 in Algiers ) was a professional French footballer .
Marietta Canty was born in Hartford , Connecticut , the daughter of Mary and Henry Canty , who attended the Metropolitan African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church and actively canvassed for the Republican Party .
Michele Stefano de Rossi ( 30 October 1834 , Rome - 23 October 1898 , Rocca di Papa ) was an Italian seismologist .
Luca Forte ( c. 1615 - -c . 1670 ) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period , active mainly as a still - life painter in Naples .
Arthur Willis ( born 2 February 1920 in Denaby , Conisbrough , Yorkshire , -- died 7 November 1987 ) was a professional footballer who played for Tottenham Hotspur , Swansea City , Haverfordwest and England .
Anthonie van Borssom ( January 2 , 1631 in Amsterdam -- March 19 , 1677 in Amsterdam ) , was a Dutch Golden Age landscape painter .
Paul Scardon ( 6 May 1874 in Melbourne , Australia -- 17 January 1954 in Fontana , California ) was an actor , a producer , and a director on both Australian and New York stages .
Leon Pasternak ( 12 August 1910 , Lemberg , Austro - Hungarian Empire ( soon became Lwow , Poland , now Lviv , Ukraine ) - 14 November 1969 Warsaw , Poland ) was a Polish poet and satirist .
Felix McGrogan ( 27 July 1914 - 13 December 1989 ) was a Scottish footballer who played for Blackburn Rovers , Dunfermline Athletic , Falkirk , Kilmarnock and Dumbarton .
Héctor Anglada ( January 31 , 1976 in Villa Carlos Paz , Córdoba Province , Argentina -- March 2 , 2002 in Burzaco , Buenos Aires , Argentina in a road accident ) was a film and television actor .
Howie Schultz died on October 30 , 2009 , aged 87 , after a brief battle with cancer , in Chaska , Minnesota .
Alfred Jahn ( April 22 , 1915 , Kleparów , near Lwów ( L'viv ) -- April 1 , 1999 , Wrocław ) was a Polish geographer , geomorphologist , polar explorer and rector of Wrocław University .
Sulejman Delvina ( 5 October 1884 , Delvinë - 1 August 1933 , Vlorë ) was an Albanian politician and prime minister from March to November 1920 .
Paul Alverdes ( 6 May 1897 , Strasbourg - 28 February 1979 , Munich ) was a German novelist and poet .
Beaumont Asquith ( 16 September 1910 -- 12 April 1977 ) was an English footballer who played for Barnsley , Manchester United and Bradford City .
Federico Halbherr ( Rovereto , then in the Austro - Hungarian Empire , 15 February 1857 -- Rome , 17 July 1930 ) was an Italian archaeologist and epigrapher , known for his excavations of Crete .
Rudolf Mauersberger ( born 29 January 1889 in Mauersberg , Saxony , died 22 February 1971 in Dresden ) was a German choral conductor and composer .
John Wesley Young ( November 17 , 1879 , Columbus , Ohio , to February 17 , 1932 , Hanover , New Hampshire ) was an American mathematician who , with Oswald Veblen , introduced the axioms of projective geometry , coauthored a 2-volume work on them , and proved the Veblen--
Jacques Denis Antoine ( 6 August 1733 , Paris - 24 August 1801 ) was a French architect .
Zeki Müren ( Turkish pronunciation : ( zeˈci myˈɾen ) ) ( born in Bursa , Turkey on 6 December 1931 , died in İzmir on 24 September 1996 ) was a prominent Turkish singer , composer , and actor .
Detlev Peukert ( September 20 , 1950 in Gütersloh -- May 17 , 1990 in Hamburg ) was a German historian , noted for his studies of the relationship between what he called the `` spirit of science '' and the Holocaust and in social history and the Weimar Republic .
Pierre - Joseph Thoulier d'Olivet , Abbot of Olivet ( 1 April 1682 , Salins - les - Bains -- 8 October 1768 , Paris ) was a French abbot , writer , grammarian and translator .
Ida Hawley died on 9 December 1908 in New York City at Alston 's Sanitarium on West 61st Street from complications following an operation for appendicitis .
Robert Dearing , usually credited as R. E. Dearing ( 1893 - February 1968 , Hillingdon ) , was an English film editor .
Nicolaas van Eyck I or Nicolaas van Eijck ( I ) ( 1617 , Antwerp -- 1679 , Antwerp ) , was a Flemish painter of landscapes , equestrian and battle scenes and portraits .
Chicago Tribune journalist Arch Ward was offered the position of commissioner , but he turned it down and suggested Elmer Layden for the position .
Abraham - Louis Perrelet , ( 9 January 1729 -- 1826 ) , born in Neuchâtel in Switzerland , was a Swiss horologist .
Dr Wilhelm Ferdinand Erichson ( 26 November 1809 in Stralsund - 18 December 1848 in Berlin ) was a German entomologist .
Alan Branscombe ( 4 June 1936 , Wallasey - 27 October 1986 , London ) was an English jazz pianist , vibraphonist , and alto saxophonist .
Leonardo de Mango ( 19 February 1843 -- 1930 ) was an Italian Orientalist painter who lived and worked for most of his career in Istanbul .
Saint Philastrius ( also Philaster or Filaster ) Bishop of Brescia , was one of the bishops present at a synod held in Aquileia in 381 .
Jānis Ikaunieks ( 28 April 1912 Riga -- 27 April 1969 Riga ) was a Latvian astronomer , the founder of the Observatory of the Latvian Academy of Sciences ( LAS ) at Baldones Riekstukalns and its first director ( 1958 - 1969 ) .
Georges Davy ( French : ( davi ) ; 31 December 1883 , Bernay -- 27 July 1976 , Coutances ) was a French sociologist .
Jonathan Bayard Smith ( February 21 , 1742 -- June 16 , 1812 ) was an American merchant from Philadelphia , Pennsylvania .
Bernhard Egidius Konrad ten Brink ( January 12 , 1841 in Amsterdam -- January 29 , 1892 in Strasbourg ) was a German philologist .
Upon his retirement in 1955 , Lt . General Daniel Noce purchased a 1200 acre farm near Sperryville , Virginia and produced award winning yields of corn and prized Black Angus beef .
Theoderich von Wied ( also called Dietrich von Wied or Theodoric II ) was the Archbishop of Trier from 1212 to 1242 AD and Prince - elector .
Pietro Testa ( 1611 - -1650 ) was an Italian High Baroque artist , best known , both to his contemporaries and modern appreciation , as a printmaker and draftsman , who was active in Rome .
Marianne Van Hirtum ( 20 July 1925 , Namur -- 11 June 1988 , Paris ) was a Belgian author writing in the French language , connected with the surrealist movement .
Louis - Jacques - Paul Bergon ( 27 September 1863 , Paris -- 27 January 1912 ) was a French photographer , musician and naturalist .
Kujtim Majaci ( born in Fier , 20 March 1962 - 14 July 2009 ) was an Albanian football player .
Richerus or Richer of Reims ( fl . 10th century ) was a monk of Saint - Remi , just outside Reims , and a historian , an important source for the contemporary kingdom of France .
Walter Hohmann ( 18 March 1880 in Hardheim , Germany -- 11 March 1945 in Essen , Germany ) was a German engineer who made an important contribution to the understanding of orbital dynamics .
Frank Tarloff ( February 4 , 1916 , Brooklyn , New York -- June 25 , 1999 , Beverly Hills , California ) was a blacklisted American screenwriter who won an Academy Award for best original screenplay for Father Goose .
Carlo Alberto Castigliano ( 9 November 1847 , Asti -- 25 October 1884 , Milan ) was an Italian mathematician and physicist known for Castigliano 's method for determining displacements in a linear - elastic system based on the partial derivatives of strain energy .
Carl Friedländer ( 19 November 1847 , Brieg ( Brzeg ) , Silesia -- 13 May 1887 , Meran ( Merano ) , County of Tyrol ) was a German pathologist and microbiologist who helped discover the bacterial cause of pneumonia in 1882 .
Samson Flexor ( born Samson Modestovich Flexor ; 9 September 1907 , in Soroca , Bessarabia , Imperial Russia -- 31 July 1971 , in São Paulo , Brazil ) was a French and Brazilian artist , and founder of the Brazilian abstract art .
Otto Weidinger died January 10 , 1990 , aged 75 , in Aalen , Baden - Württemberg , Germany .
María Elena Walsh was born in Villa Sarmiento , Ramos Mejía , Greater Buenos Aires , to an English railway worker , of Irish descent , who played the piano and an Argentine woman of Andalusian descent .
Joseph Hillebrand ( 24 August 1788 Großdüngen ( near Hildesheim ) - 25 January 1871 Bad Soden am Taunus ) was a German novelist , philosopher and historian of literature .
Israel Aksenfeld ( Nemirov , Ukraine , Russian Empire , ca . 1787 - Paris , France , ca . 1868 ) was a Judæo - German writer .
Pietro Buscaglia ( born February 9 , 1911 in Turin ; died July 12 , 1997 in Vigevano ) was an Italian professional football player .
Georg Christian Dieffenbach ( 4 December 1822 Schlitz , Hesse - 10 May 1901 Schlitz ) was a German poet and theologian .
Gold Selleck Silliman ( 1732 - -1790 ) was born in Fairfield , Connecticut , graduated from Yale University and practiced law and served as a crown attorney before the American Revolution .
Mazyar was shortly brought to Samarra , where he was executed .
John Frederick Amelung ( 1741 - -1798 ) , was a German glass artist active in Maryland .
Dante Carnesecchi ( b. Vezzano Ligure , 12 March 1892 -- d. La Spezia , 29 March 1921 ) was an Italian individualist anarchist associated with left wing futurism alongside other individualist anarchists such as Renzo Novatore , Leda Rafanelli , Auro d'Arcola , and Giovanni Governato .
Arthur Goldreich ( 1929 -- 24 May 2011 ) was a South African - Israeli abstract painter and a key figure in the anti - apartheid movement in the country of his birth and a critic of the form of Zionism practiced in Israel .
Charles - André Julien taught at the Mohammed V University of Rabat and the Sorbonne of Paris .
Cowboy Morgan Evans died at home in Bonham , Texas , of an apparent heart attack .
Blessed Meinwerk ( c. 975 -- 5 June 1036 ) was the Bishop of Paderborn from 1009 until his death .
Norbert Goeneutte ( 23 July 1854 , Paris - 9 October 1894 , Auvers - sur - Oise ) was a French painter , engraver and illustrator ; notably for the novel La Terre by Émile Zola .
Aladar Imre ( February 14 , 1898 - 1937/1938 ) was a Romanian trade unionist , communist militant and member - elect of the Romanian Parliament , executed in the Soviet Union during the Great Purge .
Paul Diderichsen ( 16 August 1905 , Copenhagen -- 9 October 1964 , Copenhagen ) was a Danish linguist who is known for his model of sentence structure in Danish which has been widely applied to describe the syntax of languages with fixed word order , such as the mainland Scandinavian languages .
Carlo Donida Labati ( 30 October 1920 , in Milan -- 22 April 1998 , in Porto Valtravaglia ) was an Italian composer and pianist .
Grigorios Maraslis ( Greek : Γρηγόριος Μαρασλής , Russian : Григорий Григорьевич Маразли ; 25 July 1831 -- 1 May 1907 ) was an official of the Russian Empire and long - time mayor of Odessa ( 1878 - -1895 ) of Greek origin .
Vico Torriani ( September 21 , 1920 in Geneva as Ludovico Oxens Torriani -- February 26 , 1998 in Agno , Ticino ) was a Swiss actor and Schlager singer .
Broncia Koller - Pinell ( 25 February 1863 , Sanok - 26 April 1934 , Oberwaltersdorf ) was an Austrian Expressionist painter who specialized in portraits and still - lifes .
Chela Cordero ( born Zaira Cordero in Mendoza , 1892 - March 24 , 1982 in Buenos Aires ) was an Argentine actress .
Eugen Zintgraff ( born January 16 , 1858 in Düsseldorf , died December 4 , 1897 on Tenerife ) was a German explorer .
Carl Reinhold August Wunderlich ( August 4 , 1815 , Sulz am Neckar -- September 25 , 1877 , Leipzig ) was a German physician , pioneer psychiatrist , and medical professor .
Émile Colinus ( born 1884 in Paris , died 1966 in Paris ) , was a French painter and illustrator .
Jacob Abendana ( 1630 -- September 12 , 1685 ) was hakham of London from 1680 until his death .
Daniel Itzig ( also known as Daniel Yoffe 18 March 1723 in Berlin -- 17 May 1799 in Potsdam ) was a Court Jew of Kings Frederick II the Great and Frederick William II of Prussia .
Bruno of Cologne ( Cologne c. 1030 -- Serra San Bruno 6 October 1101 ) was the founder of the Carthusian Order , personally founded the order 's first two communities .
Johannes Conrad was a Professor of economics in Halle ( Saale ) , Prussian Germany .
Nikolaus Dumba ( 24 July 1830 , Vienna - 23 March 1900 , Budapest ) was an Austrian industrialist and liberal politician of Greek - Aromanian descent .
Paulus Hector Mair ( 1517 - -1579 ) was an Augsburg civil servant , and active in the martial arts of his time .
Bengt Sundkler ( May 7 1908 Degerfors , Västerbotten , Sweden - April 5 1995 , Uppsala , Sweden ) was a Swedish - Tanzanian Church historian , missiologist , professor and bishop of Bukoba .
Saint Émilie de Villeneuve ( 9 March 1811 -- 2 October 1854 ) was a Roman Catholic French nun and the founder of the Sisters of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception of Castres .
Matteo Pertsch ( German : Matthäus Pertsch ) ( 1769 -- April 11 , 1834 ) was an Austrian classical architect responsible for many historic structures in Trieste .
Helmut Bohlens was killed in action on 19 April 1943 over the Mediterranean Sea .
Marie Epstein ( born Marie - Antonine Epstein ; 14 August 1899 , Warsaw - 24 April 1995 , Paris ) was an actress , scenarist , film director , and film preservationist .
Victor Millan , whose real name was Joseph Brown , ( August 1 , 1920 -- April 3 , 2009 ) was an American actor , academic and former Dean of the theatre arts department at Santa Monica College in Santa Monica , California .
George de Godzinsky ( 5 July 1914 , Saint Peterburg , Russia -- 23 May 1994 , Helsinki , Finland ) was a Russian - Finnish composer and conductor .
François Barthélemy Michel Édouard Cibot ( 1799 - -1877 ) was a French historical and landscape painter born in Paris .
Johann Georg Sulzer ( German : ( ˈzʊltsər ) ; 16 October 1720 in Winterthur -- 27 February 1779 in Berlin ) was a Swiss professor of Mathematics , who later on moved on to the field of electricity .
Rev. Pauli Murray died of pancreatic cancer in the house she owned with a lifelong friend , Maida Springer Kemp , in Pittsburgh , Pennsylvania , on July 1 , 1985 .
Danilo Alvim was an amateur playing with América when Flávio Costa 's Rio de Janeiro squad practiced against them in 1941 .
Gustav von Myrdacz ( born 12 July 1874 in Vienna ; died 11 July 1945 in Tirana ) was an Austrian noble who was instrumental in organising the Royal Albanian Army from the early 1920s to 1945 .
Anton Ausserer ( 5 July 1843 in Bozen ( Bolzano ) , Tyrol -- 20 July 1889 in Graz ) was an Austrian naturalist specialising in spiders .
Adele Faccio ( November 13 , 1920 in Pontebba , Udine -- February 8 , 2007 in Rome ) was an Italian politician and deputy of the Radical Party ( Partito Radicale ) .
Bernardo di Matteo del Borra Gamberelli ( 1409 Settignano -- 23.9.1464 Florence ) , better known as Bernardo Rossellino , was an Italian sculptor and architect , the elder brother of the sculptor Antonio Rossellino .
Amschel Moses Rothschild ( c. 1710 -- 6 October 1755 ) was an 18th - century German Jewish moneychanger and trader in silk cloth in the Frankfurter Judengasse , the Jewish ghetto in the Free Imperial City of Frankfurt am Main in present - day Germany .
Count Fran Đivo Gundulić or Francesco Giovanni Gondola ; ( born 1633 , Dubrovnik - died 1700 , Vienna ) was a member of an old noble family from Dubrovnik ( then Republic of Ragusa ) , the House of Gundulić .
Balthasar Beschey ( 1708 , Antwerp -- 1776 , Antwerp ) was a Flemish painter , draughtsman and decorative painter of interiors .
Joseph - Jacques Ramée ( April 26 , 1764 in Charlemont , France -- May 18 , 1842 at the Chateau de Beaurains , Noyon ) was a French architect , interior designer , and landscape architect working within the neoclassicist idiom .
Thomas Grynaeus , also Thomas Griner , ( 1512 Veringendorf-- 2 August 1564 Rötteln ) was a theologian , reformer and pastor .
Anna Simms Banks ( 1862 - -1923 ) was an African - American educator and political figure from Winchester , Kentucky .
Wilhelm Uhde ( 28 October 1874 , Friedeberg , Province of Brandenburg ( now Poland ) -- 17 August 1947 , Paris ) was a German art collector , dealer , author and critic , an early collector of modernist painting , and a significant figure in the career of Henri Rousseau .
Pietro Porcinai ( Florence , Italy 1910 - -1986 ) is renowned as one of the most outstanding Italian landscape architects of the twentieth century .
Jean - Louis Aristide Hignard ( Nantes 20 May 1822 - Vernon 20 March 1898 ) , was a French composer of light opera notable as a friend of Jules Verne , also from Nantes and six years Hignard 's junior , some of whose librettos and verse he set to music .
Antoine Rater ( 26 April 1729 , Lyon -- 4 August 1794 Miribel ) was a French architect .
Arthur Villeneuve , C.M. ( January 4 , 1910 , Chicoutimi , Quebec - May 24 , 1990 , Montreal , Quebec ) was a Québécois painter and member of the Order of Canada .
Konrad Wachsmann ( May 16 , 1901 in Frankfurt an der Oder , Germany -- November 25 , 1980 in Los Angeles , California ) was a German modernist architect .
Elmer Rice lived for many years on a wooded estate in Stamford , Connecticut , until his death in Southampton , England , in 1967 while on a trip with third wife , Barbara .
Frank Sheeran was born in Darby , Pennsylvania , a small working - class borough on the outskirts of Philadelphia .
Frederick Forrest Peabody ( July 6 , 1859 -- February 23 , 1927 ) was a prominent citizen of Santa Barbara , California in the early twentieth century .
Georgios Prokopiou ( Greek : Γεώργιος Προκοπίου ; 1876 , in Smyrna -- 20 December 1940 , near Tepelenë ) was a Greek war artist , photographer and documentary film maker .
Arnold Johan Messenius ( Gdańsk , 1607 - Stockholm , 1651 ) was a Swedish enfant terrible and Rikshistoriograf who was condemned to death and executed under the reign of Christina , Queen of Sweden .
Georg Carabelli , Edler von Lunkaszprie ( Squire of Lunkaszprie ) ( Hungarian : Carabelli György ) ( December 11 , 1787 , Pest -- October 24 , 1842 , Vienna ) was a prominent Hungarian dentist and professor of dental surgery in Vienna .
Hans Müller - Schlösser ( 1884 - -1956 ) was a German poet and playwright closely associated with his native city of Düsseldorf .
Jan Piotr Sapieha ( English : John Peter Sapieha , 1569 - -1611 ) was a Polish nobleman , general , politician , diplomat , governor of Uświat county , member of the Parliament and a skilled commander of the Polish troops stationing in the Moscow Kremlin .
Martín Rico y Ortega ( 12 November 1833 , El Escorial -- 13 April 1908 , Venice , Italy ) was a Spanish painter of landscapes and cityscapes .
Conrad Weygand ( 8 November 1890 -- 18 April 1945 ) was Professor of Chemistry at the University of Leipzig .
Roger Caron was born in 1938 , to extremely poor parents Donat and Yvonne in Cornwall , Ontario , Canada .
Jean - Michel Beysser ( Ribeauvillé , 4 November 1753 -- Paris , 13 April 1794 ) was a French general .
Antonio Annarumma ( January 10 1947 Monteforte Irpino -- November 19 , 1969 Milan ) was an Italian policeman .
Richard Rudolf Walzer , FBA ( 14 July 1900 , Berlin -- 16 April 1975 , Oxford ) was a German - born British expert on Greek philosophy .
Pierre Charron was born in Paris , one of the twenty - five children of a bookseller .
William Allman , M.D. ( 1776 - -1846 ) , professor of botany at Dublin , was born at Kingston , Jamaica , on 7 Feb. 1776 , but his parents removed to Ireland before he was four years of age , his mother being a native of Waterford .
Éva Ruttkai ( 31 December 1927 , Budapest -- 27 September 1986 , Budapest ) was a Hungarian actress , well known from her work on stage , cinema , and television productions .
Gerd Wedler ( 19 August 1929 in Braunschweig , Germany -- 13 September 2008 in Erlangen , Germany ) was a German chemist .
Apollonie Sabatier ( born Aglaé Joséphine Savatier ; 1822 - -1890 ) was a French courtesan , artists ' muse and bohémienne in 1850s Paris .
Marin Marais ( French : ( maʁɛ̃ maʁɛ ) ; 31 May 1656 , Paris -- 15 August 1728 , Paris ) was a French composer and viol player .
Angelos Mavropoulos ( Greek : Άγγελος Μαυρόπουλος , 1901 in Asia Minor ( now Turkey ) -- 5 March 1979 in Athens , Greece ) was a Greek actor .
Jean - Louis Alléon - Dulac was born in Saint - Étienne , Loire , the son of an adviser of the king .
Ibn Hisham has been said to have grown up in Basra and moved afterwards to Egypt , while others have narrated that his family was descended from Basra but he himself was born in Old Cairo .
Lewis Saul Benjamin , ( pen name , Lewis Melville ) ( 1874 - -1932 ) was an English author , born in London , England and educated privately in England and Germany .
Yoshio Kondo ( 1910 , on Maui , Hawaii - 1990 , on Oahu , Hawaii ) was a biologist and malacologist .
Werner Tübke ( 30 July 1929 Schönebeck , Germany -- 27 May 2004 Leipzig , Germany ) was a German painter , best known for his monumental Peasants ' War Panorama located in Bad Frankenhausen .
Franco Fraticelli ( 30 August 1928 in Rome , Italy--26 April 2012 in Rome ) was an Italian film editor with more than 150 film credits .
August Ferdinand von Veltheim ( 18 September 1741 Harbke - 2 October 1801 . Braunschweig ) was a German mineralogist and geologist , and came from the aristocratic family of Veltheim .
Noe Canjura ( Apopa , El Salvador , August 14 , 1922 - Morienval , France , September 29 , 1970 ) was a Salvadoran painter and a prominent figure in 20th century modern art in France .
Baldomero Sanín Cano ( 1861 in Rionegro , Antioquia -- 1957 in Bogotá ) was a Colombian essayist , journalist , linguist , humanist and university professor .
Shami Kermashani ( in Kurdish : شامی کرماشانی ) , also known as Shamurad Mushtaq , ( 1927-November 23 , 1984),was a famous Kurdish poet from the city of Kermanshah from Iran - also known as Iranian Kurdistan .
Günther Rücker ( February 2 , 1924 Reichenberg ( Liberec ) - February 24 , 2008 Meiningen ) was a German writer , playwright and film director .
Alexander Brullov was born in Saint Petersburg into a family of French artists : his great grandfather , his grandfather , his father and his brothers ( including Karl Brullov ) were artists .
Romulus Bărbulescu ( October 27 , 1925 , Sulina -- February 9 , 2010 , Bucharest ) was a Romanian science - fiction writer .
Eldon P. Wyman ( 11 January 1917 - 7 December 1941 ) was an ensign serving aboard the USS Oklahoma ( BB-37 ) when the Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor on 7 December 1941 .
Harold Rosenberg ( February 2 , 1906 , New York City -- July 11 , 1978 , New York City ) was an American writer , educator , philosopher and art critic .
Willem Romeyn ( ca.1624 , Haarlem -- after 1693 ) , was a Dutch Golden Age landscape painter .
Kazimierz Serocki ( 2 May 1922 -- 9 January 1981 ) was a Polish composer and one of the founders of the Warsaw Autumn contemporary music festival .
Lloyd Lonergan ( 3 March 1870 , Chicago , Illinois - 6 April 1937 , New York ) was one of the most prolific scenario and screenwriters in American silent film .
Paul Best ( Hutton Cranswick c.1590 - Driffield , 1657 ) was one of the first British converts to the `` Socinian '' Polish Brethren , and one of the first Unitarians to be imprisoned .
The David Rocastle Trust is a charity based in London , UK founded in memory of Rocastle .
Strachan Bethune ( November 6 , 1821 -- March 8 , 1910 ) , Q.C. , twice Bâtonnier of Montreal and the 1st Anglican Chancellor of the Diocese of Montreal .
Roger Proot ( born 21 November 1905 in Woumen - died 29 September 1971 in Bruges ) was a Belgian football player .
Jacques Carlu ( 7 April 1890 Bonnières - sur - Seine - 3 December 1976 Paris ) was a French architect and designer , working mostly in Art Deco style , active in France , Canada , and in the United States .
Pieter de Molijn ( 6 April 1595 in London -- 23 March 1661 in Haarlem ) was a Dutch Golden Age painter and engraver born in England .
Albert Hay Malotte ( Philadelphia , Pennsylvania , May 19 , 1895-Los Angeles on November 16 , 1964 ) was an American pianist , organist , composer and educator .
Jan Linsen ( Hoorn , 1602 or 1603 -- Hoorn , May 26 , 1635 ) was a Dutch painter of mythological and historical themes .
Jean Tinguely died in 1991 at the age of 66 years in the Bern Hospital after a heart illness .
Albert Nicholas ( May 27 , 1900 , New Orleans , Louisiana -- September 3 , 1973 , Basel , Switzerland ) was an American jazz reed player .
Antoni Melchior Fijałkowski ( Pszczew , near Poznań , January 3 , 1778 -- October 5 , 1861 , Warsaw ) was the Archbishop Metropolitan of Warsaw and spiritual leader of the nation during the Partitions of Poland .
Walter Johannes Stein ( 6 February 1891 , in Vienna -- 7 July 1957 , in London ) was an Austrian philosopher , Waldorf school teacher , Grail researcher , and one of the pioneers of anthroposophy .
Vincenzo Monaco ( 20 July 1911 , Rome -- 3 March 1969 , Rome ) was an Italian architect .
Berthold of Calabria ( French : Berthold de Malifaye ; Latin : Bertoldus Calabriensis ; died 1195 ) was a Norman French crusader who instituted a hermit colony on Mount Carmel in 1185 .
Mildred McDaniel - Singleton died in Pasadena , California , aged 70 , from undisclosed causes .
Caridad Bravo Adams ( Spanish pronunciation : ( kaɾiˈðað ˈbɾaβo ˈaðams ) ) ( born on January 14 , 1908 in Villahermosa , Tabasco -- August 13 , 1990 in Mexico City ) was a prolific Mexican writer and the most famous telenovela writer worldwide .
Juana Reina Castrillo , Juanita Reina , alias La Reina de la Copla ( Copla Queen ) ( August 25 , 1925 in Seville -- March 19 , 1999 in Seville ) was a Spanish actress and copla singer .
Fanny Churberg ( 12 December 1845 Vaasa -- 10 May 1892 Helsinki ) was a Finnish landscape painter .
William Loughton Smith ( 1758 -- December 19 , 1812 ) was an American lawyer from Charleston , South Carolina .
Joachim Lütkemann ( 15 December 1608 , Demmin - 18 October 1655 , Wolfenbüttel ) was a German Lutheran theologian and writer of devotional literature .
Charles II , Duke of Bourbon ( Château de Moulins , 1434 - -September 13 , 1488 , Lyon ) , was Archbishop of Lyon from an early age and a French diplomat under the rule of Louis XI of France .
Devery Freeman , born Feb. 13 , 1913 in Brooklyn , died Oct 07 , 2005 in Los Angeles was a screen writer , novelist and union activist who helped to establish the Writers Guild of America .
Sawai Bhawani Singh , was admitted to a private hospital in Gurgaon , Haryana on 29 March and died on 17 April 2011 following multi - organ failure .
John McClannahan Crockett ( December 26 , 1816 -- August 4 , 1887 ) was a Texan lawyer , mayor of Dallas , and the eighth Lieutenant Governor of Texas .
Innocenzo Fraccaroli ( 1805 , in Castelrotto di Valpolicella ( Verona ) -- 1882 , in Milan ) was an Italian sculptor .
Ferdinand Pfohl ( German : ( pfoːl ) ; 12 October 1862 , Elbogen , Bohemia , Austria - Hungary , now Loket n . O. , Czech Republic -- 16 December 1949 , Hamburg - Bergedorf ) , was a German music critic , music writer and composer .
Jean - François Heymans , also Jan Frans Heymans ( 25 December 1859 , Gooik -- 10 April 1932 , Middelkerke ) was a Belgian pharmacologist and physiologist .
Selvarajah Rajivarnam ( 1982 -- April 29 , 2007 ) was a young minority Sri Lankan Tamil journalist from Jaffna , Sri Lanka .
Ernest Mamboury ( 1 April 1878 - 23 September 1953 ) was a Swiss scholar renowned for his works on the historic structures in Turkish cities , particularly on Byzantine art and architecture in Istanbul .
Johann Georg Schwarz ( Иван Григорьевич Шварц ; 1751 - -1784 ) was a philosophy professor at the Moscow University who headed the Russian branch of the Rosicrucian Society .
Peter Reichensperger ( b. at Coblenz , 28 May 1810 - d. at Berlin , 31 December 1892 ) was a German jurist and parliamentarian .
Dula Bhaya Kag ( November 25 , 1902 - February 22 , 1977 ) was an Indian poet , songwriter , writer , and artist born in 1902 in Kagdham ( Majadar ) , a village in the Saurashtra Region , near Mahuva in Gujarat , India .
John Sjoberg ( 12 June 1941 -- 2 October 2008 ) was a Scottish footballer who played 15 seasons for Leicester City between 1958 and 1973 .
William Dana Orcutt was an important book and typeface designer in Boston , an important printmaking and bookmaking center , in the late nineteenth and early twentieth century .
Edward Vermilye Huntington ( April 26 , 1874 , Clinton , New York , USA -- November 25 , 1952 , Cambridge , Massachusetts , USA ) was an American mathematician .
Giovanni Battista Doria ( 1470 -- March 1563 ) was a doge of Genoa .
Count Nicolò Minato ( b. Bergamo , ca . 1627 ; d. Vienna , 28 February 1698 ) was an Italian poet , librettist and impresario .
After creating four clay sculptures to memorialize his children , Ivan Meštrović died in early 1962 at the age of 79 , in South Bend , Indiana at St. Joseph Hospital .
François Pidou de Saint Olon ( 1640 , Touraine - 1720 , Paris ) was a French diplomat under Louis XIV .
Rudolf Miele ( November 4 , 1929 , in Gütersloh , Westphalia -- August 19 , 2004 , in Gütersloh ) was a German entrepreneur .
Fernand Augereau ( Naintré , 23 November 1882 - - Combrée , 26 July 1958 ) was a successful early twentieth century French road racing cyclist .
Egide Linnig or Egidius Linnig ( Antwerp , 25 August 1821 -- Sint Willibrords , Antwerp , 13 October 1860 ) was a Belgian painter , draughtsman and engraver who is best known for his marine art and occasional genre scenes .
Georg Heinrich Zincke or Georg Heinrich Zincken ( 27 September 1692 , Altenroda -- 15 August 1769 , Braunschweig ) was a German jurist and cameralist .
Max Linde ( 14 June 1862 -- 23 April 1940 in Lübeck ) was an ophthalmologist who is best known as a patron and art collector of the early 20th century .
Born in Lausanne , Maurice Chappaz spent his childhood between Martigny and the abbey of Le Châble , in the Swiss canton of Valais .
Gabriel Ramanantsoa ( 13 April 1906 Antananarivo - 9 May 1979 Paris ) was the President and Prime Minister of Madagascar from 1972 to 1975 .
Born in Darlington , Tommy Atkin started out with his home town club Darlington in 1925 who were in the Second Division , having their highest ever League finsh that season .
John Wellborn Root ( January 10 , 1850 -- January 15 , 1891 ) was an American architect who was based in Chicago with Daniel Burnham .
Heinz Traimer ( 1921 - 2002 ) was a German graphic designer and advertising copywriter who lived and worked in Vienna .
Lieutenant Colonel Óscar Osorio died in Methodist Hospital in Houston , Texas , USA , as a result of kidney failure complicated by pneumonia .
Jean - Eugène Buland is a French painter , born on October 26 , 1852 , in Paris , and died in 1926 in Charly - sur - Marne in the Aisne .
Watzenrode was born in Thorn ( Toruń ) , son of the merchant Lucas Watzenrode the Elder ( 1400 - -62 ) .
Margaret of Brunswick - Lüneburg ( 1442 -- 8 April 1512 in Wienhausen ) was a princess of Brunswick - Lüneburg by birth and by marriage a Duchess of Mecklenburg - Stargard .
Giuseppe Astarita ( Naples , 1707 -- Naples , 1775 ) was an Italian architect and engineer of the late - Baroque or Rococo period .
Rudolf Ernst ( 14 February 1854 , Vienna - 1932 , Fontenay - aux - Roses ) was an Austro - French painter , printmaker and ceramics painter who is best known for his orientalist motifs .
Paul Raud ( 22 October ( O.S. 10 October ) 1865 in Kirikuküla , Viru - Jaagupi Parish -- 22 November 1930 in Tallinn ) was an Estonian painter .
Captain George Duff RN ( c. 1 February 1764 -- 21 October 1805 ) was a British naval officer during the American War of Independence , the French Revolutionary Wars and the Napoleonic Wars , who was killed by a cannonball at the Battle of Trafalgar .
Jan Anton Garemyn ( or Garemijn ) ( 1712 - 1799 ) , a Flemish painter and engraver , was born at Bruges , and studied under Louis Boons and Matthias de Visch .
Friedrich Wilhelm Hans Ludendorff ( Dunowo , 26 May 1873 - Potsdam , 26 June 1941 ) was a German astronomer and astrophysicist .
Constance Baker Motley ( September 14 , 1921 -- September 28 , 2005 ) was an African - American civil rights activist , lawyer , judge , state senator , and Borough President of Manhattan , New York City .
Edwin Atwater ( September 14 , 1808 in Williston , Vermont -- June 18 , 1874 in Montreal ) was a Canadian businessman , corporate director and municipal politician in Montreal .
Ambrosius Francken II , also called the younger , to distinguish him from his uncle of the same name , was born at Antwerp in the latter part of the 16th century .
Maxwell Mays died at his home in the Greene section of Coventry , Rhode Island on November 16 , 2009 .
Oberto Spinola was an Italian politician , a leader of the Republic of Genoa in the 13th century .
Aby Warburg was born in Hamburg into the wealthy Warburg family of German Jewish bankers .
Count Pavel Andreyevich Shuvalov ( Russian : Па́вел Андре́евич Шува́лов ; Leipzig / Saint Petersburg , 25 November ( O.S. 13 November ) 1830 -- Yalta , 20 April ( O.S. 7 April ) 1908 ) was an Imperial Russian statesman and the brother of Count Pyotr Andreyevich Shuvalov .
In the 1980s , Cheikha Rimitti moved to Paris , loosening her ties with the Algerian authorities but never cutting herself off from the Algerian people , her first fans .
Milan Ružić ( 25 July 1955 in Rijeka , Yugoslavia -- 25 January 2014 in Rijeka , Croatia ) was a Croatian football player .
Carl Gustav Calwer ( 11 November 1821 , Stuttgart -- 19 August 1874 , Mineralbad Berg ) was a German entomologist who specialised in Coleoptera .
Dionysios Tsokos ( Greek : Διονύσιος Τσόκος ; c.1814/20 , Zakynthos -- 1862 , Athens ) was a Greek painter ; one of the first to gain recognition in the post - Ottoman period .
Johannes Sass ( also in German : Saß , born 4 September 1889 in Hamburg , died 31 December 1971 ) was a linguist who specialized in the Low German language .
Vlastimir Pavlović Carevac ( Serbian Cyrillic : Властимир Павловић Царевац ; 9 October 1895 - 10 January 1965 ) was a Serbian violinist and conductor , and founder and director of the National Orchestra of Radio Belgrade .
