King Tubby 's music career began in the 1950s with the rising popularity of Jamaican sound systems , which were to be found all over Kingston and which were developing into enterprising businesses .
Simon - Emmanuel Duplay ( 10 September 1836 , in Paris -- 16 January 1924 ) was a French surgeon who was a member of the Académie de Médecine ( 1879 ) .
David Hendricks Bergey was an American bacteriologist , born December 27 , 1860 in Skippack , Pennsylvania , died September 5 , 1937 in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania .
Frederik Theodor Kloss ( 19 September 1802 , in Braunschweig -- 9 June 1876 , in Copenhagen ) was a German - Danish painter who specialized in marine painting .
Hermann Rieder ( May 3 , 1928 , in Altfraunhofen ( near Landshut ) -- August 22 , 2009 , in Gaiberg ( near Heidelberg ) ) was a German javelin thrower , trainer and sports scientist .
Albert Allen Bartlett ( born March 21 , 1923 in Shanghai , died September 7 , 2013 in Boulder , Colorado ) was an emeritus professor of physics at the University of Colorado at Boulder , USA .
Richard Phené Spiers ( 1838 - October 3 , 1916 , London ) was an English architect and author .
Jannes van der Wal ( November 12 , 1956 in Driesum -- September 24 , 1996 in Groningen ) was a Dutch / Frisian draughts player and world champion in the game .
Fritz Moravec was born on April 27 , 1922 in the Favoriten tenth district of Vienna , Austria .
Kutlu Adalı ( 1935 in Nicosia -- July 6 , 1996 ) , was a Turkish Cypriot journalist , poet and socio - political researcher , and peace advocate .
Rodney Gregory Masterson , Jr. , known as Rod Masterson ( February 14 , 1945 -- September 12 , 2013 ) , was an American film and television actor from Baton Rouge , Louisiana .
Chaim Ozer Grodzinski ( Hebrew : חיים עוזר גרודזנסקי‎ ; August 24 , 1863 -- August 9 , 1940 ) was a pre - eminent Av beis din ( rabbinical chief justice ) , posek ( halakhic authority ) , and Talmudic scholar in Vilnius , Lithuania in the late 19th and early 20th centuries .
Alfred Guillou ( 12 September 1844 , Concarneau - 1926 , Concarneau ) was a French painter of Breton heritage .
Maurice Archambaud ( born Paris , 30 August 1906 , died Le Raincy , 3 December 1955 ) was a French professional cyclist from 1932 to 1944 .
Volodia Dubinin ( Russian : Володя Дубинин August 29 , 1928 -- January 4 , 1942 in Kerch , Ukraine ) was a Pioneer Hero of the Soviet Union .
Eduard Steuermann ( June 18 , 1892 in Sambor , Austro - Hungarian Empire -- November 11 , 1964 in New York City ) was an Austrian ( and later American ) pianist and composer .
Rupprecht Geiger ( 26 January 1908 -- 6 December 2009 ) was an abstract painter and sculptor from Munich , Germany .
A district attorney in Hyderabad filed a case with human rights commission against undisclosed film personalities of Telugu film industry for discrimination against Uday Kiran .
Edo Patregnani died on 3 December 2013 , aged 75 , in Cento , Province of Ferrara , Italy .
Eugenio Bava ( 4 June 1886 , Italy -- 23 October 1966 , Rome , Italy ) was an Italian film cinematographer and is the patriarch of the Bava family .
Charles de Berlaymont ( 1510 in Berlaimont ? -- 1578 in Namur ? ) was a leading nobleman in the Low Countries in the 16th century .
Jean - François Bautte ( 22 March 1772 , Geneva -- 30 November 1837 , Geneva ) was a Swiss watchmaker and jeweller famous for several reasons : he founded the most complete watch manufacture of his time in Geneva .
Friedrich August Theodor Winnecke ( February 5 , 1835 in Groß - Heere , near Hannover -- December 3 , 1897 in Bonn ) was a German astronomer .
Patrick de Gayardon ( French pronunciation : ​(patʁik də ɡɛjaʁdɔ̃ ) ; 23 January 1960 , Oullins , Rhône -- 13 April 1998 , Hawaii ) was a French skydiver , skysurfer and a BASE jumper .
Johann Jakob Sulzer ( 23 December 1821 -- 27 June 1897 ) was a Swiss politician , mayor of Winterthur ( 1858 - -1873 ) and President of the Swiss Council of States ( 1876 ) .
Dr. Tinsley Lindley OBE ( 27 October 1865 in Nottingham -- 31 March 1940 in Nottingham ) was an English footballer .
William Herbert Dray ( 23 June 1921 , in Montreal -- 6 August 2009 , in Toronto ) was a Canadian philosopher of history .
Adriaan Koerbagh ( 1633 , Amsterdam -- 1669 , Amsterdam ) was a Dutch scholar and writer best known as a critic of religion and conventional morality .
Louis - Marie Michon ( 2 November 1802 , Blanzy , Saône - et - Loire - 6 May 1866 , Paris ) was a French surgeon .
In the Battle of Yamama , Tufayl ibn Amr fell as a martyr .
Johann Christian Mikan ( born December 5 , 1769 in Teplitz , died December 28 , 1844 in Prague ) was an Austrian - Czech botanist , zoologist and entomologist .
Franz Heinrich Ludolf Ahrens ( 6 June 1809 , Helmstedt -- 25 September 1881 , Hanover ) was a German philologist .
Charles Previn ( January 11 , 1888 - September 21 , 1973 ) was an American film composer who was highly active at Universal in Hollywood during the 1940s and 1950s .
Christian Dotremont , ( 12 December 1922 -- 20 August 1979 ) , was a Belgian painter and poet who was born in Tervuren , Belgium .
Olfert Dapper was born in early 1636 in the Jordaan in Amsterdam .
Giacomo Tebaldi was born in Rome , the son of nobles Marco and Ventura Tebaldi .
Matthias Hoë von Hoënegg ( 24 February 1580 , Vienna -- 4 March 1645 , Dresden ) was a German Lutheran pastor .
Antonio Neri ( 29 February 1576 , Florence -- 1614 , Florence ) was a Florentine priest who published L’Arte Vetraria or The Art of Glass in 1612 .
Elizabeth Boothe Hunton ( June 20 , 1853 -- September 30 , 1854 ) Eppa Hunton III ( April 14 , 1855 -- March 5 , 1932 ) Their second child , Eppa Hunton III , went on to co - found the notable Richmond law firm Hunton & Williams in 1901 .
Heinrich Jakob Fried , born at Queichheim , near Landau , in 1802 , studied at Stuttgart and Augsburg , and from 1822 under Langer and Cornelius at the Academy of Munich .
Egidio Vagnozzi was born in Rome to Francesco and Pasqua ( née Jachetti ) Vagnozzi , and studied at the Minor Seminary , Pontifical Roman Seminary , and Pontifical Lateran University ( from where he obtained doctorates in philosophy , theology , and canon law ) .
Givi Javakhishvili was born on December 18 , 1912 in Tbilisi in the family of prominent doctor Dimitri Javakhishvili and Anna Magalashvili .
George II of Brieg ( Legnica , 18 July 1523 -- Brzeg , 7 May 1586 ) , was a Duke of Brzeg from 1547 until his death .
Ellen Pollock ( 29 June 1902 -- 29 March 1997 ) was a British character actress , mainly appeared on stage in London 's West End .
Federico Gana ( Santiago , Chile ; January 15 , 1867 -- April 22 , 1926 ) was a Chilean writer and diplomat .
Ludwig Arndts von Arnesberg ( 19 August 1803 , Arnsberg , Prussia - 1 March 1878 , Vienna ) was a German jurist .
Edmund William Barker ( 1 December 1920 -- 12 April 2001 , often referred to as `` Edmund W. Barker '' , `` E. W. Barker '' or `` Eddie Barker '' ) was a politician and lawyer from Singapore .
Saint Gabriel Lalemant ( October 3 , 1610 , Paris , France -- March 17 , 1649 , Saint Ignace , Ontario ) was a Jesuit missionary in New France beginning in 1646 .
Giovanni Domenico Ferretti ( Giandomenico ) , also called Giandomenico d'Imola ( 15 June 1692 -- 18 August 1768 ) was an Italian Rococo style painter from Florence .
Jiří Hájek ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈjɪr̝iː ˈɦaːjɛk ) ; 6 June 1913 , Krhanice near Benešov -- 22 October 1993 , Prague ) was a Czech politician and diplomat .
Eduard Herbst ( 1820 - -1892 ) was an Austrian jurist and statesman , born in Vienna .
Benjaminas Jakševičius ( March 31 , 1895 in Panevėžys -- August 13 , 1979 in Kaunas ) was a Lithuanian sculptor and partisan .
Adolf Wagner von der Mühl ( 2 February 1884 in Rohrbach in Oberösterreich -- 27 August 1962 in Vienna ) was an Austrian sculptor .
Billo Frómeta ( born November 15 , 1915 in Santo Domingo , Dominican Republic - Caracas May 5 , 1988 ) was a Dominican orchestra conductor , arranger and composer who lived and worked most of his life in Venezuela , where he is remembered .
Plácido Francés y Pascual ( April 1834 , Alcoy - 12 December 1902 , Madrid ) was a Spanish painter who specialized in portraits , historical scenes and Costumbrista .
Frederick A. Shannon ( May 4 , 1921 in Mount Pleasant , Iowa -- August 31 , 1965 in Los Angeles County , California ) was a U.S. herpetologist and medical doctor .
Lluís Claramunt ( Barcelona , August 19 , 1951 - Zarautz , December 18 , 2000 ) was a Catalan artist .
Isaac Cruikshank ( 1764 - -1811 ) , Scottish painter and caricaturist , was born in Edinburgh and had most of his career in London .
Gottlieb Samuel Studer ( 5 August 1804 , Langnau i m Emmental -- 22 December 1890 , Vienna ) was a Swiss mountaineer , notary public and draughtsman .
Kazimierz Stabrowski ( born November 21 , 1869 in Nowogródek , died June 10 , 1929 in Garwolin ) was a Polish painter , and director of the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw .
Ferre Grignard ( 13 March 1939 -- 8 August 1982 ) was a Belgian skiffle - singer from Antwerp who surprised the world in 1965 with his international hits `` Ring Ring , I 've Got To Sing '' and `` My Crucified Jesus '' .
Dominique Lefèbvre ( 1810 - -1865 ) was a French missionary of the Paris Foreign Missions Society , Bishop of Isauropolis in partibus infidelium , and Vicar Apostolic in Vietnam during the 19th century .
Nick LaRocca was born in New Orleans , Louisiana , the son of poor Sicilian immigrants .
Renato De Manzano ( born March 19 , 1907 in Trieste , Austria - Hungary , now Italy ) was an Italian professional football player .
Alice Hollister 's husband died in 1952 and she died in 1973 , aged 86 , in Costa Mesa , California .
Art Mardigian ( February 12 , 1923 , Detroit - June 6 , 1977 , Detroit ) , better known as Art Mardigan , was an American jazz drummer .
Bartolomeo Suardi , best known as Bramantino ( c. 1456 -- c. 1530 ) , was an Italian painter and architect , mainly active in his native Milan .
Archie Turner was born in Hartley Wintney and began his professional career with Aldershot North End , before playing for South Farnborough and St. Michael 's , Camberley .
Giorgio Pini ( 1 February 1899 , in Bologna -- 30 March 1987 , in Rome ) was an Italian politician and journalist .
Joost de Soete or de Zoete , Lord of Villers or Villiers , ( 1510 - -1520 , Sluis - March 1589 , The Hague ) was a Dutch nobleman and Field Marshal who fought in the early years of the Eighty Years ' War .
Rudolph Hass expanded to Fallbrook , planting an 80-acre ( 320,000 m2 ) orchard in 1948 which bore its first crop in 1952 , just as his 17-year patent expired .
Peter Boenisch ( born May 4 , 1927 in Berlin ; died July 8 , 2005 in Gmund am Tegernsee ) is a German columnist and journalist .
Marius Eugène Chaboud ( 12 April 1907 in Lyon -- 28 December 1983 in Montfermeil , Seine - Saint - Denis ) was a racing driver from France .
Arthur Rigby ( born 7 June 1900 in Chorlton - cum - Hardy , Manchester , England ; died March 1960 in Crewe , England ) was an English professional footballer who played as inside left or outside left .
Philip Fruytiers ( alternative spellings : Philip Fruijtiers , Philip Fruitiers ) ( 1610 , Antwerp -- 1666 , Antwerp ) was a Flemish Baroque painter and engraver .
Ernest Vajda ( 27 May 1886 , Komárno , Austria - Hungary , today Slovakia - 3 April 1954 , Woodland Hills , California ; birth name Ernő Vajda ) was a Hungarian actor , playwright and novelist , but is more famous today for his screenplays .
Hermes Lima ( born Livramento de Nossa Senhora , 22 December 1902 ; died Rio de Janeiro , 10 October 1978 ) was Brazilian politician who was the Prime Minister of Brazil , jurist , and winner of the 1975 Prêmio Machado de Assis .
Salvatore Fergola ( 1799 -- 7 March 1874 ) was an Italian painter , mainly of landscapes or vedute in and around his native Naples .
Stanisław Baczyński aka `` Adam Kersten '' , `` Bittner '' , `` Akst '' ( born 27 July 1890 in Lwów -- 27 July 1939 in Warsaw , Poland ) was a Polish writer , literary critic , journalist , soldier of the Polish Legions and captain of the Polish Army .
Othmar Schimkowitz ( October 2 , 1864 in Tárts , Komárom County -- April 24 , 1947 in Graz ) was a Hungarian - born architectural sculptor who worked on the greatest landmarks of the Vienna Secession .
Bertoldo di Giovanni ( after 1420 Poggio a Caiano -- 28 December 1491 Florence ) was an Italian sculptor and medallist .
Enrico Bandini ( September 13 , 1807 -- February 27 , 1888 ) was an Italian painter , active in Parma , Italy .
Betty Neels ( born 15 September 1909 in Leyton , England -- d. 7 June 2001 in England ) was a prolific British writer of over 134 romance novels ( first publication entirely for Mills & Boon in United Kingdom and later reprinted in the North America by Harlequin ) , beginning in 1969 and continuing until her death .
Keene Thompson ( born November 15 , 1885 in Minneapolis , Minnesota , died July 11 , 1937 in Hollywood , California ) was a story , scenario and screenwriter who worked in the film industry from 1920 to 1937 .
John Emory Andrus ( February 16 , 1841 -- December 26 , 1934 ) was mayor of Yonkers , New York , a U.S. Congressman from New York , and founder of the SURDNA Foundation .
Nicholas Stone was born in 1586 , the son of a quarryman of Woodbury , near Exeter .
Giovanni Manzolini ( 1700 - 1755 ) was a Bolognese artist , an expert maker of wax anatomical models and a professor of anatomy at the University of Bologna .
Peter Mennin ( born Mennini ) ( May 17 , 1923 , Erie , Pennsylvania -- June 17 , 1983 , New York City ) was an American composer and teacher of Italian descent .
Johann Melchior Goeze ( born October 16 , 1717 in Halberstadt , †May 19 , 1786 in Hamburg , epithet : Zionswächter , i.e. Zion 's Guardian ) was a Lutheran pastor and theologian during the period of Late Orthodoxy .
From 1844 to 1849 Peter Fuchs was an apprentice mason in the Cologne Dombauhütte and for the next two years he worked as a mason for St. Nicolai in Hamburg and in the studio of Vincenz Statz in Cologne .
Robert F. Ensko I ( October 17 , 1855 -- May 13 , 1934 ) also known as Robert Ensko , Sr . was a Manhattan silver expert and author of Makers of Early American Silver in 1915 .
Clemens Timpler ( 1563 in Stolpen -- 28 February 1624 in Steinfurt ) was a German philosopher , physicist and theologian .
Ferit Tüzün ( 24 April 1929 , Istanbul -- 21 October 1977 , Ankara ) was a Turkish composer .
Milan Ćurčin ( Pančevo , 14 November 1880 -- Zagreb , 20 January 1960 ) was a Serbian poet and editor of an influential magazine , printed in Zagreb during the Kingdom of Yugoslavia .
Wong Shun Leung ( Chinese : 黃淳樑 ; pinyin : Huang Shun Liáng ; Jyutping : Wong4 Seon4 Loeng4 ; 8 May 1935 -- 28 January 1997 ) was a Chinese martial artist from Hong Kong who studied Wing Chun kung fu under Yip Man ( 葉問 ) and was credited with training Bruce Lee .
Annie Jiagge After learning of a young woman who was raped in Accra after coming there from the countryside for a job interview , Jiagge sought government assistance to provide safe accommodations for visiting women .
Júlia Székely ( Budapest , 8 May 1906 -- 19 March 1986 ) was a Hungarian writer and musician .
Luigi Da Porto ( Vicenza , 1485 -- May 10 , 1529 ) was an Italian writer and storiographer , better known as the author of the novel Novella novamente ritrovata with the story of Romeo and Juliet , later reprised by William Shakespeare for his famous drama .
Gregorio Marañón y Posadillo ( 19 May 1887 in Madrid -- 27 March 1960 in Madrid ) was a Spanish physician , scientist , historian , writer and philosopher .
Evald Aav ( 7 March ( O.S. 22 February ) 1900 -- 21 March 1939 ) was an Estonian composer born in Tallinn , Governorate of Estonia , Russian Empire .
Theodoor van Loon ( 1581 or 1582 , in Erkelenz -- 1649 , in Maastricht ) was a Flemish Baroque painter .
Born in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania , Joseph de Pasquale was a student of Louis Bailly , Max Aronoff and William Primrose at the Curtis Institute of Music .
Jean - Nicolas Boulay ( 11 June 1837 in Vagney -- 19 October 1905 in Lille ) was a French clergyman , bryologist and paleobotanist .
Franz Rühl ( 26 October 1845 , Hanau -- 3 July 1915 , Jena ) was a German historian who published numerous works in the field of classical history .
Pieter Frans Christiaan Koch , better known as Pyke Koch ( Beek , July 15 , 1901 -- Wassenaar , October 27 , 1991 ) , was a Dutch artist who painted in a magic realist manner .
Blanche Partington ( 25 November 1866 -- 12 March 1951 ) was a prominent San Francisco journalist and member of the San Francisco Bay Area literary and cultural scene .
Otto Dietze ( Latvian : Oto Dīce ) ( 1 July 1833 , Chemnitz -- 17 October 1890 , Riga ) was a German - born architect .
Count Friedrich August von Harrach - Rohrau , ( Vienna , June 8 , 1696 -- Vienna , June 4 , 1749 ) , was plenipotentiary minister of the Austrian Netherlands ( 1732 - -1741 ) and became Governor - General ad interim in 1741 - -1744 .
Daniel Pope Cook was born in Scott County , Kentucky into an impoverished branch of the prominent Pope family of Kentucky and Virginia .
Håkon Flood ( 1905 - 2001 ) was a professor of inorganic chemistry at the Norwegian Institute of Technology in Trondheim , Norway , from 1953 to 1975 .
Jan Kreczmar ( 6 May 1908 in Warsaw - 29 August 1972 in Warsaw ) was a Polish theatre and film actor .
Karl Chmielewski ( born 16 July 1903 in Frankfurt am Main ; died 1 December 1991 in Bernau am Chiemsee ) was a German SS officer and concentration camp commandant .
Alois Eliáš ( 29 September 1890 Prague -- 19 June 1942 Prague ) was a Czechoslovak general and politician .
Giuseppe Porta ( 1520 - -1575 ) , also known as Giuseppe Salviati , was an Italian painter of the late - Renaissance period , active mostly in Venice .
Jacques Aliamet ( 30 November 1726 , Abbeville - 29 May 1788 , Paris ) was a French engraver .
Jürgen Kröger ( 16 November 1856 in Haale , Germany -- 27 February 1928 in Aukrug ) was a German architect , active from 1880 to 1920 .
Raffaele Bendandi ( Faenza , 17 October 1893 -- Faenza , 3 November 1979 ) was an Italian clockmaker known for his predictions of earthquakes .
Franz Hamburger ( 14 August 1874 in Pitten -- 29 August 1954 in Vöcklabruck ) was an Austrian doctor and university lecturer .
Sigmund Gundelfinger ( 14 February 1846 in Kirchberg an der Jagst -- 13 December 1910 in Darmstadt ) was a German mathematician who introduced the Gundelfinger quartic and proved the completeness of the invariants of a ternary cubic .
Hans Fährmann ( December 17 , 1860 , Lommatzsch ( Saxony ) -- June 29 , 1940 , Dresden ) was a German composer of Romantic music and organist .
Slavko Šurdonja ( 1 October 1912 in Sušak -- 8 January 1943 in Belgrade ) was a Croatian , Yugoslav international , football player .
Conrad Quensel ( 10 December 1767 , Schonen -22 August 1806 Schloss Karlberg in Stockholm ) was a Swedish naturalist .
Karl Ernst Jarcke ( 10 November 1801 , Danzig , Prussia -- 27 December 1852 , Vienna ) was a German publisher and professor of criminal law , who took a conservative stance towards revolutionary movements in the early nineteenth century .
Li Fenglou was born in Tongzhou , Zhili ( now part of Beijing ) and would graduate from the Fu Jen Catholic University where he would become a sports teacher .
John Webber RA ( London 6 October 1751 -- 29 May 1793 London ) was an English artist who accompanied Captain Cook on his third Pacific expedition .
Claudio Tolomei ( Asciano , 1492 - Rome , 1556 ) was an Italian philologist .
Karel Hubáček ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈkarɛl ˈɦubaːtʃɛk ) ; 23 February 1924 -- 25 November 2011 ) was a Czech architect who designed the Ještěd Tower and hotel atop the Ještěd mountain near Liberec .
Lawrence Calcagno died on April 28 , 1993 in State College , PA , while visiting relatives .
Peter Gläser was born in Leipzig , then administered as part of the Soviet occupation zone in what was left of Germany when the war had ended , a little under four years earlier .
Karl Blank ( Russian : Карл Иванович Бланк ) ( 1728 - -1793 ) was a Russian architect , notable as one of the last practitioners of Baroque architecture and the first Moscow architect to build early neoclassical buildings .
Palladas ( Greek : Παλλαδᾶς ; fl . 4th century AD ) was a Greek poet , who lived in Alexandria , Egypt .
Paul Guillaume ( Paris , 1891 -- Paris , 1934 ) was a French art dealer .
Jost Bürgi ( also Joost , Jobst ; Latinized surname Burgius or Byrgius ; 28 February 1552 -- 31 January 1632 ) , active primarily at the courts in Kassel and Prague , was a Swiss clockmaker , a maker of astronomical instruments and a mathematician .
Gillis van Tilborch was likely born in Brussels .
Giacomo Brogi created his first studio in Corso Tintori , in Florence in 1864 .
James Ponder ( October 31 , 1819 -- November 5 , 1897 ) was an American merchant and politician from Milton , in Sussex County , Delaware .
Jacques Charles Émile Jouguet ( 5 January 1871 , Bessèges ( Gard ) -- 2 April 1943 , Montpellier ) was a French engineer and scientist , whose name is attached to the Chapman--
Tom Souville ( 24 February 1777 , Calais -- 31 December 1839 , Calais ) , was a privateer and `` rescue of Calais '' , causing the first `` rescue boat '' from Calais , lateen - rigged in 1819 with the support of society to Agriculture Calais .
Between 1676 ( when he was 16 years old ) and 1686 , Peter Strudel came to the Hofburg in Vienna and , together with his brother Paul Strudel , obtained a position as painter to the Imperial Court .
Konstantin Velichkov died on his way to Grenoble in November 1907 .
Janko Matúška ( * 10 January 1821 , Dolný Kubín , † 11 January 1877 , Dolný Kubín ) was a Slovak poet , activist , occasional playwright , and clerk of the court .
Jean Jimmy Alexandre ( March 9 , 1974 -- January 12 , 2010 ) , better known by his stage name Jimmy O , was a Haitian hip hop artist who was born in Port - au - Prince and lived in New York City .
Jean - Jacques Kieffer ( 1857 Guinkirchen--1925 Bitche ) was a French naturalist and entomologist who specialised in the study of parasitic insects .
Hans Schinz ( December 6 , 1858 -- October 30 , 1941 ) was a Swiss explorer and botanist who was a native of Zürich .
Witold Szalonek - born in 1927 in Czechowice - Dziedzice , died in 2001 in Berlin , Polish composer .
Erik Leonard Ekman ( 14 October 1883 , Stockholm -- 15 January 1931 , Santiago de los Caballeros ) was a Swedish botanist and explorer .
Petrus Christus ( c. 1410/1420 -- 1475/1476 ) was an Early Netherlandish painter active in Bruges from 1444 , where , along with Hans Memling , he became the leading painter after the death of Jan van Eyck .
Ion Popescu - Gopo ( Romanian pronunciation : ( iˈon poˈpesku ˈɡopo ) ; 1 May 1923 -- 28 November 1989 ) was a Romanian graphic artist and animator , but also writer , movie director and actor born in Bucharest , Romania .
Andreas Heusler ( 10 August 1865 in Basel -- 28 February 1940 in Basel ) was a Swiss medievalist , specialising in Germanic and Norse studies .
Henry Maurice Goguel ( 20 March 1880 -- 31 March 1955 ) was Dean of the Faculty of Protestant Theology in Paris , director of studies at the Ecole Pratique des Hautes Etudes , and professor at the Sorbonne .
Captain John Lightfoot Trollope , MC & Bar , ( Wallington , 30 May 1897 - Hove , 21 October 1958 ) was a British First World War flying ace , who was the first British pilot to shoot down 7 enemy aircraft in one day , on 24 March 1918 .
Marian Kozlowski ( December 10 , 1927 , in Warsaw , Poland -- August 15 , 2004 , in Warsaw , Poland ) was a Polish basketball administrator .
Stefan Dimitrov Todorov ( Bulgarian : Стефан Димитров Тодоров ) ( 5 February 1889 in Dupnitsa -- 26 August 1944 in Bryansk ) , better known as Stanke Dimitrov ( Станке Димитров ) or under the pseudonym Marek ( Марек ) , was a high - ranking Bulgarian Communist Party activist and anti - fascist .
In honor of Yakub Kolas , a square and a street in the center of Minsk bear his name .
Vanya Voynova ( Bulgarian : Ваня Войнова ; December 27 , 1934 in Sofia , Bulgaria -- March 9 , 1993 in Sofia , Bulgaria ) was a Bulgarian basketball player .
Louis - Urbain - Aubert de Tourny ( 1695 , Les Andelys - 1760 , Paris ) was a French administrator active in 18th century Bordeaux .
Werner Schreyer ( 14 November 1930 in Nuremberg ; 12 February 2006 in Bochum ) was a German mineralogist and experimental metamorphic petrologist .
Ecaterina Stahl - Iencic ( Hungarian : Katalin Jencsik , 31 July 1946 , Satu Mare , Romania -- 26 November 2009 ) was a Romanian foil fencer , world champion in 1975 .
Camillo Berneri ( also known as Camillo da Lodi ; May 28 , 1897 , Lodi -- May 5 , 1937 , Barcelona ) was an Italian professor of philosophy , anarchist militant , propagandist and theorist .
Siegfried Aufhäuser ( born 1 January 1884 in Augsburg -- died 6 December 1969 in Berlin ) was a German politician and union leader , and from 1921 to 1933 , chairman of the largely white - collar AfA - Bund .
Erasmus de Bie ( 1629 , Antwerp -- 1675 , Antwerp ) was a Flemish painter known for his city views and landscapes .
Samuel Bronston ( Samuel Bronshtein , March 26 , 1908 , Bessarabia -- January 12 , 1994 , Sacramento , California ) was a Bessarabian - born American film producer , film director , and a nephew of socialist revolutionary figure , Leon Trotsky .
Pieter Teyler van der Hulst was born on 25 March 1702 in Haarlem in the Dutch Republic .
Juozas Balčikonis ( March 24 , 1885 in Ėriškiai , Panevėžys district -- February 5 , 1969 in Vilnius ) was a Lithuanian linguist and teacher , who contributed to the standardization of the Lithuanian language .
Hassan al - Banna was born on the 14th of October 1906 in Egypt in Mahmudiyya , a rural town located northwest of Cairo in Beheira Governorate in the Nile delta .
Annemarie von Nathusius , originally Anna Maria Luise von Nathusius ( 28 August 1874 , Ludom / Poznań -- 17 October 1926 , Berlin ) , was a German novelist who wrote boldly about issues of women 's sexuality and lived a distinctly unconventional life .
Dr. Božidar Širola ( Žakanje , 1889 - Zagreb , 1956 ) was a Croatian composer , musicologist and ethnomusicologist .
John , Count of Nassau - Dillenburg ( died 10 August 1328 , fell in battle near Wetzlar ) was the third son of Count Otto I of Nassau and his wife Agnes ( d. 1303 ) , daughter of Count Emich IV of Leiningen - Landeck .
Ion Pillat ( March 31 , 1891 in Bucharest -- April 17 , 1945 in Bucharest ) was a distinguished Romanian poet .
Aleksander Kokular ( 9 August 1793 , Warsaw - 6 April 1846 , Warsaw ) was a Polish painter , art collector and teacher .
Léonce Lagarde , comte de Rouffeyroux , ( 1860 , Lempdes ( Haute - Loire ) -- 15 February 1936 , Paris ) was a French colonial governor of French Somaliland and ambassador .
Michael Stapleton ( born Dublin , Ireland , in 1747 , died 8 August 1801 , in Dublin ) is regarded as having been the most skilled stuccodore working in the neoclassical or `` Adam '' style that dominated Dublin interior decoration in the final decades of the 18th century .
Thomas Carmody ( October 9 , 1859 in Milo , Yates County , New York -- January 22 , 1922 in New Rochelle , Westchester County , New York ) was an American lawyer and politician .
Colonel Theodore S. Westhusing ( November 17 , 1960 -- June 5 , 2005 ) , a West Point professor of English and Philosophy , volunteered to serve in Iraq in late 2004 and died in Baghdad in June 2005 from an allegedly self - inflicted gunshot wound .
Hildebold ( died 3 September 818 ) was the Bishop of Cologne from 787 until 795 and the first Archbishop of Cologne thereafter .
Josephus Laurentius Dyckmans or Jozef Laurent Dyckmans ( Lier , 9 August 1811 -- Antwerp , 8 January 1888 ) was a Belgian painter mainly of genre scenes and portraits whose painstakingly detailed pictures earned him the nickname ' The Belgian Gerard Dou ' .
Alois Reiser ( April 6 , 1887 - April 4 , 1977 in Los Angeles ) was an American composer of Czechoslovakian origin .
George Morland ( 26 June 1763 in London -- 29 October 1804 in Brighton ) was an English painter of animals and rustic scenes .
Oleksiy Fedorov died on September 9 , 1989 in Kiev , a monument was built to honour partisan hero of anti - Nazi struggle in his native Dnipropetrovsk .
Alfred Kordelin ( 6 November 1868 , Rauma -- 7 November 1917 , Mommila , Hausjärvi ) was a Finnish industrialist , businessman , entrepreneur , and a major philanthropist .
Nicolas - Henri Tardieu was born in Paris on 18 January 1674 and was baptized three days later .
Robert Saitschick or Robert Saitschik ( Russian : Рувим Маркович Зайчик ; April 24 , 1868 , Mstsislau , Russian Empire -- February 23 , 1965 , Horgen ) was a Swiss philosopher .
Franz Umbscheiden ( 1821 Grünstadt , Rhine Province - December 13 , 1874 Newark , New Jersey ) was a revolutionary during the revolutions of 1848 who emigrated to the United States ( one of the Forty - Eighters ) and became a journalist .
Javier Portales , whose birth name was Miguel Ángel Álvarez , ( Tancacha , Córdoba , Argentina , 21 April 1937 - Buenos Aires , 14 October 2003 ) was an Argentine actor with work in television , film and theater .
Heinrich Christian Schwan ( April 5 , 1819 - May 29 , 1905 ) , a German Lutheran pastor , served as a missionary in Brazil , a pastor in Cleveland , Ohio , and Central District President and General President in the Lutheran Church - Missouri Synod .
Thomas Sim Lee ( October 29 , 1745 -- November 9 , 1819 ) was an American planter and statesman of Frederick County , Maryland .
Wing Commander General František Peřina ( 8 April 1911 , Morkůvky u Břeclavi ; died 6 May 2006 in Prague ) was a Czech fighter pilot , an ace during World War II with the French Armée de l'Air , who also served twice with Britain 's Royal Air Force .
Marvin Warlick Carr ( January 4 , 1921 -- July 9 , 2008 ) was a prominent American attorney in Lubbock , Texas , and the brother of former Texas Attorney General Waggoner Carr .
Roberto Lordi ( Naples , 11 April 1984 -- Rome , 24 March 1944 ) was Brigadier General of the Regia Aeronautica , Gold Medal of Military Valour Recipient and Martyr in the Fosse Ardeatine Massacre .
James Guillaume ( February 16 , 1844 , London -- November 20 , 1916 , Paris ) was a leading member of the Jura federation , the anarchist wing of the First International .
Norbert Riedel ( * 1 April 1912 in Jägerndorf , Sudetenland , then Austria - Hungary ; † 24 February 1963 in Zürs am Arlberg , Austria ) was an engineer and entrepreneur .
Paul Ernest Sanson ( Paris , 12 May 1836 -- Paris , 15 January 1918 ) was a French architect trained in the Beaux - Arts manner .
Joaquín Capilla Pérez ( December 23 , 1928 -- May 8 , 2010 ) , born in Mexico City , was a Mexican diver .
Johann Gottlob Immanuel Breitkopf ( Leipzig , 23 November 1719 -- 28 January 1794 , Leipzig ) was a German music publisher and typographer .
Oscar Brown , Sr . was a prominent Chicago businessman , lawyer and community activist .
Cesare Dell'Acqua ( Piran , 22 July 1821 - Brussels , 16 February 1905 ) was an Italian painter known for historical works .
Vicente López Carril ( December 2 , 1942 , A Coruña , province of A Coruña - March 29 , 1980 , Gijón , Asturias ) was a Spanish professional road racing cyclist from A Coruña .
Milan Antolković ( born 27 September 1915 in Zagreb , died 27 June 2007 in Zagreb ) was a Croatian footballer who played international football for the both the Croatian and Royal Yugoslav national teams .
Oldřich Blažíček ( January 5 , 1887 in Slavkovice , Nové Město na Moravě - May 3 , 1953 in Prague ) was a Czech painter , representative of modern landscape paintings .
Otto Gruppe ( 18 July 1851 , Berlin -- 27 November 1921 , Berlin ) was a German mythographer , remembered for his `` Griechische Mythologie und Religion - Geschichte '' ( 1906 ) , which summed up the 19th century reading of Greek mythology through surviving texts .
Ludwig von Flotow , after 1919 known simply as Ludwig Flotow ( 17 November 1867 in Vienna - 6 April 1948 in Gmunden ) was an Austro - Hungarian statesman .
Honorio Delgado Espinosa ( born Arequipa , 26 September 1892 - died Lima , 28 November 1969 ) was a gifted teacher , a creative researcher , a humanist , a philosopher , a linguist , and scholar whose work covered almost 50 years of the 20th - century history of Latin American psychiatry .
Guntram ( `` war raven '' ; c. 532 in Soissons -- 28 January 592 , Chalon - sur - Saône ) , also called Gontram , Gontran , Gunthram , Gunthchramn or ( Saint ) Guntramnus , was the king of Burgundy from 561 to 592 .
Nicola Salvi or Niccolò Salvi ( 6 August 1697 ( Rome ) -- 8 February 1751 ( Rome ) ) was an Italian architect ; among his few projects completed is the famous Trevi fountain in Rome , Italy .
Samuel Hoffmann ( 1591 , Zürich -- 1648 , Frankfurt ) , was a Baroque painter from Zurich .
Jules Mouquet studied at the Conservatoire de Paris with Théodore Dubois and Xavier Leroux .
In October 1968 , at the age of 59 , Freddie Frinton died suddenly from a heart attack in London .
Dr Eusebio Rodolfo Cordón Cea ( December 16 , 1899 in Sonsonate -- January 9 , 1966 in Mejicanos ) was provisional president of El Salvador between January 25 and July 1 , 1962 .
Jakob Streit ( 23 September 1910 in Spiez , Switzerland -- 15 May 2009 in Spiez ) was a Swiss author , teacher and anthroposophist .
Lev Mordukhov Tseitlin ( Лев Цейтлин 1884 , in Pinsk -- July 8 , 1930 , in New York City ) , billed as Leo Zeitlin , was a Russian composer .
Melchior Adam ( c. 1575 in Grottkau -- 26 December 1622 , in Heidelberg ) was a German literature historian .
The Rex Bell Elementary School in Las Vegas was named in honor of Bell .
Henri Meunier ( born Henri Georges Jean Isidore Meunier ; 25 July 1873 Ixelles -- 8 September 1922 Brussels ) was a Belgian Art Nouveau lithographer , etcher , illustrator , bookbinder and poster designer of the Belle Époque .
Paul Gavarni was the nom de plume of Sulpice Guillaume Chevalier ( 13 January 1804 , Paris -- 24 November 1866 ) , a French illustrator , born in Paris .
Julius Echter von Mespelbrunn ( 18 March 1545 -- 13 September 1617 ) was a Prince - Bishop of Würzburg , Echter was born in Mespelbrunn Castle , Spessart ( Lower Franconia ) and died in Würzburg .
Engelbert I , Count of the Mark ( died 16 November 1277 at Castle of Bredevoort ) was a German nobleman .
Dom Nikollë Kaçorri died in 1917 in Vienna , at the age of 55 , from cancer .
Georg Cracow , Kraków , Cracov , Cracau or Cracovius ( 7 November 1525 , Stettin - 17 March 1575 , Leipzig ) was a German lawyer and statesman .
Matthias Christian Rabbethge ( 1 March 1804 , Klein Rodensleben - 26 December 1902 , Klein Wanzleben ) was a German sugar beet grower and sugar manufacturer .
Nick Travis ( b. Nov. 16 , 1925 , Philadelphia , Pennsylvania - d. Oct. 7 , 1964 , New York City ) was an American jazz trumpeter .
Alfonso Franco ( 1466 -- 1524 ) , was an Italian painter from Messina , Sicily , active during the Italian Renaissance .
Otto Hönigschmid ( March 13 , 1878 , in Hořovice -- October 14 , 1945 , in Munich ) was a Czech / Austrian chemist .
Toshiro Mayuzumi ( 黛 敏郎 Mayuzumi Toshirō ( majɯᵝzɯᵝmi toɕiɽoo ) ; 20 February 1929 , in Yokohama -- 10 April 1997 , in Kawasaki ) was a Japanese composer .
Khalifa Bin Yousef was a statesman who played a significant role in the creation of The United Arab Emirates and in the economic and political life of the time in the Persian Gulf .
Blessed Grimoaldo of the Purification ( May 4 , 1883 , Pontecorvo , Frosinone , Italy -- November 18 , 1902 , Ceccano , Italy ) , born Ferdinando Santamaria , was a religious and clerical student of the Congregation of the Passion of Jesus Christ , who was beatified by Pope John Paul II in 1995 .
Georg Franck von Franckenau ( born 3 May 1643 in Naumburg ( Saale ) ; died 17 June 1704 in Copenhagen ) was a German physician and botanist .
Matteo Zane ( -1605 ) was the Patriarch of Venice from 1600 to 1605 .
Ernst Melchior ( 26 June 1920 in Villach -- 5 August 1978 in Rouen , France ) was an Austrian football player .
Bill Gallo ( December 28 , 1922 -- May 10 , 2011 ) was a cartoonist and newspaper columnist for the New York Daily News .
Raymond Hornberger ( born December 23 , 1898 ; died May 1976 in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania ) was a former U.S. soccer halfback .
Pierre - Jules Cavelier ( Paris 30 August 1814 -- 1894 Paris ) was a French academic sculptor .
Rudolf August Oetker ( 20 September 1916 , Bielefeld -- 16 January 2007 , Hamburg ) was a German entrepreneur who became a billionaire running his private food company Oetker - Gruppe .
Josep Irla died on 19 September 1958 , shortly before turning 82 , in Saint - Raphaël , Var ( Provence ) .
Charles Godefroy ( 29 December 1888 at La Flèche ( Sarthe ) -- 11 December 1958 at Soisy - sous - Montmorency , ( Val d'Oise ) , north of Paris ) was a French aviator who became famous by his spectacular flight passing through the Arc de Triomphe in Paris in 1919 .
Mikayil Mushfig ( Azerbaijani : Mikayıl Müşfiq , born Mikayil Ismayilzadeh ) ( 5 June 1908 , Baku -- 06 January 1938 , Baku ) was an Azerbaijani poet of the 1930s .
José Camarón y Bononat ( May 18 , 1731 -- June 14 , 1803 ) was a Spanish painter , mainly active in Valencia , where he became director of the Academy of San Carlos .
Nataniel Aguirre ( Cochabamba , Bolivia , October 10 , 1843 -- Montevideo , Uruguay , September 11 , 1888 ) , was a prominent Bolivian lawyer , diplomat , politician , writer , and historian .
Johann Wilhelm Hittorf ( 27 March 1824 -- 28 November 1914 ) was a German physicist who was born in Bonn and died in Münster , Germany .
Louis III , Duke of Württemberg , ( German : Ludwig der Fromme ; 1 January 1554 , Stuttgart -- 28 August 1593 , Stuttgart ) was a German nobleman .
Leopold Niemirowski ( 1810 , Tahaczyn , Volhynian Governorate - December 1883 , Liuboml ) was a self - taught Polish painter ; exiled to Siberia for his revolutionary activities .
Otto Mainzer ( 26 November 1903 in Frankfurt am Main -- 28 June 1995 in New York City ) was a German - American writer .
Dale Van Every ( July 23 , 1896 , Van , Michigan -- May 28 , 1976 , Santa Barbara , California ) was an American writer , film producer and studio executive .
Pius Keller ( 30 September 1825 in Ballingshausen , Bavaria , Germany -- 15 March 1904 in Münnerstadt , Germany ) was an Augustinian friar , a teacher , and a leader who revitalized The Order of Saint Augustine in Germany .
Louisa Horton Hill died on January 25 , 2008 , at the Lillian Booth Actors ' Fund Home in Englewood , New Jersey , aged 87 .
Matthew of Janow ( d. 1394 in Prague ) was a fourteenth - century Bohemian ecclesiastical writer .
John Cloake CMG FSA D Litt ( 2 December 1924 -- 9 July 2014 ) was a historian and author of several works mostly relating to the local history of Richmond upon Thames and surrounding areas .
Sándor Wekerle ( 14 November 1848 , Mór -- 26 August 1921 , Budapest ) was a Hungarian politician who served three times as prime minister .
Jon Richards ( born September 5 , 1963 ) is an American attorney and former teacher from Milwaukee , Wisconsin , serving as a Democratic member of the Wisconsin State Assembly representing the 19th Assembly District since 1999 and currently serving as chairman of the Health and Healthcare Reform Committee .
Pavlos Oikonomou - Gouras ( Greek : Παύλος Οικονόμου-Γκούρας , 1897 - -1991 ) was a Greek diplomat and thrice Minister for Foreign Affairs of Greece .
Maurice Le Bègue de Germiny was born the 23 November 1939 and he is bishop of Blois since 1997 .
Woodbridge Nathan Ferris ( January 6 , 1853 -- March 23 , 1928 ) was an educator from New York , Illinois and Michigan , as well as Democratic statesman and the 28th Governor of Michigan ( 1913 - -1917 ) .
Ernest of Bavaria ( German : Ernst von Bayern ) ( 17 December 1554 -- 17 February 1612 ) was Prince - elector - archbishop of the Archbishopric of Cologne from 1583 to 1612 as successor of the expelled Gebhard Truchsess von Waldburg .
Robert W. Heagney is a former member of the Connecticut House of Representatives , representing Simsbury , Connecticut , the 16th House Assembly District , for the Republican Party .
Mirko Tomassoni ( born 24 April 1969 ) was Captain Regent of San Marino for the six - month term from October 2007 to March 2008 .
Gerontius of Cervia ( Gerontius of Ficocle ) ( died 501 AD ) was an Italian bishop of Cervia who is venerated as a saint .
Sebastián Ágreda ( 1795 , Potosí , Bolivia -- December 18 , 1875 , La Paz , Bolivia ) served briefly as President of Bolivia , from June 10 to July 9 , 1841 .
Jeremy Collier ( /ˈkɒlɪər/ ; 23 September 1650 -- 26 April 1726 ) was an English theatre critic , non - juror bishop and theologian .
Rinchen Gyaltsen 's elder half - brother Phagpa enjoyed a close relationship with Kublai Khan and was appointed to the title Imperial Preceptor ( Dishi ) in 1270 .
Camillo Mazzella ( February 10 , 1833 -- March 26 , 1900 ) was an Italian Jesuit theologian and cardinal .
Manuel Gondra Pereira ( 1 January 1871 -- 8 March 1927 ) was President of Paraguay from November 25 , 1910 to January 11 , 1911 and from August 15 , 1920 to October 31 , 1921 .
Guillermo von Schulenburg Prado , often referred to simply as Guillermo Schulenburg , ( June 12 , 1916 - July 19 , 2009 ) was the abbot of the Basilica of Guadalupe in Mexico City from 1963 to 1996 .
William Wyatt Bibb ( October 2 , 1781 -- July 10 , 1820 ) was a United States Senator from Georgia and the first Governor of the U.S. state of Alabama .
Raffaele Baldassarre ( born 23 September 1956 ) is an Italian politician and member of the European Parliament for the European People 's Party .
Lyle Vanclief , PC ( born September 19 , 1943 ) was Canada 's Minister of Agriculture from 1997 - 2003 .
Stewart Barlow is an American politician and a Republican member of the Utah House of Representatives representing District 17 since his September 1 , 2011 appointment to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Julie Fisher .
Gilbert Crispin ( c. 1055 -- 1117 ) was a Christian author and Anglo - Norman monk , appointed by Archbishop Lanfranc in 1085 to be the abbot , proctor and servant of Westminster Abbey , England .
Taddeo Barberini ( 1603 - -1647 ) was an Italian nobleman of the House of Barberini who became Prince of Palestrina and Gonfalonier of the Church ; commander of the Papal Army .
Thomas Sim Lee was the second State Governor of Maryland , serving twice , from 1779 to 1783 and again from 1792 to 1794 .
Saint Laurent - Joseph - Marius Imbert , M.E.P. ( 23 March 1796 -- 21 September 1839 ) , sometimes called Laurent - Marie - Joseph Imbert and affectionately known in Korea as Bishop Imbert Bum was a French missionary bishop in Asia .
Donald Alexander MacKinnon ( 22 February 1863 -- 20 April 1928 ) was a Canadian teacher , lawyer , politician , author , and the eighth Lieutenant Governor of Prince Edward Island from 1904 to 1910 .
Guntis Ulmanis ( born on September 13 , 1939 ) is a Latvian politician and was the fifth President of Latvia from 1993 to 1999 .
Major Thibaut , Jr. ( born January 3 , 1977 ) , is an insurance investment planner from his native Pointe Coupee Parish , Louisiana , who has been since 2008 a Democrat member of the Louisiana House of Representatives for District 18 , which encompasses Iberville , West Baton Rouge , West Feliciana , and Pointe Coupee parishes .
Elke Roex ( born 29 June 1974 ) is a Belgian , Flemish politician and member of the Flemish Parliament for the Socialist Party --
Geoffroy de Bar ( in Latin : Gaufridus de Barro ) or Barbeau , of Burgundy , was a French cardinal and member of the Roman Curia .
Sir David Cunningham of Robertland , in Ayrshire , was Master of Work to the Crown of Scotland from 1602 to 1607 , and Surveyor of the King 's Works in England from 1604 to 1606
Joseph A. Scanlon ( 1901 -- April 1957 ) was a Democratic member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives , serving from 1935 - 1952 .
Louis Metzler ( February 18 , 1864 - October 9 , 1929 ) was an American auditor , bookkeeper and Republican politician who served one term as a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly from Milwaukee , Wisconsin , representing the 10th Milwaukee County district ( the 10th Ward of the City of Milwaukee ) .
Robert Hood Saunders , Q.C. , CBE ( May 30 , 1903 -- January 16 , 1955 ) was mayor of Toronto from 1945 to 1948 , President of the Canadian National Exhibition , chairman of the Ontario Hydro ( formally named the Hydro Electric Power Commission of Ontario ( HEPCO ) ) .
Pierre de La Baume ( 1477 -- 5 May 1544 ) was a grand seigneur of Savoy and a cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church .
Since 2004 Malu Dreyer has been married to Klaus Jensen , a fellow SPD politician and a former mayor of Trier who had been widowed three years earlier .
Archbishop Domenico Sorrentino ( born 16 May 1948 ) is an Italian Catholic archbishop .
Elbridge Van Syckel Besson ( December 22 , 1839 - -1915 ) was an American Republican party politician who served two non - consecutive terms as the 14th and 16th Mayor of Hoboken , New Jersey .
Barbara Buckley ( born November 23 , 1960 in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania ) is an attorney and Democratic Party politician who served as a member of the Nevada Assembly , representing Clark County District 8 from 1994 to 2011 .
The Blessed John Juvenal Ancina , C.O. , ( Italian : Giovanni Giovenale Ancina ) ( 19 October 1545 -- 30 August 1604 ) was an Italian bishop who belonged to the Congregation of the Oratory , as well being a scholar and music composer .
William Benedict Friend ( October 22 , 1931 -- April 2 , 2015 ) was the first bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Shreveport , in Louisiana .
Juan Manuel Frutos ( June 12 , 1879 -- April 15 , 1960 ) was President of Paraguay in 1948 .
Win Aung served as an ambassador to Germany and the UK until he was appointed as Minister of Foreign Affairs in November 1998 .
George Otto Wirz ( January 17 , 1929 -- November 23 , 2010 ) served as a Roman Catholic auxiliary bishop of the Diocese of Madison , Wisconsin and titular bishop of Municipa .
Lloyd H. Kincaid was an American cabinetmaker who served as a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly and the Wisconsin State Senate .
Mohammad Najibullah Ahmadzai ( Pashto : ډاکټر نجیب ﷲ احمدزی‎ ; February 1947 -- 28 September 1996 ) , commonly known as Najibullah or Najib , was the de facto , though unrecognized by the majority of the international community , President of Afghanistan from 1987 until 1992 , when the mujahideen took over Kabul .
LeRoy Pope Walker ( February 7 , 1817 -- August 23 , 1884 ) was the first Confederate States Secretary of War .
Anspert ( died 7 December 881 ) was archbishop of Milan from 861 to 881 .
Pietro III Candiano was the Doge of Venice from 942 until 959 .
Ertha Pascal - Trouillot ( born 13 August 1943 ) was the provisional President of Haiti for 11 months in 1990 and 1991 .
Byzantius ( died 1035 ) was the archbishop of Bari in the early eleventh century .
Garba Duba is a retired Nigerian Army Lieutenant General who was Governor of Bauchi State , Nigeria from July 1978 to October 1979 during the military regime of General Olusegun Obasanjo , and Administrator of Sokoto State from January 1984 to August 1985 during the military regime of Major General Muhammadu Buhari .
Douglas Imrie McKay ( 1879 -- September 24 , 1962 ) was an American artillery and law enforcement officer and New York City Police Department police official who served as New York City Police Commissioner in 1914 .
Henry Sievers ( October 13 , 1874 - ? ) was an assistant printer , trade union activist and liquor store operator from Milwaukee , Wisconsin who served one term as a Socialist member of the Wisconsin State Assembly .
George Gordon , 1st Earl of Aberdeen ( 3 October 1637 -- 20 April 1720 ) , was a Lord Chancellor of Scotland .
George Bryan Porter ( February 9 , 1791 -- July 6 , 1834 ) , was an American statesman in Pennsylvania and Territorial Governor of Michigan from August 6 , 1831 , until his death on July 6 , 1834 .
Acacius of Caesarea in Greek Ἀκάκιος Mονόφθαλμος ( died 366 ) was a Christian bishop , the pupil and successor in the Palestinian see of Caesarea of Eusebius AD 340 , whose life he wrote .
Menachem Mendel Schneerson ( April 5 , 1902 OS -- June 12 , 1994 ) , known to many as the Rebbe , was a Russian Empire - born American Orthodox Jewish rabbi , and the last Lubavitcher Rebbe .
Juan Evo Morales Ayma ( born October 26 , 1959 ) , popularly known as Evo ( Spanish pronunciation : ( ˈeβo ) ) , is a Bolivian politician and cocalero activist who has served as President of Bolivia since 2006 .
Gyani Zail Singh ( Punjabi : ਜ਼ੈਲ ਸਿੰਘ , pronunciation ; 5 May 1916 -- 25 December 1994 ) was the seventh President of India , serving from 1982 to 1987 .
Juraj Haulik de Váralya ( Slovak : Juraj Haulík Váralyai , Hungarian : Haulík Váralyai György ) ( Nagyszombat , Kingdom of Hungary , present - day Trnava , Slovakia , 20 April 1788 -- Zagreb , 11 May 1869 ) was a Croatian cardinal in the Roman Catholic Church of Slovak ethnicity and the first archbishop of Zagreb .
Domenico Monegario was the traditional sixth Doge of Venice ( 756 - -764 ) .
Reginald Norman Morgan Empey , Baron Empey OBE ( born 26 October 1947 ) , best known as Reg Empey , is a British politician who was the leader of the Ulster Unionist Party from 2005 to 2010 , and has been its chairman since 2012 .
Stephan Ackermann ( born Mayen , 1963 ) is a German bishop .
Stephen Kalonzo Musyoka ( born 24 December 1953 ) is a Kenyan politician who was Vice - President of Kenya from 2008 to 2013 .
Michael Helding ( 1506 -- 30 September 1561 ) was a Roman Catholic bishop , scholar , writer and humanist .
Nandamuri Taraka Rama Rao ( 28 May 1923 -- 18 January 1996 ) , popularly known as N. T. Rama Rao or by his initials NTR , was an Indian film actor , writer , director , producer , and politician who also served as the Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh for three terms .
Jacob Harold Gallinger ( March 28 , 1837 -- August 17 , 1918 ) , was a United States Senator from New Hampshire who served as President pro tempore of the Senate in 1912 and 1913 .
Randy Law is a former member of the Ohio House of Representatives , representing the 64th District for one term in the Ohio 126th General Assembly .
George of Baden ( 1433 -- Moyenvic , February 11 , 1484 ) was Bishop of Metz .
Harry Hill McAlister ( July 15 , 1875 -- October 30 , 1959 ) was an American politician who served as Democratic Governor of Tennessee from 1933 to 1937 .
Alexander of Telese ( Italian : Alessandro Telesino ) was an Italian chronicler and historian , and the abbot of San Salvatore , near Telese , in southern Italy from before 1127 to before November 1143 .
Elena Kagan ( pronounced /ˈkeɪɡən/ ; born April 28 , 1960 ) is an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States .
Arthur Roche ( born 6 March 1950 ) is an English archbishop of the Catholic Church .
Mirza Hameedullah Beg ( M. H. Beg ) ( 22 February 1913 -- 19 November 1988 ) was the 15th Chief Justice of India , serving from January 1977 to February 1978 .
James Aloysius O'Gorman , Sr . ( May 5 , 1860 -- May 17 , 1943 ) was a one - term United States Senator from New York .
Saint Baculus of Sorrento ( Italian : San Bacolo di Sorrento , San Baccolo di Sorrento ) is venerated as a bishop of Sorrento .
El Hadj Omar Bongo Ondimba ( born Albert - Bernard Bongo ; 30 December 1935 -- 8 June 2009 ) was a Gabonese politician who was President of Gabon from 1967 to 2009 .
Alfred Winsor Brown ( November 6 , 1885 -- September 7 , 1938 ) was a United States Navy Captain who served as the 31st Naval Governor of Guam .
Alfred James Jones ( 4 October 1871 -- 7 October 1945 ) was an Australian politician who served as a Member of the Queensland Legislative Assembly , a Member of the Queensland Legislative Council and as Lord Mayor of Brisbane .
Jan Mazur ( June 5 , 1920 in Płoskie -- September 26 , 2008 in Siedlce ) was the Polish bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Siedlce from August 6 , 1968 until his retirement on March 25 , 1996 .
Harry E. Turner Sr . ( December 25 , 1927 -- July 27 , 2004 ) is a former member of the Ohio House of Representatives .
Juan Antonio Ríos Morales ( November 10 , 1888 -- June 27 , 1946 ) was a Chilean political figure , and President of Chile from 1942 to 1946 , during the height of World War II . He died in office .
Francisco Domingo Barbosa Da Silveira ( 26 March 1944 in Tambores , Uruguay -- 17 June 2015 ) was a Roman Catholic bishop in Uruguay .
Patrick M. Gallivan ( born November 18 , 1960 ) is a member of the New York State Senate and the former Sheriff of Erie County .
Fidel Sánchez Hernández ( July 7 , 1917 , in El Divisadero -- February 28 , 2003 ) was President of El Salvador from 1967 to 1972 .
General Mustafa Adrisi ( c. 1922 -- 28 July 2013 ) was Vice President of Uganda from 1977 to 1978 and one of President Idi Amin 's closest associates .
Patrick Francis Moran ( 16 September 1830 -- 16 August 1911 ) was the third Roman Catholic Archbishop of Sydney and the first Australian cardinal .
Wendy Alexander ( born 27 June 1963 , Glasgow ) is a retired Scottish politician and the former Member of the Scottish Parliament ( MSP ) for Paisley North .
Zheng Tianxiang ( simplified Chinese : 郑天翔 ; traditional Chinese : 鄭天翔 ; pinyin : Zhèng Tiānxiáng ; August 1 , 1914 -- October 10 , 2013 ) was a Chinese politician and was the President of the Supreme People 's Court of China .
Aaron B. Rollins ( 1818 - December 4 , 1878 ) was a member of the New York State Assembly for the 9th district of Manhattan from 1851 to 1853 .
Vladimir Aseev ( born 19 June 1951 ) is a Russian politician and member of the State Duma of the Russian Federation .
Maurice L. Ayers , sometimes listed as M. S. Ayres , ( December 4 , 1819 -- June 11 , 1884 ) was an American banker , farmer , hotelier and politician from Burlington , Wisconsin , who served a single term as a Free Soil Party member of the Wisconsin State Assembly from Racine County .
Edward Salomon ( August 11 , 1828 -- April 21 , 1909 ) was an American politician and the Lieutenant Governor and eighth Governor of Wisconsin during the American Civil War after the accidental drowning of his predecessor , Louis P. Harvey .
Rudolf Schuster ( born 4 January 1934 ) was President of Slovakia from 1999 to 2004 .
Siim Kallas ( Estonian pronunciation : ( ˈsiːm ˈkɑlˑɑs ) ; born 2 October 1948 in Tallinn ) is an Estonian politician , who most recently served as European Commissioner for Transport between 2010 and 2014 .
Johann Lohelius ( 1549 -- November 2 , 1622 ) , better known as Johann Lohel , was the archbishop of Prague from September 18 , 1612 until his death .
Mabeth Hurd Paige ( 1869 - -1961 ) was a Minnesota politician , a member of the Minnesota House of Representatives from 1923 to 1945 .
William Pierron was a Republican member of the Wisconsin State Assembly from Milwaukee for two terms ( 1881 and 1891 ) .
Aigars Kalvītis ( born 27 June 1966 ) is a Latvian politician , former Prime Minister of Latvia and current Chairman of the Board of Latvijas Balzams .
George Rankl ( February 28 , 1867 in Milwaukee , Wisconsin -- ? ) was a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly
Userkaf ( meaning `` His soul is strong '' ) was the founder of the Fifth dynasty of Egypt and the first pharaoh to start the tradition of building sun temples at Abusir .
Keith Grover ( born in Provo , Utah ) is an American politician and a Republican member of the Utah House of Representatives .
Alex Blanco ( born 1972 ) is an American politician and mayor of Passaic , New Jersey , United States .
Karen May ( born 1944 ) is a former Democratic member of the Illinois House of Representatives for the 58th District , serving from 2001 to 2012 .
Hernando Siles Reyes ( August 5 , 1882 -- November 23 , 1942 ) was a Bolivian politician who served as the 31st President of Bolivia , serving from 1926 - 1930 .
Edward Sanford was a member of the New York State Assembly ( New York Co. ) in 1843 and 1844 ; and a member of the New York State Senate ( 1st D. ) in 1846 and 1847 .
In 650 Ildefonsus was elected its abbot of Agali .
Gyula Gömbös de Jákfa ( 26 December 1886 -- 6 October 1936 ) was a Hungarian military officer and politician , and served as Prime Minister of Hungary from 1 October 1932 until his death on 6 October 1936 .
Josef Georg Hörl ( August 22 , 1722 -- December 9 , 1806 ) was an Austrian lawyer , served as mayor of Vienna from 1773 to 1804 .
Pasquale Macchi ( 9 November 1923 -- 5 April 2006 ) was a Roman Catholic archbishop and the private secretary to Pope Paul VI .
Astrik accompanied Saint Adalbert in the latter 's missionary work to the Bohemians and became the first abbot of Břevnov Monastery .
William Warwick Buckland , M.A. , LL.D. ( 11 June 1859 - 16 January 1946 ) was a scholar of Roman law , Regius Professor of Civil Law at the University of Cambridge from 1914 to 1945 .
Jerome Weber OSB ( September 14 , 1915 -- September 4 , 2008 ) was a Canadian abbot of the Roman Catholic Church .
Jeremy Faison is a Republican member of the Tennessee House of Representatives for the Eleventh District .
William Woods Holden ( November 24 , 1818 -- March 1 , 1892 ) was the 38th and 40th Governor of North Carolina , who was appointed by President Andrew Johnson in 1865 for a brief term , and then elected in 1868 , serving until 1871 .
Herrauðr , Herraud , Herröðr , Herruðr , Herrud , Herothus or Heroth is a legendary earl of Götaland or king of Sweden , who appears in several medieval legends , in particular those relating to Ragnar Lodbrok ( e.g. Tale of Ragnar 's Sons , Tale of Ragnar Lodbrok , Krákumál and Gesta Danorum , book 9 ) .
Alan Ray Ater ( born December 15 , 1953 ) , known as Al Ater , is a farmer and businessman from Ferriday , Louisiana , who served from 1984 - 1992 as a Democratic member of the Louisiana House of Representatives from District 21 in the eastern portion of his state .
Pier Francesco Ferrero ( 1510 - -1566 ) was an Italian Roman Catholic abbot , bishop and cardinal .
In 2003 Corina Porro was elected mayor of Vigo in 2003 after a censure motion against the socialist Ventura Pérez Mariño approved by 10 members from Galician People 's Party and seven from Bloque Nacionalista Galego and rejected by eight members of Socialist Party of Galicia and two from Progresistas Vigueses .
Sir Cornthwaite Hector William James Rason ( 18 June 1858 -- 15 March 1927 ) , better known as Hector Rason , was the seventh Premier of Western Australia .
Carlos Soublette ( 15 December 1789 -- 11 February 1870 ) was President of Venezuela 1837 - 1839 and 1843 - -1847 , and a hero of the Venezuelan War of Independence .
Oran Milo Roberts ( July 9 , 1815 -- May 19 , 1898 ) , was the 17th Governor of Texas from January 21 , 1879 to January 16 , 1883 .
José Eloy Alfaro Delgado ( June 25 , 1842 -- January 28 , 1912 ) served as President of Ecuador from 1895 to 1901 and from 1906 to 1911 .
LeBaron Bradford Colt ( June 25 , 1846 -- August 18 , 1924 ) was a United States Senator from Rhode Island and a federal court judge on the United States District Court for the District of Rhode Island , the United States Circuit Court , and the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit .
Anne Lindboe ( born 1 August 1971 ) is a Norwegian paediatrician , currently serving as the Norwegian Children 's Ombudsman .
Sylvester Turner ( born September 27 , 1954 ) is an American Democratic politician who is currently Mayor of Houston , Texas and previously served as a member of the Texas House of Representatives from 1989 until 2016 .
Lyman Trumbull ( October 12 , 1813 -- June 25 , 1896 ) was a United States Senator from Illinois during the American Civil War , and co - author of the Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution .
Alain Tardif ( born 23 August 1946 ) was a Liberal party member of the House of Commons of Canada .
José dos Santos Garcia S.M.P. ( April 16 , 1913 -- December 11 , 2010 ) was a Portuguese bishop of the Roman Catholic Church .
Otto Orseolo ( Italian : Ottone Orseolo , also Urseolo ; c. 992 - 1032 ) was the Doge of Venice from 1008 to 1026 .
Girolamo Rusticucci ( 1537 - -1603 ) was an Italian Roman Catholic cardinal and bishop .
François - Marie - Benjamin Richard ( 1 March 1819 -- 27 January 1908 ) was a French cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church and served as the Archbishop of Paris .
Walter d'Eynsham , also known as Walter de Hempsham was a medieval Archbishop of Canterbury - elect .
Clarence Ray Nagin , Jr. , also known as C. Ray Nagin ( born June 11 , 1956 ) , is an American management consultant who served as the 60th mayor of New Orleans , Louisiana from 2002 to 2010 .
Bernardin Gantin ( 8 May 1922 -- 13 May 2008 ) was a prominent Beninese cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church .
Kurt M. Granberg was a Democratic member of the Illinois House of Representatives , representing the 107th District from 1987 until his retirement at the end of his term in January 2009 .
In the second round of voting on 6 May 2012 , François Hollande was elected President of the French Republic with 51.7 % of the vote .
The Most Reverend John Bosco Panya Kritcharoen ( Thai : ปัญญา กฤษเจริญ ; born December 18 , 1949 ) is the bishop of the Roman Catholic diocese of Ratchaburi , Thailand .
Mark Painter ( born August 3 , 1957 ) was a Democratic member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives .
John D. Payne is a Republican member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives for the 106th District and was elected in 2002 .
Sebastião Soares de Resende ( 1906 - 1967 ) was a Portuguese Catholic bishop in Africa at the head of the diocese of Beira in Mozambique .
Jasper Tsang Yok - sing , GBM , JP ( born 17 May 1947 ) is the 2nd and the current President of the Legislative Council of Hong Kong .
Marsha Swails ( born April 3 , 1952 ) is Minnesota politician and a former member of the Minnesota House of Representatives who represented District 56B , which includes the cities of Woodbury and Landfall in Washington County in the eastern Twin Cities metropolitan area .
Epiphanius of Salamis ( Greek : Ἐπιφάνιος ; c. 310 - -320 -- 403 ) was bishop of Salamis , Cyprus at the end of the 4th century .
Bernard of Sédirac ( c. 1050 -- 1125 ) , also known as Bernard of Agen or Bernard of Le Sauvetat , was the metropolitan archbishop of Toledo from 1086 and first primate of Spain from 1088 to his death .
John Felix Anders , known as Andy Anders ( born May 3 , 1956 ) , is a farmer and agricultural equipment salesman from Clayton in eastern Louisiana , who is a Democratic member of the Louisiana House of Representatives from District 21 ( Concordia and parts of Tensas , Madison , and East Carroll parishes ) .
Pope Adrian VI ( Latin : Hadrianus VI ) , born Adriaan Florensz ( Boeyens ) ( 2 March 1459 ‒ 14 September 1523 ) , was the 218th pope of the Catholic Church from 9 January 1522 until his death on 14 September 1523 .
Dr. Garry Conille ( born 26 February 1966 ) is a Haitian academic , development worker , author , and former Prime Minister of Haiti .
Mark Francis Schmitt ( February 14 , 1923 -- December 14 , 2011 ) served as the tenth Roman Catholic bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Marquette , in Marquette , Michigan .
Adrian Mung'andu ( c. 1923 -- 25 June 2007 ) was the Catholic archbishop of Lusaka between 1984 and 1996 .
Mak Chai - kwong GBS , JP ( Chinese : 麥齊光 , born 1950 ) is a retired Hong Kong civil servant , former Permanent Secretary for Development ( Works ) and Secretary for Development .
Anders Fogh Rasmussen ( Danish pronunciation : ( ɑnɐs ˈfɔʊ̯ˀ ˈʁɑsmusn̩ ) ; born 26 January 1953 ) is a Danish politician who was the 39th Prime Minister of Denmark from November 2001 to April 2009 and the 12th Secretary General of NATO from August 2009 to October 2014 .
Will Ford Hartnett ( born June 3 , 1956 ) is an attorney in Dallas , Texas , who was from 1993 to 2013 a Republican member of the Texas House of Representatives from District 114 in Dallas County .
It was as a representative of the Cultural Association , and not , formally , as a representative of the Socialist Unity Party that between 1963 and 1967 Werner Scheler sat as a member of the Volkskammer .
Levi Withee was a lumberman and investor who served as a Republican member of the Wisconsin State Senate .
Isaac José Woldenberg Karakowski ( born 8 September 1952 ) is a Mexican political scientist and sociologist who served as the first president of the Federal Electoral Institute and currently works as director of Nexos magazine .
Lee Heider ( born February 17 , 1947 ) is a Republican member of the Idaho Senate , first elected in 2010 .
Francis Dashwood , 11th Baron le Despencer PC FRS ( December 1708 -- 11 December 1781 ) was an English rake and politician , Chancellor of the Exchequer ( 1762 - -1763 ) and founder of the Hellfire Club .
Benjamin Jason Horton ( 1873 - -1963 ) was a Puerto Rico politician and one - time acting Governor of Puerto Rico .
Ioannis Paraskevopoulos ( Greek : Ιωάννης Παρασκευόπουλος ) ( 1900 - -1984 ) , was a Greek banker and politician who served twice as interim Prime Minister of Greece during the 1960s .
Jon Tester ( born August 21 , 1956 ) is the senior United States Senator from Montana , serving since 2007 .
Humphrey Wells was an American politician who served as the 11th Governor of Georgia for only two days , from February 16 , 1780 to February 18 , 1780 .
Giulio Bevilacqua , Orat ( November 14 , 1881 -- May 6 , 1965 ) was an Italian Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church who served as an auxiliary bishop of Brescia from 1965 until his death , and was elevated to the cardinalate in 1965 .
Cormac Murphy - O'Connor ( born 24 August 1932 ) is a retired bishop and cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church , Archbishop Emeritus of Westminster and former President of the Catholic Bishops ' Conference of England and Wales .
Ahmad Mukhtar Baban ( 1900 - 24 November 1976 ) ( Arabic : أحمد مختار بابان‎ ) was the last Prime Minister of Iraq under the monarchy in 1958 .
Allen J. Greenough ( September 20 , 1905 -- 1974 ) was the 14th and last president of the Pennsylvania Railroad .
Timothy L. Schmitz is a Republican member of the Illinois House of Representatives , representing the 49th district from 1999 to 2015 .
Peter the Venerable ( c. 1092 -- 25 December 1156 ) , also known as Peter of Montboissier , abbot of the Benedictine abbey of Cluny , was born to Blessed Raingarde in Auvergne , France .
Maja Gojković ( Serbian Cyrillic : Маја Гојковић ; born May 22 , 1963 in Novi Sad ) is a Serbian politician and current President of the National Assembly of Serbia .
Witold Tomczak ( born 5 April 1957 , in Kępno ) is a right - wing Polish politician , a member of the European Parliament 2004 - 2009 .
Shahid Siddiqui is a former member of the Rajya Sabha , the Upper House of the Indian Parliament representing the state of Uttar Pradesh from 2002 to 2008 .
M. Joseph Michael Perera is a Sri Lankan politician and a Former Member of the Parliament of Sri Lanka .
Gaius Coelius Caldus , nomen also spelled Caelius , was a consul of the Roman Republic in 94 BC . His colleague was Lucius Domitius Ahenobarbus .
Ingrid Roxana Baldetti Elías ( born May 13 , 1962 ) was the first female Vice President of Guatemala from 2012 until her resignation amid a corruption scandal in 2015 .
Hatshepsut ( /hætˈʃɛpsʊt/ ; also Hatchepsut ; meaning Foremost of Noble Ladies ; 1507 - -1458 BC ) was the fifth pharaoh of the eighteenth dynasty of Egypt .
Coelchu ( fl . latter half of the eighth century AD ) was the abbot of the School of Clonmacnoise in Ireland .
George Forrest Browne ( 4 December 1833 -- 1 June 1930 ) was an English bishop , the first Anglican Bishop of Stepney from 1895 until 1897 when he was appointed Bishop of Bristol .
Thomas Tenison ( 29 September 1636 -- 14 December 1715 ) was an English church leader , Archbishop of Canterbury from 1694 until his death .
David Ervine ( 21 July 1953 -- 8 January 2007 ) was a Northern Irish unionist politician from Northern Ireland and the leader of the Progressive Unionist Party ( PUP ) .
Cynesige ( or Kynsige ; died 1060 ) was a medieval English Archbishop of York between 1051 and 1060 .
Neferkauhor Khuwihapi was an ancient Egyptian pharaoh of the 7th/8th Dynasty during the early First Intermediate Period ( 2181 - -2055 BC ) , at a time when Egypt was possibly divided between several polities .
Jordan Burrow ( born 12 September 1992 ) is an English semi - professional footballer who plays as a forward for National League club FC Halifax Town .

Mahan Rahmani ( Persian : ماهان رحمانی‎‎ ) ; is an Iranian Football midfielder who currently plays for Iranian football club Saipa in the Iran Pro League .
Kelechi Francis Ibekwe ( born 5 April 1984 , Lagos ) is a Nigerian football forward who currently plays for S.S. Calcio Giugliano in the Eccellenza .
Latu Makaafi , also spelt as Latu Maka'afi , ( born 1982 ) is a Tongan rugby union flanker and Number 8 who plays for RFU Championship team , Doncaster Knights
Justice Wamfor ( born 5 August 1981 ) is a Cameroonian footballer who plays for Royal Antwerp in the Belgian Second Division as a midfielder .
Marcelo Nascimento da Costa ( born 24 August 1984 in Manacapuru , Amazonas ) commonly known as Marcelinho , is a Brazilian footballer who currently plays as a midfielder for Bulgarian club Ludogorets Razgrad .
Dimitar Pechikamakov ( Bulgarian : Димитър Печикамъков ; born 24 June 1963 ) , is a former Bulgarian football midfielder and legendary footballer of Lokomotiv Gorna Oryahovitsa .
Nino Pekarić ( Serbian Cyrillic : Нино Пекарић ; born 16 August 1982 ) is a Serbian professional footballer who plays as a defender for Vojvodina .
Javier Modrego Casado ( born 19 January 1988 in Soria , Castile and León ) is a Spanish footballer who plays as a midfielder .
Ânderson Luís da Silva ( born 13 February 1981 ) , known as Luisão , is a Brazilian professional footballer who plays as a central defender for Portuguese club Benfica .
Marco Perrotta ( born 14 February 1994 in Campodipietra ) is an Italian footballer who plays as a defender for Pescara in Serie A.
Sergio Schulmeister ( 30 April 1977 -- 4 February 2003 ) was an Argentine footballer who played as goalkeeper in some clubs in the Argentine Primera División .
Michel Pensée Billong ( born 16 June 1973 in Yaoundé ) is a former Cameroonian footballer who played as a defender .
Fernando Zunzunegui Rodríguez ( 5 October 1943 -- 28 August 2014 ) was a Spanish footballer , who played as a defender .
Christian Alfonso López ( born 2 May 1989 ) is a Spanish professional footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder .
Normunds Sējējs ( born February 16 , 1968 in Riga ) is a former Latvian ice hockey defenceman and coach .
Dejan Koturović ( Serbian Cyrillic : Дејан Котуровић ; born March 31 , 1972 ) is a retired Serbian basketball center .
Magdy Atwa or Magdi Atwa ( Arabic : مجدي عطوة‎ ) is an Egyptian football midfielder .
Darius Gvildys ( born 26 December 1970 ) is former football defender from Lithuania .
Harvey Limón ( born July 21 , 1975 ) is a Surinamese professional footballer who plays as midfielder for Groene Ster Heerlerheide
Lubambo Musonda ( born 1 March 1995 ) is a Zambian international footballer who plays for the Armenian club Gandzasar Kapan as a left winger .
Andrej Panadić ( born 9 March 1969 in Zagreb ) is a Croatian football coach and a former defender .
Milen Gamakov ( Bulgarian : Милен Гамаков ; born 12 April 1994 ) is a Bulgarian footballer who currently plays for Botev Plovdiv and the Bulgarian U21 team as a midfielder .
Pablo Sebastián Álvarez Valeira ( born 17 April 1984 in San Martín , Buenos Aires ) is an Argentine football defender who currently plays for Rosario Central .
Juris Laizāns ( born 6 January 1979 in Riga ) is a Latvian former football midfielder , currently working as a scout for FC Krasnodar in the Russian Premier League .
Narcís Julià Fontané ( born 24 May 1963 ) is a Spanish retired footballer who played as a defender , and a current manager .
Nicolás Cambiasso ( born March 2 , 1978 ) is a retired Argentine football goalkeeper who last played for All Boys in the Argentine Primera División .
Juan José Ribera ( born 11 October 1980 ) is a Chilean former football midfielder who plays for Santiago Morning in Chile .
Guido van de Kamp ( born February 8 , 1964 in Den Bosch ) is a Dutch former footballer who played as a goalkeeper and is currently Facilities Manager for his hometown club F. C. Den Bosch .
Shang Yi ( born 20 January 1979 ) is Chinese former footballer who played at both professional and international levels , as a midfielder .
Régis Gurtner ( born 8 December 1986 in Saverne , Bas - Rhin ) is a French professional footballer who currently plays for Amiens as a goalkeeper .
César Cruchaga Lasa ( born 26 January 1974 in Ezcároz -- Ezkaroze , Navarre ) is a Spanish retired footballer who played as a central defender .
Seamus Donal D'Arcy , known as Jimmy D'Arcy or sometimes Paddy D'Arcy , ( 14 December 1921 -- 22 February 1985 ) was an Northern Irish international footballer who played as an inside forward .
Dino Škvorc ( born 2 February 1990 ) is a Croatian football defender who currently playing for Hapoel Kfar Saba .
Marino Bifulco ( born 9 August 1982 in Pescara ) is an Italian goalkeeper who currently plays for Matera in the Italian Lega Pro / C.
Arsen Chilingaryan ( Armenian : Արսեն Չիլինգարյան , 1965 - 14 May 2013 ) was a Soviet Armenian football defender .
Stelios Longras(Greek : Στέλιος Λόγκρας ) born 17 August 1976 in Nicosia , Cyprus is a Cypriot football defender who last played for Olympiakos Nicosia after serving as captain for APEP Pitsilia for many years .
Ruaidhrí Higgins ( born 23 October 1984 ) is a midfielder playing with Coleraine in the Danske Bank NIFL Premiership in Northern Ireland .
Pete Marino ( born April 23 , 1973 ) is an American soccer forward currently playing for the Treasure Coast Galleons in the FESL .
Isus Angelov ( Bulgarian : Исус Ангелов ; born 30 March 1994 ) is a Bulgarian footballer , currently playing for Botev Galabovo as a midfielder .
José Antonio Redondo García ( born 8 March 1953 ) is a retired footballer who played as a defender , and a current manager .
Pedro dos Santos Pereira ( born 28 July 1978 in Lisbon ) is a Portuguese retired footballer who played mainly as a defender .
Eduardo Vieira do Nascimento , shortly Edu ( born January 11 , 1983 ) is a Brazilian footballer who plays as a forward .
Olavo Leite de Bastos , commonly known by the nickname Kafunga ( August 7 , 1914 -- November 17 , 1991 ) , was an association footballer who played goalkeeper , who spent his entire career defending Atlético Mineiro .
Andrejs Piedels ( born in Jēkabpils , 17 September 1970 ) is a former Latvian football goalkeeper and the current goalkeeping coach of FK Jelgava in the Latvian Higher League and Latvia national football team .
Yevhen Yevseyev ( Ukrainian : Євген Васильович Євсеєв ; 16 April 1987 -- 19 August 2011 ) was a professional Ukrainian football defender who played for Arsenal Kyiv in the Ukrainian Premier League .
Dinko Felić ( born 10 November 1983 ) is a Bosnian - born Norwegian footballer who plays as a forward .
Rowan Liburd ( born 28 August 1992 ) is an English professional footballer who plays for Reading as a forward .
Steven Rice ( born May 26 , 1971 ) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey right winger who played eight seasons in the National Hockey League in the 1990s .
Mondas is a fictional planet in the British science fiction television series Doctor Who .
The Lahnstein family is a very wealthy and aristocratic prestigious fictional family on the German soap opera Verbotene Liebe ( Forbidden Love ) .
Uriah Heep is a fictional character created by Charles Dickens in his novel David Copperfield .

The White Rabbit is a fictional character in Lewis Carroll 's book Alice 's Adventures in Wonderland .
Glenn Quagmire , often referred to as just Quagmire , is a character from the animated television series Family Guy .
Meredith Grey , M.D. is a fictional character from the hit medical drama television series Grey 's Anatomy , which airs on the American Broadcasting Company ( ABC ) in the United States .
Yasmin Green ( née McHugh ; previously Matthews and MacKenzie ) was a fictional character in UK soap opera Family Affairs , played by Ebony Thomas from 1998 until the end of the series in 2005 .

Wilkins Micawber is a fictional character from Charles Dickens 's 1850 novel , David Copperfield .
Charlotte Day was a fictional character in UK soap opera Family Affairs , played by Leanne Lakey .
Dr. Reid Oliver is a fictional character from CBS 's daytime drama As the World Turns .
The Illusive Man is a fictional character in BioWare 's Mass Effect video game franchise .
Thomson and Thompson ( French : Dupond et Dupont ) are fictional characters in The Adventures of Tintin , the comics series by Belgian cartoonist Hergé .
Cosmic Boy , along with Saturn Girl and Lightning Lad , made his live - action debut in the eleventh episode of the eighth season of the CW series Smallville , portrayed by actor Ryan Kennedy .
Lady Tara Thornfield ( née Cockburn , previously Lady Oakwell ) is a fictional character from the British soap opera Emmerdale , played by Anna Brecon .

Prospero ( /ˈprɒspəroʊ/ PROS - pər - oh ) is a fictional character and the protagonist of William Shakespeare 's play The Tempest .

The Silver Tongued Devil and I is the second album by Kris Kristofferson , released in 1971 on Monument Records .
The demo for `` Make Me Your Baby '' was cut by journeyman session singer Jean Thomas on 22 January 1965 at the behest of Atlantic Records president Jerry Wexler , who wanted to offer the song to Patti LaBelle and the Bluebelles , then a Cameo - Parkway act Wexler was hoping to woo over to Atlantic .
